ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܝܼܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ.
TRL: Aha-yleh ktawa deeleedoeta deeshoo' msheekha, broona ddaweed, broona dawraham.
ENG: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

ASY: ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ؛ ܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂؛ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܘܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ؛
TRL: Awraham moelid-leh leeskhaq; eeskhaq moelid-leh lya'qoow; ya'qoow moelid-leh leehoeda o lakhoonwateh;
ENG: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judah and his brethren;

ASY: ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܪܨ ܘܠܙܲܪܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܪ؛ ܦܲܪܨ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܸܨܪܘܿܢ؛ ܚܸܨܪܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܪܵܡ؛
TRL: Eehoeda moelid-leh lparṣ o lzarkh min tamar; parṣ moelid-leh lkhiṣroon; khiṣroon moelid-leh laram;
ENG: and Judah begat Perez and Zerah of Tamar; and Perez begat Hezron; and Hezron begat Ram;

ASY: ܐܵܪܵܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܲܡܝܼܢܵܕܵܒ݂؛ ܥܲܡܝܼܢܵܕܵܒ݂ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܸܚܫܘܿܢ؛ ܢܸܚܫܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܣܲܠܡܘܿܢ؛
TRL: Aram moelid-leh l'ameenadaw; 'ameenadaw moelid-leh lnikhshoon; nikhshoon moelid-leh lsalmoon;
ENG: and Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon; and Nahshon begat Salmon;

ASY: ܣܲܠܡܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܵܥܵܙ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܚܵܒ݂؛ ܒܵܥܵܙ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܘܿܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܥܘܿܬ؛ ܥܘܿܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܝܼܫܲܝ؛
TRL: Salmoon moelid-leh lba'az min rakhaw; ba'az moelid-leh l'ooweed min r'oot; 'ooweed moelid-leh leeshay;
ENG: and Salmon begat Boaz of Rahab; and Boaz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;

ASY: ܐܝܼܫܲܝ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ؛ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܝܼܵܐ؛
TRL: Eeshay moelid-leh ldaweed malka; daweed moelid-leh lshleymoon min bakhta dooreea;
ENG: and Jesse begat David the king. And David begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Uriah;

ASY: ܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܚܸܒ݂ܥܲܡ؛ ܪܚܸܒ݂ܥܲܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ؛ ܐܲܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܣܵܐ؛
TRL: Shleymoon moelid-leh lrkhiw'am; rkhiw'am moelid-leh laweea; aweea moelid-leh lasa;
ENG: and Solomon begat Rehoboam; and Rehoboam begat Abijah; and Abijah begat Asa;

ASY: ܐܵܣܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܵܗܘܿܫܵܦܵܛ؛ ܝܵܗܘܿܫܵܦܵܛ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܘܿܪܵܡ؛ ܝܘܿܪܵܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܘܿܙܝܼܵܐ؛
TRL: Asa moelid-leh lyahooshapaṭ; yahooshapaṭ moelid-leh lyooram; yooram moelid-leh l'oozeea;
ENG: and Asa begat Jehoshaphat; and Jehoshaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Uzziah;

ASY: ܥܘܿܙܝܼܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܘܿܬܵܡ؛ ܝܘܿܬܵܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܚܵܙ؛ ܐܵܚܵܙ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܹܙܲܩܝܵܐ؛
TRL: 'oozeea moelid-leh lyootam; yootam moelid-leh lakhaz; akhaz moelid-leh lkhezaqya;
ENG: and Uzziah begat Jotham; and Jotham begat Ahaz; and Ahaz begat Hezekiah;

ASY: ܚܹܙܲܩܝܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܢܲܫܹܐ؛ ܡܢܲܫܹܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܡܘܿܢ؛ ܐܲܡܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܘܿܫܝܼܵܐ؛
TRL: Khezaqya moelid-leh lmnashe; mnashe moelid-leh lamoon; amoon moelid-leh lyoosheea;
ENG: and Hezekiah begat Manasseh; and Manasseh begat Amon; and Amon begat Josiah;

ASY: ܝܘܿܫܝܼܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܘܿܟܲܢܝܵܐ ܘܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܹܠ.
TRL: Yoosheea moelid-leh lyookanya o lakhoonwateh, b'dana dgaloeta dbabel.
ENG: and Josiah begat Jechoniah and his brethren, at the time of the carrying away to Babylon.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܹܠ، ܝܘܿܟܲܢܝܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܹܠܲܬܐܹܝܠ؛ ܫܹܠܲܬܐܹܝܠ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܘܼܪܒܵܒܹܠ؛
TRL: Min bar galoeta dbabel, yookanya moelid-leh lshelateyl; shelateyl moelid-leh lzoerbabel;
ENG: And after the carrying away to Babylon, Jechoniah begat Shealtiel; and Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel;

ASY: ܙܘܼܪܒܵܒܹܠ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܝܼܘܿܕ؛ ܐܲܒ݂ܝܼܘܿܕ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܸܠܝܵܩܝܼܡ؛ ܐܸܠܝܵܩܝܼܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܵܙܘܿܪ؛
TRL: Zoerbabel moelid-leh laweeood; aweeood moelid-leh lilyaqeem; ilyaqeem moelid-leh l'azoor;
ENG: and Zerubbabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

ASY: ܥܵܙܘܿܪ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܵܕܘܿܩ؛ ܙܵܕܘܿܩ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܟܝܼܢ؛ ܐܲܟܝܼܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܹܠܝܼܘܿܕ؛
TRL: 'Azoor moelid-leh lzadooq; zadooq moelid-leh lakeen; akeen moelid-leh leleeood;
ENG: and Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;

ASY: ܐܹܠܝܼܘܿܕ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܹܠܝܼܥܵܙܲܪ؛ ܐܹܠܝܼܥܵܙܲܪ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܬܵܢ؛ ܡܵܬܵܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂؛
TRL: Eleeood moelid-leh lelee'azar; elee'azar moelid-leh lmatan; matan moelid-leh lya'qoow;
ENG: and Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

ASY: ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܕܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Ya'qoow moelid-leh lyawsip gawra dmaryam, dminoeha peesh-leh leeda eeshoo', dpeesha-yleh qirya msheekha.
ENG: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܗܲܠ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܣܲܪ ܫܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܗܲܠ ܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܹܠ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܣܲܪ ܫܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܹܠ ܗܲܠ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܣܲܪ ܫܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha, klayhy sharbate min awraham hal daweed arba'sar sharbate yna, min daweed hal galoeta dbabel arba'sar sharbate yna, o min galoeta dbabel hal msheekha arba'sar sharbate yna.
ENG: So all the generations from Abraham unto David are fourteen generations; and from David unto the carrying away to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon unto the Christ fourteen generations.

ASY: ܡܵܘܠܵܕܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܛܠܝܼܒܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܵܪܲܟܬܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܙܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܢܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: Mawlada deeshoo' msheekha hadkha hwe-leh: eeman dmaryam yimeh ṭleebta ywa lyawsip, min qam sharaktayhy peesh-laha khzeeta bṭeenta min roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When his mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܟܹܐܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܢܟܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ، ܘܬܘܼܚܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ ܪܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Sabab yawsip gawroeha kena ywa, la b'e-leh dmankip wa-laha galyaeet, o toekhmineh dbṭishwa rape wa-laha.
ENG: And Joseph her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, was minded to put her away privily.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܚܸܠܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena kad haw hadkha takhmoene, peesh-leh khizya ileh malakha dmarya bkhilma, o meereh ileh, ”yawsip broona ddaweed, la zad'et lishqala lmaryam dhawya bakhtoekh, sabab haw dpeesh-leh bṭeena beeoeha min roekha dqoedsha-yleh.
ENG: But when he thought on these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܹܝܬ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܥܲܡܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Bit haṣla broona, o bit qareyt shimeh eeshoo', sabab haw bit pariq l'ameh min khṭeeatayhy.“
ENG: And she shall bring forth a son; and thou shalt call his name JESUS; for it is he that shall save his people from their sins.

ASY: ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: Klaha aha hwe-laha dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesh-leh meera min Marya byad nweea, dmeereh:
ENG: Now all this is come to pass, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

ASY: ܗܵܐ ܒܬܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܛܢܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܝܼ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܢܘܼܐܹܝܠ، ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܫܩܵܐ، ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܢ.“
TRL: Ha btoelta bit baṭna o bit haṣla broona, o bit qaree shimeh 'amanoeeyl, dpyasha-yleh poeshqa, ”Alaha 'aman.“
ENG: Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, And they shall call his name Immanuel; which is, being interpreted, God with us.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܸܢܬܹܗ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܩܝܼܕܵܐ ܒܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ؛
TRL: O kad r'eesh-leh yawsip min shinteh, 'weed-leh aykh dpeesh-leh pqeeda bmalakha dmarya, o shqeela-leh dhawya bakhteh;
ENG: And Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took unto him his wife;

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܕܗܘܼܨܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ؛ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O la dee'a-leh hal dhoeṣil-laha lbroona; o qre-laha shimeh eeshoo'.
ENG: and knew her not till she had brought forth a son: and he called his name JESUS.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܓ݂ܘܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܕܢܚܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ،
TRL: Min bar dpeesh-leh leeda eeshoo' gaw beytlkhim deehoeda byawmane dheroodis malka, te-lhoon mghoeshe min madnkha loorishlim,
ENG: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹܗ ܒܡܲܕܢܚܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܣܵܓ݂ܕܲܚ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O boeqirhoon, ”ayka-yleh haw dpeesh-leh leeda malka dyhoedaye? Sabab khze lan lkawkhbeh bmadnkha o te lan dsaghdakh ileh.“
ENG: saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we saw his star in the east, and are come to worship him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ، ܘܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh heroodis malka aha, peesh-leh shgheesha, o klaha oorishlim 'ameh.
ENG: And when Herod the king heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: O qre-leh lklayhy goerane dkahne o sapre d'ama, o boeqireh minayhy ayka bit paesh wa leeda msheekha.
ENG: And gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Christ should be born.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ:
TRL: O meerhoon, ”bbeytlkhim deehoeda sabab hadkha peesha-yleh kteewa byad nweea:
ENG: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬܝ ܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ، ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܵܟ݂ܝ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܪܥܹܐ ܠܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.“
TRL: Oep aty beytlkhim, bar'a deehoeda, le ywaty baṣoorta gaw shaleeṭe deehoeda, sabab minakhy bit paleṭ shaleeṭa, o haw bit mar'e l'amee eesrayel.“
ENG: And thou Bethlehem, land of Judah, Art in no wise least among the princes of Judah: For out of thee shall come forth a governor, Which shall be shepherd of my people Israel.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܠܡܓ݂ܘܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܵܦܩܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܒܝܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܵܘܟ݂ܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah qre-leh heroodis lmghoeshe dtapqee bee-eh bṭishwa, o minayhy dee' leh dbaynee zawna moebyineh ilayhy kawkhwa.
ENG: Then Herod privily called the wise men, and learned of them carefully what time the star appeared.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܒܲܩܪܘܼܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܒܚܦܝܼܛܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܡܲܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܠܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O shoedray-leh lbeytlkhim, o meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen baqroen boet yala bkhpeeṭoeta, o eeman dmoechikh lawkhoon ileh, madi'moen-lee doep ana azen saghden ileh.“
ENG: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search out carefully concerning the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word, that I also may come and worship him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܵܘܟ݂ܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܲܕܢܚܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ، ܗܲܠ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ.
TRL: Min bar dshmee' lhoon min malka, zeel-lhoon, o ha, haw kawkhwa dkhze-lhoon bmadnkha azel wa qamayhy, hal dte-leh o kle-leh l'ilil min doeka deewa yala.
ENG: And they, having heard the king, went their way; and lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܵܘܟ݂ܒ݂ܵܐ، ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: O kad khze-lhoon lkawkhwa, khde-lhoon khadoeta raba goerta.
ENG: And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܹܗ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܲܫܢܹ̈ܐ: ܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܠܒ݂ܘܿܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: O 'weerhoon lbayta o khze-lhoon lyala 'am maryam yimeh, o npeel-lhoon o sgheed-lhoon ileh. Haygah pteekh-lhoon seematayhy, o moeqriw-lhoon ileh dashne: dahwa, o lwoota, o moera.
ENG: And they came into the house and saw the young child with Mary his mother; and they fell down and worshipped him; and opening their treasures they offered unto him gifts, gold and frankincense and myrrh.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܕܸܥܹܐ ܒܚܸܠܡܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܬܪܲܝܗܝ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: O kad peesh-lhoon moedi'e bkhilma dla dayree lkis heroodis, deerhoon latrayhy bkhda oerkha preeshta.
ENG: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܓ݂ܘܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܚܸܠܡܵܐ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܡ، ܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܥܪܘܿܩ ܠܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܦܘܼܫ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܡܪܹܢܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܠܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܕܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Min bar dzeel-lhoon mghoeshe, peesh-leh khizya malakha dmarya bkhilma lyawsip o meereh ileh, ”qoem, labil lyala o lyimeh o 'rooq lmiṣreyn, o poesh tama hal damrenoekh, sabab hdeera-yleh heroodis liṭ'aya lyala dṭaliq-leh.“
ENG: Now when they were departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I tell thee: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ.
TRL: Haygah qeem-leh yawsip o shqeel-leh lyala z'oora o lyimeh blayle o 'reeq-leh lmiṣreyn.
ENG: And he arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt;

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ.
TRL: O peesh-leh tama hal mawta dheroodis, dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesh-leh meera min Marya byad nweea, dmeereh: min miṣreyn qre-lee lbroonee.
ENG: and was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt did I call my son.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܓ݂ܘܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܚܸܡܬܵܐ؛ ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܩܛܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ ܘܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܚܘܼܡܘܼ̈ܗ̇، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܪ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܠܬܸܚܬ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܡܓ݂ܘܼܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah kad khze-leh heroodis dpeesh-leh moeskhira byad mghoeshe, peesh-leh milya khimta; o shoedireh o moeqṭil-leh lklayhy yale dgaw beytlkhim o dklayhy tkhoemoeha, anee deewaw min bar tartey shine o lltikht, aykh zawna dpeesh-leh gilya ileh bmghoeshe.
ENG: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the borders thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had carefully learned of the wise men.

ASY: ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܹܪܲܡܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: O hadkha peesh-leh toemima mindee dpeesha ywa meera byad eramya nweea, dmeereh:
ENG: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying,

ASY: ܩܵܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܡܝܼܥܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܪܵܡܬܵܐ، ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܐܸܠܝܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ؛ ܪܵܚܹܝܠ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇، ܘܠܹܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Qala peesh-leh shmee'a gaw ramta, bikhya o ilya raba; rakheyl bibkhaya 'al bnoonoeha, o le basma wa-laha lishqala liba, sabab meete ywaw.
ENG: A voice was heard in Ramah, Weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; And she would not be comforted, because they are not.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܚܸܠܡܵܐ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܓܵܘ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ،
TRL: Eeman dmeet-leh heroodis, peesh-leh khizya malakha dmarya bkhilma lyawsip gaw miṣreyn,
ENG: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܡ، ܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”qoem, labil lyala o lyimeh, o ze lar'a deesrayel, sabab meet-lhoon anee dbib'aya ywaw liqṭaleh yala.“
ENG: saying, Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead that sought the young child’s life.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: Haygah qeem-leh yawsip o shqeel-leh lyala o lyimeh, o zeel-leh lar'a deesrayel.
ENG: And he arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܲܪܟܹܠܹܐܘܿܣ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܒܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ؛ ܘܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܕܸܥܵܐ ܒܚܸܠܡܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Eena kad shmee' leh darkeleoos hwe-leh malka beehoed min geba dheroodis baboehy, zdee' leh dazel wa ltama; o kad peesh-leh moedi'a bkhilma, te-leh latra dgleela.
ENG: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither; and being warned of God in a dream, he withdrew into the parts of Galilee,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܕܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O te-leh 'meereh bmdeeta dpaysha qreeta naṣrat, dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesh-leh meera byad nwee-e, dnaṣraya bit paesh qirya.
ENG: and came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, that he should be called a Nazarene.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ، ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ،
TRL: Banee yawmane, te-leh yookhanan ma'mdana, makroeze gaw bareea deehoed,
ENG: And in those days cometh John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܬܲܘܸܒܘܼܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Bemara, ”tawiboen, sabab qoerbinaha malkoeta dshmaya.“
ENG: saying, Repent ye; for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ”ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܡܲܫܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: Aha-yleh haw dpeesh-leh meera boet dee-eh byad esha'ya nweea, dmeereh: qala biqraya gaw bareea, ”hadroen oerkha dmarya, o mashweymoen-lhoon shweeloehy.“
ENG: For this is he that was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make ye ready the way of the Lord, Make his paths straight.

ASY: ܘܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܲܥܪܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܡܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܢܵܪܵܐ ܕܓܸܠܕܵܐ ܒܚܲܨܹܗ، ܘܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܹܗ ܩܲܡܨܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܕܸܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: O lweeshta dyookhanan min sa'ra dgoemle ywa, o eet wa-leh zoenara dgilda bkhaṣeh, o mekhoelteh qamṣe ywa o diwsha dbareea.
ENG: Now John himself had his raiment of camel’s hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his food was locusts and wild honey.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܘܟܠܹܗ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ.
TRL: Haygah pleeṭ-lhoon lkis-leh nashe doorishlim o klaha eehoed, o kleh atra dkhadirwane dyoordnan.
ENG: Then went out unto him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan;

ASY: ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܢܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܟܲܕ ܡܵܘܕܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O payshee waw moe'mide bee-eh gaw nahra dyoordnan, kad mawdoeye bkhṭeeatayhy.
ENG: and they were baptized of him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܝܵܐ ܙܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܕܐܵܟܸܕܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇؟
TRL: Eena eeman dkhze-leh raba min preeshe o zadoeqaye betaya ywaw lma'moodeeteh, meereh ilayhy, ”ya zar'e dakidne, manee moedi' leh ilawkhoon d'arqeetoon min karba dbetaya-ylaha?
ENG: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said unto them, Ye offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܫܚܝܼ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha 'woodoen ṭ'oenyate dkhashkhee ltyawoeta.
ENG: Bring forth therefore fruit worthy of repentance:

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ، ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ،‘ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ!
TRL: ”O la khashweetoon o amreetoon bganawkhoon, ’baba eet lan, awraham,‘ sabab bemara ywin ilawkhoon dalaha maṣe min ane kepe maqim bnoone lawraham!
ENG: and think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܢܲܪܥܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ؛ ܘܟܠ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܘܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ha nar'a peesha-yleh moetwa 'al 'iqra deelane; o kl eelana dla ṭa'en ṭ'oenyate ṭabe bit paesh preema o dirya bnoera.
ENG: And even now is the axe laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܕܛܵܥܢܹܢ ܠܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ. ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ،
TRL: ”Ana ma'moede ywin ilawkhoon bmeea ltyawoeta, eena haw dbetaya-yleh min bar deeee boesh khaylana-yleh minee, haw dana le khashkhen dṭa'nen lṣawloehy. Haw bit ma'mid lawkhoon broekha dqoedsha o bnoera,
ENG: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܪܘܼܦ̮ܫܬܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܲܟܹܐ ܠܒܸܐܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܟܲܦܸܫ ܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܢܒܵܪ̈ܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܕ ܬܸܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: ”Haw droewshta beedeh-ylaha o bit dake lbidrateh, o bit kapish khiṭe lanbaroehy, o bit maqid tiwna gaw noera dle chame'.“
ENG: whose fan is in his hand, and he will throughly cleanse his threshing-floor; and he will gather his wheat into the garner, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܠܟܸܣ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah te-leh eeshoo' min gleela lyoordnan, lkis yookhanan, dpaesh wa moe'mida bee-eh.
ENG: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“
TRL: Eena yookhanan moekle-leh ileh o meereh, ”ana sneeqa ywin dpayshen moe'mida beeoekh, o at lkis-lee betaya ywit?“
ENG: But John would have hindered him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܬܲܡܸܡܲܚ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ.“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' joewib-leh o meereh ileh, ”shwooq adeea, sabab hadkha wale-ylaha ilan dtamimakh klaha kenoeta.“ haygah shweeq-leh dma'mid-leh.
ENG: But Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it now: for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness. Then he suffereth him.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܡܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܘܢܵܐ ܘܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O kad peesh-leh moe'mida eeshoo', seeq-leh har bhay 'dana min meea, o peesh-lhoon pteekhe ileh shmaye, o khze-leh lroekha dalaha biṣlaya aykh yawna o betaya 'aloehy.
ENG: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway from the water: and lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming upon him;

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ، ܩܵܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O ha, qala min shmaya bemara, ”aha-yleh broonee moekhiba dbee-eh bseem-laha-lee.“
ENG: and lo, a voice out of the heavens, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܒܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah peesh-leh loebla eeshoo' byad roekha lbareea dpaesh joerba bakelqarṣa.
ENG: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.

ASY: ܘܨܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܠܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܟܦܝܼܢܹܗ.
TRL: O ṣeem-leh arb'ee yawmane o arb'ee laylawate, o bkharta kpeeneh.
ENG: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he afterward hungered.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܓ̰ܲܪܒܵܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܦܩܘܿܕ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.“
TRL: O qoerbineh jarbana o meereh ileh, ”in broona dalaha ywit, pqood lane kepe dhawee lakhma.“
ENG: And the tempter came and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ: ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw joewib-leh o meereh, ”peeshta-ylaha kteewta: le-ylaha akhchee blakhma dke khaye barnasha, ila bkl hemizman dpalṭa min poema dalaha.“
ENG: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܸܢܦܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah loebil-leh ileh akelqarṣa lmdeeta qadeeshta, o moekle-leh ileh 'al kinpa dhaykla.
ENG: Then the devil taketh him into the holy city; and he set him on the pinnacle of the temple,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܪܲܦܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ؛ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ: ܒܸܬ ܦܵܩܹܕ ܠܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܘܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܢܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܕܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܩܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܩܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܟܹܐܦܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”in broona dalaha ywit, rapee ganoekh lltikht; sabab peeshta-ylaha kteewta: bit paqed lmalakhoehy boet deeoekh, o bit ṭa'nee-loekh 'al eedatayhy, dla tarqila aqloekh bkepa.“
ENG: and saith unto him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: And on their hands they shall bear thee up, Lest haply thou dash thy foot against a stone.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ: ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܪܒܸܬ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”mindrish peeshta-ylaha kteewta: la jarbit lmarya alahoekh.“
ENG: Jesus said unto him, Again it is written, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܟܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܘܚܸܩܪܲܝܗ‌ܝ؛
TRL: Min bar aha, mindrish loebil-leh ileh akelqarṣa lkhad ṭoera raba rama, o moekhze-leh ileh klayhy malkwate ddoenye o khiqrayh‌y;
ENG: Again, the devil taketh him unto an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܐܸܢ ܢܵܦܠܹܬ ܘܣܵܓ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”bit yaben iloekh klayhy ane, in naplet o saghdet ilee.“
ENG: and he said unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܛܠܘܿܩ، ܝܵܐ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ: ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܹܬ، ܘܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܦܵܠܚܹܬ.“
TRL: Haygah meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ṭlooq, ya saṭana, sabab peeshta-ylaha kteewta: lmarya alahoekh saghdet, o ileh bnawsheh palkhet.“
ENG: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ، ܘܗܵܐ، ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah, shweeq-leh ileh akelqarṣa, o ha, malake te-lhoon o 'weed-lhoon khilmat ileh.
ENG: Then the devil leaveth him; and behold, angels came and ministered unto him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo' dpeesh-leh dweeqa yookhanan, shoene-leh lgleela.
ENG: Now when he heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee;

ASY: ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܓܵܘ ܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܙܒ݂ܘܿܠܘܿܢ ܘܕܢܲܦ̮ܬܵܠܝܼ.
TRL: O shweeqa-leh naṣrat, te-leh o 'meereh gaw kparnakhoom, deelaha 'al marza dyama, gaw tkhoema dzwooloon o dnawtalee.
ENG: and leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali:

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: Hadkha dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesh-leh meera besha'ya nweea dmeereh:
ENG: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

ASY: ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܙܒ݂ܘܿܠܘܿܢ، ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܢܲܦ̮ܬܵܠܝܼ، ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Ar'a dzwooloon, ar'a dnawtalee, deelaha 'al oerkha dyama, 'iwra dyoordnan, gleela dimwate.
ENG: The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, Toward the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

ASY: ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܒܛܸܠܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܙܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: 'Ama dteewa-yleh gaw khishka khze-leh bahra goera, o anee dteebe yna bar'a o bṭilale dmawta, zreeq-leh bahra 'alayhy.
ENG: The people which sat in darkness Saw a great light, And to them which sat in the region and shadow of death, To them did light spring up.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܬܲܘܸܒܘܼܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Min hay 'dana shoere-leh eeshoo' makroeze o bemara, ”tawiboen, sabab qoerbinta-ylaha malkoeta dshmaya.“
ENG: From that time began Jesus to preach, and to say, Repent ye; for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܨܲܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Kad bikhdara ywa eeshoo' 'al marza dyama dgleela khze-leh trey akhoonwate, shim'oon dpeesh-leh qirya kepa o andreoos akhoonoehy, bidraya gardayhy gaw yama, sabab ṣayade ywaw.
ENG: And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brethren, Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishers.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܨܲܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”teymoen baree o bit 'awdenawkhoon ṣayade dbnaynasha.“
ENG: And he saith unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you fishers of men.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana shweeq-lhoon gardayhy o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And they straightway left the nets, and followed him.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ ܒܵܒܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܪܘܼܨܹܐ ܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ؛ ܘܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O kad 'weereh min tama, khze-leh trey akhoonwate khene, ya'qoow broona dzawday o yookhanan akhoonoehy, gaw gamee 'am zawday babayhy taroeṣe gardayhy; o qiryay-leh.
ENG: And going on from thence he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܠܒܵܒܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana shweeq-lhoon lgamee o lbabayhy o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And they straightway left the boat and their father, and followed him.

ASY: ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܟܠ ܟܹܐܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܟܠ ܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: Bikhdara ywa eeshoo' bkleh gleela o maloepe ywa gaw knoeshyatayhy o makroeze ewangaleeoon dmalkoeta o basoeme kl kewa o kl mar'a dgaw 'ama.
ENG: And Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of disease and all manner of sickness among the people.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܡܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ ܒܬܘܼܫܢܵܩܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܲܪ ܐܸܓܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Peesh-laha shmee'ta boet dee-eh gaw klaha soereea, o moete-lhoon lkis-leh klayhy anee djanjoere ywaw bmar'e preeshe o moelyiṣe btoeshnaqe, o anee deet waw bee-ayhy shede, o bar igare, o shpeele, o boesmay-leh.
ENG: And the report of him went forth into all Syria: and they brought unto him all that were sick, holden with divers diseases and torments, possessed with devils, and epileptic, and palsied; and he healed them.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܼܚܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܸܣܪܲܬ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon bareh raba kinshe min gleela o min oekhdana d'israt mdeenate o min oorishlim o min eehoed, o min 'iwra dyoordnan.
ENG: And there followed him great multitudes from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judaea and from beyond Jordan.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ؛ ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh eeshoo' lkinshe, seeq-leh lṭoera; o kad teew-leh, qoerbinhoon lkis-leh talmeedoehy.
ENG: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into the mountain: and when he had sat down, his disciples came unto him:

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: O shoere-leh lmaloepay o meereh,
ENG: and he opened his mouth and taught them, saying,

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lmiskene broekha, sabab dee-ayhy-ylaha malkoeta dshmaya.
ENG: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܵܥܙܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa l'awdane dta'zee, sabab anee bit payshee yoebe liba.
ENG: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡܲܟܝܼܟܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܪܬܝܼ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lmakeeke, sabab anee bit yartee lar'a.
ENG: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܵܦܢܝܼ ܘܨܵܗܝܼ ܠܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܒ݂ܥܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lanee dkapnee o ṣahee lkenoeta, sabab anee bit saw'ee.
ENG: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡܪ̈ܲܚܡܵܢܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lmrakhmane, sabab 'alayhy bit hawee rakhme.
ENG: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lanee deena dikhye blibayhy, sabab anee bit khazee lalaha.
ENG: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܠܵܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa l'awdane dshlama, sabab bnoone dalaha bit payshee qirye.
ENG: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called sons of God.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lanee dqoebil-lhoon rdoepya boet kenoeta, sabab dee-ayhy-ylaha malkoeta dshmaya.
ENG: Blessed are they that have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܵܝܡܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܟܲܡܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܕܲܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa ilawkhoon eeman dlaymee lawkhoon o kamree lawkhoon o hamzimee 'alawkhoon bdagaloeta kl hemizman beeshta boet deeee.
ENG: Blessed are ye when men shall reproach you, and persecute you, and say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܚܕܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܦܨܘܿܚܘܼܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܘܼܡܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Haygah khdeymoen o pṣookhoen, sabab zeed-leh poer'anawkhoon bshmaya. Sabab hadkha koemirhoon lnwee-e dmqam minawkhoon.
ENG: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܸܠܚܵܐ ܦܵܝܟܵܐ، ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܡܠܝܼܚܬܵܐ؟ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܪܘܼܦܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܕܘܼܫܕܸܫܬܵܐ ܒܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon eetoon milkha dar'a, eena in milkha payka, bmoodee bit paysha mleekhta? khena le khashkha, ila dpaysha roepeeta lbadar o doeshdishta bnashe.
ENG: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost its savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under foot of men.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ. ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܠܛܲܫܘܼܝܹܐ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon eetoon bahra ddoenye. Mdeeta bneeta 'al ṭoera le atya lṭashoeye.
ENG: Ye are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hid.

ASY: ”ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܗܝܼ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܘܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܣܲܐܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܢܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܒܲܗܪܸܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O le malhee shraya o matwee-laha tkhoot sata, ila 'al mnarta dbahrina lanee deena gaw bayta.
ENG: Neither do men light a lamp, and put it under the bushel, but on the stand; and it shineth unto all that are in the house.

ASY: ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܲܗܪܸܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܲܒܚܝܼ ܠܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shwooqoen bahrawkhoon hadkha bahrin qam bnaynasha, dkhazee poelkhanawkhoon ṭabe o shabkhee lbabawkhoon dbshmaya.
ENG: Even so let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܒܲܛܠܸܢ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ. ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܒܲܛܠܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܬܲܡܸܡܸܢ.
TRL: ”La khashweetoon dte-lee dbaṭlin lnamoosa yan lnwee-e. La te-lee dbaṭlin ila dtamimin.
ENG: Think not that I came to destroy the law or the prophets: I came not to destroy, but to fulfill.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܠ ܕܬܵܝܡܝܼ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܝܘܿܕ، ܘܠܹܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܚܲܕ ܣܸܪܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, hal dtaymee shmaya o ar'a, le napla khda yood, o le napel khad sirṭa min namoosa, hal dkleh paesh toemima.
ENG: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass away from the law, till all things be accomplished.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܛܹܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, kl man dshare khad min ane poeqdane raba z'oore, yan hadkha malip lbnaynasha, bit paesh qirya raba z'oora gaw malkoeta dshmaya; eena kl man dnaṭerhoon o malip-lhoon, aha goera bit paesh qirya gaw malkoeta dshmaya.
ENG: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܙܵܝܕܵܐ ܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, din la zayda kenoetawkhoon boesh min hay dsapre o dpreeshe, le 'awreetoon lmalkoeta dshmaya.
ENG: For I say unto you, that except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܠܵܐ ܩܵܛܠܹܬ،‘ ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ، ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shmee' lawkhoon dpeesh-laha meerta lanee dqam deeawkhoon, ’la qaṭlet,‘ o man dqaṭel, khayawa-yleh ldyanta.
ENG: Ye have heard that it was said to them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܟܵܪܹܒ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ، ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ؛ ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܵܐ، ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ؛ ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܫܹܐܕܵܢܵܐ، ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon: kl man dkareb 'al akhoonoehy dla khda 'ilta, khayawa-yleh ldyanta; o kl man dqare lakhoonoehy sakhla, khayawa-yleh qam knoeshya; o kl man damer shedana, khayawa-yleh lgehana dnoera.
ENG: but I say unto you, that every one who is angry with his brother shall be in danger of the judgment; and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council; and whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of the hell of fire.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܲܩܪܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܵܟ݂ܪܹܬ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Hadkha in maqroebe ywit qoerbanoekh 'al madbkha, o tama dakhret dakhoonoekh dweeqa-yleh karba blibeh 'aloekh,
ENG: If therefore thou art offering thy gift at the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath aught against thee,

ASY: ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ، ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܣܲܙܓܸܪ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Shwooq qoerbanoekh tama 'al madbkha, o ze qamayta sazgir 'am akhoonoekh, o haygah ta o maqriw qoerbanoekh.
ENG: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way, first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

ASY: ”ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܝܘܼܟ݂ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܕܝܼܘܵܢ؛ ܕܠܵܐ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܝܘܼܟ݂ ܠܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ، ܘܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ، ܘܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”'wood shlama 'am dalqoewlayoekh bjaldoeta kad bezala ywit 'ameh ldeewan; dla sape-loekh dalqoewlayoekh ldayana, o dayana sape-loekh lnaṭoora, o payshet dirya gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art with him in the way; lest haply the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܦܘܼܠܣܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin iloekh, dle palṭet min tama, hal dyabet poelsa kharaya.
ENG: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou have paid the last farthing.

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ’ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Shmee' lawkhoon dpeesh-laha meerta, ’la 'awdet gayaroeta.‘
ENG: Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܓܲܫܸܩ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܫܲܗܘܲܬܬܵܐ، ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl man dgashiq lbakhta bshahwatta, har bhay 'dana 'weed-leh gayaroeta 'amoeha gaw libeh.
ENG: but I say unto you, that every one that looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܚܪܘܿܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܪܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂؛ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܛܵܠܹܩ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”In 'aynoekh dyameena hawya 'ilta dtoerqala iloekh, khrooṭ-laha o rapee-laha minoekh; sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh dṭaleq khad min hadame dpaghroekh, o la kleh paghroekh paesh dirya gaw gehana.
ENG: And if thy right eye causeth thee to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body be cast into hell.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܩܛܸܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܪܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܛܵܠܹܩ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in eedoekh dyameena hawya 'ilta dtoerqala iloekh, qṭi' laha o rapee-laha minoekh, sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh dṭaleq khad min hadame dpaghroekh, o la kleh paghroekh paesh dirya gaw gehana.
ENG: And if thy right hand causeth thee to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body go into hell.

ASY: ”ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ’ܡ̇ܢ ܕܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ، ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܠܵܠܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Peesh-laha meerta, ’man drape bakhteh, yabil-laha ktawa ddoelala.‘
ENG: It was said also, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܘܼܗ̇ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܬܵܐ. ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܓܵܒܹܪ ܪܘܼܦܝܼܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl man drape bakhteh, shwooq min 'ilta dzanyoeta, bi'wadoeha-yleh gayarta. O man dgaber roepeeta, bi'wada-yleh gayaroeta.
ENG: but I say unto you, that every one that putteth away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, maketh her an adulteress: and whosoever shall marry her when she is put away committeth adultery.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܠܵܐ ܕܲܓܠܸܬ ܒܡܵܘܡܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܡܸܡܸܬ ܡܵܘܡܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Mindrish shmee' lawkhoon dpeesh-laha meerta lanee dqam deeawkhoon, ’la daglit bmawmatoekh, eena tamimit mawmatoekh lmarya.‘
ENG: Again, ye have heard that it was said to them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܗܸܟ̃ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dhik̃ la yameytoon, la bshmaya, sabab koersya dalaha-ylaha,
ENG: but I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by the heaven, for it is the throne of God;

ASY: ”ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܟܘܼܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ؛ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܒܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”O oep la bar'a, sabab eelaha koewsha tkhoot aqlateh; o oep la boorishlim, sabab eelaha mdeeta dmalka goera.
ENG: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܡܹܝܬ ܒܪܹܫܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܫܲܚܠܸܦܸܬ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܸܙܬܵܐ ܟܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܚܘܵܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Oep la yameyt breshoekh, sabab le maṣeyt shakhlipit gaweh khda mizta koemta yan khwarta.
ENG: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, for thou canst not make one hair white or black.

ASY: ”ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܗܹܐ، ܗܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ، ܠܵܐ؛ ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܙܵܐܹܕ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ila hawee hemizmanawkhoon: he, he, o la, la; o mindee dzaed 'al ane, min beesha-yleh.
ENG: But let your speech be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: and whatsoever is more than these is of the evil one.

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ’ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܡܒܵܕܵܠ ܕܥܲܝܢܵܐ، ܘܟܹܟܵܐ ܡܒܵܕܵܠ ܕܟܹܟܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Shmee' lawkhoon dpeesh-laha meerta, ’'ayna mbadal d'ayna, o keka mbadal dkeka.‘
ENG: Ye have heard that it was said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܬܘܼܥܠܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܵܚܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ، ܡܲܚܕܸܪ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dla shaqleetoon toe'la dbeesha, ila man dmakhe-loekh 'al patoekh dyameena, makhdir ileh oep hay kheta.
ENG: but I say unto you, Resist not him that is evil: but whosoever smiteth thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܕܵܐܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܫܵܩܹܠ ܨܘܼܕܪܘܼܟ݂، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܐܘܼܦ ܥܵܒܵܝܬܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”O man dba'e daenoekh o shaqel ṣoedroekh, shwooq dshaqel oep 'abaytoekh.
ENG: And if any man would go to law with thee, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloke also.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܫܘܼܚܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܝܼܠܵܐ، ܙܹܠ݇ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ.
TRL: ”O man dlabil-loekh bshoekhra qa khad meela, ze 'ameh trey.
ENG: And whosoever shall compel thee to go one mile, go with him twain.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܡܲܕܝܸܢ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܠܵܐ ܡܲܕܸܪܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܣܦܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Man dṭaleb minoekh, hal-leh, o man dba'e madyin minoekh, la madirit-leh speeqa.
ENG: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ’ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂، ܘܣܢܝܼ ܠܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”Shmee' lawkhoon dpeesh-laha meerta, ’makhib lshwawoekh, o snee ldishminoekh.‘
ENG: Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܡܲܚܸܒܘܼܢ ܠܕܸܫܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܒܲܪܟ݂ܘܼܢ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܟܲܡܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܠܝܸܨܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܛܵܪܕܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon: makhiboen ldishminawkhoon o barkhoen lman dkamirawkhoon, o 'woodoen ṭawta lman dsane lawkhoon, o ṣaleymoen ṣloota 'al anee dmalyiṣee lawkhoon o ṭardee lawkhoon,
ENG: but I say unto you, Love your enemies, and pray for them that persecute you;

ASY: ”ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܙܪܸܩ ܫܸܡܫܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܨܠܹܐ ܡܸܛܪܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Dhaweytoon bnoone dbabawkhoon dbshmaya, haw dmazriq shimsheh 'al ṭabe o 'al beeshe, o maṣle miṭreh 'al kene o 'al 'awale.
ENG: that ye may be sons of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sendeth rain on the just and the unjust.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ؟
TRL: ”In makhibeetoon lanee dmakhibee lawkhoon, moodee poer'ana eet lawkhoon? Qamoodee oep makhse le 'awdee hadkha?
ENG: For if ye love them that love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܕܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ؟ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ؟
TRL: ”O in dareytoon shlama lakhoonwatawkhoon akhchee, moodee ytoon bi'wada zawda? Qamoodee oep makhse le 'awdee hadkha?
ENG: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the Gentiles the same?

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܡܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܓܡܝܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, hweymoen gmeere, aykh deeleh babawkhoon dbshmaya gmeera.
ENG: Ye therefore shall be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ، ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ، ܐܸܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen hishyar, la hawya d'awdeetoon irwanawkhoon qam bnaynasha, dpaysheetoon khizye bee-ayhy, in 'awdeetoon hadkha, layt lawkhoon poer'ana min babawkhoon dbshmaya.
ENG: Take heed that ye do not your righteousness before men, to be seen of them: else ye have no reward with your Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܡܲܕܥܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܡܚܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܩܲܪܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܒܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܥܵܠܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ، ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܩܝܼܪܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, eeman d'awdet irwana, la mad'it-leh irwanoekh bmkhayta dqarna qama qamoekh, aykh dke 'awdee mashpirane bknoeshyate o b'aloole, dpayshee khqeere byad bnaynasha. Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, danee qoebil-lhoon poer'anayhy.
ENG: When therefore thou doest alms, sound not a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have received their reward.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܣܸܡܵܠܘܼܟ݂ ܝܵܕܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Eena at, eeman d'awdet irwana, la shawqet simaloekh yad'a moodee bi'wada-ylaha yameenoekh,
ENG: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

ASY: ”ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܘܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ.
TRL: ”Dhawe irwanoekh bṭishwa, o baboekh dke khaze bṭishwa, haw bit pare' loekh galyaeet.
ENG: that thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret shall recompense thee.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܲܠܹܝܬ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܟܵܠܝܼ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܩܘܼܪ̈ܢܝܼܵܬܹܐ ܕܥܵܠܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ، ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܒܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ. ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O eeman dṣaleyt ṣloota, la haweyt aykh mashpirane, anee dke makhibee kalee lṣaloeye bknoeshyate o bqoerneeate d'aloole, dpayshee khizye bnashe. Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, danee qoebil-lhoon poer'anayhy.
ENG: And when ye pray, ye shall not be as the hypocrites: for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have received their reward.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܲܠܹܝܬ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ ܠܟܘܼܚܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐ݇ܟ̰ܘܿܡ ܬܲܪܥܘܼܟ݂، ܘܨܲܠܝܼ ܩܵܐ ܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܘܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ.
TRL: ”Eena at eeman dṣaleyt ṣloota, 'woor lkoekhtoekh, o choom tar'oekh, o ṣalee qa baboekh deeleh bṭishwa, o baboekh dke khaze bṭishwa, haw bit pare' loekh galyaeet.
ENG: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thine inner chamber, and having shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret, and thy Father which seeth in secret shall recompense thee.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܲܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬܢܵܝܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܢܦܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܗܲܡܙܲܡܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dṣaleytoon ṣloota, la haweytoon bitnaya hemizman aykh khanpe, aynee dke khashwee dbhamzamta raba bit payshee shmee'e.
ENG: And in praying use not vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܕܵܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Boet aha la dameytoon ilayhy, sabab babawkhoon ke yade' lmoodee ytoon sneeqe, min qam dṭalbeetoon mineh.
ENG: Be not therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ: ܒܵܒܲܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon hadkha ṣaleymoen ṣloota: baban dbshmaya, paesh mqoedsha shimoekh,
ENG: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

ASY: ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Atya malkoetoekh, hawe ṣiwyanoekh, dakhee dbshmaya oep bar'a.
ENG: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

ASY: ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܲܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܣܘܼܢܩܵܢܲܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: Hal lan lakhma dsoenqanan idyoom yawma.
ENG: Give us this day our daily bread.

ASY: ܘܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܵܝܢܲܢ̈، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܵܝܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: O shwooq ilan daynan, dakhee doep akhnan shweeq lan lanee ddaynane yna ilan.
ENG: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܡܲܥܒܸܪܸܬ ܠܲܢ ܠܢܸܣܝܘܿܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܦܲܨܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܐ، ܘܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܥܵܠܡܝܼܢ. ܐܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: La ma'birit lan lnisyoona, ila paṣee lan min beesha, sabab deeoekh eelaha malkoeta, o khayla, o tishbookhta l'alam 'almeen. Ameyn.
ENG: And bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܢܵܗܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܠܓܢܵܗܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Sabab in pakhleetoon lbnaynasha gnahayhy, oep babawkhoon dbshmaya bit pakhil lgnahawkhoon.
ENG: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܢܵܗܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܠܓܢܵܗܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena in la pakhleetoon lbnaynasha gnahayhy, oep babawkhoon dbshmaya le pakhil lgnahawkhoon.
ENG: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܵܝܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܣܪܝܼ ܦܲܪܨܘܿܦܲܝܗܝ، ܕܡܲܒܝܸܢܝܼ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܝܼܡܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ. ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O eeman dṣaymeetoon, la haweytoon khashane aykh mashpirane, anee dke masree parṣoopayhy, dmabyinee lnashe dṣeeme yna. Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon danee qoebil-lhoon poer'anayhy.
ENG: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen of men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have received their reward.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܵܝܡܹܬ، ܚܲܠܸܠ ܦܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܡܫܘܿܚ ܪܹܫܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Eena at eeman dṣaymet, khalil patoekh o mshookh reshoekh,
ENG: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thy head, and wash thy face;

ASY: ”ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܒܝܸܢܸܬ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܘܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ.
TRL: ”Dla mabyinit lnashe dṣeema ywit, ila lbaboekh deeleh bṭishwa, o baboekh dke khaze bṭishwa, haw bit pare' loekh galyaeet.
ENG: that thou be not seen of men to fast, but of thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall recompense thee.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܡܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܐܸܟ݂ܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ، ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܙܥܝܼ ܘܓܵܢܒ݂ܝܼ.
TRL: ”La matweetoon lawkhoon seemate bar'a, ayka dmrayta o ikhla ke makhriwee, o ayka dgenabe ke baz'ee o ganwee.
ENG: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust doth consume, and where thieves break through and steal:

ASY: ”ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܲܬܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܟ݂ܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ، ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܙܥܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܓܵܢܒ݂ܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ila matwoen lawkhoon seemate bshmaya, ayka dla mrayta o la ikhla ke makhriwee, o ayka dgenabe le baz'ee o le ganwee.
ENG: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth consume, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Sabab ayka deena seematawkhoon, tama bit hawe oep libawkhoon.
ENG: for where thy treasure is, there will thy heart be also.

ASY: ”ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܟ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ، ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܒܲܗܪܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bahra dpaghra 'ayna-ylaha. Hadkha, in 'aynoekh hawya dkheeta, kleh paghroekh bahrana-yleh.
ENG: The lamp of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܚܸܫܟܵܢܵܐ. ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܘܼܟ݂ ܚܸܫܟܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܚܸܫܟܘܼܟ݂ ܟܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ!
TRL: ”Eena in 'aynoekh beeshta-ylaha, kleh paghroekh bit hawe khishkana. O hadkha, in bahra deeleh gawoekh khishkana-yleh, khishkoekh kma bit hawe!
ENG: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is the darkness!

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܲܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܸܒ؛ ܝܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܚܲܕ ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܣܠܹܐ. ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܵܠܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܠܙܘܼܙܵܐ.
TRL: ”Le maṣe khad nasha palekh ltrey marawate, sabab yan lkhad bit sane o lhaw khena bit makhib; yan bit myaqir lkhad o lhaw khena bit masle. Le maṣeytoon palkheetoon lalaha o lzoeza.
ENG: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܝܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ، ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin ilawkhoon, la akhleetoon kham boet khayoetawkhoon dmoodee bit akhleetoon o moodee bit shateytoon, o la boet paghrawkhoon dmoodee bit lawsheetoon. Le-ylaha gana boesh zawda min mekhoelta, o paghra boesh zawda min lweeshta?
ENG: Therefore I say unto you, Be not anxious for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than the food, and the body than the raiment?

ASY: ”ܓܲܫܩܘܼܢ ܒܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ: ܠܹܐ ܙܵܪܥܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܨܕܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܥܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܢܒܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܬܲܪܣܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: ”Gashqoen bṭayre dshmaya: le zar'ee o le khaṣdee, o le jam'ee gaw anbare, eena babawkhoon dbshmaya ke tarse-lhoon. Le ytoon akhtoon boesh zawda minayhy?
ENG: Behold the birds of the heaven, that they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; and your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are not ye of much more value than they?

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܚܲܡ ܒܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܡܲܙܝܸܕ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܘܡܬܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Aynee minawkhoon, kma dakel kham bqishyoeta maṣe mazyid 'al qawmteh khda yameena?
ENG: And which of you by being anxious can add one cubit unto his stature?

ASY: ”ܘܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ؟ ܓܲܫܩܘܼܢ ܒܫܘܿܫܲܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܸܫܬܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܓܲܪܘܸܣܝܼ؛ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܥܵܙܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”O qamoodee hadkha bekhala ytoon kham boet lweeshta? Gashqoen bshooshane ddishta, dakhee ke garwisee; le palkhee o le 'azlee,
ENG: And why are ye anxious concerning raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܚܸܩܪܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, doep shleymoon bkleh khiqreh le ywa lweesha aykh khad minayhy.
ENG: yet I say unto you, that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܒܸܫ ܠܓܸܠܵܐ ܕܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܬܲܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܲܠܒܸܫ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”In Alaha hadkha ke malbish lgila dkhaqla deeleh qa khad yawma, o qaydamta ke paesh dirya btanoera, le boesh zawda malbish ilawkhoon ya baṣoore dhaymanoeta?
ENG: But if God doth so clothe the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܲܚ؟‘ ܝܲܢ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܵܬܲܚ؟‘ ܝܲܢ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܲܚ؟‘
TRL: ”Boet aha, la akhleetoon kham o amreetoon, ’moodee akhlakh?‘ yan, ’moodee shatakh?‘ yan, ’moodee lawshakh?‘
ENG: Be not therefore anxious, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab klayhy ane imwate ke ṭalbee-lhoon; eena babawkhoon dbshmaya ke yade' doep akhtoon sneeqe ytoon lklayhy ane.
ENG: For after all these things do the Gentiles seek; for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܹܗ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon ṭlooboen qamayta malkoeta dalaha o zadeeqoeteh, o klayhy ane bit payshee moezyide ilawkhoon.
ENG: But seek ye first his kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܚܡܸܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇. ܡܵܠܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Boet aha la akhleetoon kham boet qaydamta, sabab qaydamta bit takhmina boet ganoeha. Malyanta-ylaha beeshta dyawma qa ganeh.
ENG: Be not therefore anxious for the morrow: for the morrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܕܵܝܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”La dayneetoon, dla paysheetoon deene.
ENG: Judge not, that ye be not judged.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܕܵܝܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ، ܘܒܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܟܵܝܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܟܝܼܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Sabab bdyanta dbeeoeha dayneetoon, bit paysheetoon deene, o bkyoela dbee-eh kayleetoon, bit paesh keela ilawkhoon.
ENG: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured unto you.

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܙܸܠܸܟܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܘܼܗ̇؟
TRL: ”Qamoodee bikhzaya ywit zilika dgaw 'ayna dakhoonoekh, eena qareeta dgaw 'aynoekh le ywit bikhzayoeha?
ENG: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ’ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܕܦܲܠܛܸܢܹܗ ܙܸܠܸܟܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂،‘ ܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܩܵܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂؟
TRL: ”Yan dakhee bemara ywit lakhoonoekh, ’shwooq dpalṭineh zilika min gaw 'aynoekh,‘ kad eet qareeta gaw 'ayna dganoekh?
ENG: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me cast out the mote out of thine eye; and lo, the beam is in thine own eye?

ASY: ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪܵܢܵܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܩܵܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܒܨܸܦܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܙܸܠܸܟܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”At ya mashpirana, qamayta paliṭ qareeta min gaw 'ayna dganoekh, o haygah bit khazeyt bṣipyoeta lpaloeṭe zilika min gaw 'ayna dakhoonoekh.
ENG: Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother’s eye.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܠܟܲܠܒܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܕܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܓܵܢܝܵܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܕܲܫܕܸܫܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܩܠܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܘܟ̰ܲܢܟ̰ܸܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”La yaweetoon mindee mqoedsha lkalbe, o la dareytoon marganyatawkhoon qam khzoere, dla dashdishee-lhoon baqlatayhy, o bkharta dayree o chanchiree lawkhoon.
ENG: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast your pearls before the swine, lest haply they trample them under their feet, and turn and rend you.

ASY: ”ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؛ ܛܥܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ؛ ܬܲܩܬܸܩܘܼܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ṭlooboen, o bit paesh yoewa ilawkhoon; ṭ'eymoen, o bit machkheetoon; taqtiqoen, o bit paesh pteekha ilawkhoon.
ENG: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܵܠܹܒ، ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ؛ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܛܵܥܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ؛ ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܲܩܬܸܩ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab kl man dṭaleb, bit qabil; o haw dṭa'e bit machikh; o lhaw dtaqtiq, bit paesh pteekha ileh.
ENG: for every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Yan aynee-yleh minawkhoon din brooneh ṭaleb mineh lakhma, bit pashiṭ ileh kepa?
ENG: Or what man is there of you, who, if his son shall ask him for a loaf, will give him a stone;

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܢܘܼܢܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܘܹܐ؟
TRL: ”O in ṭaleb mineh noena, bit pashiṭ ileh khoewe?
ENG: or if he shall ask for a fish, will give him a serpent?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܠܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ!
TRL: ”In hadkha akhtoon deetoon beeshe ke yad'eetoon leeawa mawhwate ṭabe lbnoonawkhoon, kma boesh zawda babawkhoon dbshmaya bit yabil ṭawate lanee dṭalbee mineh!
ENG: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ؛ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Kl mindee dbasma lawkhoon d'awdee ilawkhoon bnaynasha, hadkha oep akhtoon 'woodoen ilayhy; sabab hadkha bemara yna namoosa o nwee-e.
ENG: All things therefore whatsoever ye would that men should do unto you, even so do ye also unto them: for this is the law and the prophets.

ASY: ”ܥܒ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܒܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܥܝܼܩܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܸܬܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܪܘܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܲܒܠܵܐ ܠܛܠܵܩܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”'wooroen btar'a 'eeqa, sabab pitya-yleh tar'a o rweekhta-ylaha oerkha dke labla lṭlaqa, o raba yna anee dke azee beeoeha.
ENG: Enter ye in by the narrow gate: for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many be they that enter in thereby.

ASY: ”ܟܡܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܟܡܵܐ ܥܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܲܒܠܵܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ؛ ܘܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Kma z'oora-yleh tar'a, o kma 'eeqta-ylaha oerkha dke labla lkhaye; o baṣoore yna anee dke machkhee-laha.
ENG: For narrow is the gate, and straitened the way, that leadeth unto life, and few be they that find it.

ASY: ”ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܐܝܼܬ ܕܹܐܒܹ̈ܐ ܟ̰ܵܠܘܿܓ̰ܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haweytoon hishyar min nwee-e dagale datee lkis lawkhoon blweeshyate dpere, eena gawaeet debe chalooje yna.
ENG: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravening wolves.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܛܦܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܢܒܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܝܼܘܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: ”Min ṭ'oenyatayhy bit yad'eetoon-lhoon. Qamoodee ke qaṭpee min kitwe 'anbe, yan min qeeware tene?
ENG: By their fruits ye shall know them. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܟܠ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ، ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ.
TRL: ”Hadkha, kl eelana ṭawa, ṭ'oenyate ṭabe ke ṭa'en; eena eelana beesha, ṭ'oenyate beeshe ke ṭa'en.
ENG: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but the corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eelana ṭawa le maṣe ṭa'en ṭ'oenyate beeshe, o la eelana beesha maṣe ṭa'en ṭ'oenyate ṭabe.
ENG: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܘܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kl eelana dla ṭa'en ṭ'oenyate ṭabe, ke paesh preema o dirya bnoera.
ENG: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, min ṭ'oenyatayhy bit yad'eetoon-lhoon.
ENG: Therefore by their fruits ye shall know them.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܪܝܼ،‘ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ؛ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Le-ylaha kl man damer ilee, ’maree, maree,‘ bit 'aber lmalkoeta dshmaya; ila man d'abed ṣiwyana dbabee deeleh bshmaya.
ENG: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܲܢ؟ ܘܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܲܢ؟ ܘܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ؟‘
TRL: ”Raba bit amree ilee bhaw yawma, ’maree, maree, le ywa bshimoekh noebe lan? O bshimoekh shede poeliṭ lan? O bshimoekh raba khayle goere 'weed lan?‘
ENG: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy by thy name, and by thy name cast out devils, and by thy name do many mighty works?

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؛ ܪܚܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܝܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Haygah bit amren ilayhy, ’ana hik̃ le yad'enawkhoon; rkhooqoen akhtoon minee, ya palakhe d'awla.‘
ENG: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈، ܘܢܵܛܹܪܗܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܕܡܝܼܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܟܝܼܡܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, kl man dshame' ane hemizmanee, o naṭerhoon, bit paesh moedmeea lkhad nasha khakeema, haw dbne-leh bayteh 'al qaya.
ENG: Every one therefore which heareth these words of mine, and doeth them, shall be likened unto a wise man, which built his house upon the rock:

ASY: ”ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܲܗܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܲܬܐܸܣܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܝܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”O ṣle-laha miṭra, o te-lhoon nahrawate, o qeem-lhoon pawkhe, o qeet-lhoon bhaw bayta, eena la npeel-leh, sabab shatisteh 'al qaya moetiwta ywa.
ENG: and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon the rock.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈، ܘܠܵܐ ܢܵܛܹܪܗܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܕܡܝܼܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܣܹܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”O kl man dshame' ane hemizmanee, o la naṭerhoon, bit paesh moedmeea lnasha sakhla, haw dbne-leh bayteh 'al sela.
ENG: And every one that heareth these words of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:

ASY: ”ܨܠܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܲܗܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܢܦܵܠܬܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ṣle-laha miṭra, o te-lhoon nahrawate, o qeem-lhoon pawkhe, o qeet-lhoon bhaw bayta, o npeel-leh, o hwe-laha npalteh goerta.“
ENG: and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and smote upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall thereof.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܬܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ؛
TRL: Eeman dkhteem-leh eeshoo' ane hemizmane, 'oejib-lhoon kinshe byoelpaneh;
ENG: And it came to pass, when Jesus ended these words, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܦܪ̈ܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Sabab maloepay ywa aykh khad mare shoelṭana, o la aykh saprayhy.
ENG: for he taught them as one having authority, and not as their scribes.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܬܒܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dṣle-leh eeshoo' min ṭoera, tbee' lhoon ileh kinshe raba.
ENG: And when he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܓܸܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ، ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܕܲܟܹܝܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O te-leh khad girwana o sgheed-leh ileh o meereh, ”maree, in ba'eyt, maṣeyt dakeyt-lee.“
ENG: And behold, there came to him a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ، ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܵܥܹܝܢ، ܦܘܼܫ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܸܪܒܹܗ.
TRL: O poeshṭa-leh eeshoo' eedeh, o dqeereh bee-eh, o meereh, ”ba'eyn, poesh dikhya.“ o har bhay 'dana peesh-leh dikhya min girbeh.
ENG: And he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou made clean. And straightway his leprosy was cleansed.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܠܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܵܗܢܵܐ، ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh eeshoo', ”la hawya damret loep khad, ila ze makhzee ganoekh lkahna, o maqriw diwkha aykh dpqeed-leh moeshe lsahdoetayhy.“
ENG: And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: Eeman d'weereh eeshoo' gaw kparnakhoom, te-leh lkis-leh khad rab ima o poerpil-leh bee-eh,
ENG: And when he was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܪܹܓܝܼ ܒܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh, ”maree, regee bshweeta-yleh gaw bayta, shpeela, o janjoere-yleh raba.“
ENG: and saying, Lord, my servant lieth in the house sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܘܒܲܣܡܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ana bit ateyn o basmineh.“
ENG: And he saith unto him, I will come and heal him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ، ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܘܒܸܬ ܒܵܣܹܡ ܪܹܓܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh rab ima o meereh, ”maree, ana le ywin khsheekha dat 'awret gaw baytee, ila moor, bhemizman akhchee, o bit basem regee.
ENG: And the centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but only say the word, and my servant shall be healed.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ، ’ܙܹܠ݇،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ؛ ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ’ܬܵܐ،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ؛ ܘܠܪܹܓܝܼ، ’ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܐܵܗܵܐ،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ.“
TRL: ”Oep ana khad nasha ywin tkhoot shoelṭana, o eet tkhoot eedee dakhshe, o ke amren-laha, ’ze,‘ o ke azel; o lhaw khena, ’ta,‘ o ke ate; o lregee, ’'wood aha,‘ o ke 'abed.“
ENG: For I also am a man under authority, having under myself soldiers: and I say to this one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo' aha, 'oejib-leh, o meereh lanee dbetaya ywaw 'ameh, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, oep gaw eesrayel la moechikh-lee haymanoeta aykh aha.
ENG: And when Jesus heard it, he marveled, and said to them that followed, Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

ASY: ”ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܕܢܚܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܥܪܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ؛
TRL: ”O bemara ywin ilawkhoon, draba bit atee min madnkha o min ma'rwa, o bit yatwee 'am awraham o eeskhaq o ya'qoow gaw malkoeta dshmaya;
ENG: And I say unto you, that many shall come from the east and the west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܪܘܼܦܝܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܒܲܪܵܝܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena bnoone dmalkoeta bit payshee roepye gaw khishka baraya, ayka dbit hawe bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke.“
ENG: but the sons of the kingdom shall be cast forth into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ”ܙܹܠ݇، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܓܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ.
TRL: O meereh eeshoo' lhaw rab ima, ”ze, aykh dhoeminoekh hawe-loekh.“ o bseem-leh regeh bhay sa'at.
ENG: And Jesus said unto the centurion, Go thy way; as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee. And the servant was healed in that hour.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܡܵܬܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' lbayta dshim'oon kepa, o khze-leh lkhmateh dmeekhta o dweeqtoeha khamkhamta.
ENG: And when Jesus was come into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother lying sick of a fever.

ASY: ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܘܼܗ̇ ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ.
TRL: O dqeereh beedoeha o shweeq-laha iloeha khamkhamta, o qeem-laha o 'weed-laha ilayhy khilmat.
ENG: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she arose, and ministered unto him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ. ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܹܐܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܘܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh ramsha, moete-lhoon lkis-leh raba min anee deet waw bee-ayhy shede. O poeliṭ-leh lshedayhy bhemizman, o boesim-leh lklayhy anee dmree'e ywaw.
ENG: And when even was come, they brought unto him many possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all that were sick:

ASY: ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: O aha hwe-laha dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesh-leh meera besha'ya nweea dmeereh:
ENG: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bare our diseases.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh eeshoo' lkinshe raba deewaw lkhadirwanoehy, pqeed-leh dazee lhaw marza khena dyama.
ENG: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܣܵܦܪܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܬ.“
