ENG: which, when it was filled, they drew up on the beach; and they sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but the bad they cast away.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ. ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܫܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”Hadkha bit hawe bshoelama dzawna. Bit atee malake o bit parshee beeshe min ṭabe,
ENG: So shall it be in the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the righteous,

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܬܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”O bit daree-lhoon beeshe gaw atoona dnoera, ayka dbit hawe bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke.“
ENG: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܡܵܪܲܢ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”poerme lawkhoon klayhy ane?“ joewib-lhoon, ”he, Maran.“
ENG: Have ye understood all these things? They say unto him, Yea.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܠ ܣܵܦܪܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܠܡܸܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܬܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”kl sapra dpeesha-yleh toelmida qa malkoeta dshmaya ke dame lnasha mara dbayta dke paliṭ min seemateh mindeeane khate o 'ateeqe.“
ENG: And he said unto them, Therefore every scribe who hath been made a disciple to the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is a householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dtoemim-leh eeshoo' lane matle, shoene-leh min tama,
ENG: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܹܗ، ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: O te-leh lmdeeteh, o malip wa gaw knoeshyatayhy, dakhee d'ajbee waw o amree waw, ”min ayka aha nasha eet-leh aha khikhmta o ane khayle goere?
ENG: And coming into his own country he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this man this wisdom, and these mighty works?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܲܓܵܪܵܐ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܣܹܐ ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Le-yleh aha broona dnagara? Le-ylaha yimeh maryam, o akhoonwateh ya'qoow o yoose o shim'oon o eehoeda?
ENG: Is not this the carpenter’s son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joseph, and Simon, and Judas?

ASY: ”ܘܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ؟ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟“
TRL: ”O le yna khatwateh klayhy lkis lan? Min ayka eet-leh klayhy ane?“
ENG: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this man all these things?

ASY: ܘܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܹܗ ܘܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.“
TRL: O naplee waw btoerqala bee-eh. Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”layt nweea moesleea ila gaw mdeeteh o gaw bayteh.“
ENG: And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܠܲܝܬܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O la 'weed-leh tama khayle goere raba boet laytayoeta dhaymanoetayhy.
ENG: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܘܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: Banee yawmane, shmee' leh heroodis ṭiṭrarka boet shoelane deeshoo',
ENG: At that season Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: O meereh lregawateh, ”aha-yleh yookhanan ma'mdana dqeema-yleh min gaw meete, boet aha khayle goere pyasha yna 'weede bee-eh.“
ENG: and said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore do these powers work in him.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܕܸܪܝܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܝܼܵܐ، ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Sabab heroodis dweeqa ywa lyookhanan, seereh o diryeh gaw beyt aseere boet heroodeea, bakhta dpeeleepoos akhoonoehy.
ENG: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܵܩܠܹܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Sabab meera ywa ileh yookhanan, ”le-ylaha qanoonayta dshaqlet-laha iloekh bakhta.“
ENG: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.

ASY: ܘܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܙܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: O ba'e wa heroodis dqaṭel wa lyookhanan, eena ke zade' wa min kinsha sabab aykh nweea ke khashwee waw lyookhanan.
ENG: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܝܬ ܝܲܠܕܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܪܩܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܝܼܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Eena eeman dhwe-leh beyt yalda dheroodis, rqeed-laha brata dheroodeea qam anee dteebe ywaw, o bseem-laha-leh heroodis beeoeha.
ENG: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced in the midst, and pleased Herod.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܵܘܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܵܐ.
TRL: O qoewil-leh bmawmate dbit yabil-laha kl mindee dṭalba.
ENG: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she should ask.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ، ܟܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܦܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O hay, kad min qam 'dana peeshta ywa moelipta byad yimoeha, meeraha, ”hal-lee adeea lakha gaw mana resha dyookhanan ma'mdana.“
ENG: And she, being put forward by her mother, saith, Give me here in a charger the head of John the Baptist.

ASY: ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܘܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Psheem-leh malka, eena boet mawmate, o boet anee dteebe ywaw, pqeed-leh dpaesh yoewa iloeha.
ENG: And the king was grieved; but for the sake of his oaths, and of them which sat at meat with him, he commanded it to be given;

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܦܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Shoedireh o moeprim-leh resha dyookhanan gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: and he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܬܝܵܐ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܒܪܵܬܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܐ ܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O peesh-leh moetya resheh gaw mana, o peesh-leh yoewa lbrata, o hay moete-laha qa yimoeha.
ENG: And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she brought it to her mother.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܠܲܕܹܗ ܘܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: te-lhoon talmeede dyookhanan o shqeel-lhoon lshladeh o qweera-lhoon, o te-lhoon moekhbirhoon leeshoo'.
ENG: And his disciples came, and took up the corpse, and buried him; and they went and told Jesus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܒܐܲܩܠܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo' boet yookhanan, bnawsheh shoene-leh bgamee ldoeka kheta. O kad shmee' lhoon kinshe dayka ywa, zeel-lhoon bareh baqlayhy min mdeenate.
ENG: Now when Jesus heard it, he withdrew from thence in a boat, to a desert place apart: and when the multitudes heard thereof, they followed him on foot from the cities.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' o khze-leh kinshe raba, o roekhim-leh 'alayhy, o boesim-leh mree'ayhy.
ENG: And he came forth, and saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, and healed their sick.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܘܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇. ܫܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܙܵܒ݂ܢܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O kad hwe-leh ramsha, te-lhoon talmeedoehy o meerhoon leeshoo', ”gaw bareea ywakh o 'dana 'weerta-ylaha. Shree lkinshe dazee lmatwate, o zawnee-lhoon mekhoelta.“
ENG: And when even was come, the disciples came to him, saying, The place is desert, and the time is already past; send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܢܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”le-ylaha sneeqta dazee, akhtoon haloen-lhoon mekhoelta.“
ENG: But Jesus said unto them, They have no need to go away; give ye them to eat.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Anee joewib-lhoon ileh, ”layt lan lakha ila khamsha lakhme o tartey noene.“
ENG: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”mayteymoen-lhoon lakha lkis-lee.“
ENG: And he said, Bring them hither to me.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠ ܓܸܠܵܐ. ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh lkinshe dyatwee waw 'al gila. O shqeel-leh anee khamsha lakhme o tartey noene, o kheereh bshmaya, o boerikh-leh, o qṣe-leh, o yoebil-leh ltalmeedoehy, o talmeede yoebil-lhoon lkinshe.
ENG: And he commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake and gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ.
TRL: O klayhy kheel-lhoon o swee' lhoon, o shqeel-lhoon qiṭ'aṭe dzeed-lhoon, tri'sar qoepe milye.
ENG: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up that which remained over of the broken pieces, twelve baskets full.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܲܠܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Anee dkheel-lhoon aykh khamsha alpe nashe ywaw, shwooq min bakhtate o yaloede.
ENG: And they that did eat were about five thousand men, beside women an children.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܐܵܣܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܦܫܸܛ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Hay gaha pqeed-leh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy dasqee waw gaw gamee o azee waw min qam dee-eh lhaw marza khena, kad haw mapshiṭ wa lkinshe.
ENG: And straightway he constrained the disciples to enter into the boat, and to go before him unto the other side, till he should send the multitudes away.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ. ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܘܗܹܫ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshoedireh lkinshe, seeq-leh lṭoera bnawsheh lṣaloeye. O hwe-leh khishka o hesh haw tama bnawsheh.
ENG: And after he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain apart to pray: and when even was come, he was there alone.

ASY: ܘܓܵܡܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܘܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܥܸܫܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O gamee raba rikhqa ywa min birza o pyasha moesh'ishta raba byad lape, sabab pawkha lbalqoewloeha ywa.
ENG: But the boat was now in the midst of the sea, distressed by the waves; for the wind was contrary.

ASY: ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܐܸܫܸܬ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Maykh sa'at dishit qaydamta zeel-leh eeshoo' lkis layhy bikhdara 'al meea.
ENG: And in the fourth watch of the night he came unto them, walking upon the sea.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܲܝܗܝ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon ileh talmeede bikhdara 'al meea, min zdoe'tayhy shgheesh-lhoon o moeqwikh-lhoon, ”khizwa-yleh.“
ENG: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is an apparition; and they cried out for fear.

ASY: ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܸܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Har bhay 'dana joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”hweymoen libane, ana ywin, la zad'eetoon.“
ENG: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ، ܦܩܘܿܕ ܠܝܼ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”maree, in at eewit, pqood-lee dateyn lkis-loekh 'al meea.“
ENG: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee upon the waters.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܵܐ.“ ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ta.“ o ṣle-leh shim'oon kepa min gamee bikhdara 'al meea, date lkis eeshoo'.
ENG: And he said, Come. And Peter went down from the boat, and walked upon the waters, to come to Jesus.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܛܒܵܥܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܝܼ،“
TRL: O kad khze-leh pawkha khaylana, zdee' leh, o shoere-leh liṭba'a, o moeqwikh-leh, ”maree, pariq-lee,“
ENG: But when he saw the wind, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying, Lord, save me.

ASY: ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܫܸܟ؟“
TRL: Har bhay 'dana poeshṭa-leh eedeh eeshoo' o dweeq-leh bee-eh o meereh, ”ya baṣoora dhaymanoeta, qamoodee peesh-loekh bshik?“
ENG: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand, and took hold of him, and saith unto him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܫܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ.
TRL: O kad 'weereh gaw gamee, shle-leh pawkha.
ENG: And when they were gone up into the boat, the wind ceased.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ.“
TRL: O anee deewaw gaw gamee sgheed-lhoon ileh, o meerhoon, ”shareeraeet broona dalaha ywit.“
ENG: And they that were in the boat worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܹܣܲܪ.
TRL: 'weerhoon o te-lhoon lar'a dgenesar.
ENG: And when they had crossed over, they came to the land, unto Gennesaret.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon boet dee-eh nashe dhay doeka, shoedirhoon o moekhbirhoon lklayhy matwate dkhadirwanayhy, o moete-lhoon lkis-leh klayhy anee dmree'e ywaw.
ENG: And when the men of that place knew him, they sent into all that region round about, and brought unto him all that were sick;

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܕܵܩܪܝܼ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܫܸܦܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ. ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܩܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O poerpil-lhoon bee-eh ddaqree akhchee bshipoela dlweeshteh. O klayhy anee ddqeerhoon, bseem-lhoon.
ENG: and they besought him that they might only touch the border of his garment: and as many as touched were made whole.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon sapre o preeshe min oorishlim lkis eeshoo' o boeqirhoon mineh,
ENG: Then there come to Jesus from Jerusalem Pharisees and scribes, saying,

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܒܸܫܡܵܛܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܲܠܘܼܠܹܐ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܟܲܕ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Qamoodee talmeedoekh bishmaṭa yna sapyanoeta dkhwardiqne? Sabab le yna khaloele eedatayhy kad akhlee lakhma.“
ENG: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܫܡܵܛܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qamoodee oep akhtoon bishmaṭa ytoon poeqdana dalaha byad sapyanoetawkhoon?
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God because of your tradition?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ، ’ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܨܲܥܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܲܢ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ.‘
TRL: ”Sabab Alaha pqeed-leh, ’myaqir lbaboekh o lyimoekh, o man dṣa'ir lbaboehy yan lyimeh, mawta maet.‘
ENG: For God said, Honour thy father and thy mother: and, He that speaketh evil of father or mother, let him die the death.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܲܢ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ’ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܢܸܕܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،‘ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܲܢ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon ke amreetoon kl man damer lbaboehy yan lyimeh, ’mindee dhawe yoetrana iloekh, nidra-yleh minee qa Alaha,‘ le-ylaha ananqayta dmyaqir lbaboehy yan lyimeh.
ENG: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, That wherewith thou mightest have been profited by me is given to God;

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܛܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Boeṭil lawkhoon hemizman dalaha byad sapyanoetawkhoon.
ENG: he shall not honour his father. And ye have made void the word of God because of your tradition.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ:
TRL: ”Ya mashpirane, ṣpayee noebe-leh boet deeawkhoon esha'ya nweea, bemara:
ENG: Ye hypocrites, well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܣܸܦܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܟܹܐ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܸܒܹܗ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ.
TRL: Aha 'ama bsipwateh ke myaqir ilee, eena libeh rikhqa-yleh minee.
ENG: This people honoureth me with their lips; But their heart is far from me.

ASY: ܘܣܪܝܼܩܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: O sreeqaeet bisghada yna ilee, kad maloepe yna yoelpane dpoeqdane dbnaynasha.“
ENG: But in vain do they worship me, Teaching as their doctrines the precepts of men.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܘܦܲܪܡܹܝܡܘܼܢ،
TRL: O qre-leh lkinshe o meereh ilayhy, ”shmi'moen o parmeymoen,
ENG: And he called to him the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܠܹܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Mindee d'aber lpoema le chaplin lbarnasha, ila mindee dpaleṭ min poema, haw ke chaplin lbarnasha.“
ENG: Not that which entereth into the mouth defileth the man; but that which proceedeth out of the mouth, this defileth the man.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon talmeedoehy lkis-leh o meerhoon ileh, ”beeda'a ywit dkreeb-lhoon preeshe eeman dshmee' lhoon aha?“
ENG: Then came the disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, when they heard this saying?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܠ ܢܨܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܢܨܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܥܩܝܼܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”kl nṣeewta dla nṣeewa-leh babee dbshmaya bit paysha 'qeerta.
ENG: But he answered and said, Every plant which my heavenly Father planted not, shall be rooted up.

ASY: ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܡܗܲܕܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ. ܘܐܸܢ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܠܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܡܗܲܕܹܐ، ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܒܓܘܼܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Shwooqoen-lhoon, simye yna o mhadyane dsimye. O in simya lsimya mhade, tirwayhy bgoeba bit naplee.“
ENG: Let them alone: they are blind guides. And if the blind guide the blind, both shall fall into a pit.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܦܲܫܸܩ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”maree, pashiq lan aha matla.“
ENG: And Peter answered and said unto him, Declare unto us the parable.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܹܫ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”oep akhtoon hesh dla parmayta ytoon?
ENG: And he said, Are ye also even yet without understanding?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ؟
TRL: ”Le yad'eetoon, mindee d'aber lpoema ke azel lkesa, o min tama ke paesh roepya lbadar?
ENG: Perceive ye not, that whatsoever goeth into the mouth passeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܠܹܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena mindee dpaleṭ min poema ke ate min liba, haw ke chaplin lbarnasha.
ENG: But the things which proceed out of the mouth come forth out of the heart; and they defile the man.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ: ܩܸܛܠܹ̈ܐ، ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ، ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܓܘܼܕܵܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab min liba ke palṭee khoeshabe beeshe: qiṭle, gayaroeta, zanyoeta, sahdoeta ddoegla, genawoeta, o goedape.
ENG: For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, railings:

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢܝܼ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠܬܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܠܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ane yna dke chaplinee lbarnasha. Eena khalta beedate la khoelile le chaplina lbarnasha.“
ENG: these are the things which defile the man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not the man.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܨܘܿܪ ܘܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh min tama eeshoo' o te-leh ltkhoema dṣoor o ṣaydoon.
ENG: And Jesus went out thence, and withdrew into the parts of Tyre and Sidon.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܟܢܲܥܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܚܘܼܡܹ̈ܐ، ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ، ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܒܪܵܬܝܼ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܬܵܐ ܒܫܹܐܕܵܐ.“
TRL: O ha khda bakhta kna'nayta te-laha min anee tkhoeme, maqwoekhe, o bemara, ”rakhim 'alee maree, broona ddaweed, bratee khirba pyasha-ylaha joenjirta bsheda.“
ENG: And behold, a Canaanitish woman came out from those borders, and cried, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ. ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܫܲܕܸܪܵܗ̇، ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܲܢ.“
TRL: Eena haw la joewib-leh iloeha oep khad khabra. O talmeedoehy te-lhoon lkis-leh o meerhoon ileh, ”shadiraha, maqwoekhe-laha baran.“
ENG: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܛܠܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”la peesh-lee shoedra ila qa 'irbe ṭleeqe min beyt eesrayel.“
ENG: But he answered and said, I was not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܗܲܝܸܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Eena hay bakhta te-laha, sgheed-laha ileh, bemara, ”maree, hayiree.“
ENG: But she came and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܚܫܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܕܪܵܝܹܗ ܠܟܲܠܒܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw joewib-leh o meereh, ”le-ylaha khsheekhta lishqala lakhma dbnoone o ldrayeh lkalbe.“
ENG: And he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children’s bread and cast it to the dogs.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇، ”ܗܹܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܲܠܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܸܪ̈ܬܘܼܚܹܐ ܕܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: O hay joewib-laha, ”he maree, eena oep kalbe ke akhlee min pirtoekhe dnaplee min patoora dmarawatayhy.“
ENG: But she said, Yea, Lord: for even the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܟ݂ܝ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܵܥܝܲܬܝ.“ ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ.
TRL: Haygah joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh iloeha, ”bakhta, goerta-ylaha haymanoetakhy, hawe lakhy aykh dba'yaty.“ o bseem-laha bratoeha min hay sa'at.
ENG: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it done unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was healed from that hour.

ASY: ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Shoene-leh eeshoo' min hay doeka deewa o te-leh lmarza dyama dgleela, seeq-leh lṭoera, o teew-leh tama.
ENG: And Jesus departed thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܸܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܪ̈ܫܹܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܒܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ،
TRL: O kinshe raba te-lhoon lkis-leh, o moete-lhoon 'amayhy shpeele o shile o simye o kharshe, o raba khene, o moetbay-lhoon qam aqlate deeshoo' o boesmay-leh,
ENG: And there came unto him great multitudes, having with them the lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and they cast them down at his feet; and he healed them:

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܪ̈ܫܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܘܫܸܠܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܣܡܹܐ، ܘܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ، ܘܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ؛ ܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: Hadkha d'ajbee waw kinshe, eeman dkhze-lhoon kharshe hamzoeme, o shile pyasha boesme, o shpeele bikhdara, o simye bikhzaya; shoebikh-lhoon lalaha deesrayel.
ENG: insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb speaking, the maimed whole, and the lame walking, and the blind seeing: and they glorified the God of Israel.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܪܲܚܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܫܲܕܪܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܟܦܝܼܢܹܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܫܲܡܫܸܡܝܼ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.“
TRL: O qre-leh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy o meereh, ”rakhoeme ywin 'al aha kinsha, sabab ane tlata yawmane lakha yna lkis-lee, o layt-lhoon mindee dakhlee, o le ba'eyn dshadrinhoon kpeene, dla shamshimee boerkha.“
ENG: And Jesus called unto him his disciples, and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days and have nothing to eat: and I would not send them away fasting, lest haply they faint in the way.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܕܡܲܣܒܸܥܲܚ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: meerhoon ileh talmeedoehy, ”min ayka eet lan khad hadkha lakhma gaw bareea, dmasbi'akh khad hadkha kinsha?“
ENG: And the disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so many loaves in a desert place, as to fill so great a multitude?

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܡܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ، ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Boeqireh eeshoo' minayhy, ”kma lakhme eet lawkhoon?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”shaw'a, o khakma noene z'oore.“
ENG: And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few small fishes.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh lkinshe dyatwee 'al ar'a.
ENG: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground;

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh lshaw'a lakhme 'am noene o boerikh-leh, o qṣe-leh, o yoebil-leh ltalmeedoehy, o talmeedoehy yoebil-lhoon lkinshe.
ENG: and he took the seven loaves and the fishes; and he gave thanks and brake, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܠܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O kheel-lhoon klayhy o swee' lhoon, o shqeel-lhoon qiṭ'aṭe dzeed-lhoon shaw'a qoepe milye.
ENG: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up that which remained over of the broken pieces, seven baskets full.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܲܠܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O anee dkheel-lhoon arb'a alpe nashe ywaw, shwooq min bakhtate o yaloede.
ENG: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܓ݂ܕܘܿ.
TRL: Min bar dshoedireh lkinshe, seeq-leh lgamee, o te-leh ltkhoeme dmaghdoo.
ENG: And he sent away the multitudes, and entered into the boat, and came into the borders of Magadan.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ. ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: te-lhoon preeshe o zadoeqaye lkis eeshoo' djarbee waw-leh. Ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dmakhze-lhoon neeshanqa min shmaya.
ENG: And the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and tempting him asked him to shew them a sign from heaven.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܨܸܚܘܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܡܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.‘
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy, ”eeman deeleh ramsha, ke amreetoon, ’ṣikhwa-ylaha doenye sabab smeeq-laha shmaya.‘
ENG: But he answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, It will be fair weather: for the heaven is red.

ASY: ”ܘܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܗܵܘܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܪܵܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܡܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܚܘܼܫܟܸܢܵܗ̇.‘ ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܪܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܵܪܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O bṣapra ke amreetoon, ’idyoom hawa dboeran eeleh, sabab smeeq-laha shmaya o khoeshkinaha.‘ ya mashpirane, pata dshmaya ke yad'eetoon dparsheetoon-laha, eena neeshanqe daha zawna le maṣeytoon parsheetoon-lhoon.
ENG: And in the morning, It will be foul weather today: for the heaven is red and lowring. Ye know how to discern the face of the heaven; but ye cannot discern the signs of the times.

ASY: ”ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܓܲܝܵܪܬܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.“ ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sharbta beeshta o gayarta neeshanqa biṭlaba-ylaha, o neeshanqa le paesh yoewa iloeha, shwooq min neeshanqa dyawnan nweea.“ o shweeqay-leh o zeel-leh.
ENG: An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of Jonah. And he left them, and departed.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܡܘܼܢܫܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman d'weerhoon talmeedoehy lhaw marza khena dyama, moenshe-lhoon dshaqlee waw lakhma.
ENG: And the disciples came to the other side and forgot to take bread.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܕܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Haygah meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”hweymoen hishyar min khmeera dpreeshe o dzadoeqaye.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܕܠܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܢ.“
TRL: O anee khsheew-lhoon bganayhy o meerhoon, ”dla shqeel lan lakhma 'aman.“
ENG: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, We took no bread.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh o meereh ilayhy, ”ya baṣoore dhaymanoeta, qamoodee bikhshawa ytoon bganawkhoon dlakhma la shqeel lawkhoon?
ENG: And Jesus perceiving it said, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have no bread?

ASY: ”ܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܡܵܐ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: ”Hal adeea la poerme lawkhoon? Le ytoon bidkhara lanee khamsha lakhme o khamsha alpe nashe, o kma qoepe dshqeel lawkhoon?
ENG: Do ye not yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

ASY: ”ܘܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܡܵܐ ܣܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: ”O lanee shaw'a lakhme o arb'a alpe nashe, o kma sale dshqeel lawkhoon?
ENG: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܕܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: ”Dakhee la poerme lawkhoon dle ywa boet lakhma meeree ilawkhoon, eena dhaweytoon hishyar min khmeera dpreeshe o dzadoeqaye?“
ENG: How is it that ye do not perceive that I spake not to you concerning bread? But beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܕܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah poerme-lhoon talmeede dla meereh dhawee hishyar min khmeera dlakhma, eena min yoelpana dpreeshe o dzadoeqaye.
ENG: Then understood they how that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad te-leh eeshoo' ltkhoeme dqesarya dpeeleepoos, boeqireh min talmeedoehy, ”moodee ke amree nashe, dmanee-yleh broona dnasha?“
ENG: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Who do men say that the Son of man is?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ، ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܹܪܲܡܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܝܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.“
TRL: O anee joewib-lhoon, ”khakma ke amree, at eewit yookhanan ma'mdana, o khakma ke amree, eleea ywit, o khakma ke amree eramya ywit, yan khad min nwee-e khene.“
ENG: And they said, Some say John the Baptist; some, Elijah: and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܘܸܢ؟“
TRL: Eena haw boeqireh minayhy, ”eena akhtoon manee bemara ytoon deewin?“
ENG: He saith unto them, But who say ye that I am?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh, ”at eewit msheekha, broona dalaha khaya.“
ENG: And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܘܕܸܡܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܓܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”ṭoewa iloekh shim'oon, broona dyawna, sabab bisra o dima la gle-leh iloekh ila babee dbshmaya,
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-Jonah: for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܢܹܝܢܵܗ̇ ܥܹܕܬܝܼ، ܘܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܕܫܝܘܿܠ ܠܹܐ ܟܵܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗ̇،
TRL: ”O ana bemara ywin iloekh, at eewit kepa, o 'al aha kepa bit baneynaha 'edtee, o tar'ane dshyool le kalee qamoeha,
ENG: And I also say unto thee, that thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܩܕܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܕܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܣܪܹܬ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܬ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O ana bit yabenoekh qdeele dmalkoeta dshmaya, dkl mindee dasret bar'a bit hawe seera bshmaya, o kl mindee dshareyt bar'a bit hawe shirya bshmaya.“
ENG: I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh ltalmeedoehy dla amree lnasha dhaw eeleh msheekha.
ENG: Then charged he the disciples that they should tell no man that he was the Christ.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܩܲܒܸܠ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ.
TRL: Min hay 'dana shoere-leh eeshoo' lmadoe'e ltalmeedoehy dakhee wale ywa dazel loorishlim o qabil raba khasha min khwardiqne o min goerane dkahne o sapre, o paesh qṭeela, o byawma dtlata qaem.
ENG: From that time began Jesus to shew unto his disciples, how that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܢܟ݂ܘܼܣܹܗ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܚܵܣ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Eena shim'oon kepa loebil-leh ileh lkhad geba, o shoere-leh lmankhoeseh o bemara, ”khas minoekh, maree, daha mindee hawe 'aloekh.“
ENG: And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall never be unto thee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܵܒܵܬ݇ܪܵܐ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ، ܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw deereh o meereh lshim'oon kepa, ”ze-loekh labara saṭana, toerqala ywit ilee, sabab le ywit takhmoene boet mindee deeleh dalaha, ila dbnaynasha.“
ENG: But he turned, and said unto Peter, Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art a stumbling-block unto me: for thou mindest not the things of God, but the things of men.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܣܵܪܹܒ݂ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܫܵܩܹܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܗ، ܘܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.
TRL: Haygah meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”man dba'e ate baree, sarew lganeh, o shaqel zqeepeh, o ate baree.
ENG: Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any man would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Sabab man dba'e pariq lganeh bit ṭaliq-laha, o man dṭaliq lganeh boet deeee bit machikh-laha.
ENG: For whosoever would save his life shall lose it: and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake shall find it.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܩܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܹܗ؟ ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܒܵܕܵܠ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Sabab moodee yoetrana eet lbarnasha in qane-laha klaha doenye eena ṭaliq-laha ganeh? Yan moodee bit yabil barnasha mbadal dganeh?
ENG: For what shall a man be profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and forfeit his life? or what shall a man give in exchange for his life?

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܥܲܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܥ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Bit ate broona dnasha bshoewkha dbaboehy 'am malakhoehy, o haygah bit pare' lkl khad aykh poelkhanoehy.
ENG: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels; and then shall he render unto every man according to his deeds.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܬ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, eet nashe kilye lakha dle khazee mawta hal dkhazee lbroona dnasha betaya bmalkoeteh.“
ENG: Verily I say unto you, There be some of them that stand here, which shall in no wise taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Min bar ishta yawmane, loebil-leh eeshoo' 'ameh lshim'oon kepa, o lya'qoow, o lyookhanan akhoona dya'qoow, o seeq-lhoon lṭoera rama bnawshayhy.
ENG: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into a high mountain apart:

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ. ܦܵܬܹܗ ܒܘܼܗܪܸܢܵܗ̇ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܘܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܡܘܼܚܘܸܪܵܗ̇ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܘܼܗܪܵܐ.
TRL: Peesh-leh shoekhlipa qamayhy. Pateh boehrinaha aykh shimsha, o lweeshteh moekhwiraha aykh noehra.
ENG: and he was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his garments became white as the light.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: O ha peesh-lhoon khizye ilayhy moeshe o eleea hamzoeme 'ameh.
ENG: And behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elijah talking with him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ، ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܬܠܵܬ ܡܛܲܠܠܹ̈ܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh shim'oon kepa leeshoo', ”maree, ṣpayee-ylaha ilan dpayshakh lakha, o in at ba'eyt, bit 'awden tlat mṭalle, khda qatoekh, o khda qa moeshe o khda qa eleea.“
ENG: And Peter answered, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, I will make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܗܵܐ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܗܵܐ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܝܼ، ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ.“
TRL: O kad haw hamzoeme, ha 'nana bahranta 'weed-laha ṭilaneeta 'alayhy, o ha qala min gaw 'nana te-leh bemara, ”aha-yleh broonee moekhiba dbee-eh bseem-laha-lee, ileh shmi'moen.“
ENG: While he was yet speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold, a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon talmeede, npeel-lhoon 'al patwatayhy o zdee' lhoon raba.
ENG: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' te-leh o dqeereh bee-ayhy o meereh ilayhy, ”qoemoen, la zad'eetoon.“
ENG: And Jesus came and touched them and said, Arise, and be not afraid.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dmoerim-lhoon 'aynayhy, la khze-lhoon nasha ila eeshoo' bnawsheh.
ENG: And lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, save Jesus only.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O kad biṣlaya ywaw min ṭoera, pqeeday-leh eeshoo' dlnasha la amree mindee boet aha khizwa hal dqaem broona dnasha min gaw meete.
ENG: And as they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen from the dead.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh talmeedoehy o meerhoon, ”qamoodee sapre ke amree deleea wale-ylaha date qamayta?“
ENG: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elijah must first come?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܕܸܪ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”eleea betaya-yleh qamayta dmadir mindrish klayhy mindeeane.
ENG: And he answered and said, Elijah indeed cometh, and shall restore all things:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, deleea teea-yleh, o nashe la dee' lhoon ileh, o 'weed-lhoon bee-eh mindee dbseem-laha-lhoon, o hadkha broona dnasha bit qabil khasha minayhy.“
ENG: but I say unto you, that Elijah is come already, and they knew him not, but did unto him whatsoever they listed. Even so shall the Son of man also suffer of them.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah poerme-lhoon talmeede dboet yookhanan ma'mdana hamzoeme ywa 'amayhy.
ENG: Then understood the disciples that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Kad te-lhoon lkis kinsha, qoerbineh lkis eeshoo' khad nasha, o breek-leh qamoehy o meereh,
ENG: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a man, kneeling to him, and saying,

ASY: ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܕܒܲܪ ܐܸܓܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܓܵܘ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܓܵܘ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: ”Maree, rakhim 'al broonee, dbar igara-yleh, o khirba mree'a-yleh. Raba gahe ke napel gaw noera, o raba gahe ke napel gaw meea.
ENG: Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is epileptic, and suffereth grievously: for oft-times he falleth into the fire, and oft-times into the water.

ASY: ”ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܣܡܝܼ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”O moete-lee lkis talmeedoekh. Eena la mṣe-lhoon basmee-leh.“
ENG: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܸܢܬܵܐ ܘܦܟ̰ܝܼܠܬܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܗܲܠ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܢܹܢ ܝܘܼܩܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”ya sharbta la mhoeminta o pcheelta, hal eeman bit haweyn 'amawkhoon? Hal eeman bit ṭa'nen yoeqrawkhoon? Mayteymoen-leh lkis-lee lakha.“
ENG: And Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you? bring him hither to me.

ASY: ܘܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܫܹܐܕܵܐ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ.
TRL: O njeew-leh eeshoo' bsheda, o pleeṭ-leh mineh, o bseem-leh yala bhay sa'at.
ENG: And Jesus rebuked him; and the devil went out from him: and the boy was cured from that hour.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܦܲܠܛܲܚ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon talmeede lkis eeshoo' bnawshayhy o boeqirhoon mineh, ”qamoodee la mṣe lan akhnan palṭakh mineh sheda?“
ENG: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast it out?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܘܼܬ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܪܕܲܠ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ’ܫܲܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ،‘ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ. ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܸܨܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo' o meereh, ”boet baṣooroeta dhaymanoetawkhoon. Sabab troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in hawe lawkhoon haymanoeta aykh dandikta dkhardal, bit amreetoon-laha ṭoera, ’shanee min aha doeka lhay doeka kheta,‘ o bit paesh shoenya. Mindee le hawe 'iṣya ilawkhoon.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Because of your little faith: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܸܢܣܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܨܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena aha ginsa le paleṭ ila bṣawma o bṣloota.“
ENG: However, this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Kad shirye ywaw gaw gleela, meereh eeshoo' ilayhy, ”hdeera-yleh broona dnasha dpaesh soepya beedate dbnaynasha.
ENG: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be delivered up into the hands of men;

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ.“ ܘܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bit qaṭlee-leh, o byawma dtlata bit paesh moeqima.“ o psheem-lhoon raba.
ENG: and they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised up. And they were exceeding sorry.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܪܹܝ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܠ ܪܹܫܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܪܲܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: O kad te-lhoon lkparnakhoom, te-lhoon lkis shim'oon kepa anee dshaqlee waw trey zoeze qa kl resha, o boeqirhoon mineh, ”le yabil rabeeawkhoon trey zoeze?“
ENG: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received the half-shekel came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay the half-shekel?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ.“ ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܕܪܹܫܝܼܬܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh, ”he.“ o eeman d'weereh lbayta, min qam dhamzim wa shim'oon kepa, boeqireh mineh eeshoo', ”moodee bikhshawa ywit shim'oon, malke dar'a min manee ke shaqlee zoeza dresheeta, min bnoonayhy yan min noekhraye?“
ENG: He saith, Yea. And when he came into the house, Jesus spake first to him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? the kings of the earth, from whom do they receive toll or tribute? from their sons, or from strangers?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܲܣ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh, ”min noekhraye.“ meereh eeshoo', ”bas bnoone khere yna.“
ENG: And when he said, From strangers, Jesus said unto him, Therefore the sons are free.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܙܹܠ݇ ܠܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܕܪܝܼ ܟ̰ܲܢܓܵܠ، ܘܢܘܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܕܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܠܹܗ، ܦܬܘܿܚ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܸܬ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ. ܫܩܘܿܠ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܝܼ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Eena dla makribakh-lhoon, ze lyama o dree changal, o noena qamaya ddawqet-leh, ptookh poemeh o bit machkhit zoeza dsema. Shqool o hal-leh min gebee o min geboekh.“
ENG: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go thou to the sea, and cast a hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a shekel: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: Bhay 'dana te-lhoon talmeede lkis eeshoo' o boeqirhoon mineh, ”manee-yleh boesh goera gaw malkoeta dshmaya?“
ENG: In that hour came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

ASY: ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Qre-leh eeshoo' lkhad yala z'oora o moekle-leh bgawayhy,
ENG: And he called to him a little child, and set him in the midst of them,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܕܵܝܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in la dayreetoon o haweytoon aykh yale z'oore, le 'awreetoon lmalkoeta dshmaya.
ENG: and said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye turn, and become as little children, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܟܸܦ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha kl man dmakip ganeh aykh daha yala z'oora, haw eeleh goera gaw malkoeta dshmaya.
ENG: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O man dqabil bshimee khad yala z'oora aykh daha, ilee qaboele-yleh.
ENG: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me:

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܸܠܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܐܸܪܚܹܐ ܒܩܕܵܠܹܗ ܘܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O man dhawe toerqala lkhad min ane dke haminee beeee, ṣpayee ywa ileh dhawe wa tilya kepa dirkhe bqdaleh o hawe wa roepya b'oemqa dyama.
ENG: But whoso shall cause one of these little ones which believe on me to stumble, it is profitable for him that a great millstone should be hanged about his neck, and that he should be sunk in the depth of the sea.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܘܼܪ̈ܩܵܠܹܐ. ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܬܘܼܪ̈ܩܵܠܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܬܘܼܪ̈ܩܵܠܹܐ.
TRL: ”Way l'alma min toerqale. Ananqayta-ylaha datee toerqale, eena way lhaw nasha dhawe 'ilta dtoerqale.
ENG: Woe unto the world because of occasions of stumbling! for it must needs be that the occasions come; but woe to that man through whom the occasion cometh!

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܝܲܢ ܐܲܩܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܚܛܝܼܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܦܪܘܿܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܪܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܫܸܠܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, in eedoekh yan aqloekh makhṭeea-loekh, proom-laha o rapee-laha minoekh, sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh d'awret lkhaye shila yan shpeela min dhawe-loekh tartey eedate yan tartey aqlate o payshet dirya bnoera dl'alam.
ENG: And if thy hand or thy foot causeth thee to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from thee: it is good for thee to enter into life maimed or halt, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܚܛܝܼܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܚܪܘܿܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܪܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in 'aynoekh makhṭeea-loekh, khrooṭ-laha o rapee-laha minoekh, sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh d'awret lkhaye bkhda 'ayna min dhawe-loekh tartey 'ayne o payshet dirya gaw gehana dnoera.
ENG: And if thine eye causeth thee to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: it is good for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the hell of fire.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܣܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ. ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܲܠܲܐܟܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܐܲܡܝܼܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen hishyar dla masleytoon lkhad min ane z'oore. Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, malakayhy ameenaeet ke khazee pata dbabee deeleh bshmaya.
ENG: See that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, that in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab broona dnasha te-leh dpariq lhaw dṭleeqa ywa.
ENG: For the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost.

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ، ܘܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܛܵܠܹܩ، ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܬܸܫܥܝܼ ܘܬܸܫܥܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܘܐܵܙܹܠ ܛܵܥܹܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܛܠܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Moodee bikhshawa ytoon, in nasha hawe-leh ima 'irbe, o khad minayhy ṭaleq, le shabeq tish'ee o tish'a 'al ṭoerane o azel ṭa'e lhaw dṭleeq-leh?
ENG: How think ye? if any man have a hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and go unto the mountains, and seek that which goeth astray?

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܹܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܥܸܪܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܸܫܥܝܼ ܘܬܸܫܥܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, eeman dkhaze-leh bit khade bhaw 'irba boesh zawda min tish'ee o tish'a dla ṭleeq-lhoon.
ENG: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth over it more than over the ninety and nine which have not gone astray.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܕܛܵܠܹܩ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha, le-yleh ṣiwyana dbabawkhoon dbshmaya dṭaleq khad min ane z'oore.
ENG: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ܙܹܠ݇ ܘܡܲܕܸܥ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܢܵܗܹܗ ܒܹܝܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܒܹܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ. ܐܸܢ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܩܢܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”In 'abed gnaha beeoekh akhoonoekh, ze o madi' ileh gnaheh beyloekh o beyleh akhchee. In shame' iloekh, qne-loekh akhoonoekh.
ENG: And if thy brother sin against thee, go, shew him his fault between thee and him alone: if he hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܠܲܒܸܠ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܝܲܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܕܥܲܠ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ.
TRL: ”Eena in la shame' iloekh, labil 'amoekh khad yan trey khene, d'al poema dtrey yan tlata sahde paysha moeqweeta kl hemizman.
ENG: But if he hear thee not, take with thee one or two more, that at the mouth of two witnesses or three every word may be established.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܢܦܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in la shame' oep ilayhy, moor l'edta, o in la shame' l'edta, hawe iloekh aykh makhsa o aykh khanpa.
ENG: And if he refuse to hear them, tell it unto the church: and if he refuse to hear the church also, let him be unto thee as the Gentile and the publican.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܣܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl mindee dasreetoon bar'a bit hawe seera bshmaya, o kl mindee dshareytoon bar'a bit hawe shirya bshmaya.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, What things soever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and what things soever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܲܙܓܸܪܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Mindrish bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in trey minawkhoon sazgiree 'al ar'a 'al kl mindee dṭalbee, bit hawe ilayhy min lkis babee dbshmaya.
ENG: Again I say unto you, that if two of you shall agree on earth as touching anything that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Sabab ayka dtrey yan tlata jmee'e yna bshimee, tama ywin ana gawayhy.“
ENG: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܟܡܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܛܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ ܘܦܲܚܠܸܢܹܗ، ܗܲܠ ܫܒܲܥ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: te-leh shim'oon kepa lkis eeshoo' o boeqireh, ”maree, kma gahe khaṭe ilee akhoonee o pakhlineh, hal shba' gahe?“
ENG: Then came Peter, and said to him, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? until seven times?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܗܲܠ ܫܒܲܥ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܝܼ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܫܒܲܥ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”le ywin bemara iloekh hal shba' gahe, eena hal shaw'ee gahe shba'.
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times; but, Until seventy times seven.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܚܸܫܒܘܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Hadkha ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lkhad malka db'e-leh dshaqel khishboena min regawateh.
ENG: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would make a reckoning with his servants.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܚܸܫܒܘܼܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܕܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O kad shoere-leh lishqala khishboena, moete-lhoon lkis-leh khad ddaynana ywa ileh 'isra alpe kakre.
ENG: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܦܪܵܥܵܐ، ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܘܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܦܵܪܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena sabab layt wa-leh lipra'a, pqeed-leh mareh dpaesh zoebna, haw o bakhteh o yaloehy o kl mindee deet wa-leh, o pare' wa.
ENG: But forasmuch as he had not wherewith to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܘܼܪ̈ܟܵܟܘܼܗܝ ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܚܡܘܿܠ ܥܲܠܝܼ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܥܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Eena rega npeel-leh 'al boerkakoehy o poerpil-leh bee-eh o meereh, ’maree, khmool 'alee, o bit par'enoekh kl mindee.‘
ENG: The servant therefore fell down and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܦܘܼܚܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܲܝܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Haygah roekhim-leh 'aloehy mareh o shre-leh, o poekhil-leh ileh dayneh.
ENG: And the lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܒ݂ܪܹܗ ܒܪܹܓܘܼܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܵܢܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Eena haw rega pleeṭ-leh o khze-leh khad khawreh bregoeta khena ddaynana ywa ileh ima deenare, dweeq-leh o khaneq wa-leh, o meereh ileh, ’hal-lee mindee ddaynana ywit ilee.‘
ENG: But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow-servants, which owed him a hundred pence: and he laid hold on him, and took him by the throat, saying, Pay what thou owest.

ASY: ”ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܲܒ݂ܪܹܗ ܒܪܹܓܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܡܲܪܝܸܟ݂ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܒܹܐܢܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܥܹܢܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”O npeel-leh haw khawreh bregoeta qam aqlateh o poerpil-leh bee-eh, bemara, ’maryikh 'alee bena o bit par'enoekh.‘
ENG: So his fellow-servant fell down and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ. ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܪܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܕܲܝܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena haw la bseem-laha-leh. Ila zeel-leh o dre-leh ileh gaw beyt aseere hal dpare' wa ldayneh.
ENG: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay that which was due.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܒܪܹܓܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܵܪܲܝܗܝ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kad khze-lhoon khawrawatayhy bregoeta mindee dhwe-leh, psheem-lhoon raba, o te-lhoon o moekhbirhoon lmarayhy kl mindee dhwe-leh.
ENG: So when his fellow-servants saw what was done, they were exceeding sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ، ܟܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܲܝܢܵܐ ܦܘܼܚܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܼܝܼ،
TRL: ”Haygah mareh qre-leh ileh o meereh, ’rega beesha, kleh haw dayna poekhil-lee iloekh sabab poerpil-loekh beeee,
ENG: Then his lord called him unto him, and saith to him, Thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou besoughtest me:

ASY: ”’ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܪܲܚܡܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܒܪܹܓܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”’wale ywa doep at rakhmit wa lkhawroekh bregoeta aykh dana roekhim-lee 'aloekh.‘
ENG: shouldest not thou also have had mercy on thy fellow-servant, even as I had mercy on thee?

ASY: ”ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܝܸܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܪܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kreeb-leh mareh, o soepe-leh lmalyiṣane hal dpare' wa kl mindee ddaynana ywa.
ENG: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha oep babee dbshmaya bit 'abed ilawkhoon in la pakhleetoon min libawkhoon nasha lakhoonoehy.“
ENG: So shall also my heavenly Father do unto you, if ye forgive not every one his brother from your hearts.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܢܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ.
TRL: Kad toemim-leh eeshoo' ane hemizmane, shoene-leh min gleela o te-leh ltkhoeme deehoed, lhaw marza khena dnahra dyoordnan.
ENG: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judaea beyond Jordan;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon bareh kinshe raba, o boesmay-leh tama.
ENG: and great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܒܟܠ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: te-lhoon lkis-leh preeshe djarbee waw-leh, o boeqirhoon mineh in qanoonayta-ylaha lnasha drape bakhteh bkl 'ilta.
ENG: And there came unto him Pharisees, tempting him, and saying, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ، ܐܘܼܪܙܵܐ ܘܢܸܩܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”la qre lawkhoon haw dbiryay-leh min shoeraya, oerza o niqwa biryay-leh?
ENG: And he answered and said, Have ye not read, that he which made them from the beginning made them male and female,

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܒܸܬ ܬܵܒܹܥ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ، ܘܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O meereh, ’boet aha bit shabeq nasha lbaboehy o lyimeh o bit tabe' lbakhteh, o tirwayhy bit hawee khad paghra.‘
ENG: and said, For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife; and the twain shall become one flesh?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܙܘܼܘܸܓ ܠܹܗ، ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܪܹܫ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha khena le yna trey ila khad paghra yna. Boet aha, mindee dalaha zoewig-leh, barnasha la paresh-leh.“
ENG: So that they are no more twain, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܲܣ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܠܵܠܵܐ ܘܠܪܲܦܘܼܝܘܼܗ̇؟“
TRL: O anee meerhoon ileh, ”bas qamoodee moeshe pqeed-leh leeawa ktawa ddoelala o lrapoeyoeha?“
ENG: They say unto him, Why then did Moses command to give a bill of divorcement, and to put her away?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܒܘܼܬ ܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܪܲܦܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: O haw joewib-leh, ”boet qishyoeta dlibawkhoon moeshe pqeed-leh ilawkhoon drapeytoon lbakhtatawkhoon, eena min shoeraya le ywa hadkha.
ENG: He saith unto them, Moses for your hardness of heart suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it hath not been so.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܓܵܒܹܪ ܚܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܓܵܒܹܪ ܪܘܼܦܝܼܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man drape bakhteh, shwooq min 'ilta dzanyoeta, o gaber khda kheta, bi'wada-yleh gayaroeta, o man dgaber roepeeta, bi'wada-yleh gayaroeta.“
ENG: And I say unto you, Whosoever shall put away his wife, except for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery: and he that marrieth her when she is put away committeth adultery.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܐܸܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܠܸܓܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ.“
TRL: meerhoon ileh talmeedoehy, ”in hadkha-yleh shoela beyl gawra o bakhta, le-ylaha ṣpayee ligwara.“
ENG: The disciples say unto him, If the case of the man is so with his wife, it is not expedient to marry.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”klayhy nashe le maṣee qablee-laha hemizman, ila anee dpeeshta-ylaha yoebilta ilayhy.
ENG: But he said unto them, All men cannot receive this saying, but they to whom it is given.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܡܗܲܝܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܲܝܗܝ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܗܲܝܡܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܡܗܲܝܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܲܕ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܡܗܲܝܡܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܡܗܲܝܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܵܨܹܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇، ܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Sabab eet mhaymne dmin kesa dyimayhy hwe-lhoon mhaymne, o eet mhaymne dbyad bnaynasha peesh-lhoon 'weede mhaymne, o eet anee d'weeda-lhoon ganayhy mhaymne boet malkoeta dshmaya. Man dmaṣe qabil-laha, qabil-laha.“
ENG: For there are eunuchs, which were so born from their mother’s womb: and there are eunuchs, which were made eunuchs by men: and there are eunuchs, which made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven’s sake. He that is able to receive it, let him receive it.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܨܲܠܹܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah moete-lhoon lkis-leh yale z'oore dmatiw eedateh o ṣale 'alayhy; eena talmeedoehy njeew-lhoon bee-ayhy.
ENG: Then were there brought unto him little children, that he should lay his hands on them, and pray: and the disciples rebuked them.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”shwooqoen yale z'oore atee lkis-lee o la makleytoon-lhoon, sabab qa maykh dane-ylaha malkoeta dshmaya.“
ENG: But Jesus said, Suffer the little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O moetiw-leh eedateh 'alayhy, o zeel-leh min tama.
ENG: And he laid his hands on them, and departed thence.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܕܝܵܪܬܹܢ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ؟“
TRL: O ha khad nasha te-leh o boeqireh mineh, ”malpana, moodee ṭawa 'awden dyarten lkhaye dl'alam?“
ENG: And behold, one came to him and said, Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ؟ ܠܲܝܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܝܵܪܬܹܬ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܢܛܘܿܪ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”qamoodee baqoeree ywit boet moodee-yleh ṭawa? Layt oep khad ṭawa ila Alaha akhchee. Eena in ba'eyt dyartet lkhaye, nṭoor poeqdane.“
ENG: And he said unto him, Why askest thou me concerning that which is good? One there is who is good: but if thou wouldest enter into life, keep the commandments.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܩܵܛܠܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܢܹܝܬ، ܠܵܐ ܓܵܢܒܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ.
TRL: O haw boeqireh mineh, ”aynee poeqdane?“ joewib-leh eeshoo', ”la qaṭlet, la zaneyt, la ganbet, la yabet sahdoeta ddoegla.
ENG: He saith unto him, Which? And Jesus said, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness,

ASY: ”ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Myaqir lbaboekh o lyimoekh, o makhibit lshwawoekh aykh ganoekh.“
ENG: Honour thy father and thy mother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܢܛܝܼܪܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܝܼ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh haw 'layma o meereh ileh, ”klayhy ane nṭeeray ywin min yaloetee, moodee khena baṣoora-yleh minee?“
ENG: The young man saith unto him, All these things have I observed: what lack I yet?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܟܡܝܼܠܵܐ، ܙܹܠ݇ ܙܲܒܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”in ba'eyt dhaweyt kmeela, ze zabin mindeeoekh o hal-leh lmiskene o bit hawe-loekh seemta bshmaya, o ta baree.“
ENG: Jesus said unto him, If thou wouldest be perfect, go, sell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܫܝܼܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eena eeman dshmee' leh haw 'layma aha hemizman, zeel-leh psheema, sabab eet wa-leh mindee raba.
ENG: But when the young man heard the saying, he went away sorrowful: for he was one that had great possessions.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܚܲܕ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ،
TRL: Haygah meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, 'asqa-ylaha lkhad 'ateera d'aber lmalkoeta dshmaya,
ENG: And Jesus said unto his disciples, Verily I say unto you, It is hard for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heaven.

ASY: ”ܘܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܘܼܩܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܓܘܼܡܠܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܒܢܸܩܒܵܐ ܕܚܡܵܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O mindrish bemara ywin ilawkhoon, boesh pshoeqta-ylaha lgoemla li'wara bniqba dkhmaṭa min d'ateera 'aber lmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܲܣ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܩ؟“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon talmeedoehy aha, 'oejib-lhoon raba o meerhoon, ”bas manee maṣe pareq?“
ENG: And when the disciples heard it, they were astonished exceedingly, saying, Who then can be saved?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܟܸܣ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' kheereh bee-ayhy o meereh, ”lkis bnaynasha aha mindee le maṣe hawe, eena lkis Alaha kl mindee ke maṣe hawe.“
ENG: And Jesus looking upon them said to them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂. ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܲܚ؟“
TRL: Haygah joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh ileh, ”ha akhnan shweeq lan kl mindee o te lan baroekh. Moodee bit qablakh?“
ENG: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee; what then shall we have?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܒܚܘܼܕܵܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܪܘܿܢܘܿܣ ܕܚܸܩܪܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܪ̈ܘܿܢܘܿܣܹܐ ܘܕܵܝܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, akhtoon dte lawkhoon baree, bkhoedata dbreeta, eeman dyatew broona dnasha 'al troonoos dkhiqreh, oep akhtoon bit yatweetoon 'al tri'sar troonoose o dayneetoon tri'sar shawṭe deesrayel.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, that ye which have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit on the throne of his glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܫܵܒܹܩ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܝܸܡܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܝܵܪܹܬ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”O kl nasha dshabeq bate, yan akhoonwate, yan khatwate, yan baba, yan yima, yan bakhta, yan yale, yan khaqlane boet shimee, bit qabil khad bima, o bit yaret khaye dl'alam.
ENG: And every one that hath left houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, for my name’s sake, shall receive a hundredfold, and shall inherit eternal life.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena raba deena qamaye bit hawee kharaye, o kharaye bit hawee qamaye.
ENG: But many shall be last that are first; and first that are last.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܵܐ ܦܵܥܠܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܲܪܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lnasha mara dbayta dpleeṭ-leh bqaydamta jalde lidwaqa pa'le qa karmeh.
ENG: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is a householder, which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܦܵܥܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”Min bar dqṭee' leh 'am pa'le deenara byawma, shoedray-leh dpalkhee gaw karmeh.
ENG: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

ASY: ”ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܫܲܥ ܕܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O pleeṭ-leh mindrish bsa'at dtsha' dqaydamta, o khze-leh khene kilye bshoeqa baṭeele.
ENG: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing in the marketplace idle;

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܘܦܠܘܿܚܘܼܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܡܝܼ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܥܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”meereh ilayhy, ’zemoen oep akhtoon o plookhoen gaw karmee, o mindee dwale-yleh bit par'enawkhoon.‘ o zeel-lhoon.
ENG: and to them he said, Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you. And they went their way.

ASY: ”ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ، ܘܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܗܵܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Pleeṭ-leh mindrish bsa'at dtri'sar, o bsa'at dtlat min bar kawitra, o 'weed-leh hada.
ENG: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.

ASY: ”ܘܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܚܲܡܸܫ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܥܠܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ؟‘
TRL: ”O maykh sa'at dkhamish min bar kawitra, pleeṭ-leh mindrish o khze-leh pa'le khene kilye baṭeele, o meereh ilayhy, ’qamoodee kilye ytoon lakha baṭeele kleh yawma?‘
ENG: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing; and he saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܦܠܸܚ ܠܲܢ.‘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܦܠܘܿܚܘܼܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܡܝܼ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”O anee joewib-lhoon ileh, ’sabab nasha la qam maplikh lan.‘ meereh ilayhy, ’zemoen o plookhoen gaw karmee, o mindee dwale-yleh bit qableetoon.‘
ENG: They say unto him, Because no man hath hired us. He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܠܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ، ’ܩܪܝܼ ܠܦܵܥܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܪܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܗܵܩܲܝܗܝ. ܫܲܪܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”Kad hwe-leh ramsha, meereh mara dkarma lrab bayteh, ’qree lpa'le, o pri' leh haqayhy. Sharee min kharaye o hal qamaye.‘
ENG: And when even was come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward, Call the labourers, and pay them their hire, beginning from the last unto the first.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܘܼܪܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܚܲܡܸܫ ܕܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”O te-lhoon anee dshoerye ywaw min sa'at dkhamish dbar kawitra, o shqeel-leh kl khad minayhy khad deenara.
ENG: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܵܩܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman dte-lhoon anee qamaye, khsheew-lhoon bit qablee waw haqa zawda. Eena oep anee shqeel-lhoon kl minayhy khad deenara.
ENG: And when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise received every man a penny.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܛܘܼܪܛܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O kad shqeel-lhoon, ṭoerṭim-lhoon 'al mara dbayta.
ENG: And when they received it, they murmured against the householder,

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ’ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܘܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܲܢ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܛܥܝܼܢܲܢ ܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܚܸܡܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”O meerhoon, ’ane kharaye pleekh-lhoon khda sa'at o khoeshbinay-loekh maykh dee-an, akhnan dṭ'eenan yoeqra dyawma o khimeh.‘
ENG: saying, These last have spent but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܚܲܒ݂ܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂. ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡܝܼ؟
TRL: ”Joewib-leh mara dkarma lkhad minayhy o meereh, ’khawree, le ywin bi'wada gnaha beeoekh. Le ywa bdeenara qṭee' loekh 'amee?
ENG: But he answered and said to one of them, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a penny?

ASY: ”’ܫܩܘܿܠ ܗܵܩܘܼܟ݂ ܘܙܹܠ݇. ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”’shqool haqoekh o ze. Ba'eyn dyaben-laha kharaya maykh dyoebil-lee iloekh.
ENG: Take up that which is thine, and go thy way; it is my will to give unto this last, even as unto thee.

ASY: ”’ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܗܵܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܒܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܓܵܢܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܝܼ؟ ܝܲܢ ܒܲܚܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ؟‘
TRL: ”’layt-lee haqoeta d'awden bmindee dganee aykh dbasma-lee? Yan bakhoele ywit beeee sabab ṭawa ywin?‘
ENG: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? or is thine eye evil, because I am good?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ؛ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ ܘܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܝܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha, kharaye bit hawee qamaye, o qamaye kharaye; sabab raba yna cheede o baṣoore yna goebye.“
ENG: So the last shall be first, and the first last.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Kad besaqa ywa eeshoo' loorishlim, qiryay-leh talmeedoehy lkhad geba bnawshayhy o meereh ilayhy,
