ENG: And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples apart, and in the way he said unto them,

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Adeea besaqa ywakh loorishlim, o broona dnasha bit paesh soepya lgoerane dkahne o lsapre, o bit daynee-leh lmawta.
ENG: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests and scribes; and they shall condemn him to death,

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.“
TRL: ”O bit sapee-leh limwate dmaskhiree bee-eh, o makhee-leh bshawṭe o makhee-leh lzqeepa, o byawma dtlata bit qaem.“
ENG: and shall deliver him unto the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify: and the third day he shall be raised up.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ ܥܲܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇، ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܵܥܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah te-laha lkis-leh yima dbnoone dzawday 'am bnoonoeha, o sgheed-laha ileh, o ṭleeb-laha mineh khda ba'oeta.
ENG: Then came to him the mother of the sons of Zebedee with her sons, worshipping him, and asking a certain thing of him.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܝܲܬܝ؟“ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܝܼ̈ ܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Boeqireh minoeha eeshoo', ”moodee ba'yaty?“ o joewib-laha o meeraha ileh, ”shwooq ane trey bnoonee yatwee 'amoekh bmalkoetoekh, khad min yameenoekh o khad min simaloekh.“
ENG: And he said unto her, What wouldest thou? She saith unto him, Command that these my two sons may sit, one on thy right hand, and one on thy left hand, in thy kingdom.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ. ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܹܗ، ܝܲܢ ܕܥܵܡܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh iloeha, ”le ytoon beeda'a moodee biṭlaba ytoon. Maṣeytoon shateytoon min kasa dana hdeera ywin lishtayeh, yan d'amdeetoon bma'moodeeta dbeeoeha payshen 'meeda?“ o anee meerhoon, ”he, ke maṣakh.“
ENG: But Jesus answered and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink the cup that I am about to drink? They say unto him, We are able.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܟܵܣܝܼ ܗܲܪ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܡܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܝܼ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܗ̇، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܕܸܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”min kasee har bit shateytoon, o ma'moodeeta dbeeoeha payshen 'meeda bit 'amdeetoon. Eena tawta min simalee o min yameenee le ana yabenaha, ila bit paysha yoebilta lanee dhoedirta-ylaha ilayhy min babee.“
ENG: He saith unto them, My cup indeed ye shall drink: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left hand, is not mine to give, but it is for them for whom it hath been prepared of my Father.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad shmee' lhoon 'isra talmeede, kreeb-lhoon 'al anee trey akhoonwate.
ENG: And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation concerning the two brethren.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' qiryay-leh o meereh, ”ke yad'eetoon dgoerane dimwate marawatayhy yna, o goeranayhy ke 'awdee shoelṭana 'alayhy?
ENG: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Ye know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena aha mindee la hawe gawawkhoon, ila man dba'e hawe goera gawawkhoon, hawe 'awdana dkhilmat ilawkhoon.
ENG: Not so shall it be among you: but whosoever would become great among you shall be your minister;

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”O man dba'e minawkhoon lihwaya qamaya, hawe ilawkhoon 'awda.
ENG: and whosoever would be first among you shall be your servant:

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ، ܘܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Dakhee dbroona dnasha la te-leh dpaesh 'weeda khilmat min nashe, ila d'abed-lhoon khilmat, o yabil ganeh poerqana min geba draba.“
ENG: even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: Kad biplaṭa ywa eeshoo' min eereekhoo, te-leh bareh kinsha raba.
ENG: And as they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܲܢ!“
TRL: O ha trey simye teebe ywaw bmarza doerkha. Eeman dshmee' lhoon deeshoo' bi'wara ywa min tama, moeqwikh-lhoon, ”Maran, broona ddaweed, rakhim 'alan!“
ENG: And behold, two blind men sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, saying, Lord, have mercy on us, thou son of David.

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܕܫܵܬܩܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܲܢ.“
TRL: O kinsha njeew-leh bee-ayhy dshatqee. Eena anee boesh zawda moeqwikh-lhoon, ”Maran, broona ddaweed, rakhim 'alan.“
ENG: And the multitude rebuked them, that they should hold their peace: but they cried out the more, saying, Lord, have mercy on us, thou son of David.

ASY: ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: O kle-leh eeshoo' o qiryay-leh lkis-leh o meereh, ”moodee ba'eytoon d'awden ilawkhoon?“
ENG: And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, What will ye that I should do unto you?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܦܵܬܚܝܼ ܥܲܝܢܲܢ̈.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh, ”Maran, ba'akh dpatkhee 'aynan.“
ENG: They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.

ASY: ܘܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O roekhim-leh 'alayhy eeshoo', o dqeereh b'aynayhy, o har bhay 'dana khze-lhoon, o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And Jesus, being moved with compassion, touched their eyes: and straightway they received their sight, and followed him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܦܵܓܹ̈ܐ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: Kad qoerbinhoon eeshoo' o talmeedoehy loorishlim, o te-lhoon lbeyt page lgeba dṭoera dzayte, shoedireh eeshoo' trey min talmeedoehy,
ENG: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and came unto Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܘܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇. ܫܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen-laha mata deelaha lbalqoewlawkhoon, o har bhay 'dana bit machkheetoon khmarta seerta o ja'sha 'amoeha. Shreymoen o mayteymoen-lhoon lkis-lee.
ENG: saying unto them, Go into the village that is over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ،‘ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”O in nasha amer ilawkhoon mindee, mooroen ileh, ’Maran ba'e-lhoon,‘ o har bhay 'dana bit shadirhoon ilee.“
ENG: And if any one say aught unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: Aha klaha hwe-laha dpaesh toemima mindee dmeera ywa byad nweea, dmeereh:
ENG: Now this is come to pass, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܨܸܗܝܘܿܢ، ܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܟ݂ܝ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܪܟܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܡܵܪܬܵܐ، ܘܥܲܠ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܙܲܥܝܵܐ ܕܚܡܵܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: mooroen lbrata dṣihyoon, ha malkakhy betaya-yleh lkis lakhy, makeekha o rkeewa 'al khmarta, o 'al ja'sha za'ya dkhmarta.
ENG: Tell ye the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, Meek, and riding upon an ass, And upon a colt the foal of an ass.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon talmeede o 'weed-lhoon dakhee dpqeeday-leh eeshoo'.
ENG: And the disciples went, and did even as Jesus appointed them,

ASY: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܘܠܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܪܟܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Moete-lhoon lkhmarta o lja'sha, o moetiw-lhoon 'alayhy joelayhy, o rkeew-leh 'alayhy eeshoo'.
ENG: and brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their garments; and he sat thereon.

ASY: ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܵܪܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܵܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: O raba min kinshe shawee waw joelayhy boerkha, o khene parmee waw pa'wane min eelane o daree waw boerkha.
ENG: And the most part of the multitude spread their garments in the way; and others cut branches from the trees, and spread them in the way.

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܘܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ: ”ܐܘܿܫܲܥܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܐܘܿܫܲܥܢܵܐ ܒܲܡܪ̈ܵܘܡܹܐ.“
TRL: O kinshe dbezala ywaw qamoehy o bareh maqwoekhe ywaw: ”oosha'na broona ddaweed, breekha-yleh haw dbetaya-yleh bshima dmarya, oosha'na bamrawme.“
ENG: And the multitudes that went before him, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad 'weereh eeshoo' loorishlim, shgheesh-lhoon klayhy nashe dmdeeta, o baqree waw, ”manee-yleh aha?“
ENG: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred, saying, Who is this?

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.“
TRL: O kinshe amree waw, ”aha-yleh eeshoo' nweea, dmin naṣrat dgleela.“
ENG: And the multitudes said, This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܙܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܦܵܬܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܲܪ̈ܵܦܹܐ ܘܟܘܼܪ̈ܣܝܹܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܵܘܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: 'weereh eeshoo' lhaykla dalaha o poeliṭ-leh lklayhy anee dbizwana ywaw o zaboene tama, o moekhdireh lpatoore dṣarape o koersye danee dzaboene ywaw yawne.
ENG: And Jesus entered into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of them that sold the doves;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܒܲܝܬܝܼ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܸܦܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܲܝܵܣܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”kteewa-yleh dbaytee bayta dṣloota bit paesh qirya, eena akhtoon 'weed lawkhoon gipeeta dgayase.“
ENG: and he saith unto them, It is written, My house shall be called a house of prayer: but ye make it a den of robbers.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O moeqriw-lhoon lkis-leh gaw haykla simye o shpeele, o boesmay-leh.
ENG: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple: and he healed them.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ”ܐܘܿܫܲܥܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ،“ ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Kad khze-lhoon goerane dkahne o sapre o preeshe doemare dbi'wada ywa, o yale maqwoekhe bhaykla, ”oosha'na broona ddaweed,“ kreeb-lhoon.
ENG: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children that were crying in the temple and saying, Hosanna to the son of David; they were moved with indignation,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ. ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܘܝܲܠܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܬܘܼܪܸܨ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: O meerhoon ileh, ”bishma'a ywit moodee yna bemara?“ joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”he. La qre lawkhoon moodee-yleh kteewa: min poema dyale o yaloede toeriṣ-loekh tishbookhta?“
ENG: and said unto him, Hearest thou what these are saying? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea: did ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh lbadar min mdeeta lbeyt 'anya o peesh-leh tama blayle.
ENG: And he left them, and went forth out of the city to Bethany, and lodged there.

ASY: ܘܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܟܦܝܼܢܹܗ.
TRL: O qaydamta eeman deereh lmdeeta, kpeeneh.
ENG: Now in the morning as he returned to the city, he hungered.

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܛܲܪ̈ܦܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O khze-leh khad eelana dtene boerkha, o te-leh lkis-leh eena la moechikh-leh bee-eh ṭ'oenta ila ṭarpe, o meereh ileh, ”la hawee khena beeoekh ṭ'oenyate hal 'alam.“ o har bhay 'dana breez-leh haw eelana dtene.
ENG: And seeing a fig tree by the way side, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only; and he saith unto it, Let there be no fruit from thee henceforward for ever. And immediately the fig tree withered away.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Kad khze-lhoon talmeede 'oejib-lhoon o meerhoon, ”dakhee bjaldoeta breez-leh aha eelana dtene?“
ENG: And when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, How did the fig tree immediately wither away?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܵܓ݂ܵܐ ܒܚܘܼܫܵܒ݂ܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܦܘܼܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ،‘ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in hawe lawkhoon haymanoeta o la hawe poelagha bkhoeshawawkhoon, la-laha eelana eena oep-laha ṭoera in amreetoon, ’poesh shqeela o roepya byama,‘ bit hawe.
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do what is done to the fig tree, but even if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou taken up and cast into the sea, it shall be done.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܘܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”O kl mindee dṭalbeetoon bṣloota o bhaymanoeta bit qableetoon.“
ENG: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: O 'weereh eeshoo' lhaykla. O kad maloepe ywa, te-lhoon lkis-leh goerane dkahne o khwardiqne d'ama o boeqirhoon mineh, ”baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywit ane? Manee yoebil-leh iloekh aha shoelṭana?“
ENG: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܲܩܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”oep ana bit baqrinawkhoon khad boeqara, o in jawibeetoon-lee oep ana bit amren ilawkhoon baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywin ane.
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one question, which if ye tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

ASY: ”ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ’ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،‘ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ’ܒܲܣ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ؟‘
TRL: ”Ma'moodeeta dyookhanan min ayka ywa, min Alaha yan min bnaynasha?“ eena anee khsheew-lhoon gaw ganayhy, bemara, ”in amrakh, ’min Alaha,‘ bit amer ilan, ’bas qamoodee la hoeminawkhoon bee-eh?‘
ENG: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven or from men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why then did ye not believe him?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ’ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ،‘ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.“
TRL: ”O in amrakh, ’min bnaynasha,‘ bizda'a ywakh min kinsha, sabab klayhy aykh nweea ke khashwee lyookhanan.“
ENG: But if we shall say, From men; we fear the multitude; for all hold John as a prophet.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon o meerhoon ileh, ”le yad'akh.“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”oep ana le amrenawkhoon baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywin ane.“
ENG: And they answered Jesus, and said, We know not. He also said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܙܹܠ݇ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܘܦܠܘܿܚ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ.‘
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”moodee bikhshawa ytoon boet aha? Khad nasha eet wa-leh trey bnoone. te-leh lkis haw qamaya o meereh ileh, ’broonee, ze idyoom o plookh gaw karma.‘
ENG: But what think ye? A man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work today in the vineyard.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܠܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ.‘ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena haw joewib-leh o meereh, ’le azen.‘ eena bkharta psheem-leh o zeel-leh.
ENG: And he answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented himself, and went.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܪܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܘܦܵܠܹܚ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܡܹܗ. ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܗܹܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ،‘ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”te-leh lkis haw trayana o ṭleeb-leh mineh dazel o palekh gaw karmeh. O haw joewib-leh o meereh, ’he babee, bit azen,‘ eena la zeel-leh.“
ENG: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I go, sir: and went not.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܵܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”aynee min ane trey 'weed-leh bkhabra dbaboehy?“ joewib-lhoon ileh, ”haw qamaya.“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dmakhse o zanyate min qam deeawkhoon bi'wara yna lmalkoeta dalaha.
ENG: Whether of the twain did the will of his father? They say, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, that the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܵܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Sabab te-leh yookhanan ma'mdana lkis lawkhoon makroeze zadeeqoeta o la hoeminawkhoon bee-eh. Eena makhse o zanyate hoeminhoon bee-eh. Akhtoon apin dkhze lawkhoon, bkharta la psheem lawkhoon dhamineetoon waw bee-eh.“
ENG: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye saw it, did not even repent yourselves afterward, that ye might believe him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܕܢܨܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܣܝܵܓ݂ܵܐ، ܘܚܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܡܲܥܨܲܪܬܵܐ، ܘܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܒܘܼܪܓ̰ܵܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܵܦܵܪ.
TRL: O meereh eeshoo' matla khena, ”eet wa khad nasha mara dbayta, dnṣeew-leh karma o mkhe-leh lkhadirwanoehy syagha, o khpeereh gaweh ma'ṣarta, o bne-leh gaweh boerja, o soepe-leh lpalakhe, o zeel-leh bsapar.
ENG: Hear another parable: There was a man that was a householder, which planted a vineyard, and set a hedge about it, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into another country.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”O kad mṭe-leh zawna dṭ'oenyate, shoedireh lregawateh lkis palakhe dshaqlee waw ṭ'oenyate min karmeh.
ENG: And when the season of the fruits drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, to receive his fruits.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ، ܘܪܓ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena palakhe dweeq-lhoon lregawate, mkhe-lhoon lkhad, o rjeem-lhoon lkhad khena, o qṭeel-lhoon lhaw khena.
ENG: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.

ASY: ”ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Gaha dtartey shoedireh regawate khene boesh zawda min qamaye, eena palakhe 'weed-lhoon bee-ayhy maykh danee qamaye.
ENG: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them in like manner.

ASY: ”ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܢܵܟ݂ܦܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Bkharta shoedireh lkis layhy brooneh, bemara, ’qawma dnakhpee min broonee.‘
ENG: But afterward he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ’ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܵܪܘܿܬܵܐ، ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܩܵܛܠܲܚ ܠܹܗ، ܘܫܵܩܠܲܚ ܠܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Eena palakhe kad khze-lhoon lbroona, meerhoon bganayhy, ’aha-yleh yaroota, teymoen qaṭlakh-leh, o shaqlakh lyartoeta.‘
ENG: But the husbandmen, when they saw the son, said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and take his inheritance.

ASY: ”ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Dweeq-lhoon o poeliṭ-lhoon lbadar min karma o qṭeel-lhoon ileh.“
ENG: And they took him, and cast him forth out of the vineyard, and killed him.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”eeman date mara dkarma, moodee bit 'abed lanee palakhe?“
ENG: When therefore the lord of the vineyard shall come, what will he do unto those husbandmen?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܣܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܙܲܒ݂ܢܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh, ”sirya bit ṭaliq-lhoon anee beeshe, o karma bit yabil-leh lpalakhe khene, aynee dyawee-leh ṭ'oenyate bzawnayhy.“
ENG: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those miserable men, and will let out the vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ، ܕܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܪܢܝܼܬܵܐ؟ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܢ̈.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ha la qre lawkhoon bktabe, dkepa dmoesle-lhoon banaye, haw hwe-leh kepa dqoerneeta? Min Marya ywa aha, o 'oejaba-yleh b'aynan.
ENG: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, The same was made the head of the corner: This was from the Lord, And it is marvelous in our eyes?

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bit paysha shqeelta minawkhoon malkoeta dalaha o bit paysha yoebilta loemta dyawa ṭ'oenyate.
ENG: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken away from you, and shall be given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܦܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܡܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܛܒ݂ܝܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Kl man dnapel 'al aha kepa bit paesh shmeeṭa, o kl man d'aloehy napel aha kepa bit paesh ṭweekha.“
ENG: And he that falleth on this stone shall be broken to pieces: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will scatter him as dust.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܲܬܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Kad shmee' lhoon goerane dkahne o preeshe ane matloehy, dee' lhoon d'alayhy hoemzim-leh.
ENG: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.

ASY: ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܹܗ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O b'e-lhoon lidwaqeh eena zdee' lhoon min kinsha, sabab aykh nweea ke khashwee waw-leh.
ENG: And when they sought to lay hold on him, they feared the multitudes, because they took him for a prophet.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Mindrish hoemzim-leh eeshoo' bmatle o meereh,
ENG: And Jesus answered and spake again in parables unto them, saying,

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lkhad malka d'weed-leh khloela qa brooneh.
ENG: The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a certain king, which made a marriage feast for his son,

ASY: ”ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܕܩܵܪܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ ܠܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: ”O shoedireh lregawateh dqaree-lhoon cheede lkhloela, eena anee la b'e-lhoon datee waw.
ENG: and sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the marriage feast: and they would not come.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܟ̰ܝܼܕܹ̈ܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܹܗ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܛܪ̈ܝܼܨܝܼ ܦܪܝܼܡܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ.“‘
TRL: ”Mindrish shoedireh regawate khene, bemara, ’mooroen lcheede, ”ha khloela hoedreh ywin, o ṭreeṣee preemay ywin, kl mindee hoedra-yleh, teymoen lkhloela.“‘
ENG: Again he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them that are bidden, Behold, I have made ready my dinner: my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready: come to the marriage feast.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ؛ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܩܠܹܗ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܓܵܪܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena anee moesle-lhoon ilayhy o zeel-lhoon; eet wa dzeel-leh lkhaqleh, o eet wa dzeel-leh ltagaroeteh.
ENG: But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his merchandise:

ASY: ”ܘܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܟ̰ܝܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܩܛܝܼܠܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O sahma peesha dcheede dweeq-lhoon lregawate, moesle-lhoon ilayhy o qṭeelay-lhoon.
ENG: and the rest laid hold on his servants, and entreated them shamefully, and killed them.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ. ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܛܘܼܠܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܡܘܼܩܸܕ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eeman dshmee' leh malka, kreeb-leh. O shoedireh khaylawate o ṭoeliq-leh lanee qaṭoole, o lmdeenatayhy moeqid-leh.
ENG: But the king was wroth; and he sent his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned their city.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ، ’ܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܫܝܼܚܹܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah meereh malka lregawateh, ’khloela hoedra-yleh, o anee dpeeshe ywaw cheede le ywaw khsheekhe.
ENG: Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they that were bidden were not worthy.

ASY: ’ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܦܪܵܫܬܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ.‘
TRL: ’eena zemoen lprashta doerkhate, o kl man dkhazeytoon qreymoen-leh lkhloela.‘
ENG: Go ye therefore unto the partings of the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage feast.

ASY: ”ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܠܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ.
TRL: ”O pleeṭ-lhoon anee regawate loerkhate o joemi' lhoon kl man dmoechikh-lhoon, beeshe o ṭabe, o peesh-leh milya bayta dkhloela min arkhe.
ENG: And those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was filled with guests.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܠܐܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kad 'weereh malka likhzaya larkhe, khze-leh tama khad nasha dle ywa lweesha lweeshta dkhloela.
ENG: But when the king came in to behold the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding-garment:

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܚܲܒ݂ܪܝܼ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂؟‘ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܬܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”O meereh ileh, ’khawree, dakhee 'weeroekh lakha kad lweeshta dkhloela layt-loekh?‘ eena haw peesh-leh shteeqa.
ENG: and he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding-garment? And he was speechless.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ، ’ܐ݇ܣܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܕܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܒܲܪܵܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”Haygah pqeed-leh malka lregawateh, ’sooroen eedateh o aqlateh, o dreymoen-leh gaw khishka baraya ayka deet bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke.‘
ENG: Then the king said to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and cast him out into the outer darkness; there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab raba yna cheede o baṣoore yna goebye.“
ENG: For many are called, but few chosen.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܲܢܦܸܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ.
TRL: Haygah zeel-lhoon preeshe o soezgirhoon dakhee manpilee waw-leh bhemizman.
ENG: Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might ensnare him in his talk.

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܠܹܐ ܬܲܚܡܸܢܸܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܲܫܦܸܪܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Shoedirhoon lkis-leh talmeedayhy o nashe min beyt heroodis, o meerhoon ileh, ”malpana, beeda'a ywakh dshareera ywit, o oerkha dalaha bshareeroeta maloepoeha ywit, o le takhminit moodee nashe bit amree, o le ywit mashpirana.
ENG: And they send to him their disciples, with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, and carest not for any one: for thou regardest not the person of men.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ: ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܟܸܣܦܵܐ ܕܪܹܫܵܐ ܠܩܹܣܲܪ ܝܲܢ ܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”moor ilan, moodee bikhshawa ywit: qanoonayta-ylaha dyabakh kispa dresha lqesar yan la?“
ENG: Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܫܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh beeshoetayhy o joewib-leh ilayhy, ”qamoodee jaroebee ytoon ya mashpirane?
ENG: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why tempt ye me, ye hypocrites?

ASY: ”ܡܲܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܝܼ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܕܟܸܣܦܵܐ ܕܪܹܫܵܐ.“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Makhzeymoen-lee zoeza dkispa dresha.“ o anee moekhze-lhoon ileh deenara.
ENG: Shew me the tribute money. And they brought unto him a penny.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܨܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqray-leh eeshoo', ”dmanee-ylaha aha ṣoerta, o dmanee-ylaha aha kteewta?“
ENG: And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܕܩܹܣܲܪ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ ܠܩܹܣܲܪ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O anee joewib-lhoon, ”dqesar.“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”haloen hadkha mindee dqesar lqesar, o mindee dalaha lalaha.“
ENG: They say unto him, Caesar’s. Then saith he unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things that are Caesar’s; and unto God the things that are God’s.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O anee kad shmee' lhoon aha, 'oejib-lhoon, o shweeq-lhoon ileh o zeel-lhoon.
ENG: And when they heard it, they marveled, and left him, and went their way.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: Bhaw yawma te-lhoon lkis eeshoo' zadoeqaye, dle haminee bqyamta dmeete, o boeqirhoon mineh,
ENG: On that day there came to him Sadducees, which say that there is no resurrection: and they asked him,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܕܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܟܲܕ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܓܵܒܹܪ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ، ܘܡܲܩܸܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Bemara, ”malpana, moeshe moelip-leh ilan, din nasha maet kad layt-leh bnoone, akhoonoehy gaber lbakhteh, o maqim bnoone lakhoonoehy.
ENG: saying, Master, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Eet waw lkis lan shaw'a akhoonwate. Haw qamaya gweereh bakhta o meet-leh, o layt wa-leh bnoone, o shweeqa-leh bakhteh lakhoonoehy.
ENG: Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first married and deceased, and having no seed left his wife unto his brother;

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܪܹܝ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep haw dtrey, oep haw dtlata, hal haw dshaw'a.
ENG: in like manner the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.

ASY: ”ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bkharta klayhy meet-lhoon, oep bakhta.
ENG: And after them all the woman died.

ASY: ”ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܠܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Bqyamta, laynee min ane shaw'a bit hawya bakhta? Sabab klayhy gweera-lhoon.“
ENG: In the resurrection therefore whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܸܚܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”bikhlaṭa ytoon sabab le ytoon beeda'a ktabe o oep la khayla dalaha.
ENG: But Jesus answered and said unto them, Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ. ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab bqyamta, gawre le shaqlee bakhtate o bakhtate le shaqlee gawre. Ila klayhy aykh malake dalaha bit hawee bshmaya.
ENG: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as angels in heaven.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ:
TRL: ”Boet qyamta dmeete, la qre lawkhoon mindee dpeesh-leh meera ilawkhoon min Alaha, bemara:
ENG: But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,

ASY: ”’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂‘؟ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”’ana ywin Alaha dawraham, Alaha deeskhaq, Alaha dya'qoow‘? Alaha le-yleh Alaha dmeete, ila dkhaye.“
ENG: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: O kad shmee' lhoon kinshe ane khabre, 'oejib-lhoon byoelpaneh.
ENG: And when the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܬܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon preeshe dmoeshtiq-leh lzadoeqaye, jmee' lhoon m'oedale,
ENG: But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, gathered themselves together.

ASY: ܘܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: O khad minayhy deewa namoosaya boeqireh mineh ljaroebeh, bemara,
ENG: And one of them, a lawyer, asked him a question, tempting him,

ASY: ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Malpana, aynee poeqdana boesh goera-yleh bnamoosa?“
ENG: Master, which is the great commandment in the law?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܘܼܫܵܒ݂ܘܼ̈ܟ݂.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”makhibit lmarya alahoekh min kleh liboekh, o min klaha ganoekh, o min klayhy khoeshawoekh.
ENG: And he said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Aha-yleh haw poeqdana goera o qamaya.
ENG: This is the great and first commandment.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ: ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”O haw dtrey ke dame ileh: makhibit lshwawoekh aykh ganoekh.
ENG: And a second like unto it is this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ASY: ”ܥܲܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܢܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”'Al ane trey poeqdane binye yna namoosa o nwee-e.“
ENG: On these two commandments hangeth the whole law, and the prophets.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: Kad jmee'e ywaw preeshe, boeqireh minayhy eeshoo',
ENG: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question,

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ.“
TRL: ”Moodee bikhshawa ytoon boet msheekha, broona dmanee-yleh?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”broona ddaweed.“
ENG: saying, What think ye of the Christ? whose son is he? They say unto him, The son of David.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܲܣ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ:
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”bas dakhee daweed broekha biqrayeh-yleh Marya, bemara:
ENG: He saith unto them, How then doth David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܝܼ، ’ܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂‘؟
TRL: meereh Marya lmaree, ’toow min yameenee hal dmatbin dishminoekh tkhoot aqlatoekh‘?
ENG: The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, Till I put thine enemies underneath thy feet?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ؟“
TRL: ”In hadkha daweed biqrayeh-yleh Marya, dakhee bit hawe brooneh?“
ENG: If David then calleth him Lord, how is he his son?

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Oep khad la mṣe-leh ljawoebeh khabra, o min haw yawma oep khad la qoeshdireh lbaqoere mineh boeqara.
ENG: And no one was able to answer him a word, neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: Haygah hoemzim-leh eeshoo' 'am kinshe o 'am talmeedoehy,
ENG: Then spake Jesus to the multitudes and to his disciples,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”sapre o preeshe dweeq-lhoon doeka dmoeshe.
ENG: saying, The scribes and the Pharisees sit on Moses’ seat:

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܘܢܛܘܿܪܘܼܢ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ.
TRL: ”Hadkha kl mindee damree ilawkhoon dnaṭreetoon, 'woodoen o nṭooroen; eena aykh poelkhanayhy la 'awdeetoon, sabab ke amree o le 'awdee.
ENG: all things therefore whatsoever they bid you, these do and observe: but do not ye after their works; for they say, and do not.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܐܵܣܪܝܼ ܟܵܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ ܝܲܩܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܪ̈ܘܼܦ̮ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܨܸܒܥܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܩܪܝܼ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Ke asree karate yaqoere o matwee-lhoon 'al roewshane dbnaynasha, eena bganayhy le ba'ee oep bṣib'ayhy daqree bee-ayhy.
ENG: Yea, they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with their finger.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ؛ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܦܬܝܼ ܬܸܦܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܲܪܝܸܟ݂ܝܼ ܬܸܟ݂ܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܛܲܒ݂ܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Klayhy poelkhanayhy ke 'awdee-lhoon dpayshee khizye min bnaynasha; ke maptee tiplayhy o maryikhee tikhlate dqṭawyatayhy.
ENG: But all their works they do for to be seen of men: for they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܕܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܬܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”Ke makhibee dyatwee bresha dmishtoeyate o bresha dmawtbe dknoeshyate,
ENG: and love the chief place at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,

ASY: ”ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܘܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܪܲܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”O ke makhibee shlama min nashe bshoeqe, o dpayshee qirye rabee.
ENG: and the salutations in the marketplaces, and to be called of men, Rabbi.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܲܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon la paysheetoon qirye rabee, sabab khad eeleh rabeeawkhoon, o akhtoon klawkhoon akhoonwate ytoon.
ENG: But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your teacher, and all ye are brethren.

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܩܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”O la qareytoon lawkhoon baba 'al ar'a, sabab khad eeleh babawkhoon, haw dbshmaya.
ENG: And call no man your father on the earth: for one is your Father, which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܡܕܲܒܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”O la paysheetoon qirye mdabrane, sabab khad eeleh mdabranawkhoon, msheekha.
ENG: Neither be ye called masters: for one is your master, even the Christ.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܹܓܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena haw deeleh goera gawawkhoon hawe ilawkhoon rega.
ENG: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܪܸܡ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܸܦܵܐ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܟܸܦ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab kl man dmarim ganeh bit paesh moekipa, o man dmakip ganeh bit paesh moerma.
ENG: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be humbled; and whosoever shall humble himself shall be exalted.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܹܐ ܘܡܲܪܝܸܟ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܨܠܵܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, dke akhleetoon bate darmilyate o maryikheetoon ṣlawatawkhoon dla 'ilta. Boet aha bit qableetoon dyanta boesh zawda.
ENG: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye shut the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye enter not in yourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering in to enter.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, sabab ke dawreetoon malkoeta dshmaya 'al bnaynasha. Akhtoon le 'awreetoon, o anee dba'ee 'awree le shawqeetoon-lhoon d'awree.
ENG: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. Therefore you will receive greater condemnation.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܠܡܲܩܠܘܼܒܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܠܬܵܘܕܝܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܩܠܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܬܪܹܝ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, dke khadreetoon yama o birza lmaqloebe khad noekhraya ltawdeetawkhoon, o eeman dmaqlibeetoon-leh, ke 'awdeetoon-leh broona dgehana khad btrey 'alawkhoon.
ENG: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he is become so, ye make him twofold more a son of hell than yourselves.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܗܲܕܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon mhadyane simye, dke amreetoon, ’man dyame bhaykla, le-ylaha khad mindee; eena man dyame bdahwa dgaw haykla, khayawa-yleh.‘
ENG: Woe unto you, ye blind guides, which say, Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is a debtor.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܩܲܕܸܫ ܠܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ya sakhle o simye, aynee-yleh boesh goera, dahwa, yan haykla dke mqadish ldahwa?
ENG: Ye fools and blind: for whether is greater, the gold, or the temple that hath sanctified the gold?

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܲܠ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”Ke amreetoon, ’in nasha yame bmadbkha, le-ylaha khad mindee, eena man dyame bqoerbana d'al madbkha, bit paesh seera bmawmeeteh.‘
ENG: And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gift that is upon it, he is a debtor.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܩܲܕܸܫ ܠܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ya sakhle o simye, aynee-yleh boesh goera, qoerbana, yan madbkha dke mqadish lqoerbana?
ENG: Ye blind: for whether is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Hadkha kl man dyame bmadbkha, ke yame bee-eh o bkl mindee deet 'aloehy.
ENG: He therefore that sweareth by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܒܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܡܹܪ ܓܵܘܹܗ.
TRL: ”O man dyame bhaykla, ke yame bee-eh o bman d'amer gaweh.
ENG: And he that sweareth by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܡܹܐ ܒܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”O man dyame bshmaya, ke yame bkoersya dalaha o bman dyatew 'aloehy.
ENG: And he that sweareth by the heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ. ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܢܥܵܐ ܘܫܸܒܸܬ ܘܟܲܡܘܼܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ: ܕܝܼܘܵܢ، ܘܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ، ܘܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵ‌ܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane. Ke yaweetoon ma'sare dnan'a o shibit o kamoena, eena ke shawqeetoon mindeeane myoeqre dnamoosa: deewan, o rakhme, o haymanoeta‌. Ane wale ywa d'awdeetoon waw-lhoon, o anee khene la shawqeetoon waw-lhoon.
ENG: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye tithe mint and anise and cummin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law, judgment, and mercy, and faith: but these ye ought to have done, and not to have left the other undone.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܗܲܕܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܨܲܦܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܩܬܵܐ ܘܒܵܠܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܘܼܡܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ya mhadyane simye, ṣapyane dbaqta o bal'ane dgoemla.
ENG: Ye blind guides, which strain out the gnat, and swallow the camel.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܕܲܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܕܟܵܣܵܐ ܘܕܙܵܒ݂ܘܿܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܛܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܘܛܲܡܲܥܟܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, dke dakeytoon lbadar dkasa o dzawoora, eena min lgawa milye yna khṭoepya o ṭama'karoeta.
ENG: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full from extortion and excess.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܲܟܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܵܘܵܐ ܕܟܵܣܵܐ ܘܕܙܵܒ݂ܘܿܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ya preeshe simye, qamayta dakeymoen gawa dkasa o dzawoora, haygah oep lbadar bit hawe dikhya.
ENG: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of the cup and of the platter, that the outside thereof may become clean also.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܚܘܸܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܲܪ̈ܡܹܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܵܗ̇ ܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, ke dameytoon lqawre moekhwire, dmin lbadar ke payshee khizye shapeere, eena min lgawa milye yna garme dmeete o klaha ṭanpoeta.
ENG: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men’s bones, and of all uncleanness.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܫܦܲܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon, min lbadar ke dameytoon aykh zadeeqe, eena min lgawa milye ytoon 'awla o mashparta.
ENG: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but inwardly ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܒܵܢܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܲܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, dke baneytoon qawrawate dnwee-e, o saqleetoon beyt qwoere dzadeeqe.
ENG: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and garnish the tombs of the righteous,

ASY: ”ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܢ̈، ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܩܛܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”O ke amreetoon, ’in hawakh waw bikhaya byawmane dbabawatan, le hawakh waw shareeke 'amayhy bqṭalta dnwee-e.‘
ENG: and say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we should not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha bishada ytoon 'al ganawkhoon, dbnoone danee eetoon dqṭeel-lhoon lnwee-e.
ENG: Wherefore ye witness to yourselves, that ye are sons of them that slew the prophets.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܠܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܙܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Hadkha akhtoon mle lawkhoon kyoela dawahatawkhoon o zeed lawkhoon 'alayhy.
ENG: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܚܘܼܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܕܐܵܟܸܕܢܹ̈ܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܕܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ya khoeܵwate o zar'e dakidne, dakhee bit 'arqeetoon min deewan dgehana?
ENG: Ye serpents, ye offspring of vipers, how shall ye escape the judgment of hell?

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܟܝܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ. ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܡܵܚܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ، ܘܠܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܟܲܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, ha ana shadoere ywin lkis lawkhoon nwee-e o khakeeme o sapre. Minayhy bit qaṭleetoon o makheytoon lzqeepa, o lkhakma bit makheytoon bshawṭe gaw knoeshyatawkhoon, o kamreetoon-lhoon min mdeeta lmdeeta.
ENG: Therefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: some of them shall ye kill and crucify; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city:

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܦܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܒܹܝܠ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܒܪܵܟ݂ܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܹܝܠ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܠܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, bit ate 'alawkhoon kleh dima dzadeeqe dpeesh-leh shoepkha 'al ar'a, min dima dhabeyl zadeeqa hal dima dzkarya broona dbrakhya, haw dqṭeel lawkhoon beyl haykla o lmadbkha.
ENG: that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous unto the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom ye slew between the sanctuary and the altar.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, klayhy ane bit atee 'al daha sharbta.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.

ASY: ”ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܩܵܛܠܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܵܓ̰ܡܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܗ̇، ܟܡܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܓ̰ܲܡܥܸܢ ܠܒܢܘܿܢܵܟ݂ܝ̈ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܟܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܡܥܵܐ ܙܲܥܝܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܓܘܼܠܦܵܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Oorishlim, oorishlim, qaṭlanta dnwee-e o rajmanta danee deena shoedre lkis loeha, kma gahe b'e-lee djam'in lbnoonakhy aykh ktayta djam'a za'yoeha tkhoot goelpanoeha, o la bseem-laha lawkhoon.
ENG: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killeth the prophets, and stoneth them that are sent unto her! how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and ye would not!

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ، ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܵܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ha, pyasha-yleh shweeqa baytawkhoon kharaba ilawkhoon.
ENG: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.‘“
TRL: ”Sabab bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dle khazeytoon-lee min adeea hal damreetoon, ’breekha-yleh haw dbetaya-yleh bshima dmarya.‘“
ENG: For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܗ ܒܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min haykla, o kad bezala ywa, te-lhoon talmeedoehy lmakhzoeyeh binyana dhaykla.
ENG: And Jesus went out from the temple, and was going on his way; and his disciples came to him to shew him the buildings of the temple.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܬܝܼܪܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”bikhzaya ytoon klayhy ane? Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dle paesh shweeqa kepa 'al kepa dla paesh steera.“
ENG: But he answered and said unto them, See ye not all these things? verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: O kad teew-leh eeshoo' 'al ṭoera dzayte, te-lhoon lkis-leh talmeedoehy bnawshayhy, bemara, ”moor ilan, eeman bit hawee ane, o moodee-yleh neeshanqa dtaytoekh, o shoelama dzawna?“
ENG: And as he sat on the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܚܠܸܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”hweymoen hishyar dnasha la makhliṭ lawkhoon.
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Take heed that no man lead you astray.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ،‘ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܠܸܛܝܼ ܠܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab raba bit atee bshimee o bit amree, ’ana ywin msheekha,‘ o bit makhliṭee lraba.
ENG: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am the Christ; and shall lead many astray.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܠܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܠܵܫܹ̈ܐ. ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܓ݂ܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܵܘܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bit sham'eetoon plashe o khabre boet plashe. Khzeymoen dla shaghsheetoon, sabab wale-ylaha ane klayhy hawee, eena hesh le-yleh shoelama.
ENG: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars: see that ye be not troubled: for these things must needs come to pass; but the end is not yet.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܵܐ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ، ܘܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܟܸܦܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܵܘܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܪ̈ܵܘܕܵܢܹܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ.
TRL: ”Bit qayma oemta 'al oemta, o malkoeta 'al malkoeta, o bit hawee kipne, o mawtane, o rawdane bdoekane preeshe.
ENG: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines and earthquakes in divers places.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena ane klayhy shoeraya doelṣane yna.
ENG: But all these things are the beginning of travail.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܹܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܸܢܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit sapee lawkhoon dpaysheetoon joenjire, o bit qaṭlee lawkhoon, o bit paysheetoon sinye min klayhy imwate boet shimee.
ENG: Then shall they deliver you up unto tribulation, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all the nations for my name’s sake.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܠܒܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܣܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit qalbee raba, o bit sanee khad lhaw khena, o bit sapee khad lhaw khena.
ENG: And then shall many stumble, and shall deliver up one another, and shall hate one another.

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܠܸܛܝܼ ܠܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”O bit qaymee raba nwee-e dagale o bit makhliṭee lraba.
ENG: And many false prophets shall arise, and shall lead many astray.

ASY: ”ܘܒܘܼܬ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܚ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”O boet zawdoenyoeta d'awla, bit paekh khoeba draba.
ENG: And because iniquity shall be multiplied, the love of the many shall wax cold.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܡܹܠ ܗܲܠ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ.
TRL: ”Eena man dkhamel hal kharta, haw bit pareq.
ENG: But he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O bit paesh moekriza aha ewangaleeoon dmalkoeta bklaha doenye lsahdoeta dklayhy imwate, o haygah bit ate shoelama.
ENG: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world for a testimony unto all the nations; and then shall the end come.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܪܵܒܵܐ، ܒܸܟܠܵܝܵܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܕܟܸܪܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܕܵܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܐ،
TRL: ”Hadkha eeman dkhazeytoon ṭanpoeta dkharaba, biklaya bdoeka qadeeshta, dpeeshta-ylaha moedkirta byad daneeeyl nweea, haw dqare parme,
ENG: When therefore ye see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let him that readeth understand),

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܥܵܪܩܝܼ ܠܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah anee deena beehoed 'arqee lṭoerane.
ENG: then let them that are in Judaea flee unto the mountains:

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐ݇ܓܵܪܹܐ، ܠܵܐ ܨܵܠܹܐ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O haw deeleh 'al gare, la ṣale lishqala mindee deeleh gaw bayteh.
ENG: let him that is on the housetop not go down to take out the things that are in his house:

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O haw deeleh gaw khaqla, la daer lbareh lishqala lweeshteh.
ENG: and let him that is in the field not return back to take his cloke.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܠܒܛܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܡܲܡܸܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Way lbṭeene, o lmamiṣane banee yawmane.
ENG: But woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days!

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܪܵܩܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܣܸܬܘܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, ṣaleymoen dla hawe 'raqawkhoon bsitwa o la bshabta.
ENG: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on a sabbath:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab haygah bit hawe oelṣana goera dle-yleh hweea maykh dee-eh ha min shoeraya dbreeta o hal adeea, o oep le hawe.
ENG: for then shall be great tribulation, such as hath not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever shall be.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܟܪܝܼܹܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܪܝܼܹܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O in la hawee waw moekree-e anee yawmane, le pareq wa oep khad. Eena boet khatir dgoebye bit payshee moekree-e anee yawmane.
ENG: And except those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved: but for the elect’s sake those days shall be shortened.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ،‘ ܝܲܢ ’ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،‘ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Haygah in nasha amer ilawkhoon, ’lakha-yleh msheekha,‘ yan ’tama-yleh,‘ la hamineetoon.
ENG: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is the Christ, or, Here; believe it not.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܡܫܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܡܲܚܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab bit qaymee msheekhe dagale o nwee-e dagale o bit 'awdee neeshanqe goere o doemare lmakhloeṭe in maṣya oep lgoebye.
ENG: For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall shew great signs and wonders; so as to lead astray, if possible, even the elect.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Ha, bemara ywin ilawkhoon min qam dhawee ane.
ENG: Behold, I have told you beforehand.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،‘ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ؛ ܝܲܢ ’ܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܘܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،‘ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, in amree ilawkhoon, ’ha gaw bareea-yleh,‘ la palṭeetoon; yan ’ha gaw awana-yleh,‘ la hamineetoon.
ENG: If therefore they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the wilderness; go not forth: Behold, he is in the inner chambers; believe it not.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܪܩܵܐ ܡܵܚܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܕܢܚܵܐ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܡܲܥܪܒ݂ܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab dakhee birqa makhe min madnkha o paesh khizya hal ma'rwa, hadkha bit hawya tayta dbroona dnasha.
ENG: For as the lightning cometh forth from the east, and is seen even unto the west; so shall be the coming of the Son of man.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܫܠܲܕܵܐ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܢܸܫܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Ayka deelaha shlada, tama bit jam'ee nishre.
ENG: Wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

ASY: ”ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܬ ܚܵܒܹܐ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܘܣܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܒܲܗܪܹܗ، ܘܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܫܥܝܼܫܹܐ.
TRL: ”O bjaldoeta min bar oelṣana danee yawmane, bit khabe shimsha, o sahra le yabil bahreh, o kawkhbe bit naplee min shmaya, o khaylawate dshmaya bit payshee sh'eeshe.
ENG: But immediately, after the tribulation of those days, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܘܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit paesh khizya neeshanqa dbroona dnasha bshmaya, o bit 'awdee ta'zee klayhy shawṭe dar'a, o bit khazee broona dnasha betaya 'al 'nane dshmaya 'am khayla o khiqra goera.
ENG: and then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܕܫܝܼܦܘܿܪܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܡܥܝܼ ܠܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܓܹܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bit shadir malakhoehy bqala rama dsheepoora, o bit jam'ee lgoebye dee-eh min arb'a gebane ddoenye, min khad geba dshmaya lhaw khena.“
ENG: And he shall send forth his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܠܘܿܦܘܼܢ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܪܵܟܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܲܪܛܸܢܝܼ ܛܲܪ̈ܦܘܼܗܝ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܲܝܛܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min eelana dtene loopoen matla. Eeman dke rakkhee pa'wanoehy o barṭinee ṭarpoehy, ke yad'eetoon dmṭe-leh qayṭa.
ENG: Now from the fig tree learn her parable: when her branch is now become tender, and putteth forth its leaves, ye know that the summer is nigh;

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon, eeman dkhazeytoon ane klayhy, di'moen dmṭe-laha 'dana, o qam tar'a-ylaha.
ENG: even so ye also, when ye see all these things, know ye that he is nigh, even at the doors.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܵܘܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le 'aber aha dawra hal dklayhy ane hawee.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all these things be accomplished.

ASY: ”ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”Shmaya o ar'a bit 'awree, eena hemizmanee le 'awree.
ENG: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܠܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena lhaw yawma o lhay sa'at oep khad nasha le yade', o oep la malake dshmaya, ila baba bnawsheh.
ENG: But of that day and hour knoweth no one, not even the angels of heaven, neither the Son, but the Father only.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܘܿܚ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Dakhee deewa byawmane dnookh, hadkha bit hawya tayta dbroona dnasha.
ENG: And as were the days of Noah, so shall be the coming of the Son of man.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܛܵܘܦܵܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܒܸܓܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܘܡܲܓܒ݂ܘܼܪܹܐ، ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܢܘܿܚ ܠܩܹܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”Sabab dakhee deewa byawmane dqam ṭawpana, nashe bekhala o bishtaya, bigwara o magwoere, hal yawma d'weereh nookh lqewoeta,
ENG: For as in those days which were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark,

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܠ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܛܵܘܦܵܢܵܐ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”O nashe la dee' lhoon hal dte-leh ṭawpana o qṭeel-leh lklayhy. Hadkha bit hawya tayta dbroona dnasha.
ENG: and they knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall be the coming of the Son of man.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bhaw yawma in trey hawee bkhaqla, khad bit paesh loebla o haw khena bit paesh shweeqa.
ENG: Then shall two men be in the field; one is taken, and one is left:

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܓܪܵܣܵܐ ܒܓܵܪܘܿܣܬܵܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in tartey bakhtate hawee bigrasa bgaroosta, khda bit paysha loebilta o hay kheta bit paysha shweeqta.
ENG: two women shall be grinding at the mill; one is taken, and one is left.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Boet aha hweymoen r'eeshe, sabab le yad'eetoon baynee yawma bit ate marawkhoon.
ENG: Watch therefore: for ye know not on what day your Lord cometh.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܐܸܢ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܥܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena di'moen aha, din yade' wa mara dbayta baynee 'dana bit ate wa genawa, bit paesh wa r'eesha o le shabeq wa dpaesh wa sleeba bayteh.
ENG: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken through.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܠܹܐ ܣܵܦܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon hweymoen hdeere, sabab bsa'at dle sapreetoon bit ate broona dnasha.
ENG: Therefore be ye also ready: for in an hour that ye think not the Son of man cometh.

ASY: ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܘܚܲܟܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܹܗ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܘܼܗ̇؟
TRL: ”Manee-yleh rega mhoemna o khakeema dmareh 'abed-leh mdabrana 'al bnay bayteh dyabil-lhoon mekhoelta b'danoeha?
ENG: Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath set over his household, to give them their food in due season?

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܘܚܵܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lhaw rega eeman date mareh o khaze-leh bi'wada hadkha.
ENG: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bit 'abed-leh mdabrana 'al kl mindee deet-leh.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, that he will set him over all that he hath.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ، ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ ܥܲܪܩܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ،‘
TRL: ”Eena in hawe rega beesha, o amer blibeh, ’maree 'arqoele-yleh letaya,‘
ENG: But if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My lord tarrieth;

ASY: ”ܘܫܲܪܹܐ ܠܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܒܪܹܓܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܪ̈ܵܘܵܝܹܐ،
TRL: ”O share limkhaya lkhawrawateh bregoeta, o hawe bekhala o bishtaya 'am rawaye,
ENG: and shall begin to beat his fellow-servants, and shall eat and drink with the drunken;

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܣܵܦܹܪ، ܘܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ،
TRL: ”Bit ate mara dhaw rega byawma dle saper, o bsa'at dle yade',
ENG: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he expecteth not, and in an hour when he knoweth not,

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܚܲܫܒܸܢܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܫܦܸܪܵܢܵܐ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Bit 'abed-leh trey qiṭ'aṭe o bit khashbineh aykh mashpirana, tama bit hawe bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke.
ENG: and shall cut him asunder, and appoint his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܕܘܼ݂ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܥܣܲܪ ܒܬܘܼܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܡܦܹܝܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit paysha doe݂meeta malkoeta dshmaya l'sar btoelate dshqeel-lhoon lampeydayhy o pleeṭ-lhoon loerkha dkhitna.
ENG: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

ASY: ”ܚܲܡܸܫ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܬܘܼܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܵܘܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܚܲܡܸܫ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Khamish min ane btoelate hawnane ywaw, o khamish minayhy sakhle.
ENG: And five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܸܫ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܡܦܹܝܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܫܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”Anee khamish sakhle shqeel-lhoon lampeydayhy, eena la shqeel-lhoon 'amayhy mishkha.
ENG: For the foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܸܫ ܗܵܘܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܡܦܹܝܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena anee khamish hawnane shqeel-lhoon lampeydayhy o oep mishkha 'amayhy gaw mane.
ENG: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܥܘܼܪܩܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ، ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܛܠܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O kad 'oerqil-leh khitna, dmeekh-lhoon klayhy o ṭlee' lhoon.
ENG: Now while the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

ASY: ”ܘܒܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܩܘܲܚܬܵܐ، ’ܗܵܐ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܦܠܘܿܛܘܼܢ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”O bpalga dlayle hwe-laha maqwakhta, ’ha khitna betaya-yleh, plooṭoen loerkheh.‘
ENG: But at midnight there is a cry, Behold, the bridegroom! Come ye forth to meet him.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܬܘܼܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܡܦܹܝܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Haygah qeem-lhoon klayhy anee btoelate o hoedirhoon lampeydayhy.
ENG: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܬܘܼܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܵܘܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ’ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܫܚܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܡܦܹܝܕܲܢ̈ ܒܸܟ̰ܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.‘“
TRL: ”meerhoon anee btoelate sakhle lanee hawnane, ’haloen lan min mishkhawkhoon, sabab lampeydan bichma'a yna.‘“
ENG: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are going out.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܵܘܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ’ܠܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܘܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܙܲܒܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܒ݂ܘܿܢܘܼܢ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Joewib-lhoon anee hawnane o meerhoon, ’la. Sabab le male ilan o ilawkhoon. Zemoen lkis zabnane o zwoonoen lawkhoon.‘
ENG: But the wise answered, saying, Peradventure there will not be enough for us and you: go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܙܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”O kad zeel-lhoon lizwana, te-leh khitna. O anee dhdeere ywaw 'weerhoon 'ameh lbeyt khloela, o peesh-leh dweera tar'a.
ENG: And while they went away to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage feast: and the door was shut.

ASY: ”ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܬܘܼܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܦܬܘܿܚ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Bkharta te-lhoon oep anee btoelate khene, o meerhoon, ’Maran, Maran, ptookh ilan tar'a.‘
ENG: Afterward come also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Eena khitna joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ’troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le yad'enawkhoon.‘
ENG: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha poeshoen r'eeshe, sabab le yad'eetoon lhaw yawma o la lhay sa'at.“
ENG: Watch therefore, for ye know not the day nor the hour.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܒܣܵܦܵܪ، ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lnasha bezala bsapar, o qre-leh lregawateh o soepe-leh ilayhy mindee-eh.
ENG: For it is as when a man, going into another country, called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.

ASY: ”ܠܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ، ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܟܲܟܪܵܐ، ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܨܵܝܬܹܗ، ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Lkhad minayhy yoebil-leh khamsha kakre, o lhaw khena trey, o lhaw khena khad kakra, lkl khad minayhy yoebil-leh aykh mṣayteh, o shweeq-leh o zeel-leh.
ENG: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his several ability; and he went on his journey.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܙܝܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”zeel-leh haw dshqeel-leh khamsha kakre o pleekh-leh bee-ayhy, o moezyid-leh 'alayhy khamsha kakre khene.
ENG: Straightway he that received the five talents went and traded with them, and made other five talents.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ، ܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܩܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep haw dshqeel-leh trey kakre, pleekh-leh bee-ayhy o qne-leh trey kakre khene.
ENG: In like manner he also that received the two gained other two.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܟܲܟܪܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܛܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena haw dshqeel-leh khad kakra zeel-leh o khpeereh ar'a o ṭoeshe-leh zoeza dmareh.
ENG: But he that received the one went away and digged in the earth, and hid his lord’s money.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܒܘܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Min bar khad zawna yareekha, deereh mara danee regawate, o shqeel-leh khishboena minayhy.
ENG: Now after a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and maketh a reckoning with them.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܗܵܐ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”te-leh haw deewa shqeela khamsha kakre, o yoebil-leh khamsha kakre khene zawda, o meereh, ’maree, khamsha kakre yoebil-loekh ilee, ha khamsha khene moezyid-lee 'alayhy.‘
ENG: And he that received the five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: lo, I have gained other five talents.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ’ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ، ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ، ܥܲܠ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ ܠܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”meereh ileh mareh, ’ṭoewa iloekh rega ṭawa o mhoemna, 'al khacha hwe-loekh mhoemna, 'al raba bit 'awdenoekh mdabrana, 'woor lkhadoeta dmaroekh.‘
ENG: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܬܪܹܝ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܗܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”O te-leh haw dshqeela ywa trey kakre o meereh, ’maree, trey kakre yoebil-loekh ilee. Ha trey khene moezyid-lee 'alayhy.‘
ENG: And he also that received the two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: lo, I have gained other two talents.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ’ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ، ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ. ܥܲܠ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ. ܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ ܠܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”Joewib-leh ileh mareh, ’ṭoewa iloekh rega ṭawa o mhoemna, 'al khacha hwe-loekh mhoemna. 'Al raba bit 'awdenoekh mdabrana. 'woor lkhadoeta dmaroekh.‘
ENG: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܟܲܟܪܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܨܕܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܥܸܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܙܝܼܩ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”O te-leh oep haw dshqeela ywa khad kakra, o meereh, ’maree, ke yad'en wa-loekh dnasha qishya ywit, ke khaṣdet min ayka dla zree' loekh, o ke jam'it min ayka dla bzeeq-loekh.
ENG: And he also that had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou didst not sow, and gathering where thou didst not scatter:

ASY: ”’ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܘܛܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܟܲܟܪܘܼܟ݂ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܫܩܘܿܠ ܟܲܟܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”’boet aha, zdee' lee, o zeel-lee o ṭoeshe-lee kakroekh bar'a, shqool kakroekh adeea.‘
ENG: and I was afraid, and went away and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, thou hast thine own.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܣܸܠܵܢܵܐ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܨܕܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ، ܘܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܥܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܙܝܼܩ ܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”Joewib-leh mareh o meereh ileh, ’rega beesha o maksilana, beeda'a ywit wa dke khaṣden min ayka dla zree' lee, o ke jam'in min ayka dla bzeeq-lee,
ENG: But his lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I did not scatter;

ASY: ”’ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܡܲܬܒܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܨܲܪ̈ܵܦܹܐ، ܘܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܫܵܩܠܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܹܗ.
TRL: ”’wale ywa iloekh dmatbit wa zoezee 'al patoora dṣarape, o ateyn wa o shaqlen wa kakree 'am zawdoenyeh.
ENG: thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back mine own with interest.

ASY: ”’ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܟܲܟܪܵܐ، ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”’boet aha, shqooloen mineh kakra, o haloen-leh lhaw deet-leh 'isra kakre.
ENG: Take ye away therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him that hath the ten talents.

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: ”’sabab kl man deet-leh bit paesh yoewa ileh, o bit paesh moezyida ileh, eena haw dlayt-leh, oep haw deet-leh bit paesh shqeela mineh,
ENG: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken away.

ASY: ”’ܘܠܪܹܓܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܛܘܼܢ ܠܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܒܲܪܵܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”’wlrega la mare yoetrana palṭoen lkhishka baraya ayka deet bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke.‘
ENG: And cast ye out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.
