ENG: And he arose, and straightway took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' mindrish lkis yama, o kleh kinsha betaya ywaw lkis-leh, o maloepay ywa.
ENG: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܠܹܘܝܼ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܠܦܲܝ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“ ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O kad bi'wara, khze-leh llewee broona dkhalpay teewa gaw beyt makhse, o meereh ileh, ”ta baree.“ o qeem-leh zeel-leh bareh.
ENG: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the place of toll, and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܠܹܘܝܼ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Kad teewa ywa lsoepra gaw bayta dlewee, raba makhse o khaṭaye teebe ywaw 'am eeshoo' o 'am talmeedoehy, sabab raba ywaw anee dte-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And it came to pass, that he was sitting at meat in his house, and many publicans and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Eena sapre o preeshe, kad khze-lhoon leeshoo' bekhala 'am makhse o khaṭaye, meerhoon ltalmeedoehy, ”qamoodee bekhala-yleh 'am makhse o khaṭaye?“
ENG: And the scribes of the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and publicans, said unto his disciples, He eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܐܵܣܝܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܘܼܠܡܵܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ. ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܩܵܪܹܝܢ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Kad shmee' leh eeshoo' aha, meereh ilayhy, ”le yna sneeqe lasya anee deena bkhoelmana, ila anee dmree'e yna. La te-lee dqareyn lzadeeqe ila lkhaṭaye.“
ENG: And when Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of a physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܨܝܼܡܹܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ؟“
TRL: te-lhoon lkis-leh talmeede dyookhanan o dpreeshe deewaw ṣeeme, o boeqirhoon mineh, ”qamoodee talmeede dyookhanan o dpreeshe ke ṣaymee eena talmeede deeoekh le ṣaymee?“
ENG: And John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting: and they come and say unto him, Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܐܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ ܕܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܠܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qamoodee ke maṣee arkhe dkhloela ṣaymee kma dkhitna 'amayhy-yleh? La, le maṣee kma dhaw 'amayhy-yleh.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Can the sons of the bride-chamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena bit atee yawmane eeman dpaesh shqeela khitna minayhy, haygah bit ṣaymee.
ENG: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܐܹܛ ܥܵܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܠܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܓܵܪܫܵܐ ܥܵܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܙܵܐܹܕ ܦܸܪܛܵܐ.
TRL: ”nasha le khaeṭ 'arayta khadta 'al lweeshta bleeta, o in la, bit garsha 'arayta min lweeshta, o bit zaed pirṭa.
ENG: No man seweth a piece of undressed cloth on an old garment: else that which should fill it up taketh from it, the new from the old, and a worse rent is made.

ASY: ”ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܐ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܠܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ، ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܙܹܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܝܼ ܘܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܫܵܦܹܟ݂؛ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”O oep khad le dare khamra khata gaw goede bilye, o in la, khamra bit baze' lhoon goede, o goede bit kharwee o khamra shapekh; ila ke daree khamra khata gaw goede khate.“
ENG: And no man putteth new wine into old wineskins: else the wine will burst the skins, and the wine perisheth, and the skins: but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܫܠܵܓܵܐ ܫܸܒܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad bikhdara ywa eeshoo' byawma dshabta gaw khaqlane, shoere-lhoon talmeedoehy bishlaga shible.
ENG: And it came to pass, that he was going on the sabbath day through the cornfields; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ”ܚܙܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: O meerhoon ileh preeshe, ”khzee, qamoodee bi'wada yna mindee dle-yleh qanoonaya li'wada bshabta?“
ENG: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܣܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܟܦܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”ha le ytoon qirye moodee 'weed-leh daweed eeman dhaw o anee d'ameh sneeq-lhoon o kpeenhoon?
ENG: And he said unto them, Did ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܝܼܬܲܪ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ. ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Dakhee 'weereh lbayta dalaha, b'dana deewa aweetar goera dkahne, o lakhma dpatoora dmarya kheel-leh, haw dle ywa qanoonayta ileh lekhala shwooq min lkahne. O yoebil-leh oep lanee deewaw 'ameh.“
ENG: How he entered into the house of God when Abiathar was high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which it is not lawful to eat save for the priests, and gave also to them that were with him?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”shabta peeshta-ylaha breeta qa barnasha, la barnasha qa shabta.
ENG: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:

ASY: ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Broona dnasha hadkha oep mara dshabta-yleh.“
ENG: so that the Son of man is lord even of the sabbath.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܒܪܝܼܙܬܵܐ.
TRL: Mindrish 'weereh eeshoo' lknoeshta, o tama eet wa khad nasha eedeh breezta.
ENG: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had his hand withered.

ASY: ܘܨܵܝܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܸܬ ܒܲܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܩܵܐ ܕܩܵܒ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O ṣaydee waw-leh din bit basim-leh byawma dshabta, qa dqawlee waw 'aloehy.
ENG: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܒܪܝܼܙܬܵܐ، ”ܟܠܝܼ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh lhaw nasha eedeh breezta, ”klee bey palga.“
ENG: And he saith unto the man that had his hand withered, Stand forth.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ”ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܠܦܲܪܘܼܩܹܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܛܲܠܘܼܩܹܐ؟“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O boeqireh min anee deewaw tama, ”qanoonayta-ylaha li'wada ṭawta yan beeshta byawma dshabta, lparoeqe gana yan lṭaloeqe?“ eena anee la joewib-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful on the sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? to save a life, or to kill? But they held their peace.

ASY: ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܒܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܘܒܦܵܫܲܡܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ”ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ، ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: O kheereh eeshoo' bee-ayhy bkarba o bpashamta 'al qishyoeta dlibayhy, o meereh lhaw nasha, ”pashiṭ eedoekh.“ o poeshṭa-leh eedeh, o bseem-laha.
ENG: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their heart, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he stretched it forth: and his hand was restored.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܗܹܪ̈ܘܿܕܸܣܵܝܹܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Haygah pleeṭ-lhoon preeshe o soezgirhoon 'am heroodisaye dakhee dqaṭlee leeshoo'.
ENG: And the Pharisees went out, and straightway with the Herodians took counsel against him, how they might destroy him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ،
TRL: Eena eeshoo' shoene-leh min tama o te-leh lgeba dyama 'am talmeedoehy, o zeel-lhoon bareh kinshe raba min gleela o min eehoed,
ENG: And Jesus with his disciples withdrew to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed: and from Judaea,

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܕܘܿܡ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܘܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܕܨܘܿܪ ܘܕܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ، ܘܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O min oorishlim, o min adoom, o min 'iwra dyoordnan, o khadirwane dṣoor o dṣaydoon, o kinshe raba dshmee' lhoon boet mindeeane dbi'wada ywa, te-lhoon lkis-leh.
ENG: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and beyond Jordan, and about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came unto him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܙܥܘܿܪܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܝܸܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O meereh ltalmeede dmaytee waw-leh gamee z'oorta dyatew wa gawoeha dla malyiṣee waw-leh kinshe.
ENG: And he spake to his disciples, that a little boat should wait on him because of the crowd, lest they should throng him:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܩܲܪܒܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܸܕܩܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab boesim-leh raba, o klayhy anee deet waw-lhoon mar'e qarbinee waw ileh lidqara bee-eh.
ENG: for he had healed many; insomuch that as many as had plagues pressed upon him that they might touch him.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O anee deet waw bee-ayhy roekhe ṭame, eeman dkhze-lhoon ileh, npeel-lhoon qamoehy maqwoekhe o bemara, ”at eewit broona dalaha.“
ENG: And the unclean spirits, whensoever they beheld him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܲܫܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܓܵܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Eena haw qashyaeet pqeeday-leh dla galee waw boet dee-eh.
ENG: And he charged them much that they should not make him known.

ASY: ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: seeq-leh eeshoo' lṭoera o qre-leh lanee dba'e wa. O te-lhoon lkis-leh.
ENG: And he goeth up into the mountain, and calleth unto him whom he himself would: and they went unto him.

ASY: ܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܕܫܲܕܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ،
TRL: Preesh-leh tri'sar dhawee waw 'ameh, dshadir waw-lhoon dmakrizee waw,
ENG: And he appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,

ASY: ܘܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O dhawe wa-lhoon shoelṭana lpaloeṭe shede.
ENG: and to have authority to cast out devils:

ASY: ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ”ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.“
TRL: Moetiw-leh shima dshim'oon, ”kepa.“
ENG: and Simon he surnamed Peter;

ASY: ܘܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܵܐ، ”ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܪܲܓ݂ܫܝܼ،“ ܝܲܥܢܹܐ، ”ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܲܥܡܵܐ.“
TRL: O lya'qoow o lyookhanan akhoonoehy, bnoone dzawday, moetiw-leh shima, ”bnay raghshee,“ ya'ne, ”bnoone dra'ma.“
ENG: and James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and them he surnamed Boanerges, which is, Sons of thunder:

ASY: ܘܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ، ܘܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܒܲܪ ܬܘܼܠܡܲܝ، ܘܡܲܬܲܝ، ܘܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܲܪ ܚܲܠܦܲܝ، ܘܬܲܕܲܝ، ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܩܢܵܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O andreoos, o peeleepoos, o bar toelmay, o matay, o tooma, o ya'qoow bar khalpay, o taday, o shim'oon qnanaya.
ENG: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananaean,

ASY: ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O eehoeda skaryooṭa, haw dsoepe-leh ileh.
ENG: and Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him. And he cometh into a house.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' lbayta, o mindrish jmee' leh kinsha hadkha dla mṣe-lhoon haw o talmeedoehy akhlee mekhoelta.
ENG: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܠܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܘܼܕܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon khizmanoehy, te-lhoon dlablee waw-leh sabab meerhoon, ”shoedineh.“
ENG: And when his friends heard it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂، ܘܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O anee sapre dṣle-lhoon min oorishlim amree waw boet dee-eh, ”eet bee-eh b'ilzwoow, o bkhayla dgoera dshede paloeṭe-yleh shede.“
ENG: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and, By the prince of the devils casteth he out the devils.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܠܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' qiryay-leh lkis-leh o hoemzim-leh 'amayhy bmatle, bemara, ”dakhee maṣe saṭana paliṭ lsaṭana?
ENG: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܟܵܠܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in malkoeta paysha plee'ta 'al ganoeha le maṣya kalya.
ENG: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܠܝܼܥܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ.
TRL: ”O in bayta 'al ganeh paesh plee'a le maṣe kale.
ENG: And if a house be divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܠܝܼܥܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܛܹܐ ܠܚܘܼܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in saṭana qaem ldalqoewl dganeh o paesh plee'a, le maṣe kale, ila bit maṭe lkhoetama.
ENG: And if Satan hath risen up against himself, and is divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܘܣܵܠܹܒ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܵܣܹܪ ܠܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܣܵܠܹܒ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Oep khad le maṣe 'aber lbayta dkhad nasha khaylana o saleb lmindee-eh, in la qamayta aser lkhaylana o haygah saleb lbayteh.
ENG: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܘܼܕܵܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, klayhy khṭeeate bit payshee poekhle lbnaynasha, o klayhy goedape dgadpee-lhoon bit payshee poekhle ilayhy,
ENG: Verily I say unto you, All their sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and their blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܓܵܕܹܦ ܥܲܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”Eena man dgadep 'al roekha dqoedsha, layt-leh poekhala hal 'alam, eena khayawa-yleh lkhṭeeta dl'alam.“
ENG: but whosoever shall blaspheme against the Holy Spirit hath never forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: Sabab amree waw, ”roekha ṭame eet bee-eh.“
ENG: because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana te-lhoon yimeh o akhoonwateh, kle-lhoon lbadar, o shoedirhoon lkis-leh date wa.
ENG: And there come his mother and his brethren; and, standing without, they sent unto him, calling him.

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ: ”ܗܵܐ ܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ، ܘܒܸܛܠܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O kinsha dteewa ywa lkis-leh meerhoon ileh: ”ha yimoekh o akhoonwatoekh kilye yna lbadar, o biṭlaboekh eena.“
ENG: And a multitude was sitting about him; and they say unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

ASY: ܘܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܸܡܝܼ، ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈؟“
TRL: O joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”manee-ylaha yimee, o manee yna akhoonwatee?“
ENG: And he answereth them, and saith, Who is my mother and my brethren?

ASY: ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ، ܝܸܡܝܼ، ܘܗܵܐ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈.
TRL: O kheereh banee dteebe ywaw lkhadirwanoehy o meereh, ”ha, yimee, o ha, akhoonwatee.
ENG: And looking round on them which sat round about him, he saith, Behold, my mother and my brethren!

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ، ܘܚܵܬܝܼ، ܘܝܸܡܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Sabab kl man d'abed ṣiwyana dalaha, haw eeleh akhoonee, o khatee, o yimee.“
ENG: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟ̰ܸܡ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܸܪܙܵܐ.
TRL: Mindrish shoere-leh eeshoo' lmaloepe lmarza dyama, o jmee' leh lkis-leh kinsha chim raba, hada dhaw seeq-leh o teew-leh gaw gamee, o kinsha kilya ywa 'al birza.
ENG: And again he began to teach by the sea side. And there is gathered unto him a very great multitude, so that he entered into a boat, and sat in the sea; and all the multitude were by the sea on the land.

ASY: ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܡܲܠܲܦܬܹܗ:
TRL: O maloepay ywa raba mindeeane bmatle, o meereh ilayhy bmalapteh:
ENG: And he taught them many things in parables, and said unto them in his teaching,

ASY: ”ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ، ܗܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܙܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܠܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shmi'moen, ha, pleeṭ-leh zar'ana lizra'a.
ENG: Hearken: Behold, the sower went forth to sow:

ASY: ”ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܩܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O hwe-laha kad haw bizra'a ywa, eet wa min barzar'a dnpeel-leh lmarza doerkha, o te-lhoon ṭayre o lqeeṭ-lhoon ileh.
ENG: and it came to pass, as he sowed, some seed fell by the way side, and the birds came and devoured it.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܢܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܦܪܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܓ̰ܝܸܢܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ ܒܥܲܦܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh 'al ar'a kepanta, ayka dlayt wa 'apra raba, o bjaldoeta moejyineh sabab layt wa 'oemqa b'apra.
ENG: And other fell on the rocky ground, where it had not much earth; and straightway it sprang up, because it had no deepness of earth:

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܙܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܝ݇ܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ، ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ، ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O kad zreeq-leh shimsha, qeed-leh, o sabab layt wa-leh 'iqra, breez-leh.
ENG: and when the sun was risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ. ܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh gaw kitwe. Goerwis-lhoon kitwe o khneeq-lhoon ileh, o la yoebil-leh ṭ'oenta.
ENG: And other fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܡܝܼܢܬܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ؛ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܬܠܵܬܝܼ، ܘܕܐܸܫܬܝܼ، ܘܕܐܸܡܵܐܐ.“
TRL: ”O khene npeel-lhoon 'al ar'a shameenta o yoebil-lhoon ṭ'oenyate; seeq-lhoon o goerwis-lhoon o moete-lhoon dtlatee, o dishtee, o dima.“
ENG: And others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing; and brought forth, thirtyfold, and sixtyfold, and a hundredfold.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܫܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”man deet-leh natyate lishma'a, shame'.“
ENG: And he said, Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܪ̈ܙܹܒܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܥܲܡ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman deewa bnawsheh, boeqirhoon mineh anee deewaw arzebanoehy, 'am tri'sar talmeede, boet matla.
ENG: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parables.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܪܵܙܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܐ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ilawkhoon peesha-yleh yoewa dyad'eetoon raza dmalkoeta dalaha, eena lanee deena lbadar klayhy ane ke payshee meere bmatle,
ENG: And he said unto them, Unto you is given the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all things are done in parables:

ASY: ”ܩܵܐ ܕܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ، ܘܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܝܼ، ܕܠܵܐ ܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Qa dkhzaya khazee o la yad'ee, o shma'a sham'ee o la parmee, dla dayree o payshee poekhle.“
ENG: that seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest haply they should turn again, and it should be forgiven them.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ؟
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”in le yad'eetoon aha matla, dakhee bit yad'eetoon klayhy matle khene?
ENG: And he saith unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how shall ye know all the parables?

ASY: ”ܙܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܕܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ، ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Zar'ana dzree' leh, hemizman zree' leh.
ENG: The sower soweth the word.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܚܵܛܹܦ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O ane yna anee dnpeel-lhoon lmarza doerkha, ayka dpaysha zree'ta hemizman. Eeman dshmee' lhoon lhemizman, ke ate saṭana bjaldoeta o khaṭep-laha min libayhy.
ENG: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; and when they have heard, straightway cometh Satan, and taketh away the word which hath been sown in them.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܢܬܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: ”O anee dpeesh-lhoon zree'e 'al ar'a kepanta, anee yna deeman dshmee' lhoon lhemizman, bjaldoeta o bkhadoeta ke qablee-laha,
ENG: And these in like manner are they that are sown upon the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, straightway receive it with joy;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܠܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena layt-lhoon 'iqra bganayhy, ila qa khad zawna kirya yna, o eeman dke hawe oelṣana yan rdoepya boet hemizman, bjaldoeta ke qalbee.
ENG: and they have no root in themselves, but endure for a while; then, when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, straightway they stumble.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ،
TRL: ”Eena anee dpeesh-lhoon zree'e gaw kitwe, anee yna dshmee' lhoon lhemizman,
ENG: And others are they that are sown among the thorns; these are they that have heard the word,

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܸܢܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܘܡܲܚܠܸܛܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܸܠܬܵܐ، ܘܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܘܚܵܢܩܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܘܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena rinya daha doenye o makhliṭanoeta ddawilta, o shahwatyate dmindeeane khene, ke atee o khanqee-laha hemizman, o ke hawya dla ṭ'oenta.
ENG: and the cares of the world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܡܝܼܢܬܵܐ، ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܬܠܵܬܝܼ، ܘܒܐܸܫܬܝܼ، ܘܒܐܸܡܵܐܐ.“
TRL: ”O anee dpeesh-lhoon zree'e bar'a shameenta, ane yna dke sham'ee hemizman o qablee-laha o yawee ṭ'oenyate, btlatee, o bishtee, o bima.“
ENG: And those are they that were sown upon the good ground; such as hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, thirtyfold, and sixtyfold, and a hundredfold.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܗܝܼ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܘܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܣܲܐܬܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܡܢܵܪܬܵܐ؟
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ke hawya malhee shraya o matwee-laha tkhoot sata, yan tkhoot shweeta? Le-ylaha dmatwee-laha 'al mnarta?
ENG: And he said unto them, Is the lamp brought to be put under the bushel, or under the bed, and not to be put on the stand?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܛܸܫܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܠܒܲܗܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab layt mindee ṭishya dla paesh gilya, o la mindee dbkhishka dla paleṭ lbahra.
ENG: For there is nothing hid, save that it should be manifested; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܫܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: ”Man deet-leh natyate lishma'a, shame'.“
ENG: If any man hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܟܵܝܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܟܝܼܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”hweymoen hishyar moodee sham'eetoon, sabab bkyoela dkayleetoon bit paesh keela ilawkhoon, o moezyida.
ENG: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete it shall be measured unto you: and more shall be given unto you.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Sabab man deet-leh bit paesh yoewa ileh, o man dlayt-leh oep haw deet-leh bit paesh shqeela mineh.“
ENG: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he hath.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lnasha dzree' leh barzar'a bar'a.
ENG: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed upon the earth;

ASY: ”ܘܕܡܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܡܲܓ̰ܝܘܼܢܹܐ ܘܓܲܪܘܘܼܣܹܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܪܘܘܼܣܹܐ.
TRL: ”O dmeekh-leh blayle o qeem-leh byawma, o barzar'a majyoene o garwoese, o haw la beeda'a dakhee-yleh garwoese.
ENG: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he knoweth not how.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܠܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܸܒܸܠܬܵܐ، ܘܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܚܸܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܫܸܒܸܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab ar'a bganoeha ke yawa ṭ'oenta, qamayta boela, haygah shibilta, o bkharta khiṭeeta mleeta gaw shibilta.
ENG: The earth beareth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, then the full corn in the ear.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܵܛܝܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܐ ܡܲܓܠܵܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܘܫܲܪܹܐ ܒܸܚܨܵܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܨܕܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O eeman dke maṭya ṭ'oenta, ke dare magla gawoeha o share bikhṣada, sabab mṭe-leh khiṣda.“
ENG: But when the fruit is ripe, straightway he putteth forth the sickle, because the harvest is come.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܕܡܲܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟ ܘܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܡܵܬܠܲܚ ܠܵܗ̇؟
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”lmoodee madmakh-laha malkoeta dalaha? O baynee matla matlakh-laha?
ENG: And he said, How shall we liken the kingdom of God? or in what parable shall we set it forth?

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܠܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܪܕܲܠ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܥܘܿܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܲܪܙܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܕܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ke damya ldandikta dkhardal, hay deeman dke paysha zree'ta bar'a boesh z'oorta-ylaha min klayhy barzar'e d'al ar'a.
ENG: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown upon the earth, though it be less than all the seeds that are upon the earth,

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥܬܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܓܲܪܘܸܣܵܐ ܘܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܲܪ̈ܩܹܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܨܝܼ ܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܫܵܪܝܼ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Eena eeman dpaysha zree'ta, ke garwisa o hawya boesh goerta min klayhy yarqe, o ke 'awda pa'wane goere, hadkha dmaṣee ṭayre dshmaya sharee tkhoot ṭilaneetoeha.“
ENG: yet when it is sown, groweth up, and becometh greater than all the herbs, and putteth out great branches; so that the birds of the heaven can lodge under the shadow thereof.

ASY: ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܵܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ.
TRL: O raba matle khene maykh dane hoemzim-leh eeshoo' 'amayhy, dakhee dmaṣee waw sham'ee.
ENG: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it:

ASY: ܘܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܟܹܐ ܦܲܫܸܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: O dla matle le hamzim wa 'amayhy. Eena eeman deewa bnawsheh 'am talmeedoehy, ke pashiq wa kl mindee.
ENG: and without a parable spake he not unto them: but privately to his own disciples he expounded all things.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܥܵܒ݂ܪܲܚ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.“
TRL: Bhaw yawma bramsha meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”'awrakh lhaw marza khena.“
ENG: And on that day, when even was come, he saith unto them, Let us go over unto the other side.

ASY: ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܡܝܼ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: O shweeq-lhoon lkinshe o loebil-lhoon ileh bgamee, aykh deewa. O eet waw gamee-e khene 'ameh.
ENG: And leaving the multitude, they take him with them, even as he was, in the boat. And other boats were with him.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ، ܘܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܠܸܡܠܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O qeem-leh pawkha raba khaylana, o lape bimkhaya ywaw lgaw gamee hada dqoerbinaha limlaya.
ENG: And there ariseth a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the boat, insomuch that the boat was now filling.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܣܦܵܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܪܥܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܕܒܸܛܠܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ؟“
TRL: Eeshoo' dmeekha ywa 'al spadeeta bkharta dgamee. te-lhoon lkis-leh o moer'ish-lhoon o meerhoon, ”rabee-an, le ywit takhmoene dbiṭlaqa ywakh?“
ENG: And he himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܘܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܵܡܵܐ، ”ܫܠܝܼ، ܫܬܘܿܩ.“ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Qeem-leh, o njeew-leh bpawkha o meereh lyama, ”shlee, shtooq.“ o kle-leh pawkha, o hwe-leh nyakha goera.
ENG: And he awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܙܵܕܘܿܥܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟ ܗܹܫ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee hadkha zadoo'e ytoon? Hesh layt lawkhoon haymanoeta?“
ENG: And he said unto them, Why are ye fearful? have ye not yet faith?

ASY: ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܘܝܵܡܵܐ ܡܲܨܝܘܼܬܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: O zdee' lhoon raba, o meerhoon khad lhaw khena, ”manee-yleh aha doep pawkha o yama maṣyoete yna ileh?“
ENG: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܸܕܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon lmarza khena dyama latra dgidraye.
ENG: And they came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gerasenes.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ.
TRL: O kad pleeṭ-leh min gamee, har bhay 'dana tpeeq-leh bee-eh khad nasha biplaṭa min beyt qwoere, deet wa bee-eh roekha ṭame.
ENG: And when he was come out of the boat, straightway there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܣܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O ke 'amer wa gaw beyt qwoere, o nasha le maṣe wa aser wa-leh oep bsheshlate.
ENG: who had his dwelling in the tombs: and no man could any more bind him, no, not with a chain;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܩܵܘܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܛܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܵܘܕܹ̈ܐ ܬܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܲܒܛܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab raba gahe bqawde o bsheshlate ke paesh wa seera, eena ke qaṭe' wa sheshlate, o qawde taber wa-lhoon, o nasha le maṣe wa zabṭineh.
ENG: because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been rent asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: and no man had strength to tame him.

ASY: ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܒܐܝܼܡܵܡܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܘܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܕܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bkl 'dana, blayle o beemama, ke hawe wa gaw ṭoerane o gaw beyt qwoere, maqwoekhe o darboene ganeh bkepe.
ENG: And always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ، ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: Eena eeman dkhze-leh leeshoo' min rikhqa, rkheeṭ-leh lkis-leh o breek-leh qam aqlateh.
ENG: And when he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and worshipped him;

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ؟ ܡܲܡܘܼܝܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪܸܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O moeqwikh-leh bqala rama, bemara, ”ma-loekh minee, eeshoo' broona dalaha 'ilaya? Mamoeyoekh eewin balaha dla janjirit-lee.“
ENG: and crying out with a loud voice, he saith, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the Most High God? I adjure thee by God, torment me not.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܦܠܘܿܛܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ.“
TRL: Sabab meereh ileh, ”plooṭy min nasha, roekha ṭame.“
ENG: For he said unto him, Come forth, thou unclean spirit, out of the man.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܫܸܡܝܼ ܠܸܓ݂ܝܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ.“
TRL: O boeqireh mineh eeshoo', ”moodee-yleh shimoekh?“ o haw joewib-leh, ”shimee lighyoon eeleh, sabab raba ywakh.“
ENG: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he saith unto him, My name is Legion; for we are many.

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܲܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: O poerpil-leh bee-eh raba dla shadirhoon lbadar min atra.
ENG: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܪܥܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: Eet wa tama qoerba lṭoera biqra goerta dkhzoere bir'aya,
ENG: Now there was there on the mountain side a great herd of swine feeding.

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܫܲܕܸܪܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܲܚ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: O poerpil-lhoon bee-eh anee shede, bemara, ”shadiran gaw khzoere d'awrakh gawayhy.“
ENG: And they besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.

ASY: ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܪܹܝ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܫܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: O yoebil-leh ilayhy psasa, o pleeṭ-lhoon anee roekhe ṭame o 'weerhoon gaw khzoere, o hay biqra aykh trey alpe khzoere rkheeṭ-laha lshqeepa o npeel-laha gaw yama, o khneeq-laha.
ENG: And he gave them leave. And the unclean spirits came out, and entered into the swine: and the herd rushed down the steep into the sea, in number about two thousand; and they were choked in the sea.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܪܥܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Anee dmar'oeye ywaw lkhzoere 'reeq-lhoon o hoeqe-lhoon gaw mdeeta o gaw matwate. O pleeṭ-lhoon nashe likhzaya mindee dhwe-leh.
ENG: And they that fed them fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they came to see what it was that had come to pass.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܠܸܓ݂ܝܘܿܢ ܕܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܗܵܘܢܹܗ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: te-lhoon lkis eeshoo', o khze-lhoon lhaw deet wa bee-eh lighyoon dshede teewa, o lweesha o hawneh bresheh, o zdee' lhoon.
ENG: And they come to Jesus, and behold him that was possessed with devils sitting, clothed and in his right mind, even him that had the legion: and they were afraid.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O anee dkhze-lhoon hoeqe-lhoon lnashe moodee hwe-leh lhaw deet wa bee-eh shede o oep lkhzoere.
ENG: And they that saw it declared unto them how it befell him that was possessed with devils, and concerning the swine.

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܫܲܢܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܚܘܼܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O poerpil-lhoon bee-eh dshane wa min tkhoemayhy.
ENG: And they began to beseech him to depart from their borders.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܣܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: O kad seeq-leh eeshoo' lgamee, ṭleeb-leh mineh haw dpeesh-leh boesma min sheda dazel 'ameh.
ENG: And as he was entering into the boat, he that had been possessed with devils besought him that he might be with him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܸܣ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܘܗܲܩܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' la shweeq-leh dazel wa 'ameh, ila meereh ileh, ”ze lbaytoekh lkis nashoekh o haqee-lhoon moodee 'weed-leh iloekh Marya, o dakhee roekhim-leh 'aloekh.“
ENG: And he suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go to thy house unto thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and how he had mercy on thee.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܸܣܪܲܬ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O zeel-leh haw nasha, o shoere-leh lmakroeze gaw 'israt mdeenate mindee d'weed-leh ileh eeshoo', o klayhy nashe 'ajbee waw.
ENG: And he went his way, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all men did marvel.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Kad 'weereh mindrish eeshoo' lhaw marza khena, jmee' lhoon lkis-leh kinshe raba, o haw 'al marza dyama ywa.
ENG: And when Jesus had crossed over again in the boat unto the other side, a great multitude was gathered unto him: and he was by the sea.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܘܿܐܵܪܵܫ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: O te-leh lkis-leh khad min goerane dknoeshta, shimeh yooarash, o eeman dkhze-leh ileh, npeel-leh qam aqlateh.
ENG: And there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and seeing him, he falleth at his feet,

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܪܵܬܝܼ ܙܥܘܿܪܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇. ܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܘܚܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: O poerpil-leh bee-eh raba, bemara ileh, ”bratee z'oorta qam mawta-ylaha. Ta o matiw eedoekh 'aloeha dpaysha bseemta o khaya.“
ENG: and beseecheth him much, saying, My little daughter is at the point of death: I pray thee, that thou come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be made whole, and live.

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ܘܒܸܚܠܵܨܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: zeel-leh 'ameh eeshoo', o kinsha raba bezala ywaw bareh, o bikhlaṣa ywa ileh.
ENG: And he went with him; and a great multitude followed him, and they thronged him.

ASY: ܘܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܩܵܐ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O khda bakhta dke azel wa dima minoeha qa tri'sar shine,
ENG: And a woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,

ASY: ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܵܣܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܘܼܪܸܓ̰ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ.
TRL: O raba joenjirta ywa min raba asye, o khoerijta ywa kl mindee deet wa-laha, o le ywa hweeta ṣpayee, ila boesh khirba.
ENG: and had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܓܵܘܵܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ܘܕܩܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ.
TRL: Kad shmee' laha boet eeshoo', te-laha mgawa dkinsha min bareh, o dqeeraha blweeshteh.
ENG: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came in the crowd behind, and touched his garment.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܕܵܩܪܵܢ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܣܡܵܢ.“
TRL: Sabab meeraha bganoeha, ”oep in dblweeshteh daqran bit basman.“
ENG: For she said, If I touch but his garments, I shall be made whole.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܘܼܗ̇، ܘܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪܥܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana breez-laha 'ayna ddimoeha, o r'eesh-laha bpaghroeha dpeesh-laha bseemta min mar'oeha.
ENG: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of her plague.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܦܬܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܝܼ؟“
TRL: O har bhay 'dana eeshoo' dee' leh bganeh dkhayla pleeṭ-leh mineh, pteel-leh lkis kinsha o meereh, ”manee dqeereh blweeshtee?“
ENG: And straightway Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power proceeding from him had gone forth, turned him about in the crowd, and said, Who touched my garments?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܸܚܠܵܨܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ؟‘“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh talmeedoehy, ”bikhzaya ywit dakhee kinsha bikhlaṣoekh eeleh, o bemara ywit, ’manee dqeereh beeee?‘“
ENG: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

ASY: ܘܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: O bikhyara lkhadirwanoehy dkhaze manee dqeereh bee-eh,
ENG: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܘܪܲܬܪܘܼܬܹܐ، ܘܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܩܘܼܘܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Hay bakhta, bizda'a o ratroete, o beeda'a mindee dqoewim-leh iloeha, te-laha o npeel-laha qam aqlateh, o meeraha ileh kleh shrara.
ENG: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܒܪܵܬܝܼ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܟ݂ܝ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܚܝܼܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܙܹܠ݇ܝ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܫܝ ܒܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪܥܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: Eena haw meereh iloeha, ”bratee, haymanoetakhy qam makheea lakhy, zey bshlama, o poeshy bseemta min mar'akhy.“
ENG: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܪܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: O kad haw hamzoeme, te-lhoon nashe min bayta dgoera dknoeshta o meerhoon ileh, ”bratoekh meet-laha, qamoodee khena 'ajoeze ywit lmalpana?“
ENG: While he yet spake, they come from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ، ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܗܲܡܸܢ.“
TRL: Eena kad eeshoo' shmee' leh moodee hoemzim-lhoon, meereh lgoera dknoeshta, ”la zad'et, akhchee hamin.“
ENG: But Jesus, not heeding the word spoken, saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Fear not, only believe.

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂.
TRL: O la shweeq-leh lnasha dazel wa 'ameh shwooq min kepa o ya'qoow o yookhanan akhoona dya'qoow.
ENG: And he suffered no man to follow with him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܘܒܝܼܠܵܝܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon lbayta dhaw goera dknoeshta, o khze-leh shghoeshya, o nashe bibkhaya o beelaya raba.
ENG: And they come to the house of the ruler of the synagogue; and he beholdeth a tumult, and many weeping and wailing greatly.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ؟ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܝܼܬܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: O 'weereh eeshoo' lbayta, o meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee shgheeshe ytoon o bibkhaya? Brata le-ylaha meetta, ila dmeekhta-ylaha.“
ENG: And when he was entered in, he saith unto them, Why make ye a tumult, and weep? the child is not dead, but sleepeth.

ASY: ܘܓܚܝܼܟ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܘܠܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܘܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: O gkheek-lhoon bee-eh. Eena eeshoo' poeliṭ-leh lklayhy, o loebil-leh lbaba dbrata o lyimoeha o lanee d'ameh ywaw, o 'weereh layka deewa brata.
ENG: And they laughed him to scorn. But he, having put them all forth, taketh the father of the child and her mother and them that were with him, and goeth in where the child was.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܛܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܡܝ،“ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܫܩܵܐ، ”ܒܪܵܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܩܘܼܡܝ.“
TRL: Dweeq-leh beeda dbrata o meereh iloeha, ”ṭleeta qoemy,“ dpyasha-yleh poeshqa, ”brata, ilakhy bemara ywin, qoemy.“
ENG: And taking the child by the hand, he saith unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, Arise.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܘܚܕܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ܘܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܪ݇ܬ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana qeem-laha brata o khdeeraha, o hay bat tri'sar shine ywa, o klayhy 'oejib-lhoon 'oejaba goera.
ENG: And straightway the damsel rose up, and walked; for she was twelve years old. And they were amazed straightway with a great amazement.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܘܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh qiwya ilayhy eeshoo' doep khad la yade' aha. O meereh ilayhy dyawee-laha mindee lekhala.
ENG: And he charged them much that no man should know this: and he commanded that something should be given her to eat.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܹܗ، ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min tama o te-leh lmdeeteh, o talmeedoehy zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And he went out from thence; and he cometh into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

ASY: ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟
TRL: O byawma dshabta shoere-leh lmaloepe gaw knoeshta, o raba minayhy dshmee' lhoon 'ajbee waw, o amree waw, ”min ayka eet-leh ane, o moodee khikhmta peeshta-ylaha yoebilta ileh dhadkha khayle goere beedoehy bihwaya yna?
ENG: And when the sabbath was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing him were astonished, saying, Whence hath this man these things? and, What is the wisdom that is given unto this man, and what mean such mighty works wrought by his hands?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܢܲܓܵܪܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܕܝܘܿܣܹܐ ܘܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܘܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ؟ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ؟“ ܘܬܲܪܩܸܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Le-yleh aha nagara broona dmaryam, o akhoona dya'qoow o dyoose o deehoeda o dshim'oon? O le yna khatwateh lakha lkis lan?“ o tarqilee waw bee-eh.
ENG: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, and Joses, and Judas, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended in him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܓܵܘ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”layt nweea dla eeqara ila gaw mdeeta dganeh, o gaw khizmanoehy o gaw bayteh.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O la mṣe-leh 'abed wa tama oep khad khayla, ila moetiw-leh eedeh 'al khakma mree'e o boesmay-leh.
ENG: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.

ASY: ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܲܝܬܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ. ܘܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ.
TRL: O 'oejib-leh blaytayoeta dhaymanoetayhy. O bikhdara ywa gaw matwate dkhadirwane kad maloepe.
ENG: And he marveled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages teaching.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܵܬܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ، ܘܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܬܪܹܝ.
TRL: O qre-leh ltri'sar talmeedoehy, o yoebil-leh ilayhy shoelṭana 'al roekhate ṭame, o shoedray-leh trey trey.
ENG: And he called unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits;

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܩܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܛܪܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܡܵܠܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܒܟܸܣܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: O pqeeday-leh dla shaqlee mindee qa oerkha ila khoeṭra, la tarmala, o la lakhma, o la zoeza bkisyatayhy,
ENG: and he charged them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse;

ASY: ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܠܵܒ݂ܫܝܼ ܟ̰ܵܪ̈ܘܿܚܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܝܼ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܨܘܼܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: Ila dlawshee charookhe, o la lawshee tartey ṣoedrate.
ENG: but to go shod with sandals: and, said he, put not on two coats.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”laynee bayta d'awreetoon, tama hweymoen hal dpalṭeetoon min dhay doeka.
ENG: And he said unto them, Wheresoever ye enter into a house, there abide till ye depart thence.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܢܦܘܿܨܘܼܢ ܠܥܲܦܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O man dla qabil lawkhoon o la shame' ilawkhoon, npooṣoen l'apra min aqlatawkhoon lsahdoetayhy eeman dpalṭeetoon min tama.
ENG: And whatsoever place shall not receive you, and they hear you not, as ye go forth thence, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony unto them.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon o moekriz-lhoon tyawoeta lnashe.
ENG: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܸܫܚܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Raba shede poeliṭ-lhoon, o raba mree'e msheekh-lhoon bmishkha, o boesmay-lhoon.
ENG: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܪܝܼܣܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: Kad shmee' leh heroodis malka boet eeshoo', sabab preesa ywa shimeh, meereh, ”aha yookhanan ma'mdana-yleh, qeema min gaw meete. Boet aha khayle goere pyasha yna 'weede bee-eh.“
ENG: And king Herod heard thereof; for his name had become known: and he said, John the Baptist is risen from the dead, and therefore do these powers work in him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena khene amree waw deleea-yleh, o khene dnweea-yleh, maykh khad min nwee-e qamaye.
ENG: But others said, It is Elijah. And others said, It is a prophet, even as one of the prophets.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܡ ܠܝܼ ܪܹܫܹܗ، ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Eena kad shmee' leh heroodis meereh, ”aha yookhanan eeleh, haw dana preem-lee resheh, qeema-yleh.“
ENG: But Herod, when he heard thereof, said, John, whom I beheaded, he is risen.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܕܸܪܝܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܕܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ.
TRL: Sabab heroodis bganeh shoedra ywa o dweeqeh yookhanan o diryeh gaw beyt aseere boet heroodeea bakhta dpeeleepoos akhoonoehy, dgweeroeha ywa heroodis.
ENG: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife: for he had married her.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܓܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Sabab ke amer wa yookhanan lheroodis, ”le-ylaha qanoonayta iloekh dgawret bakhta dakhoonoekh.“
ENG: For John said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.

ASY: ܘܗܹܪܘܿܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܒܵܥܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܩܵܛܠܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: O heroodeea dweeqta ywa karba bliboeha ileh, o ba'ya wa dqaṭla wa-leh, eena le maṣya wa,
ENG: And Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him; and she could not;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܟܹܐ ܙܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܘܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܢܵܛܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ. ܘܟܲܕ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab heroodis ke zade' wa min yookhanan, bhay dke yade' wa dnasha zadeeqa o qadeesha ywa, o ke naṭer wa-leh. O kad shame' wa-leh, le yade' wa moodee 'abed wa, eena bkhadoeta ke shame' wa-leh.
ENG: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous man and a holy, and kept him safe. And when he heard him, he was much perplexed; and he heard him gladly.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܚܘܿܡܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܝܲܠܕܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܸܫܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܘܠܪ̈ܲܒܲܝ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Eena mṭe-laha 'dana lakhoomta byawma dbeyt yalda dheroodis eeman d'weed-leh heroodis mishtoeta lgoeranoehy o lrabay alpe dkhaylawate o lgoerane dgleela.
ENG: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, and the high captains, and the chief men of Galilee;

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܝܼܵܐ ܘܪܩܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܫܦܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܘܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܠܒܪܵܬܵܐ، ”ܛܠܘܿܒ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: O 'weeraha brata dheroodeea o rqeed-laha, o shpeeraha lheroodis o lanee dteebe ywaw 'ameh. O meereh malka lbrata, ”ṭloob minee mindee dbasma lakhy, o ana bit yabenakhy.“
ENG: and when the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and them that sat at meat with him; and the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give it thee.

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܲܬܝ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܟ݂ܝ، ܗܲܠ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܝܼ.“
TRL: O me-leh iloeha, ”mindee dṭalbaty minee bit yabenakhy, hal palga dmalkoetee.“
ENG: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܛܵܠܒܵܢ؟“ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇، ”ܛܠܘܿܒܝ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O hay pleeṭ-laha o boeqiraha min yimoeha, ”moodee ṭalban?“ o meeraha iloeha yimoeha, ”ṭlooby resha dyookhanan ma'mdana.“
ENG: And she went out, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܵܗ̇، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܒܵܥܝܵܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O har bhay 'dana 'weeraha bjaldoeta lkis malka o ṭleeb-laha, bemara, ”ba'yan adeea dyabet-lee gaw mana resha dyookhanan ma'mdana.“
ENG: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou forthwith give me in a charger the head of John the Baptist.

ASY: ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܘܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܦܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Psheem-leh malka raba, eena boet mawmate dme-leh o boet anee dteebe ywaw 'ameh lsoepra, la b'e-leh dmakhpil wa.
ENG: And the king was exceeding sorry; but for the sake of his oaths, and of them that sat at meat, he would not reject her.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ. ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܦܪܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana shoedireh naṭoora o pqeed-leh ileh dmayte wa lresha dyookhanan. zeel-leh haw o preem-leh resha dyookhanan gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: And straightway the king sent forth a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring his head: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܪܵܬܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O moete-leh resheh gaw mana o yoebil-leh lbrata, o hay yoebil-laha lyimoeha.
ENG: and brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel; and the damsel gave it to her mother.

ASY: ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܠܲܕܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: O shmee' lhoon talmeedoehy, te-lhoon o shqeel-lhoon lshladeh o moetwa-lhoon gaw beyt qwoera.
ENG: And when his disciples heard thereof, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

ASY: ܘܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O jmee' lhoon shleekhe lkis eeshoo' o moedi' lhoon ileh kl mindee d'weed-lhoon o moelip-lhoon.
ENG: And the apostles gather themselves together unto Jesus; and they told him all things, whatsoever they had done, and whatsoever they had taught.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܢ ܘܡܲܢܝܸܚܘܼܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ،“ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܘܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: O haw meereh ilayhy, ”teymoen azakh lkhda doeka gaw bareea bnawshan o manyikhoen khacha,“ sabab eet waw raba bezala o betaya, o layt waw-lhoon 'dana oep la lekhala.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while. For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܲܡܸܪ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon bgamee ldoeka moeshamir bnawshayhy.
ENG: And they went away in the boat to a desert place apart.

ASY: ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ، ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O khizyay-lhoon raba nashe kad bezala, dee'ay-lhoon, o rkheeṭ-lhoon ltama min klayhy mdeenate, o mṭe-lhoon min qam dee-ayhy.
ENG: And the people saw them going, and many knew them, and they ran there together on foot from all the cities, and outwent them.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܕܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ. ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min gamee o khze-leh lkinsha goera o roekhim-leh 'alayhy, sabab bidmaya ywaw l'irbe dla ra'ya. O shoere-leh lmaloepay raba mindeeane.
ENG: And he came forth and saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܠܸܓܢܵܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Kad qoerbineh yawma lignaya, te-lhoon lkis-leh talmeedoehy o meerhoon ileh, ”doeka bareea-ylaha, o 'dana 'weerta-ylaha.
ENG: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, The place is desert, and the day is now far spent:

ASY: ܫܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܙܘܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܘܠܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܵܒ݂ܢܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.“
TRL: Shree lkinsha dazee lzoemane dkhadirwane o lmatwate o zawnee-lhoon mindee lekhala.“
ENG: send them away, that they may go into the country and villages round about, and buy themselves somewhat to eat.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܘܙܵܒ݂ܢܲܚ ܒܬܪܲܝܡܵܐܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ؟“
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”haloen akhtoon ilayhy mindee lekhala.“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”azakh o zawnakh btrayma deenare mekhoelta o yabakh-lhoon dakhlee?“
ENG: But he answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܟܡܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“ ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”zemoen o khzeymoen kma lakhme eet lawkhoon.“ o eeman dkhze-lhoon, meerhoon ileh, ”eet lan khamsha lakhme o tartey noene.“
ENG: And he saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.

ASY: ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܣܝܼܥܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܸܠܵܐ ܩܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: Pqeeday-leh eeshoo' dmatwee lnashe bsee'ate 'al gila qeena.
ENG: And he commanded them that all should sit down by companies upon the green grass.

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܥܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܘܕܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܝܼ.
TRL: O teew-lhoon bsee'ate dima ima, o dkhamshee khamshee.
ENG: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ. ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܠܝܼܥܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh anee khamsha lakhme o tartey noene, o kheereh bshmaya, boerikh-leh, o qṣe-leh lakhme, o yoebil-leh ltalmeedoehy dmatwee qam kinsha. O oep lanee tartey noene, plee'ay-leh lklayhy.
ENG: And he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake the loaves; and he gave to the disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.

ASY: ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: kheel-lhoon klayhy o swee' lhoon.
ENG: And they did all eat, and were filled.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܕܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O shqeel-lhoon tri'sar qoepe milye min qiṭ'aṭe dlakhma o dnoene.
ENG: And they took up broken pieces, twelve basketfuls, and also of the fishes.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O anee dkheel-lhoon lakhme khamsha alpe gawre ywaw.
ENG: And they that ate the loaves were five thousand men.

ASY: ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܥܒܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܐܵܣܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܨܲܝܵܕܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܦܫܸܛ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: Har bhay 'dana moe'bid-leh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy dasqee waw lgamee o azee waw min qam dee-eh lhaw marza khena lbeyt ṣayada, kad haw mapshiṭ wa lkinsha.
ENG: And straightway he constrained his disciples to enter into the boat, and to go before him unto the other side to Bethsaida, while he himself sendeth the multitude away.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ.
TRL: O eeman dshoedray-leh, zeel-leh lṭoera lṣaloeye.
ENG: And after he had taken leave of them, he departed into the mountain to pray.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܸܪܙܵܐ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh ramsha, gamee bey palga dyama ywa, o haw bnawsheh 'al birza.
ENG: And when even was come, the boat was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.

ASY: ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ ܒܛܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܒܒܲܕܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O khizyay-leh eeshoo' janjoere bṭrayta dgamee sabab pawkha balqoewlayhy ywa. O bbadla darba' dlayle, te-leh lkis layhy bikhdara 'al yama o b'e-leh d'aber wa-lhoon.
ENG: And seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary unto them, about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking on the sea; and he would have passed by them:

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: O eeman danee khze-lhoon ileh bikhdara 'al yama, khsheew-lhoon dkhizwa ywa, o moeqwikh-lhoon,
ENG: but they, when they saw him walking on the sea, supposed that it was an apparition, and cried out:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܸܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Sabab klayhy khze-lhoon ileh, o zdee' lhoon. Har bhay 'dana hoemzim-leh 'amayhy eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”hweymoen libane, ana ywin, la zad'eetoon.“
ENG: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he straightway spake with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ، ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܪܵܒܵܐ،
TRL: O seeq-leh gaw gamee lkis layhy, o shle-leh pawkha, o 'oejib-lhoon bganayhy raba,
ENG: And he went up unto them into the boat; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ، ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Sabab la poerme-lhoon min anee lakhme, bhay dqishya ywa libayhy.
ENG: for they understood not concerning the loaves, but their heart was hardened.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܹܣܲܪ، ܘܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ.
TRL: O kad 'weerhoon lmarza khena, te-lhoon lar'a dgenesar, o greesh-lhoon lmarza.
ENG: And when they had crossed over, they came to the land unto Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O eeman dpleeṭ-lhoon min gamee, har bhay 'dana dee' lhoon ileh nashe,
ENG: And when they were come out of the boat, straightway the people knew him,

ASY: ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܝܬܘܼܝܹܐ ܠܡܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܫܘܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܟܠ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O rkheeṭ-lhoon bkleh haw atra, o shoere-lhoon lmaytoeye lmar'ane 'al shweeate, kl ayka dsham'ee waw dtama ywa.
ENG: and ran round about that whole region, and began to carry about on their beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.

ASY: ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܙܘܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܫܘܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܲܪܦܸܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܕܵܩܪܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܫܸܦܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ. ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܵܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܣܝܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: O ayka d'aber wa, gaw matwate, yan gaw mdeenate, yan gaw zoemane, ke matwee waw mree'e gaw shoeqe, o parpilee waw bee-eh ddaqree oep in dhawya bshipoela dlweeshteh. O klayhy anee ddaqree waw ke payshee waw bseeme.
ENG: And wheresoever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Haygah jmee' lhoon lkis eeshoo' preeshe o khakma sapre dte-lhoon min oorishlim.
ENG: And there are gathered together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which had come from Jerusalem,

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ، ܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܠܹܐ،
TRL: O khze-lhoon dkhakma min talmeedoehy bekhala lakhma beedate ṭame, la khoelile,
ENG: and had seen that some of his disciples ate their bread with defiled, that is, unwashen, hands.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܢ ܒܛܝܼܠܵܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܐ ܚܲܠܸܠܝܼ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܠܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab preeshe o klayhy yhoedaye in bṭeelaeet la khalilee eedatayhy le akhlee, hadkha ke hawee binṭara lsapyanoeta dkhwardiqne.
ENG: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands diligently, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders:

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܩܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܚܲܠܸܠܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ. ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܵܠܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܟܵܣܹ̈ܐ، ܘܬܲܠܸܡܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܵܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܚܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman datee min shoeqa, in la khalilee le akhlee. O raba sapyanoeyate khene qoebil-lhoon dnaṭree, aykh khalalta dkase, o talimyate, o mane dnkhasha.
ENG: and when they come from the marketplace, except they wash themselves, they eat not: and many other things there be, which they have received to hold, washings of cups, and pots, and brasen vessels.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܠܹܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh sapre o preeshe, ”qamoodee talmeedoekh le yna bi'wada aykh sapyanoeta dkhwardiqne, ila bekhala yna lakhma beedate la khoelile?“
ENG: And the Pharisees and the scribes ask him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with defiled hands?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܣܸܦܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ،
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ya mashpirane, ṣpayee noebe-leh boet deeawkhoon esha'ya, aykh deeleh kteewa: aha 'ama ke myaqir ilee bsipwateh, eena libayhy rikhqa-yleh minee,
ENG: And he said unto them, Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, But their heart is far from me.

ASY: ܘܣܪܝܼܩܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O sreeqaeet bisghada yna ilee, kad maloepe poeqdane dbnaynasha aykh malpanoeyate.
ENG: But in vain do they worship me, Teaching as their doctrines the precepts of men.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab shweeq lawkhoon poeqdane dalaha o dweeq lawkhoon bsapyanoeta dbnaynasha.
ENG: Ye leave the commandment of God, and hold fast the tradition of men.

ASY: ”ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܒܲܛܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܡܲܩܘܼܡܹܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O bemara ywa ilayhy, ṣpayee ke baṭleetoon poeqdane dalaha lmaqoeme sapyanoetawkhoon.
ENG: And he said unto them, Full well do ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your tradition.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂،‘ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡ̇ܢ ܕܨܲܥܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܝܸܡܵܐ، ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ.‘
TRL: ”Sabab moeshe meereh, ’myaqir lbaboekh o lyimoekh,‘ o oep meereh, ’man dṣa'ir lbaba yan lyima, mawta maet.‘
ENG: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, He that speaketh evil of father or mother, let him die the death:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܲܢ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܦܘܼܫܵܩܹܗ، ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،‘
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon ke amreetoon, ’in nasha amer lbaboehy yan lyimeh, mindee dhawe minee mawtrana iloekh, qoerban eeleh, poeshaqeh, mawhawta lalaha,‘
ENG: but ye say, If a man shall say to his father or his mother, That wherewith thou mightest have been profited by me is Corban, that is to say, Given to God;

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܲܢ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”khena le shawqeetoon d'abed mindee lbaboehy yan lyimeh.
ENG: ye no longer suffer him to do aught for his father or his mother;

ASY: ”ܒܲܛܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Baṭoele ytoon hemizman dalaha byad sapyanoeta dsoepe lawkhoon. O raba mindeeane khene aykh dane ke 'awdeetoon.“
ENG: making void the word of God by your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things ye do.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܦܲܪܡܹܝܡܘܼܢ،
TRL: Haygah qre-leh eeshoo' lkleh kinsha lkis-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”shmi'moen ilee klawkhoon o parmeymoen,
ENG: And he called to him the multitude again, and said unto them, Hear me all of you, and understand:

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܘܡܵܨܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܠܹܛ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Layt mindee lbadar min barnasha d'aber gaw paghreh o maṣe chaplin ileh, ila mindee dpaleṭ mineh, haw ke chaplineh.
ENG: there is nothing from without the man, that going into him can defile him: but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܫܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: ”Man deet-leh natyate lishma'a, shame'.“
ENG: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman d'weereh eeshoo' lbayta min lkis kinsha, boeqirhoon mineh talmeedoehy boet matla.
ENG: And when he was entered into the house from the multitude, his disciples asked of him the parable.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”oep akhtoon le ytoon parmoeye, le yad'eetoon dkl mindee dmin lbadar 'aber gaw paghra dbarnasha le maṣe chaplineh,
ENG: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Perceive ye not, that whatsoever from without goeth into the man, it cannot defile him;

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܹܗ، ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ؟ (ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ.)
TRL: ”Sabab le 'aber gaw libeh, ila gaw keseh, o ke paleṭ lbadar min paghreh? (hadkha 'weeday-leh dikhye klayhy mekhoelyate.)
ENG: because it goeth not into his heart, but into his belly, and goeth out into the draught? This he said, making all meats clean.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܠܹܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena mindee dpaleṭ min barnasha, haw ke chaplin ileh.
ENG: And he said, That which proceedeth out of the man, that defileth the man.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ: ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܸܛܠܵܐ،
TRL: ”Sabab min gaw liba dbnaynasha ke palṭee khoeshabe beeshe: gayaroeta, zanyoeta, genawoeta, qiṭla,
ENG: For from within, out of the heart of men, evil thoughts proceed, fornications, thefts, murders, adulteries,

ASY: ”ܛܲܡܲܥܟܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ، ܥܲܠܕܵܝܬܵܐ، ܫܪܝܼܚܘܼܬܵܐ، ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܓܘܼܕܵܦܵܐ، ܫܲܒ݂ܗܸܪܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܲܟ݂ܠܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭama'karoeta, beeshoeta, 'aldayta, shreekhoeta, 'ayna beeshta, goedapa, shawhiranoeta, sakhloeta.
ENG: covetings, wickednesses, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, railing, pride, foolishness:

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܵܐ ܘܟ̰ܲܦܠܸܢܝܼ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Klayhy ane beeshate ke palṭee min gawa o chaplinee lbarnasha.“
ENG: all these evil things proceed from within, and defile the man.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܨܘܿܪ ܘܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ. ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܸܫܝܵܐ.
TRL: O qeem-leh min tama eeshoo' o zeel-leh ltkhoema dṣoor o ṣaydoon. O 'weereh lkhad bayta, o le ba'e wa doep khad yade' wa, eena la mṣe-leh paesh wa ṭishya.
ENG: And from thence he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. And he entered into a house, and would have no man know it: and he could not be hid.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ، ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: Eena khda bakhta deet wa-laha brata z'oorta beeoeha roekha ṭame, kad shmee' laha boet dee-eh, har bhay 'dana te-laha o npeel-laha qam aqlateh.
ENG: But straightway a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܦܹܘܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܕܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ. ܘܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܦܲܠܸܛ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܪܵܬܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O hay bakhta noekhrayta ywa, min bnay pewneeqe dsoereea. O parpoele ywa bee-eh dpaliṭ wa sheda min bratoeha.
ENG: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. And she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܝ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܣܵܒ݂ܥܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܸܕܪܵܝܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܲܠܒܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh iloeha, ”shwooqy qamayta dsaw'ee bnoone, sabab le-ylaha ṣpayee lishqala lakhma dbnoone o lidrayeh qam kalbe.“
ENG: And he said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children’s bread and cast it to the dogs.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܲܠܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܸܪ̈ܬܘܼܚܹܐ ܕܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܵܬܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena hay joewib-laha o meeraha ileh, ”he maree, eena oep kalbe ke akhlee min pirtoekhe dnaplee min patoore dbnoone.“
ENG: But she answered and saith unto him, Yea, Lord: even the dogs under the table eat of the children’s crumbs.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܟ݂ܝ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܙܹܠ݇ܝ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܪܵܬܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”sabab meerakhy hadkha, zey, pleeṭ-leh sheda min bratakhy.“
ENG: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܗ̇، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O kad zeel-laha bakhta lbaytoeha, khze-laha bratoeha 'al shweeta, o sheda pleeṭa minoeha.
ENG: And she went away unto her house, and found the child laid upon the bed, and the devil gone out.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܨܘܿܪ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܵܐ ܕܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ ܠܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܓܵܘ ܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܥܸܣܪܲܬ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min tkhoema dṣoor, o te-leh min gawa dṣaydoon lyama dgleela, gaw tkhoema d'israt mdeenate.
ENG: And again he went out from the borders of Tyre, and came through Sidon unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the borders of Decapolis.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܪܫܵܐ ܘܦܸܠܬܸܟ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ.
TRL: O moete-lhoon lkis-leh khad deewa kharsha o piltik, o ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dmatiw wa 'aloehy eedeh.
ENG: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to lay his hand upon him.

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܨܸܒܥܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܒܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ، ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹܗ،
TRL: O poeliṭ-leh lbadar min kinsha bnawsheh, moetiw-leh ṣib'ateh bnatyateh, o bar dreeq-leh, dqeereh blishaneh,
ENG: And he took him aside from the multitude privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue;

ASY: ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܬܘܼܢܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܸܬ݂ܦܲܬܲܚ،“ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ”ܦܘܼܫ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: O kheereh bshmaya, toenikh-leh o meereh, ”it݂patakh,“ deelaha ”poesh pteekha.“
ENG: and looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܐܸܣܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܸܫܵܢܹܗ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܨܸܦܝܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana peesh-lhoon pteekhe natyateh, o peesh-leh shirya isoera dlishaneh, o hoemzim-leh bṣipyoeta.
ENG: And his ears were opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܕܥܝܼ ܠܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܦܵܩܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܲܚܒܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh eeshoo' lnashe dla mad'ee loep khad boet aha. Eena kma dhaw paqed wa-lhoon anee boesh zawda makhbiree waw.
ENG: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܚܲܪ̈ܫܹܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ، ܘܠܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ.“
TRL: Raba zawda 'ajbee waw, bemara, ”kl mindee ṭawa bi'wada-yleh, kharshe bi'wada-yleh dsham'ee, o lale dhamzimee.“
ENG: And they were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh even the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ. ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
