TRL: Banee yawmane mindrish kinsha raba ywa, o layt wa-lhoon mindee lekhala. Qre-leh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy,
ENG: In those days, when there was again a great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, he called unto him his disciples, and saith unto them,

ASY: ”ܪܲܚܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܠ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܘܼܪܩܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Rakhoeme ywin 'al daha kinsha, sabab ane tlata yawmane 'oerqil-lhoon lkis-lee, o layt-lhoon mindee dakhlee.
ENG: I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat:

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܫܲܕܪܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܟܦܝܼܢܹܐ ܠܒܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܒܸܬ ܫܲܡܫܸܡܝܼ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”In shadrinhoon kpeene lbatayhy, bit shamshimee boerkha, o khakma minayhy min doekane rikhqa tee-e yna.“
ENG: and if I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint in the way; and some of them are come from far.

ASY: ܘܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܡܲܣܒܸܥ ܒܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: O joewib-lhoon ileh talmeedoehy, ”min ayka maṣe nasha lakha gaw bareea masbi' blakhma lklayhy ane nashe?“
ENG: And his disciples answered him, Whence shall one be able to fill these men with bread here in a desert place?

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܡܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ.“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”kma lakhme eet lawkhoon?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”shaw'a.“
ENG: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܠܝܼܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ. ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܕܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh lkinsha leetawa 'al ar'a. O shqeel-leh lanee shaw'a lakhme, o boerikh-leh o qṣe-leh o yoebil-leh ltalmeedoehy, dmatwee waw. O anee moetiw-lhoon qam kinsha.
ENG: And he commandeth the multitude to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and having given thanks, he brake, and gave to his disciples, to set before them; and they set them before the multitude.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܪܟܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: O eet waw-lhoon khakma noene z'oore. Oep anee boerkay-leh, o pqeed-leh dmatwee waw-lhoon qam kinsha.
ENG: And they had a few small fishes: and having blessed them, he commanded to set these also before them.

ASY: ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: kheel-lhoon o swee' lhoon, o shqeel-lhoon qiṭ'aṭe dzeed-lhoon, shaw'a qoepe.
ENG: And they did eat, and were filled: and they took up, of broken pieces that remained over, seven baskets.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܘܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O anee dkheel-lhoon maykh arb'a alpe ywaw. O shoedray-leh.
ENG: And they were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܕܲܠܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah seeq-leh eeshoo' lgamee 'am talmeedoehy o te-leh latra ddalmanoeta.
ENG: And straightway he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ. ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon preeshe lkis-leh djarbee waw-leh. Shoere-lhoon bidrasha 'ameh, o ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dmakhze wa-lhoon neeshanqa min shmaya.
ENG: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܘܼܢܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ؟ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw toenikh-leh broekheh o meereh, ”qamoodee biṭlaba-ylaha neeshanqa aha sharbta? Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le paesh yoewa neeshanqa-laha sharbta.“
ENG: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.

ASY: ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: O shweeqay-leh o seeq-leh lgamee mindrish, o zeel-leh lhaw marza khena.
ENG: And he left them, and again entering into the boat departed to the other side.

ASY: ܡܘܼܢܫܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܸܪܕܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Moenshe-lhoon talmeede dshaqlee waw 'amayhy lakhma, o oep gaw gamee layt waw-lhoon lakhma shwooq min khda girdaya.
ENG: And they forgot to take bread; and they had not in the boat with them more than one loaf.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”khzeymoen, hweymoen hishyar min khmeera dpreeshe o dheroodis.“
ENG: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܩܝܼܠܹܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.
TRL: Eena anee khsheew-lhoon bganayhy dmeereh aha sabab le ywaw shqeele 'amayhy lakhma.
ENG: And they reasoned one with another, saying, We have no bread.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ، ܗܹܫ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh o meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee bikhshawa ytoon bganawkhoon dlakhma layt lawkhoon? Hesh le ytoon beeda'a o le ytoon parmoeye, hesh libawkhoon qishya-yleh?
ENG: And Jesus perceiving it saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? do ye not yet perceive, neither understand? have ye your heart hardened?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Eet lawkhoon 'ayne o le ytoon bikhzaya, eet lawkhoon natyate o le ytoon bishma'a. Le ytoon bidkhara?
ENG: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܨܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ، ܟܡܵܐ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ.“
TRL: ”Eeman dqṣe-lee anee khamsha lakhme qa khamsha alpe, kma qoepe dqiṭ'aṭe milye shqeel lawkhoon?“ joewib-lhoon, ”tri'sar.“
ENG: When I brake the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ، ܟܡܵܐ ܣܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O anee shaw'a lakhme qa arb'a alpe, kma sale milye min qiṭ'aṭe shqeel lawkhoon?“ joewib-lhoon, ”shaw'a.“
ENG: And when the seven among the four thousand, how many basketfuls of broken pieces took ye up? And they say unto him, Seven.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ؟“
TRL: Haygah meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee le ytoon parmoeye?“
ENG: And he said unto them, Do ye not yet understand?

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܨܲܝܵܕܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܕܵܩܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: te-lhoon lbeyt ṣayada, o moete-lhoon lkis-leh khad simya, o poerpil-lhoon ddaqer wa bee-eh.
ENG: And they come unto Bethsaida. And they bring to him a blind man, and beseech him to touch him.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܬܵܐ، ܘܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: Dweeq-leh beeda dhaw simya o poeliṭ-leh lbadar min mata, o reeq-leh 'al 'aynoehy, o moetiw-leh eedateh 'aloehy, o boeqireh mineh in bikhzaya ywa mindee.
ENG: And he took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village; and when he had spit on his eyes, and laid his hands upon him, he asked him, Seest thou aught?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ.“
TRL: O haw kheereh o meereh, ”bikhzaya ywin lnashe aykh eelane bikhdara.“
ENG: And he looked up, and said, I see men; for I behold them as trees, walking.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܨܸܦܝܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Mindrish moetiw-leh eeshoo' eedateh 'al 'aynoehy, o bseem-leh o kheereh o khze-leh kl mindee bṣipyoeta.
ENG: Then again he laid his hands upon his eyes; and he looked stedfastly, and was restored, and saw all things clearly.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܠܡܵܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܠܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ.“
TRL: O shoedireh ileh eeshoo' lbayteh o meereh, ”la 'awret lmata, o la amret loep khad.“
ENG: And he sent him away to his home, saying, Do not even enter into the village.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܘܸܢ؟“
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' 'am talmeedoehy lmatwate dqesarya dpeeleepoos, o boerkha boeqireh min talmeedoehy, ”moodee ke amree nashe boet deeee dana eewin?“
ENG: And Jesus went forth, and his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi: and in the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Who do men say that I am?

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Anee joewib-lhoon, ”khakma ke khashwee at eewit yookhanan ma'mdana, o khene ke amree eleea ywit, o khene khad min nwee-e.“
ENG: And they told him, saying, John the Baptist: and others, Elijah; but others, One of the prophets.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ، ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܘܸܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw boeqireh, ”eena akhtoon, manee bemara ytoon dana eewin?“ joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh ileh, ”at eewit msheekha, broona dalaha khaya.“
ENG: And he asked them, But who say ye that I am? Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: O pqeed-leh dlnasha la amree boet dee-eh.
ENG: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ. ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.
TRL: O shoere-leh eeshoo' madoe'e ltalmeedoehy dbroona dnasha wale-ylaha dqabil raba khasha o paesh moesleea min khwardiqne o min goerane dkahne o min sapre. Bit paesh qṭeela, o byawma dtlata bit qaem.
ENG: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, and the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.

ASY: ܘܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܢܟ݂ܘܼܣܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O galyaeet meereh aha hemizman ilayhy. Haygah shim'oon kepa loebil-leh ileh lkhad geba o shoere-leh lmankhoese ileh.
ENG: And he spake the saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܢܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܪܚܘܿܩ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw deereh o kheereh btalmeedoehy o moenkis-leh lshim'oon kepa o meereh ileh, ”rkhooq minee saṭana, sabab le ywit takhmoene boet moodee deeleh dalaha, ila dbarnasha.“
ENG: But he turning about, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and saith, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou mindest not the things of God, but the things of men.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܣܵܪܹܒ݂ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܫܵܩܹܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܗ، ܘܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ،
TRL: O qre-leh eeshoo' lkinsha 'am talmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy, ”man dba'e ate baree, sarew ganeh, o shaqel zqeepeh, o ate baree,
ENG: And he called unto him the multitude with his disciples, and said unto them, If any man would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇. ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܲܠܸܩ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: ”Sabab man dba'e pariq ganeh bit ṭaliq-laha. O man dṭaliq ganeh boet deeee o boet ewangaleeoon bit pariq-laha,
ENG: For whosoever would save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel’s shall save it.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܩܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇؟
TRL: ”Sabab moodee yoetrana eet lbarnasha in qane-laha klaha doenye eena ganeh ṭaliq-laha?
ENG: For what doth it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܒܵܕܵܠ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Yan moodee bit yabil barnasha mbadal dganeh?
ENG: For what should a man give in exchange for his life?

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܟܹܦ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܓܲܝܵܪܬܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܟܹܦ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܥܲܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Kl man dnakep beeee o bhemizmanee gaw aha sharbta khaṭayta o gayarta, oep broona dnasha bit nakep bee-eh eeman date bshoewkha dbaboehy 'am malakhoehy qadeeshe.“
ENG: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of man also shall be ashamed of him, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܬ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܵܝܬܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, eet nashe lakha dle maytee hal dkhazee malkoeta dalaha betaya bkhayla.“
ENG: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There be some here of them that stand by, which shall in no wise taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God come with power.

ASY: ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܡܘܼܐܣܩܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ. ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Bar ishta yawmane, loebil-leh eeshoo' 'ameh lshim'oon kepa o lya'qoow o lyookhanan, o moesqay-leh lṭoera rama bnawshayhy. O peesh-leh shoekhlipa qamayhy.
ENG: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and bringeth them up into a high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them:

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܒܪܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܚܘܸܪܵܗ̇ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܲܠܓܵܐ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܲܚܘܸܪܵܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܲܚܘܘܼܪܹܐ.
TRL: O moebriq-laha lweeshteh o moekhwiraha raba aykh talga, hada doep khad makhwirana gaw doenye le maṣe wa lmakhwoere.
ENG: and his garments became glistering, exceeding white; so as no fuller on earth can whiten them.

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O khze-lhoon moeshe o eleea hamzoeme 'am eeshoo'.
ENG: And there appeared unto them Elijah with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܬܠܵܬ ܡܛܲܠܠܹ̈ܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”rabee, ṣpayee-ylaha dpayshakh lakha, o 'awdakh tlat mṭalle, khda qatoekh, o khda qa moeshe, o khda qa eleea.“
ENG: And Peter answereth and saith to Jesus, Rabbi, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: La dee' leh moodee hamzoeme ywa, sabab klayhy gaw zdoe'ta ywaw.
ENG: For he wist not what to answer; for they became sore afraid.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܩܵܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ، ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ.“
TRL: O hwe-laha 'nana o 'weed-laha ṭilaneeta 'alayhy, o qala te-leh min 'nana, bemara, ”aha-yleh broonee moekhiba, ileh shmi'moen.“
ENG: And there came a cloud overshadowing them: and there came a voice out of the cloud, This is my beloved Son: hear ye him.

ASY: ܘܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܚܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O minshiltane kheerhoon talmeede, lnasha la khze-lhoon ila leeshoo' bnawsheh 'amayhy.
ENG: And suddenly looking round about, they saw no one any more, save Jesus only with themselves.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܠ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O kad biṣlaya ywaw min ṭoera, pqeeday-leh eeshoo' dlnasha la amree boet mindee dkhze-lhoon hal dqaem broona dnasha min gaw meete.
ENG: And as they were coming down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, save when the Son of man should have risen again from the dead.

ASY: ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: O dweeqa-lhoon aha hemizman gaw libayhy. Eena baqree waw khad min haw khena o amree waw: moodee-ylaha ma'naya dqaem min gaw meete?
ENG: And they kept the saying, questioning among themselves what the rising again from the dead should mean.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh, bemara, ”qamoodee ke amree sapre deleea wale-ylaha date qamayta?“
ENG: And they asked him, saying, The scribes say that Elijah must first come.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܕܸܪ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܵܐ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”eleea bshareeroeta betaya-yleh qamayta dhadir kl mindee. Dakhee peesha-yleh kteewa boet broona dnasha draba bit qabil khasha o bit paesh moesleea?
ENG: And he said unto them, Elijah indeed cometh first, and restoreth all things: and how is it written of the Son of man, that he should suffer many things and be set at nought?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, doep eleea te-leh o 'weed-lhoon bee-eh kl mindee dbseem-laha-lhoon, dakhee deeleh kteewa boet dee-eh.“
ENG: But I say unto you, that Elijah is come, and they have also done unto him whatsoever they listed, even as it is written of him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Kad te-lhoon lkis talmeedoehy, khze-lhoon kinsha raba khadirwanayhy, o sapre bidrasha 'amayhy.
ENG: And when they came to the disciples, they saw a great multitude about them, and scribes questioning with them.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana, kleh kinsha kad khze-lhoon ileh, 'oejib-lhoon, o rkheeṭ-lhoon o dre-lhoon shlama ileh.
ENG: And straightway all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ؟“
TRL: O boeqireh min sapre, bemara, ”qamoodee bidrasha ytoon 'amayhy?“
ENG: And he asked them, What question ye with them?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܵܠܹܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh khad min kinsha o meereh ileh, ”malpana, moete-lee broonee lkis-loekh sabab eet bee-eh roekha lale,
ENG: And one of the multitude answered him, Master, I brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܪܲܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܓܲܒܓܸܒ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ، ܘܚܲܪܚܸܟ̰ܝܼ ܟܹܟܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܟܹܐ ܒܵܪܹܙ. ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”O eeman dke dawqa-leh, ke rapya-leh lar'a, o ke gabgib poemeh, o kharkhichee kekoehy, o ke barez. Ṭleeb-lee min talmeedoekh dpalṭee-laha roekha mineh, eena la mṣe-lhoon.“
ENG: and wheresoever it taketh him, it dasheth him down: and he foameth, and grindeth his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast it out; and they were not able.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܝܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܸܢܬܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܗܲܠ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܢܹܢ ܝܘܼܩܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”ya sharbta la mhoeminta, hal eeman bit haweyn 'amawkhoon, o hal eeman bit ṭa'nen yoeqrawkhoon? Mayteymoen-leh lkis-lee.“
ENG: And he answereth them and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you? bring him unto me.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܥܲܪܒܘܼܛܹܐ، ܘܓܘܼܒܓܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ.
TRL: O moete-lhoon lkis-leh, o kad khze-laha ileh roekha, roepe-laha ileh, o npeel-leh 'al ar'a 'arboeṭe, o goebgib-leh poemeh.
ENG: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him grievously; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: Boeqireh eeshoo' min baboehy, ”aha kma 'dana hadkha-yleh?“ joewib-leh baboehy, bemara, ”ha min yaloeteh.
ENG: And he asked his father, How long time is it since this hath come unto him? And he said, From a child.

ASY: ”ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܩܵܛܠܵܐ ܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܗܲܝܸܪܲܢ ܘܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܲܢ.“
TRL: ”O raba gahe ke darya-leh bnoera o bmeea dqaṭla-leh. Eena in maṣeyt 'awdet mindee, hayiran o rakhim 'alan.“
ENG: And oft-times it hath cast him both into the fire and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do anything, have compassion on us, and help us.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܗܲܡܸܢܸܬ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”in maṣeyt haminit, kl mindee bit hawe lman dhamin.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, If thou canst! All things are possible to him that believeth.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܗܲܝܸܪ ܠܒܵܨܘܿܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܝܼ.“
TRL: O har bhay 'dana moeqwikh-leh baba dyala o meereh, ”hamoene ywin, hayir lbaṣooroeta dhaymanoetee.“
ENG: Straightway the father of the child cried out, and said, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܸܪܚܵܛܵܐ ܘܒܸܓ̰ܡܵܥܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܚܲܪܫܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܠܹܐ، ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܦܠܘܿܛܝ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܲܬܝ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: Kad khze-leh eeshoo' lkinsha birkhaṭa o bijma'a lkis-leh, njeew-leh bhay roekha ṭame o meereh iloeha, ”roekha kharshta o lale, bipqada ywin ilakhy, plooṭy mineh o khena la 'awraty bee-eh.“
ENG: And when Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying unto him, Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I command thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Moeqwikh-laha hay roekha raba, roepe-laha ileh o pleeṭ-laha mineh, o hwe-leh aykh meeta haw yala, hadkha draba meerhoon dmeeta-yleh.
ENG: And having cried out, and torn him much, he came out: and the child became as one dead; insomuch that the more part said, He is dead.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dweeq-leh beedeh o moeqim-leh.
ENG: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܦܲܠܛܲܚ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eeman d'weereh eeshoo' lbayta, boeqirhoon mineh talmeedoehy bnawshayhy, ”qamoodee la mṣe lan akhnan dpalṭakh mineh sheda?“
ENG: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, saying, We could not cast it out.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܸܢܣܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܨܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”aha ginsa le paleṭ, ila bṣawma o bṣloota.“
ENG: And he said unto them, This kind can come out by nothing, save by prayer.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O kad pleeṭ-lhoon min tama, 'weerhoon min gaw gleela o la b'e-leh dnasha yade' wa.
ENG: And they went forth from thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know it.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ، ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.“
TRL: Sabab maloepe ywa ltalmeede, meereh ilayhy, ”broona dnasha bit paesh soepya beedate dbnaynasha o bit qaṭlee-leh. O min bar dpaesh qṭeela, byawma dtlata bit qaem.“
ENG: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered up into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and when he is killed, after three days he shall rise again.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ.
TRL: Eena anee la poerme-lhoon moodee bemara ywa, o zdee' lhoon dbaqree waw-leh zawda.
ENG: But they understood not the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܘܟܲܕ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: O te-lhoon lkparnakhoom, o kad gaw bayta ywa, boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”moodee bidrasha ytoon waw boerkha?“
ENG: And they came to Capernaum: and when he was in the house he asked them, What were ye reasoning in the way?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena anee la joewib-lhoon, sabab bidrasha ywaw boerkha khad 'am haw khena dmanee-yleh goera gawayhy.
ENG: But they held their peace: for they had disputed one with another in the way, who was the greatest.

ASY: ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: teew-leh eeshoo', o qre-leh ltri'sar talmeede o meereh ilayhy, ”man dba'e hawe qamaya, hawe kharaya dklayhy o 'awdana dkhilmat lklayhy.“
ENG: And he sat down, and called the twelve; and he saith unto them, If any man would be first, he shall be last of all, and minister of all.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܘܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܕܪ̈ܲܥܢܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: O shqeel-leh khad yala o moekle-leh bey palga. O min bar dshqeel-leh gaw dra'nanoehy, meereh ilayhy,
ENG: And he took a little child, and set him in the midst of them: and taking him in his arms, he said unto them,

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ، ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܸܠ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Kl man dqabil khad yala aykh aha bshimee, ilee qaboele-yleh, o man dilee qabil, le-yleh ilee qaboele ila lman dshoedrineh.“
ENG: Whosoever shall receive one of such little children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever receiveth me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܬܒܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: meereh ileh yookhanan, ”rabee, khze lan khad nasha paloeṭe shede bshimoekh, eena moekle lan ileh sabab la tbee' leh ilan.“
ENG: John said unto him, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name: and we forbade him, because he followed not us.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”la makleytoon-leh, sabab layt khad d'abed doemara bshimee o har bhay 'dana hamzim beeshta 'alee.
ENG: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܢ ܠܓܹܒܲܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Man dle-yleh ldalqoewlan lgeban eeleh.
ENG: For he that is not against us is for us.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܫܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܹܩ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kl man dmashte lawkhoon kasa dmeea bshimee sabab eetoon dmsheekha, troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon le ṭaleq poer'aneh.
ENG: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink, because ye are Christ’s, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܚܛܹܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܸܠܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܐܸܪܚܹܐ ܒܩܕܵܠܹܗ ܘܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kl man dmakhṭe lkhad min ane z'oore dke haminee beeee, ṣpayee ywa ileh dhawe wa tilya kepa dirkhe bqdaleh o hawe wa dirya byama.
ENG: And whosoever shall cause one of these little ones that believe on me to stumble, it were better for him if a great millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܚܛܝܼܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܦܪܘܿܡ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܫܸܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܬ ܠܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”In eedoekh makhṭeea-loekh, proom-laha, sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh dshila 'awret lkhaye min dhawe-loekh tartey eedate o azet lgehana.
ENG: And if thy hand cause thee to stumble, cut it off: it is good for thee to enter into life maimed, rather than having thy two hands to go into hell, into the unquenchable fire.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܬܸܘܸܠܥܬܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܢܘܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܵܡܹܥ.
TRL: ”Ayka dtiwil'toeha le mayta o noeroeha le chame'.
ENG: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܲܩܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܚܛܝܼܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܦܪܘܿܡ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in aqloekh makhṭeea-loekh, proom-laha, sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh dshpeela 'awret lkhaye min dhawe-loekh tartey aqlate o payshet roepya bgehana.
ENG: And if thy foot cause thee to stumble, cut it off: it is good for thee to enter into life halt, rather than having thy two feet to be cast into hell.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܬܸܘܸܠܥܬܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܢܘܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܵܡܹܥ.
TRL: ”Ayka dtiwil'toeha le mayta o noeroeha le chame'.
ENG: ‘where their worm does not die and the fire is not quenched.’

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܚܛܝܼܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܚܪܘܿܛ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in 'aynoekh makhṭeea-loekh, khrooṭ-laha, sabab boesh ṣpayee-ylaha iloekh bkhda 'ayna 'awret lmalkoeta dalaha o la dhawe-loekh tartey 'ayne o payshet roepya bnoera dgehana.
ENG: And if thine eye cause thee to stumble, cast it out: it is good for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell;

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܬܸܘܸܠܥܬܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܢܘܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܵܡܹܥ.
TRL: ”Ayka dtiwil'toeha le mayta o noeroeha le chame'.
ENG: ‘where their worm does not die and the fire is not quenched.’

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܡܠܸܚܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܒܡܸܠܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܡܠܸܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab kl khad bnoera ke paesh moemlikha, o kl diwkha bmilkha ke paesh moemlikha.
ENG: For every one shall be salted with fire.

ASY: ”ܡܸܠܚܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܸܠܚܵܐ ܦܵܝܟܵܐ، ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܡܠܸܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܗ̇؟ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܚܵܐ، ܘܚܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Milkha ṣpayee-ylaha, eena in milkha payka, bmoodee bit mamlikheetoon-laha? Hawya gawawkhoon milkha, o kheymoen bshlama khad 'am haw khena.“
ENG: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost its saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace one with another.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܕܲܬ.
TRL: Qeem-leh min tama eeshoo' o te-leh ltkhoema deehoed, lmarza khena dyoordnan, o zeel-lhoon lkis-leh kinshe raba, o malip wa-lhoon mindrish aykh deet wa-leh 'adat.
ENG: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the borders of Judaea and beyond Jordan: and multitudes come together unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.

ASY: ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܠܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܗ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ.
TRL: Qoerbinhoon lkis-leh preeshe ljaroebeh, o boeqirhoon mineh in qanoonayta-ylaha dnasha rape bakhteh.
ENG: And there came unto him Pharisees, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”moodee pqeed-leh ilawkhoon moeshe?“
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܟܵܬܒܲܚ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܠܵܠܵܐ ܘܪܲܦܲܚ.“
TRL: O anee joewib-lhoon, ”moeshe yoebil-leh psasa ilan dkatbakh ktawa ddoelala o rapakh.“
ENG: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', bemara, ”moeshe boet qishyoeta dlibawkhoon kteew-leh ilawkhoon aha poeqdana.
ENG: But Jesus said unto them, For your hardness of heart he wrote you this commandment.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܙܵܐ ܘܢܸܩܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena min shoeraya dbreeta oerza o niqwa biryay-leh Alaha.
ENG: But from the beginning of the creation, Male and female made he them.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܒܸܬ ܬܵܒܹܥ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Boet aha bit shabeq gawra lbaboehy o lyimeh o bit tabe' lbakhteh.
ENG: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife;

ASY: ”ܘܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O tirwayhy bit hawee khad paghra, sabab khena le yna trey ila khad paghra yna.
ENG: and the twain shall become one flesh: so that they are no more twain, but one flesh.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܙܘܼܘܸܓ ܠܹܗ، ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܪܹܫ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha mindee dalaha zoewig-leh, barnasha la paresh-leh.“
ENG: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman deewaw gaw bayta, boeqirhoon talmeedoehy mineh boet aha.
ENG: And in the house the disciples asked him again of this matter.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܘܓܵܒܹܪ ܚܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”kl man drape bakhteh o gaber khda kheta, bi'wada-yleh gayaroeta.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her:

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܪܲܦܝܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܘܓܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O in bakhta rapya gawroeha o gawra khad khena bi'wada-ylaha gayaroeta.“
ENG: and if she herself shall put away her husband, and marry another, she committeth adultery.

ASY: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܝܬܘܼܝܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Moete-lhoon nashe yale z'oore lkis eeshoo' dmatiw wa eedeh 'alayhy, eena talmeedoehy njeew-lhoon banee dmaytoeyay ywaw.
ENG: And they brought unto him little children, that he should touch them: and the disciples rebuked them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh eeshoo' talmeedoehy hadkha bi'wada, kreeb-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”shwooqoen yale z'oore atee lkis-lee o la makleytoon-lhoon, sabab dee-ayhy-ylaha malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me; forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl man dla qabil malkoeta dalaha maykh khad yala z'oora dke qabil-laha, le 'aber gawoeha.“
ENG: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall in no wise enter therein.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܕܪ̈ܲܥܢܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܪܟܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O shqeelay-leh gaw dra'nanoehy o moetiw-leh eedeh 'alayhy o boerkay-leh.
ENG: And he took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands upon them.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܕܝܵܪܬܹܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ؟“
TRL: Kad bezala ywa eeshoo' boerkha, rkheeṭ-leh khad nasha o breek-leh qamoehy o boeqireh mineh, ”malpana ṭawa, moodee 'awden dyarten khaye dl'alam?“
ENG: And as he was going forth into the way, there ran one to him, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ؟ ܠܲܝܬ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”qamoodee biqrayee ywit ṭawa? Layt ṭawa ila Alaha akhchee.
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good save one, even God.

ASY: ”ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܢܹܝܬ، ܠܵܐ ܓܵܢܒܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܩܵܛܠܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܛܵܠܡܹܬ، ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Poeqdane ke yad'et, la zaneyt, la ganbet, la qaṭlet, la yabet sahdoeta ddoegla, la ṭalmet, myaqir lbaboekh o lyimoekh.“
ENG: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not kill, Do not commit adultery, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honour thy father and mother.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܛܝܼܪܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܝܼ.“
TRL: Haw joewib-leh o meereh ileh, ”malpana, ane klayhy nṭeeray ywin min yaloetee.“
ENG: And he said unto him, Master, all these things have I observed from my youth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂. ܙܹܠ݇ ܙܲܒܸܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܫܩܘܿܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܘܼܟ݂، ܘܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Eena kheereh bee-eh eeshoo', o moekhib-leh, o meereh ileh, ”khad mindee baṣoora-yleh iloekh. Ze zabin kl mindee deet-loekh o hal-leh lmiskene, o bit hawe-loekh seemta bshmaya, o shqool zqeepoekh, o ta baree.“
ENG: And Jesus looking upon him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܫܵܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܘܼܬܪܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw psheem-leh baha hemizman, o zeel-leh khashana sabab eet wa-leh 'oetra raba.
ENG: But his countenance fell at the saying, and he went away sorrowful: for he was one that had great possessions.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܡܵܐ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܘܼܬܪܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah kheereh eeshoo' btalmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy, ”kma 'asqa-ylaha lanee deet-lhoon 'oetra d'awree lmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ. ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܢܘܿܢܝܼ̈، ܟܡܵܐ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܥܘܼܬܪܲܝܗܝ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eena talmeede 'oejib-lhoon 'al hemizmanoehy. Joewib-leh eeshoo' mindrish o meereh ilayhy, ”bnoonee, kma 'asqa-ylaha lanee deena bhewee 'al 'oetrayhy d'awree lmalkoeta dalaha.
ENG: And the disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܝܼܛܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܓܘܼܡܠܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܒܢܸܩܒܵܐ ܕܚܡܵܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Boesh psheeṭta-ylaha lgoemla d'awra bniqba dkhmaṭa min d'ateera 'aber lmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܲܣ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܩ؟“
TRL: O talmeede boesh zawda 'oejib-lhoon o amree waw beylayhy, ”bas manee maṣe pareq?“
ENG: And they were astonished exceedingly, saying unto him, Then who can be saved?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' kheereh bee-ayhy o meereh, ”barnasha le maṣe 'abed aha, eena Alaha maṣe 'abed kl mindee.“
ENG: Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for all things are possible with God.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh ileh, ”ha akhnan shweeq lan kl mindee o te lan baroekh.“
ENG: Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܫܵܒܹܩ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܝܸܡܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܝܲܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ،
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl nasha dshabeq bayta, yan akhoonwate yan khatwate, yan baba yan yima, yan bakhta yan bnoone, yan khaqlane, boet deeee o boet ewangaleeoon,
ENG: Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or lands, for my sake, and for the gospel’s sake,

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܝܸܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܥܲܡ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ، ܘܒܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”Bit qabil khad bima adeea baha zawna, bate o akhoonwate o khatwate, o yimate o bnoone, o khaqlane, 'am rdoepya, o bzawna date khaye dl'alam.
ENG: but he shall receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.

ASY: ”ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Raba deena qamaye bit hawee kharaye, o kharaye bit hawee qamaye.“
ENG: But many that are first shall be last; and the last first.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ، ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܙܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ. ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܠܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܩܲܘܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Kad besaqa ywaw boerkha loorishlim, o eeshoo' bezala ywa qamayhy, 'ajbee waw talmeedoehy, o zad'ee waw anee dazee waw bareh. O loebil-leh ltri'sar lkhad geba o shoere-leh lemara ilayhy mindee dhdeera ywa dqawim wa ileh.
ENG: And they were in the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going before them: and they were amazed; and they that followed were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were to happen unto him,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: meereh, ”ha besaqa ywakh loorishlim, o broona dnasha bit paesh soepya lgoerane dkahne o lsapre, o bit daynee-leh lmawta o bit sapee-leh limwate,
ENG: saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests and the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him unto the Gentiles:

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܵܝܩܝܼ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ. ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.“
TRL: ”O anee bit maskhiree bee-eh o makhee-leh bshawṭe o rayqee 'aloehy o qaṭlee-leh. O byawma dtlata bit qaem.“
ENG: and they shall mock him, and shall spit upon him, and shall scourge him, and shall kill him; and after three days he shall rise again.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܲܚ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O te-lhoon lkis-leh ya'qoow o yookhanan, bnoone dzawday, o meerhoon ileh, ”malpana, ba'akh d'awdet ilan kl mindee dṭalbakh minoekh.“
ENG: And there come near unto him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying unto him, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall ask of thee.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”moodee ba'eytoon d'awden ilawkhoon?“
ENG: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܢ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܘܼܟ݂، ܒܚܸܩܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh, ”ba'akh dkhad minan yatew min yameenoekh o khad min simaloekh, bkhiqroekh.“
ENG: And they said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and one on thy left hand, in thy glory.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ. ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܵܬܹܝܢܹܗ، ܘܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ، ܥܵܡܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: Eena haw joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”le ytoon beeda'a moodee biṭlaba ytoon. Maṣeytoon shateytoon kasa dana shateyneh, o ma'moodeeta dbeeoeha payshen 'meeda, 'amdeetoon?“
ENG: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink the cup that I drink? or to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܵܣܵܐ ܕܫܵܬܹܝܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܥܵܡܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ،
TRL: Anee joewib-lhoon ileh, ”he, ke maṣakh.“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”kasa dshateyneh bit shateytoon, o ma'moodeeta dbeeoeha payshen 'meeda, bit 'amdeetoon,
ENG: And they said unto him, We are able. And Jesus said unto them, The cup that I drink ye shall drink; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܝܼ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܗ̇، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܘܼܕܸܪܬܵܐ ܩܵܬܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Eena tawta min yameenee o min simalee le-ylaha dana yabenaha, ila bit paysha yoebilta lanee dpeeshta-ylaha hoedirta qatayhy.“
ENG: but to sit on my right hand or on my left hand is not mine to give: but it is for them for whom it hath been prepared.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon 'isra talmeede khene, kreeb-lhoon 'al ya'qoow o yookhanan.
ENG: And when the ten heard it, they began to be moved with indignation concerning James and John.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܡܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' qiryay-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”ke yad'eetoon anee dkhashwee dgoerane dimwate yna ke 'awdee maroeta, o goeranayhy ke 'awdee shoelṭana 'alayhy?
ENG: And Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them; and their great ones exercise authority over them.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”Eena aha mindee la hawe gawawkhoon. Man dba'e hawe goera gawawkhoon, hawe 'awdana dkhilmat ilawkhoon,
ENG: But it is not so among you: but whosoever would become great among you, shall be your minister:

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O man dba'e minawkhoon hawe qamaya, hawe 'awda dklayhy.
ENG: and whosoever would be first among you, shall be servant of all.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab oep broona dnasha la te-leh dnashe 'awdee-leh khilmat, ila dhaw 'abed khilmat lnashe o dyabil ganeh diwkha dpoerqana min geba draba.“
ENG: For verily the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܛܝܼܡܲܝ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܛܝܼܡܲܝ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܘܒܸܓܒ݂ܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon leereekhoo. O eeman dpleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min eereekhoo 'am talmeedoehy o kinsha raba, khad simya shimeh ṭeemay, broona dṭeemay, teewa ywa 'al marza doerkha o bigwaya.
ENG: And they come to Jericho: and as he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the way side.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh deeshoo' naṣraya ywa, shoere-leh lmaqwoekhe o lemara, ”broona ddaweed, rakhim 'alee.“
ENG: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܫܵܬܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Raba nashe njeew-lhoon bee-eh dshateq wa, eena haw boesh zawda moeqwikh-leh, ”broona ddaweed, rakhim 'alee.“
ENG: And many rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried out the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.

ASY: ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ. ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܘܝܼ ܠܸܒܵܢܵܐ، ܩܘܼܡ، ܒܸܩܪܵܝܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Kle-leh eeshoo' o pqeed-leh dmaytee-leh lkis-leh. O qre-lhoon lhaw simya o meerhoon ileh, ”hwee libana, qoem, biqrayoekh eeleh.“
ENG: And Jesus stood still, and said, Call ye him. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good cheer: rise, he calleth thee.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O haw simya roepya-leh lweeshteh o qeem-leh o zeel-leh lkis eeshoo'.
ENG: And he, casting away his garment, sprang up, and came to Jesus.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܢ.“
TRL: Boeqireh mineh eeshoo', ”moodee ba'eyt d'awden iloekh?“ joewib-leh haw simya, bemara, ”rabee, ba'eyn dkhazeyn.“
ENG: And Jesus answered him, and said, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? And the blind man said unto him, Rabboni, that I may receive my sight.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܩܲܡ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ze, haymanoetoekh qam basma-loekh.“ o har bhay 'dana khze-leh o zeel-leh bareh boerkha.
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole. And straightway he received his sight, and followed him in the way.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܥܲܠ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܦܵܓܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܠܟܸܣ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: O kad qoerbinhoon loorishlim, 'al geba dbeyt page o beyt 'anya, lkis ṭoera dzayte, shoedireh eeshoo' trey min talmeedoehy,
ENG: And when they draw nigh unto Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth two of his disciples,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܗܹܫ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܟܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ. ܫܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen-laha mata deelaha lbalqoewlawkhoon, o eeman d'awreetoon gawoeha bit machkheetoon ja'sha seera dhesh nasha le-yleh rkeewa 'aloehy. Shreymoen o mayteymoen-leh.
ENG: and saith unto them, Go your way into the village that is over against you: and straightway as ye enter into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat; loose him, and bring him.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܲܩܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟‘ ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.‘“
TRL: ”O in nasha baqirawkhoon, ’qamoodee bi'wada ytoon aha?‘ mooroen ileh, ’Maran ba'e-leh, o har bhay 'dana bit shadireh lakha.‘“
ENG: And if any one say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye, The Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him back hither.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܒܥܵܠܘܿܠܵܐ، ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon o khze-lhoon lja'sha seera qam tar'a lbadar b'aloola, o shre-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And they went away, and found a colt tied at the door without in the open street; and they loose him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: nashe dkilye ywaw tama boeqirhoon, ”moodee bi'wada ytoon dbishraya ytoon lja'sha?“
ENG: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O anee meerhoon ilayhy dakhee dpqeeday ywa eeshoo'. O shweeqay-lhoon.
ENG: And they said unto them even as Jesus had said: and they let them go.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܪܟܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O moete-lhoon ja'sha lkis eeshoo' o dre-lhoon 'aloehy joelayhy, o rkeew-leh 'aloehy eeshoo'.
ENG: And they bring the colt unto Jesus, and cast on him their garments; and he sat upon him.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܲܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܵܪܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܝܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܲܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: Raba shawee waw joelayhy boerkha, o khene parmee waw pa'wane deelane min gaw khaqlane, o shawee waw-lhoon boerkha.
ENG: And many spread their garments upon the way; and others branches, which they had cut from the fields.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܘܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܘܿܫܲܥܢܵܐ، ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O anee dbezala ywaw qamoehy o bareh maqwikhee waw, ”oosha'na, breekha-yleh haw dbetaya-yleh bshima dmarya.
ENG: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:

ASY: ”ܘܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܲܢ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܘܿܫܲܥܢܵܐ ܒܲܡܪ̈ܵܘܡܹܐ.“
TRL: ”O breekhta-ylaha malkoeta dbaban daweed dbetaya-ylaha, oosha'na bamrawme.“
ENG: Blessed is the kingdom that cometh, the kingdom of our father David: Hosanna in the highest.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O 'weereh eeshoo' loorishlim o lhaykla, o kheereh lkhadirwanoehy bkl mindee. O eeman dhwe-leh ramsha, pleeṭ-leh lbeyt 'anya 'am tri'sar talmeedoehy.
ENG: And he entered into Jerusalem, into the temple; and when he had looked round about upon all things, it being now eventide, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܟܦܝܼܢܹܗ،
TRL: Byawma khena, eeman dpleeṭ-lhoon eeshoo' o talmeedoehy min beyt 'anya, kpeeneh,
ENG: And on the morrow, when they were come out from Bethany, he hungered.

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܛܲܪ̈ܦܹܐ. ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܲܪ̈ܦܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O khze-leh khad eelana dtene min rikhqa deet wa bee-eh ṭarpe. O te-leh lkis-leh bhewee dmachikh wa bee-eh mindee, eena la moechikh-leh mindee shwooq min ṭarpe, sabab le ywa 'dana dtene.
ENG: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find anything thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for it was not the season of figs.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟܹܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O meereh, ”min adeea o hal 'alam la akel nasha minoekh ṭ'oenyate.“ o shmee' lhoon talmeedoehy.
ENG: And he answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit from thee henceforward for ever. And his disciples heard it.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܙܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܦܵܬܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܲܪ̈ܵܦܹܐ ܘܟܘܼܪ̈ܣܝܹܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܵܘܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' loorishlim o 'weereh lhaykla dalaha, o shoere-leh lpaloeṭe lanee dbizwana ywaw o zaboene gaw haykla, o moekhdireh lpatoore dṣarape o koersye danee dzaboene ywaw yawne.
ENG: And they come to Jerusalem: and he entered into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and them that bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of them that sold the doves;

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܒܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ،
TRL: O la shweeq-leh nasha dma'bir wa mana gaw haykla,
ENG: and he would not suffer that any man should carry a vessel through the temple.

ASY: ܡܘܼܠܦܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܝܼ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ؟ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܸܦܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܲܝܵܣܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Moelpay-leh, bemara, ”le-yleh kteewa dbaytee bayta dṣloota bit paesh qirya lklayhy imwate? Eena akhtoon 'weed lawkhoon gipeeta dgayase.“
ENG: And he taught, and said unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations? but ye have made it a den of robbers.

ASY: ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܛܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: O shmee' lhoon goerane dkahne o sapre, o ṭ'e-lhoon dakhee qaṭlee waw-leh, eena ke zad'ee waw mineh sabab kleh kinsha ke 'ajbee waw byoelpaneh.
ENG: And the chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, for all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh ramsha, pleeṭ-lhoon lbadar min mdeeta.
ENG: And every evening he went forth out of the city.

ASY: ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܪܝܼܙܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܩܪܹܗ.
TRL: Bṣapra kad bezala ywaw eeshoo' o talmeedoehy boerkha, khze-lhoon lhaw eelana dtene breeza min 'iqreh.
ENG: And as they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.

ASY: ܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܝܼܛ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Dkheereh shim'oon kepa o meereh ileh, ”rabee, ha haw eelana dtene dleeṭ-loekh, breez-leh.“
ENG: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Rabbi, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”hawya beeawkhoon haymanoeta balaha.
ENG: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ’ܦܘܼܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ،‘ ܘܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܵܓ݂ܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܹܒ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man damer-laha ṭoera, ’poesh shqeela o roepya byama,‘ o la hawe poelagha blibeh, ila hamin dmindee dṭaleb bit hawe, bit paesh 'weeda ileh.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou taken up and cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that what he saith cometh to pass; he shall have it.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin ilawkhoon: kl mindee dṭalbeetoon bṣloota, o hamineetoon dbit shaqleetoon, bit hawe ilawkhoon.
ENG: Therefore I say unto you, All things whatsoever ye pray and ask for, believe that ye have received them, and ye shall have them.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܵܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܦܲܚܠܘܼܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܢܵܗܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”O eeman dkaleytoon lṣaloeye, pakhloen lnasha mindee deet lawkhoon 'aloehy, doep babawkhoon dbshmaya pakhil ilawkhoon gnahawkhoon,
ENG: And whensoever ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have aught against any one; that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܢܵܗܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Eena in la pakhleetoon, oep babawkhoon dbshmaya le pakhil ilawkhoon gnahawkhoon.“
ENG: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in heaven forgive your trespasses

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ،
TRL: te-lhoon mindrish loorishlim, o kad bikhdara ywa eeshoo' gaw haykla, te-lhoon lkis-leh goerane dkahne o sapre o khwardiqne,
ENG: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders;

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh, ”baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywit ane?“
ENG: and they said unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? or who gave thee this authority to do these things?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܲܩܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܵܐ. ܐܸܢ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo', bemara, ”oep ana bit baqrinawkhoon khad boeqara. In jawibeetoon-lee, ana bit amren ilawkhoon baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywin ane.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, I will ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

ASY: ”ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ؟ ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Ma'moodeeta dyookhanan min ayka ywa, min shmaya yan min bnaynasha? mooroen ilee.“
ENG: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men? answer me.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܘܼܚܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ’ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ؟‘
TRL: Anee toekhminhoon gaw ganayhy, bemara, ”in amrakh min shmaya, bit amer ilan, ’qamoodee la hoeminawkhoon bee-eh?‘
ENG: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“ (ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.)
TRL: ”O in amrakh min bnaynasha.“ (bizda'a ywaw min 'ama, sabab klayhy nashe bshareeroeta aykh nweea ke khashwee waw lyookhanan.)
ENG: But should we say, From men—they feared the people: for all verily held John to be a prophet.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon bemara ileh, ”le yad'akh.“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”oep ana le amren ilawkhoon baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywin ane.“
ENG: And they answered Jesus and say, We know not. And Jesus saith unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

ASY: ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܢܨܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ، ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܣܝܵܓ݂ܵܐ، ܘܚܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܡܲܥܨܲܪܬܵܐ، ܘܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܒܘܼܪܓ̰ܵܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܵܦܵܪ.
TRL: Shoere-leh eeshoo' lhamzoeme ilayhy bmatle, o meereh, ”khad nasha nṣeew-leh karma, o mkhe-leh lkhadirwanoehy syagha, o khpeereh gaweh ma'ṣarta, o bne-leh gaweh boerja, o soepe-leh lpalakhe, o zeel-leh bsapar.
ENG: And he began to speak unto them in parables. A man planted a vineyard, and set a hedge about it, and digged a pit for the winepress, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into another country.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”O eeman dmṭe-laha 'dana dṭ'oenyate, shoedireh regeh lkis palakhe dshaqel wa ṭ'oenyate min karmeh.
ENG: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruits of the vineyard.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܣܦܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena anee palakhe dweeq-lhoon o mkhe-lhoon ileh, o shoedirhoon speeqa.
ENG: And they took him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.

ASY: ”ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܚܲܕ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Shoedireh mindrish khad rega khena, o lhaw doerbinhoon resheh o moesle-lhoon.
ENG: And again he sent unto them another servant; and him they wounded in the head, and handled shamefully.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܠܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ، ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O shoedireh rega khena, o lhaw qṭeel-lhoon. O lraba khene dshoedireh, minayhy mkhe-lhoon, o minayhy qṭeel-lhoon.
ENG: And he sent another; and him they killed: and many others; beating some, and killing some.

ASY: ”ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ. ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܒܸܬ ܢܵܟ݂ܦܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Bkharta eet wa-leh pyasha khad broona moekhiba. Shoedireh lkis layhy, bemara, ’bit nakhpee min broonee.‘
ENG: He had yet one, a beloved son: he sent him last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ’ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܵܪܘܿܬܵܐ، ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܩܵܛܠܲܚ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Eena palakhe eeman dkhze-lhoon lbroona meerhoon bganayhy, ’aha-yleh yaroota, teymoen qaṭlakh-leh, o bit hawya dee-an yartoeta.‘
ENG: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.

ASY: ”ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Dweeq-lhoon o qṭeel-lhoon ileh, o roepe-lhoon ileh lbadar min karma.“
ENG: And they took him, and killed him, and cast him forth out of the vineyard.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ؟ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܹܠ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: O boeqireh eeshoo', ”moodee bit 'abed mara dkarma? Bit ate o bit qaṭel lanee palakhe, o bit yabil karma lpalakhe khene.
ENG: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ: ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܪܢܝܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”La qre lawkhoon gaw ktawa: kepa dmoesle-lhoon banaye, haw hwe-leh kepa dqoerneeta?
ENG: Have ye not read even this scripture; The stone which the builders rejected, The same was made the head of the corner:

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܢ̈.“
TRL: ”Min Marya ywa aha o 'oejaba-yleh b'aynan.“
ENG: This was from the Lord, And it is marvelous in our eyes?

ASY: ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ. ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O b'e-lhoon lidwaqeh, sabab dee' lhoon d'alayhy mkhe-leh aha matla, eena zdee' lhoon min kinsha. O shweeq-lhoon ileh o zeel-lhoon.
ENG: And they sought to lay hold on him; and they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spake the parable against them: and they left him, and went away.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܕܡܲܢܦܸܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: O shoedirhoon lkis-leh nashe min preeshe o min beyt heroodis dmanpilee waw-leh bhemizmaneh.
ENG: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, that they might catch him in talk.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܠܹܐ ܬܲܚܡܸܢܸܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܲܫܦܸܪܵܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܦܸܬ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܟܸܣܦܵܐ ܕܪܹܫܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܩܹܣܲܪ ܝܲܢ ܠܵܐ؟ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܝܲܢ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ؟“
TRL: O anee te-lhoon o meerhoon ileh, ”malpana, beeda'a ywakh dshareera ywit, o le takhminit moodee nashe bit amree, o le ywit mashpirana, ila bshareeroeta ke malpit oerkha dalaha. Qanoonayta-ylaha dyabakh kispa dresha qa qesar yan la? Yabakh yan la yabakh?“
ENG: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest not for any one: for thou regardest not the person of men, but of a truth teachest the way of God: Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܫܦܲܪܬܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟ ܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܢܹܗ.“
TRL: Eena haw dee' leh mashpartayhy o meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee jaroebee ytoon? Mayteymoen-lee khad deenara dkhazeyneh.“
ENG: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܨܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܕܩܹܣܲܪ.“
TRL: O moekhze-lhoon ileh. O haw boeqireh minayhy, ”dmanee-ylaha aha ṣoerta, o dmanee-ylaha aha kteewta?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”dqesar.“
ENG: And they brought it. And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription? And they said unto him, Caesar’s.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ ܠܩܹܣܲܪ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“ ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”haloen mindee dqesar lqesar, o mindee dalaha lalaha.“ o 'oejib-lhoon bee-eh.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Render unto Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and unto God the things that are God’s. And they marveled greatly at him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: O te-lhoon lkis-leh zadoeqaye, anee dle haminee bqyamta min gaw meete, o boeqirhoon mineh, bemara,
ENG: And there come unto him Sadducees, which say that there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,

ASY: ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܕܐܸܢ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܘܟܲܕ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܵܩܹܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܩܸܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Malpana, moeshe kteew-leh ilan, din maet akhoona dnasha o paysha bakhteh o kad layt-leh bnoone, shaqel haw nasha lbakhta o maqim bnoone lakhoonoehy.
ENG: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man’s brother die, and leave a wife behind him, and leave no child, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eet waw shaw'a akhoonwate. Haw qamaya gweereh bakhta o meet-leh, o layt wa-leh bnoone.
ENG: There were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed;

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haw dtrey gweereh bakhta dakhoonoehy o meet-leh, oep haw layt wa-leh bnoone, hadkha oep haw dtlata.
ENG: and the second took her, and died, leaving no seed behind him; and the third likewise:

ASY: ”ܫܲܒ݂ܥܘܿܢܬܲܝܗܝ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ. ܘܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Shaw'oontayhy gweera-lhoon hay bakhta o la qam hawe-lhoon bnoone. O bkharta dklayhy oep hay bakhta meet-laha.
ENG: and the seven left no seed. Last of all the woman also died.

ASY: ”ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܘܿܢܬܲܝܗܝ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Bqyamta, bakhta daynee minayhy bit hawya? Sabab shaw'oontayhy gweera-lhoon.“
ENG: In the resurrection whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܚܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”le-ylaha boet aha bikhlaṭa ytoon dle ytoon beeda'a ktabe o la khayla dalaha?
ENG: Jesus said unto them, Is it not for this cause that ye err, that ye know not the scriptures, nor the power of God?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܓܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܓܒܸܪܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab bqyamta dmeete, le gawree o le magbiree, ila aykh malake dbshmaya yna.
ENG: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as angels in heaven.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܣܲܢܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂‘؟
TRL: ”Boet qyamta dmeete, la qre lawkhoon gaw ktawa dmoeshe, dakhee min gaw sanya meereh ileh Alaha, ’ana ywin Alaha dawraham, o Alaha deeskhaq o Alaha dya'qoow‘?
ENG: But as touching the dead, that they are raised; have ye not read in the book of Moses, in the place concerning the Bush, how God spake unto him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܚܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Alaha le-yleh Alaha dmeete, ila dkhaye. Akhtoon raba bikhlaṭa ytoon.“
ENG: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living: ye do greatly err.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܡܝܼܥܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: O te-leh khad nasha min sapre o shmee'ay-leh bidrasha. O eeman dkhze-leh dṣpayee joewib-leh lzadoeqaye, boeqireh min eeshoo', ”aynee poeqdana qamaya-yleh dklayhy poeqdane?“
ENG: And one of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together, and knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, What commandment is the first of all?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܫܡܸܥ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܲܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”haw poeqdana qamaya aha-yleh: shmi' eesrayel, Marya alahan Marya khad eeleh.
ENG: Jesus answered, The first is, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God, the Lord is one:

ASY: ”ܘܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܪܸܥܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܠܘܼܟ݂. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”O makhibit lmarya alahoekh min kleh liboekh, o min kleh ganoekh, o min kleh ri'yanoekh, o min kleh khayloekh. Aha-yleh haw poeqdana qamaya,
ENG: and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength.

ASY: ”ܘܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܕܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂. ܠܲܝܬ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.“
TRL: ”O poeqdana dtrey ke dame ileh, dmakhibit lshwawoekh aykh ganoekh. Layt poeqdana boesh goera min ane.“
ENG: The second is this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܵܦܪܵܐ، ”ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܕܚܲܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: Joewib-leh haw sapra, ”ṣpayee rabee, bshareeroeta hoemzim-loekh, dkhad eeleh Alaha, o layt khad khena shwooq mineh,
ENG: And the scribe said unto him, Of a truth, Master, thou hast well said that he is one; and there is none other but he:

ASY: ”ܘܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܹܗ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܚܝܼܵܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܪܸܥܝܵܢܹܗ، ܘܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܩܕܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”O dmakhib-leh nasha min kleh libeh, o min kleh kheealeh, o min kleh ganeh, o min kleh ri'yaneh, o dmakhib lshwabeh aykh ganeh, aha zawda-yleh min klayhy diwkhe moeqde.“
ENG: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbour as himself, is much more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܗܵܘܢܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“ ܘܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܹܗ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܗ.
TRL: Eeshoo' khze-leh dbhawnanoeta joewib-leh, o meereh ileh, ”le ywit rikhqa min malkoeta dalaha.“ o la nasha qoeshdireh zawda lbaqoereh.
ENG: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no man after that durst ask him any question.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Kad maloepe ywa eeshoo' gaw haykla, boeqireh, ”dakhee ke amree sapre dmsheekha broona ddaweed eeleh?
ENG: And Jesus answered and said, as he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that the Christ is the son of David?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܝܼ، ’ܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܟܘܼܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”Sabab daweed bganeh meereh broekha dqoedsha: meereh Marya lmaree, ’toow min yameenee hal dmatbin dishminoekh koewsha tkhoot aqlatoekh.‘
ENG: David himself said in the Holy Spirit, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ؟“ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”In daweed hadkha biqrayeh-yleh Marya, dakhee bit hawe brooneh?“ o kinsha goera ke shame' wa-leh bkhadoeta.
ENG: David himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he his son? And the common people heard him gladly.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܕܚܵܕܪܝܼ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ، ܘܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܫܘܼܩܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O meereh kad maloepe, ”hweymoen hishyar min sapre dke makhibee dkhadree blweeshyate yareeke, o makhibee dnashe daree-lhoon shlama bshoeqe,
ENG: And in his teaching he said, Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and to have salutations in the marketplaces,

ASY: ”ܘܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܒܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܸܫܬܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”O resha dmawtbe gaw knoeshyate o mishtoeyate,
ENG: and chief seats in the synagogues, and chief places at feasts:

ASY: ”ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܹܐ، ܘܒܡܲܫܦܲܪܬܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܸܟ݂ܝܼ ܨܠܵܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O ke akhlee bate darmilyate, o bmashparta maryikhee ṣlawatayhy. Ane bit qablee dyanta goerta.“
ENG: they which devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers; these shall receive greater condemnation.

ASY: ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ، ܘܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܒܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ. ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: teew-leh eeshoo' lbalqoewl dbeyt gaza, o bikhyara bkinsha dbidraya ywaw zoeze gaw beyt gaza. O raba 'ateere bidraya ywaw raba zoeze.
ENG: And he sat down over against the treasury, and beheld how the multitude cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܬܵܐ، ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܪܹܝ ܦܘܼܠܣܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O te-laha khda armilta miskenta, o dre-laha trey poelse.
ENG: And there came a poor widow, and she cast in two mites, which make a farthing.

ASY: ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܬܵܐ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Qre-leh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, aha armilta miskenta dre-laha gaw beyt gaza boesh zawda min klayhy ane nashe dbidraya yna.
ENG: And he called unto him his disciples, and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, This poor widow cast in more than all they which are casting into the treasury:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܘܼܬܘܼܗ̇ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܝܘܼܬܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Sabab klayhy min zawdoenyoetayhy dre-lhoon, eena aha min baṣooroetoeha dre-laha, kl mindee deet wa-laha, klaha khayoetoeha.“
ENG: for they all did cast in of their superfluity; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, even all her living.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܚܙܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Kad biplaṭa ywa eeshoo' min haykla, meereh ileh khad min talmeedoehy, ”malpana, khzee ane kepe goere o ane binyane shapeere.“
