ENG: And as he went forth out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, behold, what manner of stones and what manner of buildings!

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ؟ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܬܝܼܪܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”bikhzaya ywit ane binyane goere? Le paesh shweeqa kepa 'al kepa dla paesh steera.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left here one stone upon another, which shall not be thrown down.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ، ܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: O eeman dteew-leh eeshoo' 'al ṭoera dzayte, balqoewl dhaykla, boeqirhoon mineh shim'oon kepa o ya'qoow o yookhanan o andreoos bnawshayhy,
ENG: And as he sat on the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܐ؟“
TRL: ”moor ilan, eeman bit hawee ane, o moodee-yleh neeshanqa eeman dane payshee toemime?“
ENG: Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when these things are all about to be accomplished?

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܚܠܸܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: O shoere-leh eeshoo' lemara ilayhy, ”hweymoen hishyar dnasha la makhliṭ lawkhoon,
ENG: And Jesus began to say unto them, Take heed that no man lead you astray.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ،‘ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܠܸܛܝܼ ܠܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab raba bit atee bshimee o bit amree, ’ana ywin,‘ o bit makhliṭee lraba.
ENG: Many shall come in my name, saying, I am he; and shall lead many astray.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܠܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܠܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܵܘܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman dsham'eetoon boet plashe o khabre boet plashe, la zad'eetoon, sabab wale-ylaha ane klayhy hawee, eena hesh le-yleh shoelama.
ENG: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be not troubled: these things must needs come to pass; but the end is not yet.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܵܐ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܪ̈ܵܘܕܵܢܹܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܟܸܦܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bit qayma oemta 'al oemta, o bit qayma malkoeta 'al malkoeta, o bit hawee rawdane bdoekane preeshe, o bit hawee kipne o shghoeshye. Eena ane klayhy akhchee shoeraya doelṣane yna.
ENG: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: there shall be earthquakes in divers places; there shall be famines: these things are the beginning of travail.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܕܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܟܵܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon hweymoen hishyar, sabab bit sapee lawkhoon lbeyt deene, o gaw knoeshyate bit makhee lawkhoon, o qam malke o shaleeṭe bit kaleytoon boet deeee lsahdoetayhy.
ENG: But take ye heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in synagogues shall ye be beaten; and before governors and kings shall ye stand for my sake, for a testimony unto them.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena qamayta bit paesh moekriza aha ewangaleeoon lklayhy imwate.
ENG: And the gospel must first be preached unto all the nations.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܣܲܦܘܼܝܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dlablee lawkhoon lsapoeyawkhoon, la akhleetoon kham min qam 'dana dmoodee bit hamzimeetoon, ila mindee dpaesh yoewa ilawkhoon bhay 'dana haw hamzimoen-leh, sabab le akhtoon hamzimeetoon, ila roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: And when they lead you to judgment, and deliver you up, be not anxious beforehand what ye shall speak: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܡܝܸܬܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bit sape akhoona lakhoona lmawta, o baba lbrooneh, o bit qaymee bnoone dalqoewl dawahayhy o bit mamyitee-lhoon.
ENG: And brother shall deliver up brother to death, and the father his child; and children shall rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܸܢܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܡܹܠ ܗܲܠ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ.
TRL: ”O bit paysheetoon sinye min kl nasha boet shimee, eena man dkhamel hal kharta, haw bit pareq.
ENG: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake: but he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܟܠܵܝܵܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠܝܼܬܵܐ، (ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܐ)، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܥܵܪܩܝܼ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman dkhazeytoon ṭanpoeta dkharaba biklaya bdoeka dla paysha wa kleeta, (haw dqare parme), haygah anee deena beehoed 'arqee lṭoera.
ENG: But when ye see the abomination of desolation standing where he ought not (let him that readeth understand), then let them that are in Judaea flee unto the mountains:

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐ݇ܓܵܪܹܐ، ܠܵܐ ܨܵܠܹܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O haw deeleh 'al gare, la ṣale o la 'aber lishqala mindee dgaw bayteh.
ENG: and let him that is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house:

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O haw deeleh gaw khaqla, la daer lbareh lishqala lweeshteh.
ENG: and let him that is in the field not return back to take his cloke.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܠܒܛܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܡܲܡܸܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Way lbṭeene, o lmamiṣane banee yawmane.
ENG: But woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days!

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܪܵܩܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܣܸܬܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha ṣaleymoen dla hawe 'raqawkhoon bsitwa.
ENG: And pray ye that it be not in the winter.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ
TRL: ”Sabab mindrish banee yawmane bit hawe oelṣana dle-yleh hweea maykh dee-eh min shoeraya dbreeta dbirya-leh Alaha o hal adeea, o le hawe mindrish
ENG: For those days shall be tribulation, such as there hath not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never shall be.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܡܘܼܟܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O in Marya la makre wa lanee yawmane, le pareq wa oep khad. Eena boet khatir dgoebye dgoebe-leh, moekre-leh lanee yawmane.
ENG: And except the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved: but for the elect’s sake, whom he chose, he shortened the days.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ”ܗܵܐ ’ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ،‘ ܝܲܢ ’ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،‘ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Haygah in nasha amer ilawkhoon, ”ha ’lakha-yleh msheekha,‘ yan ’tama-yleh,‘ la hamineetoon.
ENG: And then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is the Christ; or, Lo, there; believe it not:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܡܫܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܡܲܚܠܸܛܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab bit qaymee msheekhe dagale o nwee-e dagale o bit 'awdee neeshanqe o doemare, dmakhliṭee in maṣya oep lgoebye.
ENG: for there shall arise false Christs and false prophets, and shall shew signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, the elect.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon hweymoen hishyar, sabab meeree ilawkhoon kl mindee min qamayta.
ENG: But take ye heed: behold, I have told you all things beforehand.

ASY: ”ܘܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ، ܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܲܫܟܸܢ، ܘܣܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܒܲܗܪܹܗ،
TRL: ”O banee yawmane min bar haw oelṣana, shimsha bit khashkin, o sahra le yabil bahreh,
ENG: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,

ASY: ”ܘܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܫܥܸܫܹܐ.
TRL: ”O kawkhbe bit naplee min shmaya, o khaylawate dshmaya bit payshee moesh'ishe.
ENG: and the stars shall be falling from heaven, and the powers that are in the heavens shall be shaken.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܚܸܩܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit khazee broona dnasha betaya 'al 'nana 'am khayla goera o khiqra.
ENG: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܡܸܥ ܠܓܘܼܒܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܓܹܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit shadir malakhoehy o bit jami' lgoebyoehy min arb'a gebane, o min marza dar'a o hal marza dshmaya.
ENG: And then shall he send forth the angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܠܘܿܦܘܼܢ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܪܵܟܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܲܪܛܸܢܝܼ ܛܲܪ̈ܦܘܼܗܝ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܲܝܛܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min eelana dtene loopoen matla: eeman dke rakkhee pa'wanoehy o barṭinee ṭarpoehy, ke yad'eetoon dmṭe-leh qayṭa.
ENG: Now from the fig tree learn her parable: when her branch is now become tender, and putteth forth its leaves, ye know that the summer is nigh;

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ، ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon, eeman dkhazeytoon ane bihwaya, di'moen dqoerba-yleh, qam tar'a.
ENG: even so ye also, when ye see these things coming to pass, know ye that he is nigh, even at the doors.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܵܘܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le 'aber aha dawra hal dhawee klayhy ane.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, until all these things be accomplished.

ASY: ”ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”Shmaya o ar'a bit 'awree, eena hemizmanee le 'awree.
ENG: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena boet haw yawma o boet hay sa'at, nasha le yade' oep la malake dshmaya o la broona, ila baba bnawsheh.
ENG: But of that day or that hour knoweth no one, not even the angels in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.

ASY: ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܪܥܘܿܫܘܼܢ ܘܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khzeymoen, r'ooshoen o ṣaleymoen, sabab le yad'eetoon eeman eelaha 'dana.
ENG: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܵܦܵܪ: ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܘܠܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹܗ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܪܥܝܼܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Aykh nasha-yleh dzeel-leh bsapar: shweeq-leh bayteh, o yoebil-leh shoelṭana lregawateh o lkl nasha poelkhaneh, o pqeed-leh lnaṭoora dhawe r'eesha.
ENG: It is as when a man, sojourning in another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, to each one his work, commanded also the porter to watch.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܒܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܩܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ،
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon hweymoen r'eeshe, sabab le yad'eetoon eeman bit ate mara dbayta, bramsha yan bpalga dlayle yan bqrayta dqarooya yan bṣapra,
ENG: Watch therefore: for ye know not when the lord of the house cometh, whether at even, or at midnight, or at cockcrowing, or in the morning;

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ.
TRL: ”La hawe date minshiltane o machikh lawkhoon dmeeke.
ENG: lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ: ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Mindee dilawkhoon bemara ywin, lklayhy bemara ywin: hweymoen r'eeshe.“
ENG: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܦܸܠܡܵܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar trey yawmane hwe-leh 'eda dpaṭeere, o b'e-lhoon goerane dkahne bpilma dawqee waw leeshoo' o qaṭlee waw-leh.
ENG: Now after two days was the feast of the passover and the unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him with subtilty, and kill him:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena meerhoon, ”la b'eda, dla hawe shghoeshya gaw 'ama.“
ENG: for they said, Not during the feast, lest haply there shall be a tumult of the people.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܓܸܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܵܛܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܕܢܵܪܕܝܼܢ ܪܹܫܵܝܵܐ ܘܡܵܪܹܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܵܛܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܦܸܟ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad eeshoo' gaw beyt 'anya ywa gaw bayta dshim'oon girwana, o teewa lsoepra, te-laha khda bakhta deet wa-laha shaṭeepta dbisma dnardeen reshaya o mare ṭeema raba, pteekha-laha shaṭeepta o shoepikh-laha bisma 'al resha deeshoo'.
ENG: And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster cruse of ointment of spikenard very costly; and she brake the cruse, and poured it over his head.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܘܼܣܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ؟
TRL: Eena nashe deewaw tama kreeb-lhoon o meerhoon, ”qamoodee aha khoesrana dbisma?
ENG: But there were some that had indignation among themselves, saying, To what purpose hath this waste of the ointment been made?

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܠܵܬܡܵܐܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ،“ ܘܛܲܪܛܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”Ke maṣe wa paesh wa zoebna zawda min tlatma deenare o yoewa lmiskene,“ o ṭarṭimee waw 'aloeha.
ENG: For this ointment might have been sold for above three hundred pence, and given to the poor. And they murmured against her.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܠܵܗ̇، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܠܝܘܼܨܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇؟ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”shwooqoen-laha, qamoodee malyoeṣe ytoon iloeha? Poelkhana ṭawa 'weed-laha ilee.
ENG: But Jesus said, Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.

ASY: ”ܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Miskene bkl 'dana eet 'amawkhoon, o eeman dba'eytoon maṣeytoon 'awdeetoon ṭawta ilayhy, eena ana le ywin bkl 'dana lkis lawkhoon.
ENG: For ye have the poor always with you, and whensoever ye will ye can do them good: but me ye have not always.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܡܨܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇. ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܠܩܒ݂ܵܪܬܝܼ ܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Aha bakhta 'weed-laha haw mindee dmṣe-laha. Aykh lqwartee msheekh-laha paghree min qam 'dana.
ENG: She hath done what she could: she hath anointed my body aforehand for the burying.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇، ܠܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bkl doeka dpaesh moekriza aha ewangaleeoon bklaha breeta, bit paesh hoemzima aha mindee d'weed-laha, ldkhara iloeha.“
ENG: And verily I say unto you, Wheresoever the gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world, that also which this woman hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah eehoeda skaryooṭa, khad min tri'sar talmeede, zeel-leh lkis goerane dkahne dsape wa-leh eeshoo' ilayhy.
ENG: And Judas Iscariot, he that was one of the twelve, went away unto the chief priests, that he might deliver him unto them.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ. ܘܗ̇ܘ ܛܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܠܣܲܦܘܼܝܹܗ.
TRL: O eeman dshmee' lhoon anee khde-lhoon, o 'weed-lhoon qawla 'ameh dyawee-leh zoeze. O haw ṭa'e wa bar pirsat lsapoeyeh.
ENG: And they, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently deliver him unto them.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܚܝܼ ܦܹܐܪܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܘܗܲܕܪܲܚ ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: Byawma qamaya dpaṭeere, eeman dyhoedaye ke dawkhee pera dpiṣkha, meerhoon talmeede leeshoo', ”ayka basma-loekh dazakh o hadrakh qatoekh doeka dpiṣkha?“
ENG: And on the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the passover, his disciples say unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and make ready that thou mayest eat the passover?

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܬܵܦܹܩ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܥܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ؛ ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O shoedireh trey min talmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen lmdeeta o bit tapeq beeawkhoon khad nasha ṭ'eena talma dmeea; zemoen bareh.
ENG: And he sendeth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, Go into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water: follow him;

ASY: ”ܘܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ’ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܝܼ̈؟‘
TRL: ”O layka d'aber mooroen lmara dbayta, ’rabee-an bemara-yleh, ayka-ylaha doeka dakhlen piṣkha 'am talmeedee?‘
ENG: and wheresoever he shall enter in, say to the goodman of the house, The Master saith, Where is my guest-chamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܸܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܫܘܼܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܬܵܐ؛ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ.“
TRL: ”O haw bit makhze lawkhoon 'ileeta goerta, shoeweeta o hoedirta; tama hadroen.“
ENG: And he will himself shew you a large upper room furnished and ready: and there make ready for us.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon talmeedoehy o te-lhoon lmdeeta o khze-lhoon dakhee dmeereh ilayhy, o hoedirhoon piṣkha.
ENG: And the disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh ramsha, te-leh eeshoo' 'am tri'sar talmeedoehy.
ENG: And when it was evening he cometh with the twelve.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O kad teebe ywaw bekhala, meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon: khad minawkhoon dbekhala-yleh 'amee bit sape-lee.“
ENG: And as they sat and were eating, Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, One of you shall betray me, even he that eateth with me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܦܫܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܒܚܲܕ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ؟“
TRL: Haygah anee shoere-lhoon lipshama, o meerhoon ileh khad bkhad, ”qamoo ana ywin?“
ENG: They began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one, Is it I?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܕܒܸܛܡܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܒܡܵܐܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw joewib-leh, ”khad min tri'sar dbiṭmasha-yleh 'amee bmana.
ENG: And he said unto them, It is one of the twelve, he that dippeth with me in the dish.

ASY: ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Broona dnasha bezala-yleh dakhee deeleh kteewa boet dee-eh, eena way lhaw nasha dbeedeh paesh soepya broona dnasha. Boesh ṣpayee ywa lhaw nasha dla hawe wa leeda.“
ENG: For the Son of man goeth, even as it is written of him: but woe unto that man through whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had not been born.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: O kad bekhala ywaw, shqeel-leh eeshoo' lakhma, o boerikh-leh, o qṣe-leh, o yoebil-leh ilayhy, o meereh, ”shqooloen, aha-yleh paghree.“
ENG: And as they were eating, he took bread, and when he had blessed, he brake it, and gave to them, and said, Take ye: this is my body.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܣܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܟܸܪܹܗ، ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh kasa, o shoekireh, o boerikh-leh, o yoebil-leh ilayhy, o shte-lhoon mineh klayhy.
ENG: And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them: and they all drank of it.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܸܡܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܦܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”aha dimee-yleh dwa'da khata, dmin geba draba pyasha-yleh shoepkha.
ENG: And he said unto them, This is my blood of the covenant, which is shed for many.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܬܹܝܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܕܓܸܦܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܵܬܹܝܢܵܗ̇ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, khena le shateyn min ṭ'oenta dgipta hal haw yawma dshateynaha khadta bmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: Verily I say unto you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ.
TRL: O min bar dshoebikh-lhoon, seeq-lhoon lṭoera dzayte.
ENG: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out unto the mount of Olives.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܹܝܢ ܠܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”klawkhoon bit shawqeetoon-lee, sabab kteewa-yleh: bit makheyn lra'ya o bit payshee boerbize 'irboehy.
ENG: And Jesus saith unto them, All ye shall be offended: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered abroad.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܵܝܡܹܢ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena min bar dqaymen, bit azen min qam deeawkhoon lgleela.“
ENG: Howbeit, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Eena shim'oon kepa meereh ileh, ”oep in dklayhy shawqee-loekh, ana le shawqenoekh.“
ENG: But Peter said unto him, Although all shall be offended, yet will not I.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ، ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”troeṣa bemara ywin iloekh, idyoom baha layle, min qam dtartey gahe qare qarooya, tlat gahe bit sarbet-lee.“
ENG: And Jesus saith unto him, Verily I say unto thee, that thou today, even this night, before the cock crow twice, shalt deny me thrice.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܙܝܸܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܡܵܝܬܹܢ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂، ܠܹܐ ܣܵܪܒܹܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena haw mazyid wa lemara, ”oep in dhawya dmayten 'amoekh, le sarbenoekh.“ o hadkha oep klayhy talmeede meerhoon.
ENG: But he spake exceeding vehemently, If I must die with thee, I will not deny thee. And in like manner also said they all.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܲܕܣܹܡܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܘܨܲܠܹܝܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.“
TRL: te-lhoon ldoeka dpyasha-ylaha qreeta gadseman, o meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”toowoen lakha hal dazen o ṣaleyn ṣloota.“
ENG: And they come unto a place which was named Gethsemane: and he saith unto his disciples, Sit ye here, while I pray.

ASY: ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܦܫܵܡܵܐ ܘܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܒܥܵܘܩܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O loebil-leh 'ameh lshim'oon kepa o lya'qoow o lyookhanan, o shoere-leh lipshama o li'wara b'awqana.
ENG: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be greatly amazed, and sore troubled.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܦܫܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ. ܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”psheemta-ylaha ganee hal mawta. Poeshoen lakha o hweymoen r'eeshe.“
ENG: And he saith unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful even unto death: abide ye here, and watch.

ASY: ܘܪܚܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܕܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ.
TRL: O rkheeq-leh minayhy o npeel-leh 'al ar'a, o shoere-leh lṣaloeye din maṣya 'awra mineh aha sa'at.
ENG: And he went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ، ܡܲܥܒܸܪ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܵܣܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O meereh, ”aba, babee, kl mindee maṣeyt 'awdet, ma'bir minee aha kasa. Eena la aykh ṣiwyanee, ila aykh ṣiwyanoekh.“
ENG: And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible unto thee; remove this cup from me: howbeit not what I will, but what thou wilt.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܵܗܲܪܬܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ؟
TRL: O deereh lkis talmeedoehy o khizyay-leh dmeeke, o meereh lshim'oon kepa, ”shim'oon, dmeekha ywit? La mṣe-loekh 'awdet wa shaharta khda sa'at?
ENG: And he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, Simon, sleepest thou? couldest thou not watch one hour?

ASY: ”ܪܥܘܿܫܘܼܢ ܘܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܪܵܒܵܐ. ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܝܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܙܲܒܘܼܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”R'ooshoen o ṣaleymoen dla 'awreetoon ljoeraba. Roekha ke ba'ya eena paghra zaboen eeleh.“
ENG: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܗ̇ܝ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: O zeel-leh mindrish o ṣoele-leh maykh hay gaha qamayta.
ENG: And again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܝܘܼܩܪܸܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܫܸܢܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O deereh mindrish o khizyay-leh dmeeke sabab 'aynayhy yoeqrine ywaw bshinta, o la dee' lhoon moodee amree waw ileh.
ENG: And again he came, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy; and they wist not what to answer him.

ASY: ܘܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܡܘܿܟ݂ܘܼܢ ܘܡܲܢܝܸܚܘܼܢ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ. ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O gaha dtlat te-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”adeea dmookhoen o manyikhoen, mṭe-laha kharta o te-laha sa'at. Broona dnasha pyasha-yleh soepya beedate dkhaṭaye.
ENG: And he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: it is enough; the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

ASY: ”ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ، ܗܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Qoemoen dazakh, ha qoerbineh haw dsape-lee.“
ENG: Arise, let us be going: behold, he that betrayeth me is at hand.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܘܥܲܡܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܒܣܲܝܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܼܛܪܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ.
TRL: Kad haw hamzoeme ywa, te-leh eehoeda skaryooṭa, khad min tri'sar talmeede, o 'ameh kinsha raba, bsaype o khoeṭre, peeshe shoedre min goerane dkahne o sapre o khwardiqne.
ENG: And straightway, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.

ASY: ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܵܫܩܹܢܹܗ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ. ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ ܘܠܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܸܫܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O eehoeda sapyana yoewa ywa ilayhy neeshanqa, bemara, ”haw dnashqeneh, haw eeleh. Dawqeetoon-leh o lableetoon-leh bhishyaroeta.“
ENG: Now he that betrayed him had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he; take him, and lead him away safely.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܪܲܒܝܼ،“ ܘܢܫܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: te-leh sapyana o bjaldoeta qoerbineh o meereh ileh, ”rabee, rabee,“ o nsheeq-leh.
ENG: And when he was come, straightway he came to him, and saith, Rabbi; and kissed him.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O anee deewaw 'ameh dweeq-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And they laid hands on him, and took him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah khad min anee deewaw 'am eeshoo' greesh-leh saypa o mkhe-leh lrega dgoera dkahne o preema-leh nateh.
ENG: But a certain one of them that stood by drew his sword, and smote the servant of the high priest, and struck off his ear.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܥܲܠ ܓܲܝܵܣܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܒܣܲܝܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܚܘܼܛܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”aykh d'al gayasa pleeṭ lawkhoon 'alee bsaype o bkhoeṭre ddawqeetoon-lee?
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Are ye come out, as against a robber, with swords and staves to seize me?

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ. ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Kl yoom ke haweyn wa lkis lawkhoon maloepe bhaykla o la qam dawqeetoon-lee. Ila hwe-laha aha dpayshee toemime ktabe.“
ENG: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and ye took me not: but this is done that the scriptures might be fulfilled.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Haygah talmeedoehy shweeq-lhoon ileh o 'reeq-lhoon.
ENG: And they all left him, and fled.

ASY: ܘܚܲܕ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ. ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ،
TRL: O khad 'layma betaya ywa bareh, dirya kitana lpaghreh shoelkhaya. Dweeq-lhoon ileh,
ENG: And a certain young man followed with him, having a linen cloth cast about him, over his naked body: and they lay hold on him;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ ܘܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw shweeq-leh kitana o 'reeq-leh shoelkhaya.
ENG: but he left the linen cloth, and fled naked.

ASY: ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ.
TRL: Loebil-lhoon leeshoo' lkis goera dkahne, o jmee' lhoon tama klayhy goerane dkahne o sapre o khwardiqne.
ENG: And they led Jesus away to the high priest: and there come together with him all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.

ASY: ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܫܚܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: O shim'oon kepa bezala ywa bar eeshoo' min rikhqa hal gaw darta dgoera dkahne, o teew-leh 'am naṭoore bishkhana qam noera.
ENG: And Peter had followed him afar off, even within, into the court of the high priest; and he was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.

ASY: ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܛܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܲܡܝܸܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Goerane dkahne o kleh knoeshya ṭa'ee waw sahdoeta 'al eeshoo' dmamyitee waw-leh, o la moechikh-lhoon.
ENG: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found it not.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Raba yoebil-lhoon 'aloehy sahdoeta dagalta, eena sahdwatayhy la dweeq-lhoon 'am 'oedale.
ENG: For many bare false witness against him, and their witness agreed not together.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: O qeem-lhoon sahde dagale o meerhoon,
ENG: And there stood up certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܵܠܚܹܢܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܢܹܝܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ.‘“
TRL: ”Akhnan shmee' lan dmeereh, ’ana bit talkheneh aha haykla binya beedate, o btlata yawmane bit baneyn khad khena la binya beedate.‘“
ENG: We heard him say, I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Eena oep aha sahdoeta la dweeq-laha.
ENG: And not even so did their witness agree together.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Haygah qeem-leh goera dkahne bey palga, o boeqireh min eeshoo', ”qamoodee le ywit jawoebe lane dbishada yna 'aloekh?“
ENG: And the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ. ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܒܘܼܪܟ݂ܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' shteeqa ywa, o mindee la joewib-leh. Mindrish boeqireh mineh goera dkahne, ”at eewit msheekha, broona dmboerkha?“
ENG: But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and saith unto him, Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܬܵܢܵܐ ܘܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo', bemara, ”ana ywin. O bit khazeytoon broona dnasha teewa min yameena dkhayltana o betaya 'am 'nana dshmaya.“
ENG: And Jesus said, I am: and ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.

ASY: ܘܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܟ̰ܘܼܢܟ̰ܸܪܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: O goera dkahne choenchireh joeloehy, bemara, ”qamoodee khena sneeqe ywakh lsahde?
ENG: And the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What further need have we of witnesses?

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ ܓܘܼܕܵܦܵܐ. ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ ܕܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ha shmee' lawkhoon min poemeh goedapa. Moodee bikhshawa ytoon?“ o anee klayhy deenhoon dkhayawa-yleh lmawta.
ENG: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be worthy of death.

ASY: ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܪܵܩܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܟܘܼܣܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܬܹܗ، ܘܩܲܪܦܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܢܲܒܝܼ.“ ܘܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܟ̰ܵܦܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Shoere-lhoon nashe biraqa 'aloehy, o koese-lhoon pateh, o qarpikhee waw-leh o amree waw, ”nabee.“ o naṭoore makhee waw-leh bchapoole.
ENG: And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the officers received him with blows of their hands.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܚܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O kad shim'oon kepa lltikht gaw darta ywa, te-laha khda khamta dgoera dkahne,
ENG: And as Peter was beneath in the court, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest;

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܫܚܵܢܵܐ. ܚܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: O khze-laha ileh kad bishkhana. Kheeraha bee-eh o meeraha ileh, ”oep at 'am eeshoo' naṣraya ywit wa.“
ENG: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and saith, Thou also wast with the Nazarene, even Jesus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ.“ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܠܨܘܼܦܵܐ، ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw sreew-leh o meereh, ”le ywin beeda'a o la parmoeye moodee bemara ywaty.“ o pleeṭ-leh lbadar lṣoepa, o qre-leh qarooya.
ENG: But he denied, saying, I neither know, nor understand what thou sayest: and he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܚܵܡܬܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Mindrish khze-laha ileh hay khamta o shoere-laha bemara lanee dtama ywaw, ”oep aha minayhy-yleh.“
ENG: And the maid saw him, and began again to say to them that stood by, This is one of them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܓܒܸܠܝܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܡܙܲܡܬܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: Eena haw mindrish sreew-leh. O min bar khad mitkha anee dkilye ywaw tama meerhoon lshim'oon kepa, ”shareeraeet at minayhy ywit, o oep gbilyaya ywit, sabab hamzamtoekh madoe'e-ylaha.“
ENG: But he again denied it. And after a little while again they that stood by said to Peter, Of a truth thou art one of them; for thou art a Galilaean.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܚܪܘܼܡܹܐ ܘܠܸܡܝܵܝܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: Eena haw shoere-leh lmakhroeme o limyaya, ”le yad'en-laha nasha dhamzoeme ytoon boet dee-eh.“
ENG: But he began to curse, and to swear, I know not this man of whom ye speak.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ. ܘܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana qre-leh qarooya gaha dtartey. O dkheereh shim'oon kepa hemizman deeshoo' dmeera ywa ileh, ”min qam dqare qarooya tartey gahe, bit sarbet-lee tlat gahe.“ o shoere-leh libkhaya.
ENG: And straightway the second time the cock crew. And Peter called to mind the word, how that Jesus said unto him, Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice. And when he thought thereon, he wept.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܥܲܡ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܡ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ.
TRL: Byawma khena bṣapra, soezgirhoon goerane dkahne 'am khwardiqne o 'am sapre o 'am kleh knoeshya, o seerhoon leeshoo' o loebil-lhoon o soepe-lhoon ileh lpeelaṭoos.
ENG: And straightway in the morning the chief priests with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O boeqireh mineh peelaṭoos, ”at eewit malka dyhoedaye?“ o haw joewib-leh o meereh ileh, ”at meeroekh.“
ENG: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering saith unto him, Thou sayest.

ASY: ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܒ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O goerane dkahne qawlee waw 'aloehy braba mindeeane.
ENG: And the chief priests accused him of many things.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܟܡܵܐ ܒܸܩܒ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Mindrish boeqireh mineh peelaṭoos, bemara, ”qamoodee le ywit jawoebe, bikhzaya ywit kma biqwala yna 'aloekh?“
ENG: And Pilate again asked him, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they accuse thee of.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' la joewib-leh oep khda hemizman, hadkha d'oejib-leh peelaṭoos.
ENG: But Jesus no more answered anything; insomuch that Pilate marveled.

ASY: ܒܟܠ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Bkl 'eda eet wa 'adat dshare wa shaleeṭa khad aseera qa 'ama, haw danee ṭalbee waw.
ENG: Now at the feast he used to release unto them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܵܪ̈ܘܿܕܹܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܩܸܛܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ.
TRL: O eet wa khad aseera shimeh bar aba, haw dpeesha ywa dirya gaw beyt aseere 'am maroode, anee dbqiṭla ke 'awdee waw shghoeshya.
ENG: And there was one called Barabbas, lying bound with them that had made insurrection, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܝܵܕܵܐܝܼܬ.
TRL: Moeqwikh-leh kinsha o shoere-leh liṭlaba d'abed wa ilayhy, aykh dke 'abed wa 'yadaeet.
ENG: And the multitude went up and began to ask him to do as he was wont to do unto them.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqireh minayhy peelaṭoos, ”ba'eytoon dshareyn ilawkhoon malka dyhoedaye?“
ENG: And Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܚܸܠܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Sabab ke yade' wa peelaṭoos dmin bakhilanoeta soepe-lhoon goerane dkahne leeshoo'.
ENG: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܘܼܦܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eena goerane dkahne khoepiṭ-lhoon lkinsha dshare wa ilayhy lbar aba.
ENG: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܸܩܪܵܝܹܗ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Mindrish boeqireh minayhy peelaṭoos, ”moodee ba'eytoon d'awden-laha nasha dbiqrayeh ytoon malka dyhoedaye?“
ENG: And Pilate again answered and said unto them, What then shall I do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O anee moeqwikh-lhoon, ”zqoop-leh.“
ENG: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh peelaṭoos, ”moodee beeshta 'weeda-yleh?“ eena anee boesh zawda maqwikhee waw, ”zqoop-leh.“
ENG: And Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out exceedingly, Crucify him.

ASY: ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ. ܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O b'e-leh peelaṭoos d'abed wa dakhee dkinsha basma wa-leh. Shre-leh ilayhy lbar aba, o soepe-leh ilayhy leeshoo' dpaesh mikhya lzqeepa min bar dpeesha ywa mikhya bshawṭe.
ENG: And Pilate, wishing to content the multitude, released unto them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܦܪܵܛܘܿܪܝܼܢ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܵܗ̇ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah naṭoore loebil-lhoon ileh lgaw darta deelaha praṭooreen o qre-lhoon lklaha see'ta.
ENG: And the soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܪܓܘܵܢܵܐ، ܘܓܕܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ.
TRL: O moelbish-lhoon ileh argwana, o gdeel-lhoon kleela dkitwe o moetiw-lhoon bresheh.
ENG: And they clothe him with purple, and plaiting a crown of thorns, they put it on him;

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O shoere-lhoon bidraya shlama 'aloehy, bemara, ”shlama-loekh malka dyhoedaye.“
ENG: and they began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

ASY: ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܙܹܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪܹܫܹܗ، ܘܪܵܝܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܵܪܟܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠ ܒܘܼܪ̈ܟܵܟܲܝܗܝ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ، ܘܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O makhee waw bzela 'al resheh, o rayqee waw 'aloehy, o barkee waw 'al boerkakayhy qamoehy, o saghdee waw-leh.
ENG: And they smote his head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܫܘܼܠܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܓܘܵܢܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dmoeskhirhoon bee-eh, shoelikh-lhoon mineh joele dargwana, o moelbish-lhoon ileh joele dganeh, o poeliṭ-lhoon dpaesh mikhya lzqeepa.
ENG: And when they had mocked him, they took off from him the purple, and put on him his garments. And they lead him out to crucify him.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܵܝܵܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪܘܿܣ ܘܕܪܘܼܦܘܿܣ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܚܪܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܛܵܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Khad nasha qiwreenaya, shimeh shim'oon, baba daliksandroos o droepoos, bi'wara ywa min tama, betaya min khaqla. 'weed-lhoon shoekhra 'aloehy dṭa'en wa lzqeepa deeshoo'.
ENG: And they compel one passing by, Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܓ݂ܘܿܠܬܵܐ، ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܦܘܼܫܸܩܬܵܐ ”ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܩܲܪܩܲܦܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O moete-lhoon ileh lgaghoolta, doeka dpyasha-ylaha poeshiqta ”doeka dqarqapta.“
ENG: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

ASY: ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܚܒ݂ܝܼܛܵܐ ܒܡܘܼܪܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O yoebil-lhoon ileh khamra lishtaya, khweeṭa bmoera. Eena la shte-leh.
ENG: And they offered him wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.

ASY: ܘܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܕܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܸܫܟܹ̈ܐ، ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ.
TRL: O zqeep-lhoon ileh, o poeli' lhoon ljoeloehy bdrayta dpishke, kl khad moodee bit shaqel.
ENG: And they crucify him, and part his garments among them, casting lots upon them, what each should take.

ASY: ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܫܲܥ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: Sa'at dtsha' ywa eeman dmkhe-lhoon ileh lzqeepa.
ENG: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

ASY: ܘܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O kteewta ywa 'ilta dmawteh, ”aha-yleh malka dyhoedaye.“
ENG: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ASY: ܘܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܓܲܝܵܣܹ̈ܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܹܗ ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: O zqeep-lhoon 'ameh trey gayase, khad min yameeneh o khad min simaleh.
ENG: And with him they crucify two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܥܲܡ ܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O peesh-leh toemima ktawa dmeereh, ”'am 'awale peesh-leh khoeshbina.“
ENG: And the Scripture was fulfilled that says, “He was numbered with the transgressors”

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܫܵܥܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܹ̈ܫܲܝܗܝ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܝܵܐ ܣܵܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܒܵܢܝܵܢܹܗ ܒܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O oep anee d'awree waw gadpee waw 'aloehy o sha'shee waw reshayhy o amree waw, ”ya satrana dhaykla o banyaneh btlata yawmane,
ENG: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ha! thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,

ASY: ”ܦܲܨܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܨܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Paṣee ganoekh o ṣlee min zqeepa.“
ENG: save thyself, and come down from the cross.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܚܟܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܥܲܡ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܪܸܩ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Hadkha oep goerane dkahne gakhkee waw khad 'am dhaw khena o 'am sapre o meerhoon, ”lkhene poeriq-leh, eena ganeh le maṣe pariq-laha.
ENG: In like manner also the chief priests mocking him among themselves with the scribes said, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

ASY: ”ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܨܵܠܹܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܲܚ ܘܗܲܡܸܢܲܚ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Msheekha malka deesrayel, shwooq ṣale adeea min zqeepa dkhazakh o haminakh bee-eh.“ oep anee dpeesh-lhoon zqeepe 'ameh maskhiree waw bee-eh.
ENG: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ.
TRL: Kad hwe-laha sa'at dtri'sar, hwe-leh khishka 'al klaha ar'a hal sa'at dtlat.
ENG: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

ASY: ܘܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܹܝܠܝ ܐܹܝܠܝ، ܠܡܵܢܵܐ ܫܒܲܩܬܵܢܝ؟“ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܦܘܼܫܸܩܬܵܐ، ”ܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ، ܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܸܢܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: O bsa'at dtlat moeqwikh-leh eeshoo' bqala rama, bemara, ”eyly eyly, lmana shbaqtany?“ dpyasha-ylaha poeshiqta, ”alahee, alahee, qamoodee shweeqinoekh?“
ENG: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: nashe dkilye ywaw tama meerhoon, ”leleea biqraya-yleh.“
ENG: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elijah.

ASY: ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܣܦܘܼܓܵܐ ܚܲܠܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܙܹܠܵܐ ܕܡܲܫܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܕܚܵܙܲܚ ܐܸܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܘܡܲܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O rkheeṭ-leh khad minayhy o mle-leh ispoega khala o seereh bzela dmashte wa-leh, o meereh, ”shwooqoen dkhazakh in bit ate eleea o maṣle-leh.“
ENG: And one ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let be; let us see whether Elijah cometh to take him down.

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܹܗ.
TRL: Moeqwikh-leh eeshoo' bqala rama o soepya-leh roekheh.
ENG: And Jesus uttered a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

ASY: ܘܣܸܬܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܛܵܐ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܣܵܗܡܹ̈ܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܘܗܲܠ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ.
TRL: O sitra dhaykla peesh-leh preeṭa ltrey sahme, min l'ilil o hal lltikht.
ENG: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: O kad khze-leh rab ima dkilya ywa lkis-leh dakhee moeqwikh-leh eeshoo' o soepya-leh roekheh, meereh, ”shareeraeet aha nasha broona dalaha ywa.“
ENG: And when the centurion, which stood by over against him, saw that he so gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ. ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ، ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܕܝܘܿܣܹܐ، ܘܫܵܠܘܿܡ،
TRL: Eet waw oep bakhtate bikhyara min rikhqa. Minayhy maryam maghdlayta, maryam yima dya'qoow z'oora o dyoose, o shaloom,
ENG: And there were also women beholding from afar: among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

ASY: ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Aynee dte-lhoon bar eeshoo' eeman dhaw gaw gleela ywa, o 'awdee waw khilmat ileh. O raba bakhtate khene dseeq-lhoon 'ameh loorishlim.
ENG: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him; and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ،
TRL: O kad hwe-leh ramsha, sabab eewa yawma dhadarta, deeleh min qam shabta,
ENG: And when even was now come, because it was the Preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܡܬܵܐ، ܡܵܠܘܿܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ، ܕܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܹܗ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: te-leh yawsip, khad nasha min ramta, malookha myoeqra, dbganeh bispara ywa lmalkoeta dalaha. Aha qoeshdireh o 'weereh lkis peelaṭoos o ṭleeb-leh paghra deeshoo'.
ENG: there came Joseph of Arimathaea, a councillor of honourable estate, who also himself was looking for the kingdom of God; and he boldly went in unto Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

ASY: ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ. ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܸܢ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: 'oejib-leh peelaṭoos dhadkha jalde meet-leh. O qre-leh lrab ima o boeqireh mineh din meeta ywa min qam 'dana.
ENG: And Pilate marveled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ.
TRL: Min bar dshmee' leh peelaṭoos min rab ima, yoebil-leh paghra lyawsip.
ENG: And when he learned it of the centurion, he granted the corpse to Joseph.

ASY: ܘܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܟܘܼܪܡܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܢܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܵܝܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ،
TRL: O zweeneh yawsip kitana, o moeṣle-leh lpaghra o koermikh-leh bkitana, o moetiw-leh gaw qawra dnqeera ywa gaw qaya, o moekhdireh kepa 'al tar'a dqawra,
ENG: And he bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been hewn out of a rock; and he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

ASY: ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܣܹܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Maryam maghdlayta, o maryam yima dyoose khze-lhoon ayka peesh-leh moetwa.
ENG: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܫܵܠܘܿܡ، ܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܣܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܵܫܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad 'weeraha shabta, maryam maghdlayta o maryam yima dya'qoow, o shaloom, zweenhoon bisme datee waw o mashkhee waw leeshoo'.
ENG: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.

ASY: ܘܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܕܚܲܕܒܫܲܒܵܐ، ܒܙܪܵܩܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: O bṣapra dkhadbshaba, bzraqa dshimsha, te-lhoon lbeyt qwoera.
ENG: And very early on the first day of the week, they come to the tomb when the sun was risen.

ASY: ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܕܸܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ؟“
TRL: O amree waw gaw ganayhy, ”manee bit makhdir ilan lkepa min tar'a dbeyt qwoera?“
ENG: And they were saying among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the tomb?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܵܐ.
TRL: Eena eeman dkheerhoon khze-lhoon lkepa, deewa goera, moekhdira.
ENG: and looking up, they see that the stone is rolled back: for it was exceeding great.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ، ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܚܘܵܪܬܵܐ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: 'weerhoon lbeyt qwoera o khze-lhoon 'layma teewa min yameena, lweesha lweeshta khwarta, o zdee' lhoon.
ENG: And entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, arrayed in a white robe; and they were amazed.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ. ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ. ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”la zad'eetoon, leeshoo' naṣraya biṭ'aya ytoon, haw dpeesh-leh zqeepa. Qeem-leh, le-yleh lakha. Khzeymoen, aha-ylaha doeka dmoetiw-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Be not amazed: ye seek Jesus, the Nazarene, which hath been crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold, the place where they laid him!

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Eena zemoen o mooroen ltalmeedoehy o lshim'oon kepa, dzeel-leh min qam deeawkhoon lgleela. Tama bit khazeytoon-leh dakhee dmeereh ilawkhoon.“
ENG: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, He goeth before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܒܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܘܪܲܬܪܲܬܬܵܐ، ܘܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon, pleeṭ-lhoon o zeel-lhoon min qawra, b'oejaba o ratratta, o lnasha mindee la meerhoon sabab bizda'a ywaw.
ENG: And they went out, and fled from the tomb; for trembling and astonishment had come upon them: and they said nothing to any one; for they were afraid.

ASY: ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܕܚܲܕܒܫܲܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܦܘܼܠܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bṣapra dkhadbshaba eeman dqeem-leh eeshoo', peesh-leh khizya qamayta lmaryam maghdlayta, hay dpoelṭa ywa minoeha shaw'a shede.
ENG: Now when he was risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven devils.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ ܘܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O hay zeel-laha o meeraha lanee dhwee-e ywaw 'ameh, o anee bi'wada ywaw ta'zee o bibkhaya.
ENG: She went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O eeman dshmee' lhoon dmeeraha khaya-yleh o peesh-leh khizya iloeha, la hoeminhoon.
ENG: And they, when they heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, disbelieved.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar aha, peesh-leh khizya ltrey minayhy bdmoeta kheta, kad bezala lkhda mata.
ENG: And after these things he was manifested in another form unto two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Ane trey zeel-lhoon o moekhbirhoon lanee talmeede khene, o oep ilayhy la hoeminhoon.
ENG: And they went away and told it unto the rest: neither believed they them.

ASY: ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܚܲܕܸܥܣܲܪ ܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ، ܘܠܝܼܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ ܘܠܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ.
TRL: Bkharta peesh-leh khizya lkhadi'sar kad teebe lsoepra, o leemay-leh 'al baṣooroeta dhaymanoetayhy o lqishyoeta dlibayhy dla hoeminhoon lanee dkhze-lhoon ileh qeema.
ENG: And afterward he was manifested unto the eleven themselves as they sat at meat; and he upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙܘܼܢ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen lkleh 'alma o makrizoen ewangaleeoon bklaha breeta.
ENG: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to the whole creation.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܘܥܵܡܹܕ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ،
TRL: ”Haw dhamin o 'amed bit pareq, o haw dla hamin bit paesh deena,
ENG: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that disbelieveth shall be condemned.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ: ܒܸܬ ܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”O anee dhaminee bit 'awdee neeshanqe: bit palṭee shede bshimee, o bit hamzimee blishane khate,
ENG: And these signs shall follow them that believe: in my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܚܘܼܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܣܲܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܫܵܬܝܼ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܚܲܙܕܸܓ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܥܲܠ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܒܵܣܡܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Bit shaqlee khoeawate, o in sama dmawta shatee hich le khazdig-lhoon, o bit matwee eedatayhy 'al mree'e o bit basmee.“
ENG: they shall take up serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall in no wise hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܣܩܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dhoemzim-leh Maran eeshoo' 'amayhy, peesh-leh moesqa lshmaya o teew-leh min yameena dalaha.
ENG: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken unto them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܘܡܵܪܲܢ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܝܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܲܩܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O anee pleeṭ-lhoon o moekriz-lhoon bkl doeka, o Maran ke hayir wa-lhoon o maqwe wa hemizmanayhy bneeshanqe d'awdee waw.
ENG: And they went forth, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܬܲܫܥܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܫܘܼܪܸܪܹܐ ܓܵܘܲܢ،
TRL: Raba joerib-lhoon liktawa tash'eeate d'wade boet anee dpeesh-lhoon mshoerire gawan,
ENG: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to draw up a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Dakhee dsoepe-lhoon ilan anee dmin qamayta sahde o palakhe dhemizman eewaw.
ENG: even as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word,

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܨܘܼܚܨܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܬܝܼܬܵܐܝܼܬ، ܘܚܘܼܦܸܛ ܠܝܼ ܕܟܵܬܒܹܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܪܹܐܙܵܐ، ܝܵܐ ܢܲܨܝܼܚܵܐ ܬܹܐܘܿܦܝܼܠܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab oep ana min qamayta ṣoekhṣe-lee khateetaeet, o khoepiṭ-lee dkatben kl mindee iloekh breza, ya naṣeekha teoopeela,
ENG: it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus;

ASY: ܕܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܬܘܼܠܡܸܕܵܐ.
TRL: Dyad'et shareeroeta danee hemizmane dbee-ayhy peesh-loekh toelmida.
ENG: that thou mightest know the certainty concerning the things wherein thou wast instructed.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܪܓ݂ܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܗܪܘܿܢ، ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ.
TRL: Byawmane dheroodis, malka deehoeda, eet wa khad kahna shimeh zkarya min dargha dkahnoeta dbeyt aweea, o bakhteh min bnate dahroon, shimoeha eleeshba'.
ENG: There was in the days of Herod, king of Judaea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abijah: and he had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elisabeth.

ASY: ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܡܵܐ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܵܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Tirwayhy zadeeqe ywaw qam Alaha, bikhdara dla moema bklayhy poeqdane o qanoone dmarya.
ENG: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܥܩܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena layt waw-lhoon broona, sabab eleeshba' 'qarta ywa, o tirwayhy goere ywaw bshine.
ENG: And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both were now well stricken in years.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܛܲܟ݂ܣܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܹܗ،
TRL: O hwe-laha kad zkarya bi'wada ywa khilmat qam Alaha aykh ṭakhsa dkahnoeteh,
ENG: Now it came to pass, while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his course,

ASY: ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܪܹܐܙܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܸܕ ܒܸܣܡܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Mṭe-laha 'daneh aykh reza dkahnoeta dmaqid bisma, o 'weereh lhaykla dmarya.
ENG: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.

ASY: ܘܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܲܕܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ.
TRL: O kleh kinsha d'ama ṣaloeye ywaw lbadar b'dana dmaqadta dbisma.
ENG: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the hour of incense.

ASY: ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khze-leh zkarya malakha dmarya, kilya min yameena dmadbkha dbisme.
ENG: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

ASY: ܘܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O shgheesh-leh zkarya eeman dkhze-leh lmalakha, o zdoe'ta npeel-laha 'aloehy.
ENG: And Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܡܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܨܠܘܿܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܘܼܟ݂ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܹܝܬ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Eena meereh ileh malakha, ”la zad'et zkarya, sabab peesh-laha shmee'ta ṣlootoekh, o bakhtoekh eleeshba' bit haṣla-loekh broona, o bit qareyt shimeh yookhanan.
ENG: But the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: because thy supplication is heard, and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܦܨܵܚܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܝܼ ܒܡܵܘܠܵܕܹܗ،
TRL: ”Bit hawe-loekh khadoeta o pṣakha, o raba nashe bit khadee bmawladeh,
ENG: And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ. ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܘܫܲܟ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܬܹܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab bit hawe goera qam Marya. Khamra o shakhra le shate, o bit paesh milya min roekha dqoedsha hesh haw bkesa dyimeh.
ENG: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and he shall drink no wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother’s womb.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܸܪ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Bit madir raba min bnay eesrayel lkis Marya alahayhy.
ENG: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn unto the Lord their God.

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܹܪ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܡܲܕܸܪ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܲܨܝܸܬܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܲܪܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܲܕܸܪ ܩܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܓܡܝܼܪܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O bit khader qam Alaha broekha o bkhayla deleea nweea, dmadir liba dawahe lkis bnoone, o anee dle maṣyitee bit madirhoon lparmayta dzadeeqe, o bit hadir qa Marya 'ama gmeera.“
ENG: And he shall go before his face in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to walk in the wisdom of the just; to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܠܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܣܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܝܼ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: meereh zkarya lmalakha, ”dakhee bit yad'en aha? Ana sawa ywin, o bakhtee goerta-ylaha bshine.“
ENG: And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܝܼܹܠ ܕܟܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܝܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡܲܫܚܸܕܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh malakha o meereh ileh, ”ana ywin gawree-el dke kaleyn qam Alaha. Peesh-lee shoedra dhamzimin 'amoekh, o mashkhidinoekh bane.
ENG: And the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and I was sent to speak unto thee, and to bring thee these good tidings.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܫܬܝܼܩܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܬ ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”O min adeea bit haweyt shteeqa, o le maṣeyt hamzimit hal yawma dane hawee, sabab la hoeminoekh lhemizmanee, anee dbit payshee toemime b'danayhy.“
ENG: And behold, thou shalt be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall come to pass, because thou believedst not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.

ASY: ܘܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܘܼܪܩܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ.
TRL: O 'ama bispara ywaw lzkarya, o 'oejib-lhoon d'oerqil-leh gaw haykla.
ENG: And the people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marveled while he tarried in the temple.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܘܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܪܸܡܙܵܐ ܪܵܡܹܙ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dpleeṭ-leh zkarya, la mṣe-leh dhamzim 'amayhy, o dee' lhoon dkhizwa khze-leh gaw haykla, o haw brimza ramez wa ilayhy. O peesh-leh lala.
ENG: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: and he continued making signs unto them, and remained dumb.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬܹܗ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: O eeman dtoemim-lhoon yawmane dkhilmateh, zeel-leh lbayteh.
ENG: And it came to pass, when the days of his ministration were fulfilled, he departed unto his house.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܛܝܼܢܵܗ̇ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܛܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: O hwe-laha min bar anee yawmane bṭeenaha eleeshba' bakhta dzkarya, o ṭoeshya-laha ganoeha khamsha yarkhe, o amra wa,
ENG: And after these days Elisabeth his wife conceived; and she hid herself five months, saying,

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܠܵܘܡܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha 'weed-leh beeee Marya, byawmane dkheereh beeee lishqala lawmee min gaw bnaynasha.“
ENG: Thus hath the Lord done unto me in the days wherein he looked upon me, to take away my reproach among men.

ASY: ܒܝܲܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܝܼܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ،
TRL: Byarkha dishta peesh-leh shoedra malakha gawree-el min lkis Alaha lgleela, lmdeeta shimoeha naṣrat,
ENG: Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

ASY: ܠܟܸܣ ܒܬܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܒܬܵܐ ܠܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܘܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܬܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ.
TRL: Lkis btoelta ṭleebta lgawra shimeh yawsip, min beyt daweed, o shima dbtoelta maryam.
ENG: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin’s name was Mary.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܗ̇ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܡܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ، ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܟ݂ܝ، ܝܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O 'weereh malakha lkis loeha o meereh iloeha, ”shlama lakhy mleeta shapaqat, Marya 'amakhy, ya breekhta gaw bakhtate.“
ENG: And he came in unto her, and said, Hail, thou that art highly favoured, the Lord is with thee.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܚܵܫܒ݂ܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Hay shgheesh-laha bhemizmanoehy, o khashwa wa dmoodee-yleh aha shlama.
ENG: But she was greatly troubled at the saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this might be.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܲܬܝ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: meereh iloeha malakha, ”la zad'aty maryam, sabab moechikh lakhy shapaqat lkis Alaha.
ENG: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܛܢܲܬܝ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܲܨܠܲܬܝ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܝܲܬܝ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: ”Ha bit baṭnaty, o bit haṣlaty broona, o bit qaryaty shimeh eeshoo'.
ENG: And behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ،
TRL: ”O haw bit hawe goera, o broona d'ilaya bit paesh qirya, o bit 'abed-leh Marya Alaha malka 'al bayta ddaweed baboehy,
ENG: He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Most High: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܬܝܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O bit 'abed malkoeta 'al bayta dya'qoow hal 'alam, o lmalkoeteh le hawe tyama.“
ENG: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܠܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܟܲܕ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: meeraha maryam lmalakha, ”dakhee bit hawe aha mindee kad gawra le ywan dee'ta?“
ENG: And Mary said unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܥܲܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܪܹܐ ܥܲܠܵܟ݂ܝ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܵܟ݂ܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh malakha o meereh iloeha, ”roekha dqoedsha bit ate 'alakhy, o khayla d'ilaya bit share 'alakhy. Boet aha haw dpaesh leeda minakhy qadeesha-yleh o broona dalaha bit paesh qirya.
ENG: And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Most High shall overshadow thee: wherefore also that which is to be born shall be called holy, the Son of God.

ASY: ”ܘܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܚܸܙܡܵܟ݂ܝ ܒܛܝܼܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܒܣܲܝܒܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܲܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܩܲܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O ha oep eleeshba' khizmakhy bṭeenta-ylaha broona bsayboeta, o aha yarkha dishta-yleh lhay dke paysha qreeta 'qarta.
ENG: And behold, Elisabeth thy kinswoman, she also hath conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her that was called barren.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab layt mindee 'asqa lkis Alaha.“
ENG: For no word from God shall be void of power.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܹܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ. ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Joewib-laha maryam, bemara, ”ha ana khedamta dmarya. Shwooq hawe-lee aykh hemizmanoekh.“ o zeel-leh malakha min lkis loeha.
ENG: And Mary said, Behold, the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ.
TRL: Banee yawmane qeem-laha maryam, o zeel-laha bjaldoeta lṭoera, lmdeeta deehoed.
ENG: And Mary arose in these days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah;

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ.
TRL: O 'weeraha lbayta dzkarya, o dre-laha shlama leleeshba'.
ENG: and entered into the house of Zacharias and saluted Elisabeth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܓ̰ܘܝܼܓ̰ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܒܟܹܪ݇ܣܘܼܗ̇، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' laha eleeshba' shlama dmaryam, jweej-leh yala bkesoeha, o peesh-laha mleeta min roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: And it came to pass, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost;

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ”ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: Moeqwikh-laha eleeshba' bqala rama o meeraha lmaryam, ”breekhta ywaty gaw bakhtate, o breekhta-ylaha ṭ'oenta dkesakhy.
ENG: and she lifted up her voice with a loud cry, and said, Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܼ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ؟
TRL: ”Dakhee-ylaha aha, dyima dmaree atya lkis-lee?
ENG: And whence is this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come unto me?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܝܼܓ̰ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܒܟܹܪ݇ܣܝܼ.
TRL: ”Sabab eeman dshmee' lee qalakhy, bkhadoeta goerta jweej-leh yala bkesee.
ENG: For behold, when the voice of thy salutation came into mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܡܸܡ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lhay dhoeminaha, sabab Alaha bit tamim hemizmane dhoemzim-leh 'amoeha.“
ENG: And blessed is she that believed; for there shall be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ”ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ،
TRL: meeraha maryam, ”shaboekhe-ylaha ganee lmarya,
ENG: And Mary said, My soul doth magnify the Lord,

ASY: ܘܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܵܪܘܿܩܝܼ،
TRL: O bikhdaya-ylaha roekhee balaha parooqee,
ENG: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܹܕܲܡܬܹܗ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܝܼ ܠܝܼ ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”Sabab kheereh bmakeekhoeta dkhedamteh, o min adeea klayhy sharbate bit qaree-lee breekhta,
ENG: For he hath looked upon the low estate of his handmaiden: For behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܠܬܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܹܗ،
TRL: ”Sabab haw deeleh khayltana 'weed-leh ilee mindeeane goere, qadeesha-yleh shimeh,
ENG: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things; And holy is his name.

ASY: ”ܪ̈ܲܚܡܘܼܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܵܘܪܵܐ ܠܕܵܘܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܙܵܕܥܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Rakhmoehy min dawra ldawra yna 'al anee dzad'ee mineh.
ENG: And his mercy is unto generations and generations On them that fear him.

ASY: ”ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܓܲܢ݇ܒܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܕܪܲܥܢܹܗ، ܘܒܘܼܪܒܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܲܒ݂ܗܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܒܚܘܼܫܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”'weed-leh gabaroeta bdra'neh, o boerbiz-leh lshawhirane bkhoeshabe dlibayhy.
ENG: He hath shewed strength with his arm; He hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their heart.

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܢܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܲܢ݇ܒܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܘܼܪ̈ܣܝܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܟܝܼܟܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Moenpil-leh lgabare min koersyayhy, o moerim-leh lmakeeke.
ENG: He hath put down princes from their thrones, And hath exalted them of low degree.

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܣܒܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܦܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܲܬܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܣܦܝܼܩܹܐ.
TRL: ”Moesbi' leh lkpeene bṭawate, o 'ateere shoedray-leh speeqe.
ENG: The hungry he hath filled with good things; And the rich he hath sent empty away.

ASY: ”ܗܘܼܝܸܪܹܗ ܠܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܪܹܓܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܘܼܗܝ،
TRL: ”Hoeyireh leesrayel regeh kad dkheereh rakhmoehy,
ENG: He hath holpen Israel his servant, That he might remember mercy

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܢ̈، ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܥܲܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”Dakhee dhoemzim-leh 'am babawatan, 'am awraham o 'am bnoonoehy l'alam.“
ENG: (As he spake unto our fathers) Toward Abraham and his seed for ever.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ، ܘܕܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O peesh-laha maryam lkis eleeshba' aykh tlata yarkhe, o deeraha lbaytoeha.
ENG: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned unto her house.

ASY: ܘܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܫܒܲܥ، ܘܝ݇ܠܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: O mṭe-leh zawna dhaṣla wa eleeshba', o leed-laha broona.
ENG: Now Elisabeth’s time was fulfilled that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܘܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܕܡܘܼܙܝܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇، ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Kad shmee' lhoon shwawoeha o khizmanoeha dmoezyid-leh Marya rakhme 'aloeha, khde-lhoon 'amoeha.
ENG: And her neighbours and her kinsfolk heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her; and they rejoiced with her.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܓܙܵܪܵܐ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O hwe-laha byawma dtmanya, zeel-lhoon ligzara lyala, o b'e-lhoon dmatwee-leh shimeh zkarya, bshima dbaboehy.
ENG: And it came to pass on the eighth day, that they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.“
TRL: Eena yimeh joewib-laha, bemara, ”la aha shima, ila paesh qirya yookhanan.“
ENG: And his mother answered and said, Not so; but he shall be called John.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܵܟ݂ܝ̈ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ.“
TRL: meerhoon iloeha, ”layt nasha gaw khizmanakhy baha shima.“
ENG: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.

ASY: ܘܪܡܝܼܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܕܡܲܕܸܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ.
TRL: O rmeez-lhoon lbaboehy dmadi' wa moodee ba'e dpaesh qirya yala.
ENG: And they made signs to his father, what he would have him called.

ASY: ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܠܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܹܗ.“ ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Ṭleeb-leh loekha, o kteew-leh o meereh, ”yookhanan eeleh shimeh.“ o 'oejib-lhoon klayhy.
ENG: And he asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they marveled all.

ASY: ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܵܢܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O bhay 'dana pteekh-leh poemeh o shre-leh lishaneh o shoebikh-leh lalaha.
ENG: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue loosed, and he spake, blessing God.

ASY: ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܹܐ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ.
TRL: Zdee' lhoon klayhy dbi'mara ywaw lkhadirwanayhy, o ane mindeeane payshee waw hoemzime bkleh ṭoera deehoed.
