ENG: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ؟“ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O klayhy anee dsham'ee waw khashwee waw blibayhy o amree waw, ”dakhee bit hawe aha yala?“ sabab eeda dmarya 'aloehy ywa.
ENG: And all that heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, What then shall this child be? For the hand of the Lord was with him.

ASY: ܘܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܘܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: O zkarya baboehy peesh-leh milya min roekha dqoedsha, o noebe-leh o meereh,
ENG: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,

ASY: ”ܡܒܘܼܪܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܕܣܘܼܚܒܸܪܹܗ ܠܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Mboerkha-yleh Marya Alaha deesrayel, dsoekhbireh l'ameh, o hoedireh ileh poerqana.
ENG: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel; For he hath visited and wrought redemption for his people,

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܪܹܓܹܗ،
TRL: Moeqim-leh ilan khayla dpoerqana, min bayta ddaweed regeh,
ENG: And hath raised up a horn of salvation for us In the house of his servant David

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܠܲܡ،
TRL: Aykh dhoemzim-leh bpoema dnweeoehy qadeeshe dmin 'alam,
ENG: (As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets which have been since the world began),

ASY: ܕܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܲܢ̈، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܵܢܝܵܢܲܢ̈.
TRL: Dpariq lan min dishminan, o min eeda dklayhy sanyanan.
ENG: Salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܢ̈، ܘܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܘܲܥܕܹܗ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ.
TRL: 'weed-leh rakhme 'al babawatan, o dkheereh lwa'deh qadeesha.
ENG: To shew mercy towards our fathers, And to remember his holy covenant;

ASY: ܘܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܵܘܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ،
TRL: O dkheereh lmawmate dme-leh lbaban awraham,
ENG: The oath which he sware unto Abraham our father,

ASY: ܕܒܸܬ ܦܲܨܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܕܸܫܡܸܢܲܢ̈، ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ،
TRL: Dbit paṣe lan min eeda ddishminan, o bit 'awdakh khilmat ileh dla zdoe'ta,
ENG: To grant unto us that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies Should serve him without fear,

ASY: ܒܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܪܲܚ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܲܢ̈.
TRL: Bqadeeshoeta o bzadeeqoeta bit khadrakh qamoehy klayhy yawmanan.
ENG: In holiness and righteousness before him all our days.

ASY: ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܪܹܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܗܲܕܪܸܬ ܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: O at yala, nweea d'ilaya bit payshet qirya, sabab bit khadret qam Marya, o hadrit oerkhateh.
ENG: Yea and thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Most High: For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to make ready his ways;

ASY: ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: Dyabet da'ta dpoerqana l'ama bpoekhala dkhṭeeatayhy,
ENG: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people In the remission of their sins,

ASY: ܒܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܘܚܢܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܲܢ، ܕܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܪܹܐ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܙܪܵܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܘܡܵܐ،
TRL: Brakhme o khnana dalahan, dbee-ayhy bit share 'alan zraqa min rawma,
ENG: Because of the tender mercy of our God, Whereby the dayspring from on high shall visit us,

ASY: ܠܒܲܗܪܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܒܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܘܒܛܸܠܵܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܠܡܗܲܕܘܼܝܹܐ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܲܢ̈ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܫܠܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Lbahroene lanee deena teebe bkhishka o bṭilanyate dmawta, lmhadoeye aqlatan boerkha dshlama.“
ENG: To shine upon them that sit in darkness and the shadow of death; To guide our feet into the way of peace.

ASY: ܘܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܘܚܘܼܠܸܢܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ. ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܡܲܚܙܵܝܬܹܗ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: O goerwis-leh yala o khoelineh broekha. O hwe-leh gaw bareea hal yawma dmakhzayteh lbnay eesrayel.
ENG: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܓ݂ܘܼܣܛܘܿܣ ܩܹܣܲܪ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܬܸܒܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: Banee yawmane pleeṭ-leh poeqdana min aghoesṭoos qesar dpayshee moektibe klayhy nashe dmalkoeteh.
ENG: Now it came to pass in those days, there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be enrolled.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܟܬܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܘܿܣ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܒܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Aha maktawta qamayta hwe-laha b'dana dqiwreenoos eewa shaleeṭa bsoereea.
ENG: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܡܲܟܬܸܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O zeel-leh kl nasha lmdeeta dganeh dmaktiw wa.
ENG: And all went to enroll themselves, every one to his own city.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ، ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O seeq-leh oep yawsip min naṣrat, mdeeta dgleela, leehoed, lmdeeta ddaweed, dpyasha-ylaha qreeta beytlkhim, sabab min bayta o sharbta ddaweed eewa.
ENG: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David;

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܟܬܸܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܛܠܝܼܒܬܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܛܝܼܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: zeel-leh dmaktiw wa tama 'am maryam ṭleebteh kad hay bṭeenta.
ENG: to enroll himself with Mary, who was betrothed to him, being great with child.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O hwe-laha kad anee tama ywaw mṭe-lhoon yawmane dhaṣla wa.
ENG: And it came to pass, while they were there, the days were fulfilled that she should be delivered.

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܠܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܗ̇ ܒܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܟܘܼܪܡܸܟ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܒܲܢܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܐܘܼܪܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܫܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O leed-laha broonoeha boekhra, o koermikh-laha ileh bbande, o moetiw-laha boere, sabab layt waw-lhoon doeka gaw mashrya.
ENG: And she brought forth her firstborn son; and she wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪ̈ܵܥܝܹܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ ܒܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܒܲܕܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܸܣܩܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O eet waw ra'ye bhay doeka shirye bkhaqla, binṭara badle dlayle 'al pisqayhy.
ENG: And there were shepherds in the same country abiding in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܗܪܸܢܵܗ̇ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: O ha malakha dmarya te-leh lkis layhy, o tishbookhta dmarya boehrinaha lkhadirwanayhy, o zdee' lhoon zdoe'ta goerta.
ENG: And an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܵܐ ܡܲܫܚܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy malakha, ”la zad'eetoon, sabab ha mashkhoede ywin ilawkhoon khadoeta goerta dbit hawya lkleh 'alma.
ENG: And the angel said unto them, Be not afraid; for behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy which shall be to all the people:

ASY: ”ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܦܵܪܘܿܩܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Peesh-leh leeda ilawkhoon idyoom yawma gaw mdeeta ddaweed, parooqa, haw deeleh msheekha Marya.
ENG: for there is born to you this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܟܘܼܪܡܸܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܒܲܢܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܹܐ.“
TRL: ”O aha-yleh neeshanqa ilawkhoon: bit machkheetoon yala koermikha bbande, o moetwa boere.“
ENG: And this is the sign unto you; Ye shall find a babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, and lying in a manger.

ASY: ܘܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: O minshiltane peesh-lhoon khizye 'am malakha khaylawate dshmaya raba, shaboekhe lalaha o bemara,
ENG: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,

ASY: ”ܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܡܪ̈ܵܘܡܹܐ، ܘܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܘܣܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Tishbookhta lalaha bamrawme, o 'al ar'a shlama o sawra ṭawa lbnaynasha.“
ENG: Glory to God in the highest, And on earth peace among men in whom he is well pleased.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪ̈ܵܥܝܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܗܲܠ ܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ، ܘܚܵܙܲܚ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܲܕܸܥ ܠܲܢ.“
TRL: Hwe-laha kad zeel-lhoon min lkis layhy malake lshmaya, hoemzim-lhoon ra'ye khad 'am dhaw khena, o meerhoon, ”azakh hal beytlkhim, o khazakh-laha mindee dhwe-leh, aykh dmarya qam madi' lan.“
ENG: And it came to pass, when the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing that is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܘܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܘܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܹܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon bjaldoeta o khze-lhoon lmaryam o lyawsip, o lyala moetwa boere.
ENG: And they came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the babe lying in the manger.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ.
TRL: O eeman dkhze-lhoon, moedi' lhoon mindee dpeesh-leh hoemzima ilayhy boet aha yala.
ENG: And when they saw it, they made known concerning the saying which was spoken to them about this child.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܪ̈ܵܥܝܹܐ.
TRL: O klayhy anee dshmee' lhoon 'oejib-lhoon boet mindeeane dpeesh-lhoon meere ilayhy min ra'ye.
ENG: And all that heard it wondered at the things which were spoken unto them by the shepherds.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܢܵܛܪܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܬܲܚܡܸܢܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Eena maryam naṭra wa klayhy ane hemizmane, o takhmina wa boet dee-ayhy bliboeha.
ENG: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.

ASY: ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܪ̈ܵܥܝܹܐ ܟܲܕ ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܡܲܐܣܘܼܩܹܐ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Deerhoon anee ra'ye kad shaboekhe o masoeqe shoewkhe lalaha boet kl mindee dkhze-lhoon o dshmee' lhoon, dakhee dpeesh-leh meera ilayhy byad malakha.
ENG: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, even as it was spoken unto them.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dtoemim-lhoon tmanya yawmane dpaesh gzeera yala, qre-lhoon shimeh eeshoo', dakhee dpeesha ywa qirya byad malakha min qam dpaesh wa bṭeena bkesa.
ENG: And when eight days were fulfilled for circumcising him, his name was called JESUS, which was so called by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܲܟ݂ܵܝܬܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܡܘܼܐܣܸܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Kad toemim-lhoon yawmane ddakhaytayhy aykh namoosa dmoeshe, moesiq-lhoon ileh loorishlim dmaqriwee-leh qam Marya.
ENG: And when the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ: ܟܠ ܐܘܼܪܙܵܐ ܒܸܪܝܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa bnamoosa dmarya: kl oerza birya qamaya, qadeesha dmarya bit paesh qirya.
ENG: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord),

ASY: ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ: ܚܲܕ ܙܵܘܓܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪ̈ܓܘܼܡܹܐ، ܝܲܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܙܲܥܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ.
TRL: O hadkha moeqriw-lhoon diwkha, dakhee deeleh meera bnamoosa dmarya: khad zawga dgoergoeme, yan trey za'ye dyawna.
ENG: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܹܐܢܵܐ ܘܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha gaw oorishlim, shimeh shim'oon, nasha kena o zadeeqa ywa, o bispara ywa lyabalta dliba deesrayel, o roekha dqoedsha 'aloehy ywa.
ENG: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and this man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Spirit was upon him.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O peesha ywa gilya ileh broekha dqoedsha dle khaze mawta hal dkhaze msheekha dmarya.
ENG: And it had been revealed unto him by the Holy Spirit, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܕܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܒ݂ܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܩܝܼܕܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Aha te-leh lhaykla mhoedya broekha, b'dana dma'woere ywaw awahe deeshoo' lyala d'awdee ileh dakhee dpeesha-yleh pqeeda bnamoosa.
ENG: And he came in the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, that they might do concerning him after the custom of the law,

ASY: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܠܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܥܲܠ ܕܪ̈ܲܥܢܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Shqeel-leh shim'oon lyala 'al dra'nanoehy, o shoebikh-leh lalaha, o meereh,
ENG: then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܫܩܘܿܠ ܠܪܹܓܘܼܟ݂ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Ya Marya, adeea shqool lregoekh bshlama aykh hemizmanoekh,
ENG: Now lettest thou thy servant depart, O Lord, According to thy word, in peace;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܝܢܝܼ̈ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: Sabab khze-lhoon 'aynee poerqanoekh,
ENG: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ،
TRL: Haw dhoediroekh qam 'ayne dkleh 'alma,
ENG: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all peoples;

ASY: ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܗܪܸܢ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.“
TRL: Bahra dbahrin limwate, o khiqra l'amoekh eesrayel.“
ENG: A light for revelation to the Gentiles, And the glory of thy people Israel.

ASY: ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Yawsip o maryam 'oejib-lhoon bane dpeesh-lhoon meere boet dee-eh.
ENG: And his father and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him;

ASY: ܒܘܼܪܟܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܢܦܵܠܬܵܐ ܘܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܠܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܲܪܵܨܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: Boerkay-leh shim'oon, o meereh lmaryam yima dyala, ”aha yala moetwa-yleh qa npalta o qyamta draba gaw bnay eesrayel, o lneeshanqa dmaqaraṣoeta,
ENG: and Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the falling and rising up of many in Israel; and for a sign which is spoken against;

ASY: ”ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܓܸܠܝܹܐ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܸܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܪܘܼܡܚܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: ”Dpayshee gilye khoeshabe draba libawate, o roemkha bit 'awra bganakhy.“
ENG: yea and a sword shall pierce through thine own soul; that thoughts out of many hearts may be revealed.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܢܵܐ، ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܦܢܘܼܐܹܝܠ، ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܵܐ ܕܐܵܫܹܝܪ، ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܒܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܝܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܒܲܥ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܬܘܼܠܘܼܬܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O eet wa khda nweeta shimoeha khana, brata dpnoeeyl, min shawṭa dasheyr, goerta bshine o khye-laha shba' shine 'am gawroeha ha min btoeloetoeha.
ENG: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,

ASY: ܗܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܬܡܵܢܝܼ ܘܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܒܨܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܡܵܡܵܐ ܘܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ،
TRL: Hweeta ywa armilta qoerba ltmanee o arba' shine, o bkl 'dana hawya wa gaw haykla bṣawma o bṣloota, o bisghada beemama o blayle,
ENG: and she had been a widow even for fourscore and four years), which departed not from the temple, worshipping with fastings and supplications night and day.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܝ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Oep hay kle-laha bhay 'dana o shoebikh-laha lalaha, o hamzima wa boet eeshoo' 'am klayhy anee dbispara ywaw lpoerqana doorishlim.
ENG: And coming up at that very hour she gave thanks unto God, and spake of him to all them that were looking for the redemption of Jerusalem.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܠܢܵܨܪܲܬ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kad toemim-lhoon kl mindee aykh namoosa dmarya, deerhoon lgleela, lnaṣrat mdeetayhy.
ENG: And when they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.

ASY: ܘܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܚܘܼܠܸܢܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ، ܘܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O yala goerwis-leh, o khoelineh broekha, o peesh-leh milya khikhmta, o shapaqat dmarya 'aloehy ywa.
ENG: And the child grew, and waxed strong, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.

ASY: ܒܟܠ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܩܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ.
TRL: Bkl sheta awahe deeshoo' ke azee waw loorishlim qa 'eda dpiṣkha.
ENG: And his parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the passover.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܲܪ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܵܕܲܬ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh eeshoo' bar tri'sar shine, seeq-lhoon l'eda maykh 'adat.
ENG: And when he was twelve years old, they went up after the custom of the feast;

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ. ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܝܸܡܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: O eeman dtoemim-lhoon yawmane d'eda deerhoon yawsip o maryam, o eeshoo' yala peesh-leh gaw oorishlim. Yawsip o yimeh la dee' lhoon bee-eh,
ENG: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and his parents knew it not;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܲܡ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܛܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܓܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: Sabab khsheew-lhoon d'am khawrawateh ywa. te-lhoon oerkha dkhad yawma, o ṭ'e-lhoon bareh gaw khizmanayhy o gaw anee dyad'ee waw-lhoon,
ENG: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey; and they sought for him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance:

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O la moechikh-lhoon ileh. Deerhoon mindrish loorishlim biṭ'aya bareh.
ENG: and when they found him not, they returned to Jerusalem, seeking for him.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܲܩܘܼܪܲܝ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O min bar tlata yawmane, moechikh-lhoon ileh gaw haykla, teewa gaw malpane, bishma'a ilayhy, o baqoeray boeqare.
ENG: And it came to pass, after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions:

ASY: ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܹܗ ܘܒܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: 'Ajbee waw bkhikhmteh o bjoewaboehy klayhy anee dsham'ee waw-leh.
ENG: and all that heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܘܝܸܡܹܗ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܸܡܹܗ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܼܲܢ؟ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܘܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܲܢ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Eeman dbaboehy o yimeh khze-lhoon ileh 'oejib-lhoon. O meeraha ileh yimeh, ”broonee, qamoodee hadkha 'weed-loekh bee-an? Ana o baboekh joenjiran biṭ'aya baroekh.“
ENG: And when they saw him, they were astonished: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I sought thee sorrowing.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܢ؟“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qamoodee biṭ'aya ytoon waw baree? Le yad'eetoon waw dgaw bayta dbabee wale-ylaha dhaweyn?“
ENG: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be in my Father’s house?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena anee la poerme-lhoon aha mindee dmeereh ilayhy.
ENG: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

ASY: ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܵܨܪܲܬ، ܘܟܹܐ ܫܵܠܹܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܘܝܸܡܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܢܵܛܪܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O ṣle-leh 'amayhy o te-leh lnaṣrat, o ke shalem wa ilayhy. O yimeh ke naṭra wa klayhy hemizmane bliboeha.
ENG: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth; and he was subject unto them: and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

ASY: ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܲܪܘܘܼܣܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܩܵܘܡܬܵܐ ܘܒܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ، ܘܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O eeshoo' garwoese ywa bqawmta o bkhikhmta, o bshapaqat qam Alaha o bnaynasha.
ENG: And Jesus advanced in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and men.

ASY: ܒܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܡܫܲܥܣܲܪ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܛܹܒܲܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܩܹܣܲܪ، ܘܦܵܢܛܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܛܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ ܘܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܛܪܵܟ݂ܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܠܘܼܣܵܢܝܵܐ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܒ݂ܝܼܠܝܼܢܹܐ،
TRL: Bsheta dkhamsha'sar eewa lmalkoeta dṭebareeoos qesar, o panṭeeoos peelaṭoos shaleeṭa deehoed eewa, o heroodis ṭiṭrarka dgleela, o peeleepoos akhoonoehy ṭiṭrarka deeṭoereea o atra dṭrakhoona, o loesanya ṭiṭrarka daweeleene,
ENG: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,

ASY: ܘܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: O b'dana dkhanan o qayapa goere dkahne ywaw, hwe-laha hemizman dalaha 'al yookhanan broona dzkarya gaw bareea.
ENG: in the high-priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܘܬܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O te-leh bkleh atra dkhadirwane dyoordnan, makroeze ma'moodeeta dtyawoeta lpoekhala dkhṭeeate, dnashe payshee 'meede o tawibee dpayshee shweeqe khṭeeatayhy.
ENG: And he came into all the region round about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance unto remission of sins;

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ: ܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ: ”ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܡܲܫܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Dakhee deeleh kteewa bktawa desha'ya nweea, bemara: qala biqraya gaw bareea: ”hadroen oerkha dmarya, o mashweymoen shweeloehy.
ENG: as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make ye ready the way of the Lord, Make his paths straight.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܪ̈ܵܘܘܿܠܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܘܪ̈ܘܼܡܝܵܬܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܸܦܹܐ، ܦܟ̰ܝܼܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܘܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܸܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Klayhy rawoole bit payshee milye, o klayhy ṭoerane o roemyate bit payshee moekipe, pcheela bit paesh troeṣa, o doeka 'asqa bit hawya aykh dishta.
ENG: Every valley shall be filled, And every mountain and hill shall be brought low; And the crooked shall become straight, And the rough ways smooth;

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O kl nasha bit khaze poerqana dalaha.“
ENG: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

ASY: ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܥܡܵܕܵܐ، ”ܙܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܕܐܵܟܸܕܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇؟
TRL: O yookhanan amer wa lkinshe dbetaya ywaw lkis-leh li'mada, ”zar'e dakidne, manee meereh ilawkhoon d'arqeetoon min karba dbetaya-ylaha?
ENG: He said therefore to the multitudes that went out to be baptized of him, Ye offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

ASY: ”ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܫܚܝܼ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ. ܠܵܐ ܫܲܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܘܲܚ،‘ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ.
TRL: ”'woodoen ṭ'oenyate dkhashkhee ltyawoeta. La shareytoon lemara bganawkhoon, ’akhnan bnoone dawraham eewakh,‘ sabab bemara ywin ilawkhoon, ke maṣe Alaha min ane kepe maqim bnoone lawraham.
ENG: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܢܲܪܥܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ. ܟܠ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܵܥܹܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܘܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ha nar'a moetwa-yleh 'al 'iqra deelana. Kl eelana dla ṭa'en ṭ'oenyate ṭabe, ke paesh preema o dirya bnoera.“
ENG: And even now is the axe also laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh kinshe, bemara, ”moodee 'awdakh?“
ENG: And the multitudes asked him, saying, What then must we do?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܨܘܼܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh yookhanan o meereh ilayhy, ”man deet-leh tartey ṣoedrate yabil lman dlayt-leh, o man deet-leh mekhoelta yabil lman dlayt-leh.“
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath food, let him do likewise.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟“
TRL: te-lhoon makhse dpayshee waw 'meede bee-eh, o meerhoon ileh, ”malpana, moodee 'awdakh?“
ENG: And there came also publicans to be baptized, and they said unto him, Master, what must we do?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܩܝܼܕܹܐ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ.“
TRL: O haw joewib-leh ilayhy, ”la shaqleetoon mindee zawda min dpeeshe ytoon pqeede lishqala.“
ENG: And he said unto them, Extort no more than that which is appointed you.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܝܸܨܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ. ܘܗܵܩܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܡܵܠܝܵܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh dakhshe, bemara, ”o akhnan moodee 'awdakh?“ joewib-leh ilayhy, ”lnasha la malyiṣeetoon, o lnasha la yaweetoon sahdoeta ddoegla. O haqawkhoon hawe malyana ilawkhoon.“
ENG: And soldiers also asked him, saying, And we, what must we do? And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither exact anything wrongfully; and be content with your wages.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ،
TRL: O kad bispara ywaw 'ama, klayhy bikhshawa ywaw dqawma haw eeleh msheekha,
ENG: And as the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether haply he were the Christ;

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܬܲܣܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ. ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh yookhanan o meereh ilayhy, ”ana ma'moede ywin ilawkhoon bmeea, eena haw dbetaya-yleh min bar minee boesh khaylana-yleh minee, haw dana le khashkhen dshareyn tasmate dṣawloehy. Haw bit ma'mid lawkhoon broekha dqoedsha o bnoera.
ENG: John answered, saying unto them all, I indeed baptize you with water; but there cometh he that is mightier than I, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:

ASY: ܪܘܼܦ̮ܫܬܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܒܸܬ ܕܲܟܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܐܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܗ، ܘܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܟܲܦܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܢܒܵܪ̈ܘܼܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܸܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܟ̰ܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: Roewshta beedeh-ylaha, o bit dake-lhoon bidrateh, o khiṭe bit kapish-lhoon banbaroehy, eena tiwna bit maqid-leh gaw noera dle chame'.“
ENG: whose fan is in his hand, throughly to cleanse his threshing-floor, and to gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: O oep raba mindeeane khene malip wa o makriz wa l'ama.
ENG: With many other exhortations therefore preached he good tidings unto the people;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܢܟܸܣܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: Eena heroodis ṭiṭrarka kad peesha ywa moenkisa bee-eh boet heroodeea bakhta dpeeleepoos akhoonoehy, o boet beeshate khene d'abed wa,
ENG: but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother’s wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done,

ASY: ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ: ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Moezyid-leh oep aha lklayhy: dre-leh lyookhanan gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ ܫܡܲܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Hwe-laha kad 'meed-leh kleh 'ama, oep eeshoo' peesh-leh 'meeda. O kad ṣaloeye ywa, peesh-lhoon pteekhe shmaye.
ENG: Now it came to pass, when all the people were baptized, that, Jesus also having been baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,

ASY: ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܫܡܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ، ܘܩܵܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O ṣle-leh 'aloehy roekha dqoedsha bdmoeta dgoeshma dyawna, o qala hwe-leh min shmaya, bemara, ”at eewit broonee moekhiba dbee-eh bseem-laha-lee.“
ENG: and the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily form, as a dove, upon him, and a voice came out of heaven, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.

ASY: ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܲܪ ܬܠܵܬܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܠܡܲܬܹܗ، ܒܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܗܹܠܝܼ،
TRL: O eeshoo' aykh bar tlatee shine ywa, eeman dshoere-leh khilmateh, bihwaya, aykh dpaesh wa khsheewa, broona dyawsip, broona dhelee,
ENG: And Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years of age, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܛܬܲܬ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܠܹܘܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܐܢܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ،
TRL: Broona dmaṭtat, broona dlewee, broona dmalkee, broona dyanee, broona dyawsip,
ENG: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܬܲܬܝܼܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܘܿܨ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܣܠܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܓܝܼ،
TRL: Broona dmattateea, broona d'amooṣ, broona dnakhoom, broona dkhaslee, broona dnagee,
ENG: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܐܲܬ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܛܲܬ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܲܡܥܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ،
TRL: Broona dmaat, broona dmaṭat, broona dsham'ee, broona dyawsip, broona deehoeda,
ENG: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܪܵܣܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܙܘܼܪܒܵܒܹܠ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܹܠܲܬܐܹܝܠ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܹܪܝܼ،
TRL: Broona dyookhanan, broona drasa, broona dzoerbabel, broona dshelateyl, broona dneree,
ENG: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܕܲܝ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܩܘܿܣܵܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܡܘܿܕܵܕ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܥܝܼܪ،
TRL: Broona dmalkee, broona daday, broona dqoosam, broona dalmoodad, broona d'eer,
ENG: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܣܹܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܥܵܙܲܪ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܵܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܬܲܬ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܠܹܘܝܼ،
TRL: Broona dyoose, broona delee'azar, broona dyooram, broona dmattat, broona dlewee,
ENG: the son of Jesus, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܵܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܸܠܝܵܩܝܼܡ،
TRL: Broona dshim'oon, broona deehoeda, broona dyawsip, broona dyooram, broona dilyaqeem,
ENG: the son of Symeon, the son of Judas, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܝܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܐܢܝܼ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܛܬܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܬܵܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ،
TRL: Broona dmalya, broona dmanee, broona dmaṭta, broona dnatan, broona ddaweed,
ENG: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܫܲܝ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܥܘܿܒ݂ܝܼܕ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܥܵܙ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܣܲܠܡܘܿܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܸܚܫܘܿܢ،
TRL: Broona deeshay, broona d'ooweed, broona dba'az, broona dsalmoon, broona dnikhshoon,
ENG: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܝܼܢܵܕܵܒ݂، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܪܵܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܨܪܘܿܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܦܲܪܨ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ،
TRL: Broona d'ameenadaw, broona daram, broona dkhiṣroon, broona dparṣ, broona deehoeda,
ENG: the son of Amminadab, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܚ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܚܘܿܪ،
TRL: Broona dya'qoow, broona deeskhaq, broona dawraham, broona dtarkh, broona dnakhoor,
ENG: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܣܵܪܘܿܓ݂، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܘܿ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܦܵܠܵܓ݂، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܵܪ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܵܠܵܚ،
TRL: Broona dsaroogh, broona dar'oo, broona dpalagh, broona d'awar, broona dshalakh,
ENG: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܩܲܝܢܵܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܦܲܟ݂ܫܵܕ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܹܝܡ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܘܿܚ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܠܲܡܟ،
TRL: Broona dqaynan, broona darpakhshad, broona dsheym, broona dnookh, broona dlamk,
ENG: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܘܼܫܠܲܚ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܢܘܿܟ݂، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܪܕ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܗܠܵܠܵܐܹܝܠ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܩܲܝܢܵܢ،
TRL: Broona dmatoeshlakh, broona dkhnookh, broona dyard, broona dmahlalaeyl, broona dqaynan,
ENG: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,

ASY: ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܘܿܫ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܹܝܬ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܕܵܡ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Broona danoosh, broona dsheyt, broona dadam, dmin Alaha.
ENG: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

ASY: ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ،
TRL: Deereh eeshoo' min yoordnan milya min roekha dqoedsha, o loebil-leh ileh roekha lbareea,
ENG: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness

ASY: ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ. ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܟܦܝܼܢܹܗ.
TRL: Arb'ee yawmane peesh-leh joerba min akelqarṣa. La kheel-leh mindee banee yawmane, o eeman dtoemim-lhoon, bkharta kpeeneh.
ENG: during forty days, being tempted of the devil. And he did eat nothing in those days: and when they were completed, he hungered.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܦܩܘܿܕ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh akelqarṣa, ”in broona dalaha ywit, pqood-laha kepa dhawe lakhma.“
ENG: And the devil said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, command this stone that it become bread.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”kteewa-yleh: le-ylaha blakhma akhchee dke khaye barnasha, ila bkl hemizman dalaha.“
ENG: And Jesus answered unto him, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܣܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܟܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܪܝܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: O moesiq-leh ileh akelqarṣa lṭoera rama, o moekhze-leh ileh klayhy malkwate dar'a b'dana kreeta,
ENG: And he led him up, and shewed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܘܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ، ܘܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ،
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”iloekh bit yaben kleh aha shoelṭana o khiqra dane malkwate, sabab ilee peesha-yleh soepya, o lman dba'eyn bit yabeneh,
ENG: And the devil said unto him, To thee will I give all this authority, and the glory of them: for it hath been delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܟܵܝܦܹܬ ܘܣܵܓ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”In kaypet o saghdet ilee, iloekh bit yabeneh kleh.“
ENG: If thou therefore wilt worship before me, it shall all be thine.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܹܬ، ܘܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' joewib-leh ileh, ”kteewa-yleh: lmarya alahoekh saghdet, o ileh bnawsheh 'awdet khilmat.“
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto him, It is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܸܢܦܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܪܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ،
TRL: Haygah loebil-leh ileh saṭana loorishlim, o moekle-leh ileh 'al kinpa dhaykla, o meereh ileh, ”in at broona dalaha ywit, rapee-laha ganoekh lltikht,
ENG: And he led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܒܸܬ ܦܵܩܹܕ ܠܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Sabab kteewa-yleh: bit paqed lmalakhoehy dnaṭree-loekh,
ENG: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee, to guard thee:

ASY: ܘܥܲܠ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܢܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܕܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܩܸܠܵܐ ܒܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܲܩܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O 'al eedatayhy bit ṭa'nee-loekh, dla tarqila bkepa aqloekh.“
ENG: and, On their hands they shall bear thee up, Lest haply thou dash thy foot against a stone.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܪܒܸܬ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' joewib-leh o meereh ileh, ”kteewa-yleh: la jarbit lmarya alahoekh.“
ENG: And Jesus answering said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓ̰ܘܼܪ̈ܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ.
TRL: O kad preeq-leh akelqarṣa min klayhy joeraboehy, shweeq-leh leeshoo' qa khad zawna.
ENG: And when the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him for a season.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܡܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܘܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܹܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeshoo' deereh lgleela bkhayla droekha, o peesh-laha shmee'ta boet dee-eh bkleh atra o bklayhy gebane.
ENG: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and a fame went out concerning him through all the region round about.

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O ke malip wa gaw knoeshyatayhy, o ke paesh wa khqeera min kl nasha.
ENG: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܢܵܨܪܲܬ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܘܸܣܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܕܲܬ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' lnaṣrat ayka deewa goerwisa, o 'weereh lknoeshta byawma dshabta dakhee deet wa-leh 'adat, o qeem-leh liqraya.
ENG: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and he entered, as his custom was, into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up to read.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ. ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ:
TRL: Peesh-leh yoewa ileh ktawa desha'ya nweea. Pteekh-leh ktawa o moechikh-leh doeka ayka dkteewa-yleh:
ENG: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Isaiah. And he opened the book, and found the place where it was written,

ASY: ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܲܡ ܡܵܫܹܚ ܠܝܼ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܝܼ ܕܒܲܣܡܸܢ ܠܬܒ݂ܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ، ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܚܹܐܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܙܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܹܐܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Roekha dmarya 'alee-yleh, sabab qam mashekh-lee dmakrizin lmiskene, o qam shadiree dbasmin ltweere dliba, o makrizin kheroeta laseere, o khzayta lsimye, o kheroeta lmoelyiṣe,
ENG: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, Because he anointed me to preach good tidings to the poor: He hath sent me to proclaim release to the captives, And recovering of sight to the blind, To set at liberty them that are bruised,

ASY: ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O makrizin sheta qoebilta dmarya.
ENG: To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.

ASY: ܟܪܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܫܲܡܫܵܢܵܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ. ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܚܵܝܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Kreekh-leh lktawa o yoebil-leh lmshamshana, o teew-leh. O klayhy anee deewaw gaw knoeshta khayree waw bee-eh.
ENG: And he closed the book, and gave it back to the attendant, and sat down: and the eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”idyoom peesh-leh toemima aha ktawa aykh dshmee' lawkhoon.“
ENG: And he began to say unto them, Today hath this scripture been fulfilled in your ears.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܘܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ، ܘܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ؟“
TRL: O klayhy ke hamzimee waw ṣpayee boet dee-eh, o 'ajbee waw bhemizmane dshapaqat dpalṭee waw min poemeh, o baqree waw, ”le-yleh aha broona dyawsip?“
ENG: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the words of grace which proceeded out of his mouth: and they said, Is not this Joseph’s son?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ: ’ܐܵܣܝܵܐ ܒܲܣܸܡ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.‘ ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܼܟ݂.‘“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”shareeraeet bit amreetoon ilee aha matla: ’asya basim ganoekh.‘ o bit amreetoon, ’kl mindee dshmee' lan d'weed-loekh bkparnakhoom, 'wood oep lakha gaw matoekh.‘“
ENG: And he said unto them, Doubtless ye will say unto me this parable, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in thine own country.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܲܝܬ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, layt nweea dpaesh qoebla gaw mdeeteh.
ENG: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is acceptable in his own country.

ASY: ”ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܹܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ ܬܠܵܬ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܲܠܓܹܐ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܦܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bshareeroeta bemara ywin ilawkhoon, raba armilyate eet waw gaw eesrayel byawmane deleea nweea eeman dshmaya la yoebil-laha miṭra tlat shine o palge, o hwe-leh kipna goera bklaha ar'a.
ENG: But of a truth I say unto you, There were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when there came a great famine over all the land;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ، ܠܨܲܪܦܲܬ ܕܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena lkis oep khda minayhy la peesh-leh shoedra eleea, shwooq min lkis khda bakhta armilta, lṣarpat dṣaydoon.
ENG: and unto none of them was Elijah sent, but only to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, unto a woman that was a widow.

ASY: ”ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܸܪ̈ܒ݂ܵܢܹܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܫܲܥ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܢܲܥܡܵܢ ܐܵܪܵܡܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O raba girwane eet waw gaw eesrayel byawmane deleesha' nweea, eena oep khad minayhy la peesh-leh doekhya, ila na'man aramaya.“
ENG: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, but only Naaman the Syrian.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܚܸܡܬܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kad anee deewaw gaw knoeshta shmee' lhoon ane, peesh-lhoon milye khimta klayhy.
ENG: And they were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things;

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܓܒ݂ܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܕܪܲܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ.
TRL: Qeem-lhoon o poeliṭ-lhoon ileh lbadar min mdeeta, o moete-lhoon ileh lgweena dṭoera ayka dmdeetayhy bneeta ywa 'aloehy, drapee waw-leh lltikht.
ENG: and they rose up, and cast him forth out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might throw him down headlong.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena haw 'weereh min gawayhy o zeel-leh.
ENG: But he passing through the midst of them went his way.

ASY: ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: O ṣle-leh eeshoo' lkparnakhoom, mdeeta dgaw gleela, o malip wa-lhoon byawmane dshabta.
ENG: And he came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. And he was teaching them on the sabbath day:

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Ke 'ajbee waw byoelpaneh, sabab eet wa shoelṭana bhemizmanoehy.
ENG: and they were astonished at his teaching; for his word was with authority.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: Eet wa gaw knoeshta khad nasha deet wa bee-eh roekha dsheda ṭame, o moeqwikh-leh bqala rama,
ENG: And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil; and he cried out with a loud voice,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܠܲܢ، ܝܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ. ܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܛܲܠܘܼܩܲܢ؟ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh, ”shwooq lan, ya eeshoo' naṣraya. Ma-loekh minan, te-loekh lṭaloeqan? Beeda'a ywin manee ywit, at eewit qadeesha dalaha.“
ENG: Ah! what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܬܘܿܩ ܘܦܠܘܿܛ ܡܸܢܹܗ.“ ܘܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܙܕܸܓ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' njeew-leh bee-eh o meereh, ”shtooq o plooṭ mineh.“ o roepe-leh ileh sheda bey palga, o pleeṭ-leh mineh, o la khoezdig-leh ileh.
ENG: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him. And when the devil had thrown him down in the midst, he came out of him, having done him no hurt.

ASY: ܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܟܡܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ؟ ܒܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܘܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ ܘܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: 'oejaba goera dweeq-leh lklayhy, o hamzimee waw khad 'am haw khena o amree waw, ”kma khaylane yna hemizmanoehy? Bshoelṭana o bkhayla bipqada-yleh lroekhe ṭame o biplaṭa yna.“
ENG: And amazement came upon all, and they spake together, one with another, saying, What is this word? for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.

ASY: ܘܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O prees-leh khabra boet dee-eh bkleh atra dkhadirwanayhy.
ENG: And there went forth a rumour concerning him into every place of the region round about.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ. ܘܚܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܡܪܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܬܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min knoeshta, o 'weereh lbayta dshim'oon kepa. O khmata dshim'oon mree'ta ywa bkhamkhamta khaylanta, o meerhoon ileh boet deeoeha.
ENG: And he rose up from the synagogue, and entered into the house of Simon. And Simon’s wife’s mother was holden with a great fever; and they besought him for her.

ASY: ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇، ܘܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ ܘܩܲܡ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇. ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kle-leh eeshoo' l'ilil minoeha, o njeew-leh bkhamkhamta o qam shawqa-laha. O har bhay 'dana qeem-laha o 'weed-laha khilmat ilayhy.
ENG: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she rose up and ministered unto them.

ASY: ܘܒܓܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܒܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܘܼܐܬܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ. ܘܗ̇ܘ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O bgnayta dshimsha, klayhy anee deet waw-lhoon mar'ane bmar'e preeshe, moetyay-lhoon lkis-leh. O haw moetiw-leh eedeh 'al kl khad minayhy o boesmay-leh.
ENG: And when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܢܟܸܣ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Oep shede ke palṭee waw min raba, o maqwikhee waw, bemara, ”at eewit msheekha, broona dalaha.“ eena haw ke mankis wa-lhoon o le shabeq wa dhamzimee waw, sabab ke yad'ee waw dhaw eeleh msheekha.
ENG: And devils also came out from many, crying out, and saying, Thou art the Son of God. And rebuking them, he suffered them not to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.

ASY: ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ. ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Bṣapra pleeṭ-leh o zeel-leh lbareea, o kinshe ṭa'ee waw bareh. O te-lhoon lkis-leh, o dweeq-lhoon ileh dla azel wa min lkis layhy.
ENG: And when it was day, he came out and went into a desert place: and the multitudes sought after him, and came unto him, and would have stayed him, that he should not go from them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”wale-ylaha dmakrizin malkoeta dalaha gaw mdeenate khene, sabab boet aha peesh-lee shoedra.“
ENG: But he said unto them, I must preach the good tidings of the kingdom of God to the other cities also: for therefore was I sent.

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܙ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: O ke makriz wa gaw knoeshyate dgleela.
ENG: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.

ASY: ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܹܣܲܪ، ܘܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Kle-leh eeshoo' 'al marza dyama dgenesar, o jmee' leh lkis-leh kinsha lishma'a hemizman dalaha.
ENG: Now it came to pass, while the multitude pressed upon him and heard the word of God, that he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret;

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܨܲܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܠܝܼܛܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ، ܘܚܲܠܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O khze-leh tartey gamee-e kilye 'al marza dyama, eena ṣayade pleeṭe ywaw min gawayhy, o khaloele ywaw gardayhy.
ENG: and he saw two boats standing by the lake: but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.

ASY: ܚܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇. ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܪܲܚܩܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܠܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ. ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ.
TRL: Khda min gamee-e dshim'oon kepa ywa. seeq-leh eeshoo' o teew-leh gawoeha. O ṭleeb-leh min shim'oon drakhqin wa min birza lgaw yama. O shoere-leh lmaloepe lkinsha min gamee.
ENG: And he entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And he sat down and taught the multitudes out of the boat.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܛܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܩܬܵܐ، ܘܕܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܲܪܕܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܨܲܝܕܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dpreeq-leh min maloepe, meereh lshim'oon kepa, ”ṭreymoen gamee ldoeka 'amoeqta, o dreymoen gardawkhoon lṣayda.“
ENG: And when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Put out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܟܠܹܗ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܟܟ̰ܝܼܚ ܠܲܢ ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܠܓܲܪܕܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”rabee, kleh layle kcheekh lan o mindee la dweeq lan, eena boet hemizmanoekh bit dareyn lgarda.“
ENG: And Simon answered and said, Master, we toiled all night, and took nothing: but at thy word I will let down the nets.

ASY: ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ، ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܦܪܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ.
TRL: Dre-leh garda, o dweeq-lhoon noene raba, hada dpreeṭ-leh garda.
ENG: And when they had this done, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes; and their nets were breaking;

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܒܓܵܡܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܗܲܝܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܛܒܵܥܵܐ.
TRL: O qre-lhoon lkhawrawatayhy bgamee kheta datee waw o hayiree waw-lhoon. te-lhoon o mle-lhoon tartey gamee-e hal dshoere-lhoon liṭba'a.
ENG: and they beckoned unto their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܡܵܪܝܼ ܕܪܵܚܩܹܬ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh shim'oon kepa aha, npeel-leh qam aqlate deeshoo', o meereh ileh, ”parpoele ywin beeoekh maree drakhqet minee, nasha khaṭaya ywin.“
ENG: But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܨܲܝܕܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: meereh aha sabab 'oejib-leh haw o klayhy anee d'ameh 'al ṣayda dnoene ddweeq-lhoon.
ENG: For he was amazed, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken;

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܒܸܨܝܵܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Hadkha oep ya'qoow o yookhanan bnoone dzawday deewaw palakhe 'am shim'oon kepa 'oejib-lhoon. meereh eeshoo' lshim'oon kepa, ”la zad'et, min adeea bit haweyt biṣyada nashe lkhaye.“
ENG: and so were also James and John, sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܐܬܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dmoetay-lhoon gamee-e lmarza, shweeq-lhoon kl mindee o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And when they had brought their boats to land, they left all, and followed him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܸܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ، ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ، ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܕܲܟܹܝܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Eeman deewa eeshoo' gaw khda min mdeenate, te-leh lkis-leh khad nasha girwana. O kad khze-leh leeshoo', npeel-leh 'al pateh, o poerpil-leh bee-eh, bemara, ”maree, in ba'eyt, maṣeyt dakeyt-lee.“
ENG: And it came to pass, while he was in one of the cities, behold, a man full of leprosy: and when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

ASY: ܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܦܘܼܫ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܸܪܒܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: Poeshṭa-leh eedeh eeshoo' o dqeereh bee-eh o meereh, ”bib'aya ywin, poesh dikhya.“ o har bhay 'dana zeel-leh girbeh mineh.
ENG: And he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou made clean. And straightway the leprosy departed from him.

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܵܗܢܵܐ، ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܲܟ݂ܵܝܬܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: O pqeed-leh ileh eeshoo', ”lnasha la amret, ila ze makhzee ganoekh lkahna, o maqriw boet dakhaytoekh aykh dpqeed-leh moeshe, lsahdoetayhy.“
ENG: And he charged him to tell no man: but go thy way, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ. ܘܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܠܸܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܣܡܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena boesh prees-laha hemizman boet dee-eh. O jam'ee waw kinshe raba lishma'a mineh o lipyasha boesme min mar'ayhy.
ENG: But so much the more went abroad the report concerning him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed of their infirmities.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ.
TRL: Eena haw pleeṭ-leh lbareea lṣaloeye.
ENG: But he withdrew himself in the deserts, and prayed.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܡܲܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒܲܣܘܼܡܲܝ.
TRL: Kad maloepe ywa eeshoo' bkhad min yawmane, preeshe o malpane dnamoosa teebe ywaw tama, anee dtee-e ywaw min klayhy mdeenate dgleela, o deehoed, o min oorishlim, o khayla dmarya eet wa lbasoemay.
ENG: And it came to pass on one of those days, that he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every village of Galilee and Judaea and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O ha khakma nashe moete-lhoon khad shpeela 'al shweeta, o b'e-lhoon d'awree waw o matwee waw-leh qam eeshoo'.
ENG: And behold, men bring on a bed a man that was palsied: and they sought to bring him in, and to lay him before him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐ݇ܓܵܪܹܐ، ܓܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܘܦܘܼܫܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܫܘܝܼܬܹܗ ܒܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eena eeman dla moechikh-lhoon oerkha d'awree waw boet kinsha raba, seeq-lhoon lgare, goele-lhoon lshkoere o poeshiṭ-lhoon ileh 'am shweeteh bbey palga qam eeshoo'.
ENG: And not finding by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop, and let him down through the tiles with his couch into the midst before Jesus.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“
TRL: Kad khze-leh eeshoo' haymanoetayhy, meereh lhaw shpeela, ”ya nasha, poekhle yna iloekh khṭeeatoekh.“
ENG: And seeing their faith, he said, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܸܓܕܵܦܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eena sapre o preeshe shoere-lhoon bikhshawa bganayhy o bemara, ”manee-yleh aha dbigdapa-yleh? Manee maṣe pakhil khṭeeate shwooq min Alaha?“
ENG: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this that speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh khoeshabayhy, o boeqireh minayhy, ”moodee bikhshawa ytoon blibawkhoon?
ENG: But Jesus perceiving their reasonings, answered and said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂،‘ ܝܲܢ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܩܘܼܡ ܚܕܘܿܪ؟‘
TRL: ”Aynee-yleh boesh pshoeqa lemara, ’poekhle yna iloekh khṭeeatoekh,‘ yan lemara, ’qoem khdoor?‘
ENG: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins are forgiven thee; or to say, Arise and walk?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܦܲܚܸܠ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ“–ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ”ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܩܘܼܡ، ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Eena dyad'eetoon dbroona dnasha eet-leh shoelṭana 'al ar'a dpakhil khṭeeate“–meereh lshpeela, ”iloekh bemara ywin, qoem, shqool shweetoekh o ze lbaytoekh.“
ENG: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins (he said unto him that was palsied), I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go unto thy house.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܝܼܬܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O qeem-leh har bhay 'dana qam 'aynayhy, o shqeel-leh shweeteh o zeel-leh lbayteh kad shaboekhe lalaha.
ENG: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his house, glorifying God.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Klayhy 'oejib-lhoon, shoebikh-lhoon lalaha, o peesh-lhoon milye zdoe'ta o meerhoon, ”idyoom khze lan doemare.“
ENG: And amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God; and they were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things today.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܠܹܘܝܼ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Min bar ane, pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' o khze-leh khad makhsa shimeh lewee, teewa gaw beyt makhse, o meereh ileh, ”ta baree.“
ENG: And after these things he went forth, and beheld a publican, named Levi, sitting at the place of toll, and said unto him, Follow me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Haw shweeq-leh kl mindee, qeem-leh o zeel-leh bareh.
ENG: And he forsook all, and rose up and followed him.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܹܘܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܐܲܪܚܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: 'weed-leh ileh lewee gaw bayteh arkhoeta goerta. O eet wa kinsha raba dmakhse o dkhene teebe lsoepra 'amayhy.
ENG: And Levi made him a great feast in his house: and there was a great multitude of publicans and of others that were sitting at meat with them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܛܘܼܪܛܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eena sapre o preeshe ṭoerṭim-lhoon, o meerhoon ltalmeedoehy, ”qamoodee 'am makhse o khaṭaye bekhala ytoon o bishtaya?“
ENG: And the Pharisees and their scribes murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with the publicans and sinners?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܘܼܠܡܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܐܵܣܝܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”anee deena bkhoelmana le yna sneeqe lasya, ila anee dkhirba mree'e yna.
ENG: And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole have no need of a physician; but they that are sick.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܩܵܪܹܝܢ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”La te-lee dqareyn lzadeeqe, ila lkhaṭaye ltyawoeta.“
ENG: I am not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܟܹܐ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܟܹܐ ܨܲܠܝܼ، ܘܗܵܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܘܫܵܬܝܼ؟“
TRL: Eena anee meerhoon ileh, ”talmeede dyookhanan ke ṣaymee raba o ke ṣalee, o hada oep dpreeshe, eena deeoekh ke akhlee o shatee?“
ENG: And they said unto him, The disciples of John fast often, and make supplications; likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܥܒܸܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”le maṣeytoon ma'bideetoon khawrawate dkhitna ṣaymee kma dkhitna 'amayhy-yleh.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Can ye make the sons of the bride-chamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Eena bit atee yawmane dbit paesh shqeela khitna minayhy, haygah bit ṣaymee.“
ENG: But the days will come; and when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, then will they fast in those days.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܛ ܥܵܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܘܕܵܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܩܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܲܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܟ̰ܲܢܟ̰ܸܪ ܠܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy matla, ”nasha le pareṭ 'arayta min lweeshta khadta o dare-laha 'al joela 'ateeqa. Sabab tirwayhy le dawqee 'am 'oedale, o 'ateeqa bit chanchir lkhata.
ENG: And he spake also a parable unto them; No man rendeth a piece from a new garment and putteth it upon an old garment; else he will rend the new, and also the piece from the new will not agree with the old.

ASY: ”ܘܠܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܙܹܥ ܠܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܵܦܹܟ݂، ܘܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܝܼ.
TRL: ”O le dare nasha khamra khata gaw goede 'ateeqe, sabab khamra khata bit baze' lgoede, o khamra bit tapekh, o goede bit kharwee.
ENG: And no man putteth new wine into old wineskins; else the new wine will burst the skins, and itself will be spilled, and the skins will perish.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܢܛܝܼܪܹܐ.
TRL: Eena ke daree khamra khata bgoede khate, o tirwayhy ke payshee nṭeere.
ENG: But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܕܫܵܬܹܐ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܫܸܬܝܵܐ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܩܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܕܥܲܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܲܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O nasha le ba'e dshate khamra khata min bar dhawe shitya khamra 'ateeqa, sabab ke amer d'ateeqa boesh baseema-yleh.“
ENG: And no man having drunk old wine desireth new: for he saith, The old is good.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܫܠܵܓܵܐ ܫܸܒܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܦܪܵܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: Kad bi'wara ywa eeshoo' byawma dshabta min gaw khaqlane, shoere-lhoon talmeedoehy bishlaga shible, o biprakha beedatayhy o bekhala.
ENG: Now it came to pass on a sabbath, that he was going through the cornfields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: O nashe min preeshe meerhoon ilayhy, ”qamoodee bi'wada ytoon mindee dle-yleh qanoonaya li'wada byawma dshabta?“
ENG: But certain of the Pharisees said, Why do ye that which it is not lawful to do on the sabbath day?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܟܦܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' ilayhy, ”la qre lawkhoon moodee 'weed-leh daweed eeman dhaw o anee deewaw 'ameh kpeenhoon?
ENG: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read even this, what David did, when he was an hungred, he, and they that were with him;

ASY: ”ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”'weereh lbayta dalaha, o lakhma dpatoora dmarya shqeel-leh o kheel-leh, o yoebil-leh lanee deewaw 'ameh, oep in dle ywa qanoonayta ileh lekhala shwooq min lkahne bnawshayhy.“
ENG: how he entered into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat save for the priests alone?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”mara dshabta-yleh broona dnasha.“
ENG: And he said unto them, The Son of man is lord of the sabbath.

ASY: ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܙܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Bshabta kheta 'weereh eeshoo' lknoeshta o malip wa. O eet wa tama khad nasha deedeh dyameena breezta ywa.
ENG: And it came to pass on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man there, and his right hand was withered.

ASY: ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܲܣܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܩܵܐ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܸܩܒ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Sapre o preeshe naṭree waw-leh din basim wa byawma dshabta, qa dmachkhee waw 'ilta liqwala 'aloehy.
ENG: And the scribes and the Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath; that they might find how to accuse him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܒܪܝܼܙܬܵܐ، ”ܬܵܐ ܘܟܠܝܼ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena haw dee' leh khoeshabayhy, o meereh lnasha eedeh breezta, ”ta o klee bey palga.“ te-leh o kle-leh.
ENG: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man that had his hand withered, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܒܲܩܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ: ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ؟ ܠܦܲܪܘܼܩܹܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܛܲܠܘܼܩܹܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ba'eyn dbaqrinawkhoon khad mindee: aynee-ylaha qanoonayta li'wada byawma dshabta, ṭawta yan beeshta? Lparoeqe yan lṭaloeqe gana?“
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, I ask you, Is it lawful on the sabbath to do good, or to do harm? to save a life, or to destroy it?

ASY: ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ”ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂.“ ܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: O kheereh lkhadirwanoehy bklayhy, o meereh lhaw nasha, ”pashiṭ eedoekh.“ poeshṭa-leh o bseem-laha.
ENG: And he looked round about on them all, and said unto him, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O anee peesh-lhoon milye karba, o hamzimee waw khad 'am haw khena dmoodee 'awdee leeshoo'.
ENG: But they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Banee yawmane pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' lṭoera lṣaloeye, o tama hwe-leh kleh layle bṣloota lalaha.
ENG: And it came to pass in these days, that he went out into the mountain to pray; and he continued all night in prayer to God.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eeman dhwe-leh bahra, qre-leh ltalmeedoehy, o goebe-leh minayhy tri'sar, anee dqiryay-leh oep shleekhe.
ENG: And when it was day, he called his disciples: and he chose from them twelve, whom also he named apostles;

ASY: ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪ ܬܘܼܠܡܲܝ.
TRL: Shim'oon, haw dmoetiw-leh shimeh kepa, o andreoos akhoonoehy, o ya'qoow o yookhanan, o peeleepoos o bar toelmay.
ENG: Simon, whom he also named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,

ASY: ܡܲܬܲܝ ܘܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܠܦܲܝ، ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܛܲܢܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Matay o tooma, o ya'qoow broona dkhalpay, o shim'oon dpyasha-yleh qirya ṭanana.
ENG: and Matthew and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon which was called the Zealot,

ASY: ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O eehoeda broona dya'qoow, o eehoeda skaryooṭa haw dhwe-leh sapyana.
ENG: and Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, which was the traitor;

ASY: ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܕܸܫܬܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܨܘܿܪ ܘܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܒܘܼܣܡܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Ṣle-leh 'amayhy eeshoo' o kle-leh gaw dishta, o raba min talmeedoehy, o kinsha raba d'ama min klaha eehoed, o min oorishlim, o min marza dyama dṣoor o ṣaydoon, te-lhoon dsham'ee hemizmanoehy o payshee boesme min mar'ayhy.
ENG: and he came down with them, and stood on a level place, and a great multitude of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judaea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܵܬܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܣܡܹܐ.
TRL: O anee deewaw moelyiṣe min roekhate ṭame, peesh-lhoon boesme.
ENG: and they that were troubled with unclean spirits were healed.

ASY: ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܕܩܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܲܣܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Kleh kinsha ba'e wa lidqara bee-eh, sabab khayla paleṭ wa mineh, o lklayhy basim wa.
ENG: And all the multitude sought to touch him: for power came forth from him, and healed them all.

ASY: ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Kheereh eeshoo' btalmeedoehy, o meereh, ”ṭoewa ilawkhoon miskene, sabab deeawkhoon eelaha malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed are ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܟܦܝܼܢܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܒ݂ܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܵܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܓܵܚܟܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Ṭoewa, ilawkhoon dkpeene ytoon adeea, sabab bit saw'eetoon. Ṭoewa ilawkhoon akhtoon dbakeytoon adeea, sabab bit gakhkeetoon.
ENG: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.

ASY: ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܣܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܵܪܫܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܝܡܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܩܵܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Ṭoewa ilawkhoon eeman dsanee lawkhoon nashe, o parshee lawkhoon, o laymee lawkhoon, o qaree lawkhoon beeshe boet broona dnasha.
ENG: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.

ASY: ܚܕܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܦܨܘܿܚܘܼܢ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khdeymoen o pṣookhoen bhaw yawma, sabab poer'anawkhoon goera-yleh bshmaya. Hadkha ke 'awdee waw oep babawatayhy lnwee-e.
ENG: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy: for behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the same manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena way ilawkhoon 'ateere, sabab qoebil lawkhoon yabalta dliba.
ENG: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.

ASY: ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܣܒ݂ܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܟܵܦܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܵܚܟܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ.
TRL: Way ilawkhoon anee dswee'e ytoon adeea, sabab bit kapneetoon. Way ilawkhoon anee dgakhkeetoon adeea, sabab bit bakeytoon o 'awdeetoon ta'zee.
ENG: Woe unto you, ye that are full now! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you, ye that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

ASY: ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Way ilawkhoon eeman dhamzimee ṣpayee boet deeawkhoon klayhy bnaynasha. Hadkha ke 'awdee waw oep babawatayhy lnwee-e dagale.
ENG: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for in the same manner did their fathers to the false prophets.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܡܲܚܸܒܘܼܢ ܠܕܸܫܡܸܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܣܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon deetoon bishma'a, makhiboen ldishminawkhoon, o 'woodoen ṭawta lanee dsanee lawkhoon.
ENG: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them that hate you,

ASY: ”ܒܲܪܟ݂ܘܼܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܝܛܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܡܝܼ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Barkhoen lanee dlayṭee lawkhoon, o ṣaleymoen boet anee dṭalmee 'alawkhoon.
ENG: bless them that curse you, pray for them that despitefully use you.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܵܚܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܘܼܟ݂، ܡܲܚܕܸܪ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܥܵܒܵܝܬܘܼܟ݂، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܨܘܼܕܪܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”O man dmakhe-loekh 'al khad geba dpatoekh, makhdir ileh oep haw geba khena. O man dshaqel 'abaytoekh, hal-leh oep ṣoedroekh.
ENG: To him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and from him that taketh away thy cloke withhold not thy coat also.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܠܵܐ ܛܵܠܒܹܬ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kl man dṭaleb minoekh, hal-leh, o man dshaqel mindee minoekh, la ṭalbet-leh mineh.
ENG: Give to every one that asketh thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.

ASY: ”ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O dakhee dba'eytoon d'awdee ilawkhoon nashe, hadkha 'woodoen ilayhy oep akhtoon.
ENG: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”In makhibeetoon lanee dmakhibee lawkhoon, moodee-ylaha ṭawtawkhoon? Oep khaṭaye ke makhibee lanee dmakhibee-lhoon.
ENG: And if ye love them that love you, what thank have ye? for even sinners love those that love them.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in 'awdeetoon ṭawta lanee d'awdee ṭawta ilawkhoon, ayka-ylaha ṭawtawkhoon? Oep khaṭaye ke 'awdee aha.
ENG: And if ye do good to them that do good to you, what thank have ye? for even sinners do the same.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܲܝܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܵܪܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܕܲܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܲܝܢܵܐ ܠܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܪܝܼܥܹܐ.
TRL: ”O in yaweetoon dayna lanee deet lawkhoon hewee dpar'ee-leh daynawkhoon, moodee-ylaha ṭawtawkhoon? Oep khaṭaye ke yawee dayna lkhaṭaye dmindrish payshee pree'e.
ENG: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? even sinners lend to sinners, to receive again as much.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܘܼܢ ܠܕܸܫܡܸܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܕܲܝܢܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܩܵܛܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܣܵܪ̈ܒ݂ܵܢܹܐ ܕܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena makhiboen ldishminawkhoon, 'woodoen-lhoon ṭawta, haloen dayna, o la qaṭ'eetoon hewee dnasha, o bit hawe poer'anawkhoon goera, o bit haweytoon bnoone d'ilaya, haw dmakeekha-yleh 'al beeshe o 'al sarwane dṭawta.
ENG: But love your enemies, and do them good, and lend, never despairing; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be sons of the Most High: for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܡܪ̈ܲܚܡܵܢܹܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܪܲܚܡܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen mrakhmane, dakhee doep babawkhoon mrakhmana-yleh.
ENG: Be ye merciful, even as your Father is merciful.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܕܵܝܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ. ܠܵܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܓܢܵܗܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܦܲܚܠܘܼܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ.
TRL: ”La dayneetoon, o le paysheetoon deene. La dawqeetoon gnaha lnashe, o le payshee dweeqe gnahawkhoon. Pakhloen, o bit paysheetoon poekhle.
ENG: And judge not, and ye shall not be judged: and condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: release, and ye shall be released:

ASY: ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܘܫܥܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܫܦܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܟܵܝܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܟܝܼܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Haloen, o bit paesh yoewa ilawkhoon, bkyoela ṣpayee o sh'eesha o deesha o shpeekha bit paysheetoon yoebe. Sabab bkyoela dkayleetoon bit paesh keela ilawkhoon.“
ENG: give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, shall they give into your bosom. For with what measure ye mete it shall be measured to you again.
