ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ”ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܠܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܠܲܒܸܠ؟ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܒܓܘܼܒܵܐ؟
TRL: O meereh ilayhy matla, ”ke maṣe simya lsimya boerkha labil? Le naplee tirwayhy bgoeba?
ENG: And he spake also a parable unto them, Can the blind guide the blind? shall they not both fall into a pit?

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܲܒܝܼܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܡܝܼܠܵܐ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܪܲܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Layt talmeeda 'ilil min rabee-eh. Eena kl nasha deeleh kmeela byoelpana bit hawe aykh rabee-eh.
ENG: The disciple is not above his master: but every one when he is perfected shall be as his master.

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܙܸܠܸܟܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܘܼܗ̇؟
TRL: ”Qamoodee bikhzaya ywit zilika dgaw 'ayna dakhoonoekh, eena qareeta dgaw 'ayna dganoekh le ywit bikhzayoeha?
ENG: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ’ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܠܝܼ ܕܦܲܠܛܸܢ ܙܸܠܸܟܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂،‘ ܘܟܲܕ ܩܵܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܘܼܗ̇؟ ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪܵܢܵܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܩܵܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܨܸܦܝܵܐ ܕܦܲܠܛܸܬ ܙܸܠܸܟܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Yan dakhee maṣeyt amret lakhoonoekh, ’akhoonee, shwooq-lee dpalṭin zilika min 'aynoekh,‘ o kad qareeta b'ayna dganoekh le ywit bikhzayoeha? Ya mashpirana, qamayta paliṭ qareeta min 'aynoekh, o haygah bit khazeyt ṣipya dpalṭit zilika min 'ayna dakhoonoekh.
ENG: Or how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me cast out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Layt eelana ṭawa d'abed ṭ'oenyate khirba, o la eelana khirba d'abed ṭ'oenyate ṭabe.
ENG: For there is no good tree that bringeth forth corrupt fruit; nor again a corrupt tree that bringeth forth good fruit.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܓܲܒܝܼ ܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܲܢܒܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܝܼܘܵܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab kl eelana min ṭ'oenyate dee-eh ke paesh dee'a. Sabab le gabee tene min kitwe, o la 'anbe min qeeware.
ENG: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܙܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܸܒܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܙܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܸܒܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”nasha ṭawa min khazeene ṭabe dlibeh ke paliṭ ṭawate, o nasha beesha min khazeene beeshe dlibeh ke paliṭ beeshate. Sabab min zawdoenyoeta dliba ke hamzim poemeh.
ENG: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and the evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth that which is evil: for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܪܝܼ،‘ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Qamoodee biqrayee ytoon, ’maree, maree,‘ eena mindee dbemara ywin le ytoon bi'wadeh?
ENG: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܘܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܘܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܡܲܚܙܸܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ.
TRL: ”Kl nasha date lkis-lee o shame' hemizmanee o 'abed-lhoon, makhziynawkhoon lmoodee ke dame.
ENG: Every one that cometh unto me, and heareth my words, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܚܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܥܲܡܘܼܩܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܢܝܲܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܝܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܐܵܐ، ܩܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܥܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܢܝܲܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܝܵܐ ܫܘܼܬܐܸܣܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ke dame lnasha dbne-leh bayta, khpeereh 'amoeqa, o moetiw-leh binyateh 'al qaya. O eeman dhwe-leh mila, qeet-leh bhaw bayta, eena la mṣe-leh sha'esh wa-leh, sabab binyateh 'al qaya shoetista ywa.
ENG: he is like a man building a house, who digged and went deep, and laid a foundation upon the rock: and when a flood arose, the stream brake against that house, and could not shake it: because it had been well builded.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܘܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܲܦܪܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܒܸܢܝܲܬ. ܘܩܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܢܲܗܪܵܐ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ. ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܢܦܵܠܬܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O haw dshame' hemizmanee o la 'abed-lhoon, ke dame lnasha dbne-leh bayteh 'al 'apra, dla binyat. O qeet-leh bee-eh nahra, o har bhay 'dana npeel-leh. O hwe-laha npalteh goerta.“
ENG: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that built a house upon the earth without a foundation; against which the stream brake, and straightway it fell in; and the ruin of that house was great.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܩܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ.
TRL: Eeman dpreeq-leh eeshoo' min hamzoeme qa 'ama, 'weereh lkparnakhoom.
ENG: After he had ended all his sayings in the ears of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܕܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ. ܘܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: O eet wa rega dkhad rab ima dmree'a ywa qoerba lmawta. O rab ima ke makhib wa-leh raba.
ENG: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick and at the point of death.

ASY: ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܘܒܲܣܸܡ ܠܪܹܓܹܗ.
TRL: Shmee' leh rab ima boet eeshoo', o shoedireh lkis-leh khwardiqne dyhoedaye, biṭlaba mineh date o basim lregeh.
ENG: And when he heard concerning Jesus, he sent unto him elders of the Jews, asking him that he would come and save his servant.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܚܦܝܼܛܵܐܝܼܬ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ،
TRL: Ane te-lhoon lkis eeshoo' o ṭleeb-lhoon mineh khpeeṭaeet o meerhoon, ”khsheekha-yleh d'awdet ileh aha shoela,
ENG: And they, when they came to Jesus, besought him earnestly, saying, He is worthy that thou shouldest do this for him:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܛܵܝܸܦܲܢ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab ke makhib lṭayipan, o oep bne-leh ilan khda knoeshta.“
ENG: for he loveth our nation, and himself built us our synagogue.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܚܝܼܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܵܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܸܙ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܬ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܝܼ.
TRL: O zeel-leh eeshoo' 'amayhy. Eena hesh le ywa rkheeqa min bayta, shoedireh lkis-leh rab ima nashoehy, bemara, ”maree, la 'ajiz ganoekh, sabab le ywin khsheekha d'awret gaw baytee.
ENG: And Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof:

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܒܵܣܹܡ ܪܹܓܝܼ.
TRL: ”Boet aha ana bganee la te-lee lkis-loekh, ila moor hemizman o bit basem regee.
ENG: wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say the word, and my servant shall be healed.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ، ’ܙܹܠ݇، ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ؛ ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ’ܬܵܐ،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ؛ ܘܠܪܹܓܝܼ، ’ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܐܵܗܵܐ،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ.“
TRL: ”Sabab oep ana khad nasha ywin tkhoot shoelṭana, o eet tkhoot eedee dakhshe, ke amren-laha, ’ze, o ke azel; o lhaw khena, ’ta,‘ o ke ate; o lregee, ’'wood aha,‘ o ke 'abed.“
ENG: For I also am a man set under authority, having under myself soldiers: and I say to this one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo' ane, 'oejib-leh bee-eh. Deereh o meereh lkinsha dbetaya ywa bareh, ”bemara ywin ilawkhoon, oep gaw eesrayel la khze-lee haymanoeta aykh daha.“
ENG: And when Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said unto the multitude that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ.
TRL: O deerhoon lbayta anee deewaw shoedre, o moechikh-lhoon bseema haw rega deewa mree'a.
ENG: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole.

ASY: ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܢܵܐܹܝܢ، ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: O byawma khena, bezala ywa eeshoo' lmdeeta shimoeha naeyn, o talmeedoehy 'ameh, o kinsha raba.
ENG: And it came to pass soon afterwards, that he went to a city called Nain; and his disciples went with him, and a great multitude.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܠܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Kad qoerbineh ltar'a dmdeeta, khze-leh nashe paloeṭe khad meeta, broona eekheedaya lyimeh, hay darmilta ywa, o kinsha raba eet wa 'amoeha.
ENG: Now when he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, there was carried out one that was dead, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܠܵܐ ܒܵܟ݂ܝܲܬܝ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhizya-leh eeshoo' roekhim-leh 'aloeha, o meereh iloeha, ”la bakhyaty.“
ENG: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܛܥܝܼܢܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܓ̰ܘܲܢܩܵܐ، ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܩܘܼܡ.“
TRL: zeel-leh o dqeereh bshweeta. O anee dṭ'eenoeha ywaw kle-lhoon. O meereh eeshoo', ”jwanqa, iloekh bemara ywin, qoem.“
ENG: And he came nigh and touched the bier: and the bearers stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: O teew-leh haw meeta, o shoere-leh lhamzoeme, o yoebil-leh eeshoo' lyimeh.
ENG: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܲܒܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܢ، ܘܣܘܼܚܒܸܪܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܹܗ.“
TRL: Dweeq-laha zdoe'ta lklayhy nashe, o shabkhee waw lalaha, bemara, ”nweea goera qeem-leh gawan, o soekhbireh Alaha l'ameh.“
ENG: And fear took hold on all: and they glorified God, saying, A great prophet is arisen among us: and, God hath visited his people.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܘܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܲܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-laha boet dee-eh aha hemizman bklaha eehoed o bklayhy khadirwane datra.
ENG: And this report went forth concerning him in the whole of Judaea, and all the region round about.

ASY: ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Hoeqe-lhoon talmeede dyookhanan ileh klayhy ane d'weeday-leh eeshoo'.
ENG: And the disciples of John told him of all these things.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ، ܝܲܢ ܣܵܦܪܲܚ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: O qre-leh yookhanan ltrey min talmeedoehy o shoedray-leh lkis eeshoo' dbaqree-leh, ”at eewit haw date, yan saprakh lkhad khena?“
ENG: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to the Lord, saying, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܲܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܒܲܩܪܲܚ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ’ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܝܲܢ ܣܵܦܪܲܚ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ؟‘“
TRL: O te-lhoon anee talmeede lkis eeshoo' o meerhoon ileh, ”yookhanan ma'mdana qam shadiran lkis-loekh dbaqrakh-loekh, ’at eewit haw date yan saprakh lkhad khena?‘“
ENG: And when the men were come unto him, they said, John the Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another?

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܚܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܵܬܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana eeshoo' basoeme ywa raba nashe min mar'e o min makhwate o min roekhate beeshe, o 'weed-leh raba simye dkhazee waw.
ENG: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and on many that were blind he bestowed sight.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܓܸܪ̈ܒ݂ܵܢܹܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܹܐ، ܘܚܲܪ̈ܫܹܐ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܹܐ، ܘܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ltalmeede dyookhanan, ”zemoen o mooroen lyookhanan mindee dkhze lawkhoon o shmee' lawkhoon, dsimye bikhzaya yna, shpeele bikhdara yna, o girwane pyasha yna doekhye, o kharshe bishma'a yna, o meete pyasha yna moeqime, o miskene pyasha yna moekrize.
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, the poor have good tidings preached to them.

ASY: ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܣܵܪܹܒ݂ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Ṭoewa lman dla sarew-lee.“
ENG: And blessed is he, whosoever shall find none occasion of stumbling in me.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܙܹܠܵܐ ܫܥܝܼܫܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ؟
TRL: Min bar dzeel-lhoon talmeede dyookhanan, hoemzim-leh eeshoo' lkinsha boet yookhanan o meereh, ”moodee pleeṭ lawkhoon lbareea likhzaya, zela sh'eesha byad pawkha?
ENG: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken with the wind?

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܲܟܝܼܟܹܐ؟ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܲܟܝܼܟܹܐ ܘܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܹ̈ܐ، ܓܵܘ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Yan moodee pleeṭ lawkhoon likhzaya, nasha lweesha joele rakeeke? Anee dke lawshee joele rakeeke o deena gaw boesame, gaw bate dmalke yna.
ENG: But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ؟ ܗܹܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: ”Yan moodee pleeṭ lawkhoon likhzaya, nweea? He, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, boesh zawda-yleh min nweea.
ENG: But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ: ܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܝܼܙܓܲܕܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂ ܕܗܲܕܸܪ ܐܘܼܪܚܘܼܟ݂ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Aha-yleh haw deeleh peesha kteewa boet dee-eh: ha ana shadoere ywin eezgadee qamoekh dhadir oerkhoekh qamoekh.
ENG: This is he of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, Who shall prepare thy way before thee.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܲܝܬ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, layt nweea leeda min bakhta boesh goera min yookhanan ma'mdana. Eena haw boesh z'oora gaw malkoeta dalaha boesh goera-yleh mineh.“
ENG: I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there is none greater than John: yet he that is but little in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ، ܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh kleh 'ama, oep makhse, moede-lhoon bzadeeqoeta dalaha d'meede ywaw bma'moodeeta dyookhanan.
ENG: And all the people when they heard, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: Eena preeshe o namoosaye moesle-lhoon bganayhy ṣiwyana dalaha dla peesh-lhoon 'meede mineh.
ENG: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected for themselves the counsel of God, being not baptized of him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ، ”ܠܡ̇ܢ ܡܲܕܡܹܝܢܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ، ܘܠܡ̇ܢ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܼ؟
TRL: O meereh Maran, ”lman madmeynhoon nashe daha sharbta, o lman ke damee?
ENG: Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation, and to what are they like?

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܼ ܠܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܘܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܙܡܝܼܪܲܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܪܩܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܝ݇ܠܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܟܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Ke damee lyale teebe bshoeqa o maqwoekhe lkhawrawatayhy o bemara, ’zmeeran ilawkhoon o la rqeed lawkhoon, o le lan ilawkhoon o la bke lawkhoon.‘
ENG: They are like unto children that sit in the marketplace, and call one to another; which say, We piped unto you, and ye did not dance; we wailed, and ye did not weep.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ’ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”Sabab te-leh yookhanan ma'mdana la bekhala lakhma o la bishtaya khamra, o bemara ytoon, ’sheda eet bee-eh.‘
ENG: For John the Baptist is come eating no bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ’ܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܵܢܵܐ ܘܫܵܬܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”te-leh broona dnasha bekhala o bishtaya, o bemara ytoon, ’ha nasha akhlana o shatyana dkhamra, o khawra dmakhse o khaṭaye.‘
ENG: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold, a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!

ASY: ”ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܬܵܐ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Peesh-laha moekshiṭta khikhmta bklayhy bnoonoeha.“
ENG: And wisdom is justified of all her children.

ASY: ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O ṭleeb-leh khad min preeshe min eeshoo' dakel wa lakhma 'ameh. O 'weereh lbayta dhaw preesha o teew-leh.
ENG: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to meat.

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܵܛܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ،
TRL: O dee' laha khda bakhta khaṭayta bhay mdeeta dteewa ywa gaw bayta dhaw preesha, shqeel-laha shaṭeepta dbisma,
ENG: And behold, a woman which was in the city, a sinner; and when she knew that he was sitting at meat in the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster cruse of ointment,

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܨܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ. ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܕܸܡܥܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܡܲܬܪܘܼܝܹܐ ܠܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܒܟܵܘܣܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܡܫܵܝܲܝ، ܘܢܵܫܩܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܡܵܫܚܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܒܸܣܡܵܐ.
TRL: te-laha o kle-laha bar khaṣeh lkis aqlateh bibkhaya. Shoere-laha bdim'oeha matroeye laqlateh, o bkawsoeha bimshayay, o nashqa wa-lhoon, o mashkha wa-lhoon bbisma.
ENG: and standing behind at his feet, weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܟ̰ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܕܩܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh haw preesha dcheeda ywa leeshoo' aha mindee d'weed-laha hay bakhta, meereh gaw ganeh, ”in aha nasha hawe wa nweea, bit yade' wa manee-ylaha o moodee bakhta-ylaha ddqeeraha bee-eh, bakhta khaṭayta-ylaha.“
ENG: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what manner of woman this is which touched him, that she is a sinner.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܐܵܡܪܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܪܲܒܝܼ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”shim'oon, ba'eyn damrenoekh khad mindee.“ o meereh ileh, ”moor rabee.“ meereh ileh eeshoo',
ENG: And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on.

ASY: ”ܚܲܕ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܕܲܝܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܸܫܡܵܐܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Khad mara ddayna eet wa-leh trey daynane. Khad minayhy daynana ywa ileh khamishma deenare, o haw khena khamshee deenare.
ENG: A certain lender had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.

ASY: ”ܘܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܨܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܸܦܪܵܥܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܚܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ. ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܕܲܝܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”O layt wa-lhoon mṣayta lipra'a, o poekhil-leh ltirwayhy. moor ilee, aynee min ane trey daynane boesh zawda bit makhib lmara ddayna?“
ENG: When they had not wherewith to pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܘܼܚܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon o meereh, ”bikhshawa ywin haw dpoekhil-leh ileh zawda.“ meereh ileh eeshoo', ”bshareeroeta deenoekh.“
ENG: Simon answered and said, He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.

ASY: ܦܬܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ”ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ؟ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂، ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈ ܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܕܸܡܥܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܡܘܼܬܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈، ܘܒܟܵܘܣܘܼܗ̇ ܡܸܫܝܲܝ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Pteel-leh lgeba dbakhta o meereh lshim'oon, ”bikhzaya ywit aha bakhta? 'weeree lbaytoekh, meea qa aqlatee la yoebil-loekh. Eena aha bakhta bdim'oeha moetre-laha aqlatee, o bkawsoeha mishyay-laha.
ENG: And turning to the woman, he said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath wetted my feet with her tears, and wiped them with her hair.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܵܐ ܢܫܝܼܩܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܫܠܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܢܫܵܩܵܐ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈.
TRL: ”At la nsheeqinoekh, eena aha bakhta ha min d'weeree la shle-laha min linshaqa aqlatee.
ENG: Thou gavest me no kiss: but she, since the time I came in, hath not ceased to kiss my feet.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܪܹܫܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈.
TRL: ”At bmishkha la msheekh-loekh lreshee, eena aha bakhta bmishkha dbisma msheekh-laha aqlatee.
ENG: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but she hath anointed my feet with ointment.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܪܵܒܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin iloekh dpoekhle yna iloeha khṭeeatoeha raba, sabab moekhib-laha raba. Eena haw dbaṣoora paesh shweeqa ileh, baṣoora ke makhib.“
ENG: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܟ݂ܝ̈.“
TRL: O meereh eeshoo' lhay bakhta, ”poekhle yna ilakhy khṭeeatakhy.“
ENG: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܚܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Eena anee deewaw teebe 'ameh shoere-lhoon lemara bganayhy, ”manee-yleh aha doep khṭeeate pakhoele-yleh?“
ENG: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that even forgiveth sins?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܟ݂ܝ ܩܲܡ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܙܹܠ݇ܝ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh eeshoo' lhay bakhta, ”haymanoetakhy qam basma lakhy, zey bshlama.“
ENG: And he said unto the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܘܡܲܫܚܘܼܕܹܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar ane, bikhdara ywa eeshoo' gaw mdeenate o gaw matwate, makroeze o mashkhoede malkoeta dalaha, o tri'sar talmeedoehy 'ameh.
ENG: And it came to pass soon afterwards, that he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good tidings of the kingdom of God, and with him the twelve,

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܡܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ؛ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: Eet waw oep bakhtate 'ameh, anee dpeesh-lhoon bseeme min mar'e o min roekhe beeshe; minayhy maryam dpaysha wa qreeta maghdlayta, hay dshaw'a shede poeliṭ-leh minoeha eeshoo',
ENG: and certain women which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary that was called Magdalene, from whom seven devils had gone out,

ASY: ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܟܘܼܙܵܐ ܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܘܫܘܿܫܲܢ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O yookhan bakhta dkoeza rab bayta dheroodis, o shooshan, o raba bakhtate khene, dke 'awdee waw-lhoon khilmat min mindee deet waw-lhoon.
ENG: and Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto them of their substance.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ:
TRL: Kad jmee'e ywaw lkis eeshoo' kinshe raba, dtee-e ywaw min klayhy mdeenate, meereh ilayhy aha matla:
ENG: And when a great multitude came together, and they of every city resorted unto him, he spake by a parable:

ASY: ”ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܙܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܠܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܫܵܐ، ܘܠܩܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Pleeṭ-leh khad zar'ana lizra'a barzar'a. O kad bizra'a ywa, eet wa dnpeel-leh 'al marza doerkha, o peesh-leh deesha, o lqeeṭ-lhoon ileh ṭayre dshmaya.
ENG: The sower went forth to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden under foot, and the birds of the heaven devoured it.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܢܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܘܼܓ̰ܝܸܢܹܗ ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh 'al ar'a kepanta, o min bar dmoejyineh breez-leh, sabab layt wa-leh taleeloeta.
ENG: And other fell on the rock; and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܓ̰ܝܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh gaw kitwe, eena moejyinhoon 'ameh oep kitwe, o khneeq-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And other fell amidst the thorns; and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܡܝܼܢܬܵܐ، ܡܘܼܓ̰ܝܸܢܹܗ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܐܸܡܵܐܐ.“ ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܫܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh bar'a shameenta, moejyineh o 'weed-leh ṭ'oenyate khad bima.“ o eeman dpreeq-leh, meereh: ”man deet-leh natyate lishma'a, shame'.“
ENG: And other fell into the good ground, and grew, and brought forth fruit a hundredfold. As he said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh talmeedoehy, ”moodee-yleh ma'naya daha matla?“
ENG: And his disciples asked him what this parable might be.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܐ݇ܪ̈ܵܙܹܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܓܲܫܩܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ، ܘܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ilawkhoon peesha-yleh yoewa leeda'a raze dmalkoeta dalaha, eena lkhene bmatle ke hamzimin, sabab ke gashqee o le khazee, o ke sham'ee o le parmee.
ENG: And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to the rest in parables; that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܠܵܐ. ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Aha-yleh ma'naya dmatla. Barzar'a hemizman dalaha-yleh.
ENG: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܘܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܘܦܵܪܩܝܼ.
TRL: ”Haw dnpeel-leh 'al marza doerkha, anee yna dke sham'ee. Eena ke ate akelqarṣa o shaqel-laha hemizman min libayhy, dla haminee o parqee.
ENG: And those by the way side are they that have heard; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܢܬܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ ܩܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܠܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”O haw dnpeel-leh 'al ar'a kepanta, anee yna dke sham'ee lhemizman o bkhadoeta ke qablee-laha. Eena layt-lhoon 'iqra, ila haymanoetayhy qa khda 'dana kreeta-ylaha, o eeman date joeraba ke qalbee.
ENG: And those on the rock are they which, when they have heard, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ، ܪܸܢܝܵܐ ܘܕܵܘܸܠܬܵܐ ܘܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܢܩܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ.
TRL: ”O haw dnpeel-leh gaw kitwe, anee yna dke sham'ee, o eeman dke azee, rinya o dawilta o shahwatyate dane khaye ke khanqee-lhoon, o ṭ'oenyate le yawee.
ENG: And that which fell among the thorns, these are they that have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܡܝܼܢܬܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܒܠܸܒܵܐ ܨܸܦܝܵܐ ܘܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܡܵܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena haw dnpeel-leh bar'a shameenta, anee yna dbliba ṣipya o ṭawa ke sham'ee lhemizman o naṭree-laha, o ke yawee ṭ'oenyate bkhmalta.
ENG: And that in the good ground, these are such as in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it fast, and bring forth fruit with patience.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܗܹܐ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܘܟܲܣܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܡܢܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܒܲܗܪܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”nasha le malhe shraya o kase-laha bmana yan matiw-laha tkhoot shweeta, ila ke matiw-laha 'al mnarta dkl 'awrana khaze bahroeha.
ENG: And no man, when he hath lighted a lamp, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed; but putteth it on a stand, that they which enter in may see the light.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܣܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܛܸܫܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܘܦܵܠܹܛ ܠܒܲܗܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab layt mindee moeksa dla paesh gilya, o la ṭishya dla paesh dee'a o paleṭ lbahra.
ENG: For nothing is hid, that shall not be made manifest; nor anything secret, that shall not be known and come to light.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܚܵܫܹܒ݂ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha khzeymoen dakhee sham'eetoon, sabab man deet-leh bit paesh yoewa zawda ileh, o man dlayt-leh oep haw dkhashew deet-leh bit paesh shqeela mineh.“
ENG: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he thinketh he hath.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܛܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: te-lhoon lkis eeshoo' yimeh o akhoonwateh, eena la mṣe-lhoon maṭee lkis-leh sabab kinsha raba ywa.
ENG: And there came to him his mother and brethren, and they could not come at him for the crowd.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܒܵܥܝܼ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O meerhoon ileh, ”ha yimoekh o akhoonwatoekh kilye yna lbadar o ba'ee dkhazee-loekh.“
ENG: And it was told him, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝܸܡܝܼ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: O haw joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”ane yna yimee o akhoonwatee, anee dsham'ee hemizman dalaha o naṭree-laha.“
ENG: But he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.

ASY: ܒܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܛܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܲܚ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.“ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Bkhad min yawmane seeq-leh eeshoo' lgamee 'am talmeedoehy, o meereh ilayhy, ”ṭreymoen d'awrakh lhaw marza khena dyama.“ o ṭre-lhoon.
ENG: Now it came to pass on one of those days, that he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples; and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake: and they launched forth.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܛܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܪܵܢ ܕܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܸܡܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܘܲܢܕܹܢܘܿܣ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: O kad biṭraya ywaw, dmeekh-leh eeshoo'. Hwe-laha boeran dpawkha byama, o qoerbinaha gamee limlaya meea, o hwe-lhoon gaw qewandenoos goerta.
ENG: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filling with water, and were in jeopardy.

ASY: ܡܘܼܪܥܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܒܸܛܠܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ.“ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܦܵܘܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܸܠܝܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Moer'ish-lhoon ileh talmeedoehy, bemara, ”rabee, rabee, biṭlaqa ywakh.“ qeem-leh o njeew-leh bpawkhe o blape dmeea, o kle-lhoon. O hwe-laha shilyoeta.
ENG: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. And he awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ، ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܠܦܵܘܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܝܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”ayka-ylaha haymanoetawkhoon?“ o anee bizda'a, 'ajbee waw o amree waw khad lhaw khena, ”manee-yleh aha doep lpawkhe o lape o lyama bipqada-yleh o bishma'a yna ileh?“
ENG: And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And being afraid they marveled, saying one to another, Who then is this, that he commandeth even the winds and the water, and they obey him?

ASY: ܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܸܕܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Ṭre-lhoon o te-lhoon latra dgidraye, deeleh lmarza khena lbalqoewl dgleela.
ENG: And they arrived at the country of the Gerasenes, which is over against Galilee.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܠܵܒܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܥܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eeman dpleeṭ-leh lbirza, tpeeq-leh bee-eh khad nasha min mdeeta, deet wa bee-eh sheda min 'dana raba. Le labesh wa joele, o le 'amer wa bbayta, ila ke khaye wa gaw beyt qwoere.
ENG: And when he was come forth upon the land, there met him a certain man out of the city, who had devils; and for a long time he had worn no clothes, and abode not in any house, but in the tombs.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܝܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ؟ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪܸܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh leeshoo', npeel-leh qamoehy o moeqwikh-leh bqala rama o meereh, ”ma-loekh minee, ya eeshoo' broona dalaha 'ilaya? Parpoele ywin beeoekh, la janjirit-lee.“
ENG: And when he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the Most High God? I beseech thee, torment me not.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ ܕܦܵܠܛܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܹܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܩܵܘܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܛܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܸܣܘܼܪ̈ܘܼܗܝ، ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab pqeed-leh eeshoo' lroekha ṭame dpalṭa mineh, hay dke dawqa wa-leh raba gahe, o ke paesh wa nṭeera o seera bqawde o bsheshlate, eena ke qaṭe' wa lisoeroehy, o ke paesh wa loebla byad sheda lbareea.
ENG: For he commanded the unclean spirit to come out from the man. For oftentimes it had seized him: and he was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters; and breaking the bands asunder, he was driven of the devil into the deserts.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܠܸܓ݂ܝܘܿܢ.“ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Boeqireh mineh eeshoo', ”moodee-yleh shimoekh?“ o haw joewib-leh, ”lighyoon.“ sabab raba shede 'weere ywaw bee-eh.
ENG: And Jesus asked him, What is thy name? And he said, Legion; for many devils were entered into him.

ASY: ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܩܹܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܬܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dla paqed-lhoon dazee l'oemqa dla tyama.
ENG: And they entreated him that he would not command them to depart into the abyss.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܪܥܵܝܵܐ ܒܛܘܼܪܵܐ. ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eet wa tama biqra goerta dkhzoere bir'aya bṭoera. Ṭleeb-lhoon mineh anee shede dyabil-lhoon psasa d'awree gaw khzoere. O yoebil-leh psasa ilayhy.
ENG: Now there was there a herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they entreated him that he would give them leave to enter into them. And he gave them leave.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܠܫܸܢܵܐ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon shede min dhaw nasha o 'weerhoon gaw khzoere, o rkheeṭ-laha hay biqra lshina lltikht byama, o khneeq-lhoon.
ENG: And the devils came out from the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd rushed down the steep into the lake, and were choked.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪ̈ܵܥܝܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon ra'ye mindee dhwe-leh, rkheeṭ-lhoon o hoeqe-lhoon gaw mdeeta o gaw matwate.
ENG: And when they that fed them saw what had come to pass, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܗܵܘܢܹܗ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon nashe dkhazee mindee dhwe-leh, o te-lhoon lkis eeshoo', o khze-lhoon lhaw nasha dpleeṭ-lhoon mineh shede, lweesha o hawneh bresheh o teewa lkis aqlate deeshoo', o zdee' lhoon.
ENG: And they went out to see what had come to pass; and they came to Jesus, and found the man, from whom the devils were gone out, sitting, clothed and in his right mind, at the feet of Jesus: and they were afraid.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ.
TRL: O anee dkhze-lhoon hoeqe-lhoon ilayhy dakhee peesh-leh bseema haw deet wa bee-eh sheda.
ENG: And they that saw it told them how he that was possessed with devils was made whole.

ASY: ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܸܕܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܵܗ̇. ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ.
TRL: O ṭleeb-lhoon mineh klayhy nashe datra dgidraye dazel min lkis layhy, sabab zdoe'ta goerta dweeqay-laha. O haw seeq-leh lgamee o deereh.
ENG: And all the people of the country of the Gerasenes round about asked him to depart from them; for they were holden with great fear: and he entered into a boat, and returned.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ،
TRL: Haw nasha dpleeṭ-lhoon mineh shede ṭleeb-leh mineh dpaesh wa 'ameh. Eena eeshoo' meereh ileh,
ENG: But the man from whom the devils were gone out prayed him that he might be with him: but he sent him away, saying,

ASY: ”ܕܘܼܪ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܗܲܩܝܼ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: ”Doer lbaytoekh o haqee moodee 'weed-leh iloekh Alaha.“ o haw zeel-leh o hoeqe-leh bklaha mdeeta mindee d'weed-leh ileh eeshoo'.
ENG: Return to thy house, and declare how great things God hath done for thee. And he went his way, publishing throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done for him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman ddeereh eeshoo', qoebil-leh ileh kinsha raba, sabab klayhy bispara ywaw ileh.
ENG: And as Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him; for they were all waiting for him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܘܿܐܵܪܵܫ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ،
TRL: O te-leh khad nasha shimeh yooarash, goera dknoeshta, o npeel-leh qam aqlate deeshoo' o ṭleeb-leh mineh d'aber wa lbayteh,
ENG: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus’ feet, and besought him to come into his house;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܲܪ݇ܬ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܡܝܵܬܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܚܠܵܨܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab eet wa-leh brata eekheedayta bat tri'sar shine o qoerbinta ywa limyata. O kad eeshoo' bezala ywa, kinsha raba bikhlaṣa ywa ileh.
ENG: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the multitudes thronged him.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܩܵܐ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܘܼܪܸܓ̰ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܩܵܐ ܐܵܣܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܨܝܵܐ ܠܒܲܣܘܼܡܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O eet wa khda bakhta deewa bezala dima minoeha qa tri'sar shine, o khoerijta ywa kleh mindeeoeha qa asye, o oep khad le ywa miṣya lbasoemoeha.
ENG: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, and could not be healed of any,

ASY: ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܨܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܕܩܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܫܸܦܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓ̰ܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Qoerbinaha min bar khaṣa deeshoo' o dqeeraha bshipoela dlweeshteh, o har bhay 'dana kle-laha jrayta ddimoeha.
ENG: came behind him, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately the issue of her blood stanched.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ؟“ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܕܩܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܠܝܘܼܨܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܒܸܚܠܵܨܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ؟‘“
TRL: O meereh eeshoo', ”manee dqeereh beeee?“ o klayhy sreew-lhoon ldqarta dbee-eh. Eena shim'oon kepa o anee d'ameh meerhoon, ”rabee, kinshe malyoeṣoekh eena o bikhlaṣoekh, o at bemara ywit, ’manee dqeereh beeee?‘“
ENG: And Jesus said, Who is it that touched me? And when all denied, Peter said, and they that were with him, Master, the multitudes press thee and crush thee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh, ”khad dqeereh beeee, sabab ana dee' lee khayla pleeṭ-leh minee.“
ENG: But Jesus said, Some one did touch me: for I perceived that power had gone forth from me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܲܫܝܵܐ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܪܓܵܕܵܐ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Hay bakhta, eeman dkhze-laha dle maṣya wa ṭashya ganoeha mineh, te-laha birgada o npeel-laha qamoehy o meeraha qam kleh kinsha qamoodee dqeeraha bee-eh o dakhee bjaldoeta bseem-laha.
ENG: And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared in the presence of all the people for what cause she touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܦܘܼܫܝ ܠܸܒܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܪܵܬܝܼ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܟ݂ܝ ܩܲܡ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܙܹܠ݇ܝ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”poeshy libanta bratee, haymanoetakhy qam basma lakhy, zey bshlama.“
ENG: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.

ASY: ܘܗܹܫ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܵܬܘܼܟ݂، ܠܵܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܸܙ ܠܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O hesh eeshoo' hamzoeme, te-leh nasha min bayta dgoera dknoeshta o meereh ileh, ”meet-laha bratoekh, la 'ajiz lmalpana.“
ENG: While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܒܪܵܬܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ، ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܗܲܡܸܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo', meereh lbaba dbrata, ”la zad'et, akhchee hamin, o bit khaya.“
ENG: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, Fear not: only believe, and she shall be made whole.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܘܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܪܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: O 'weereh lbayta, o la shweeq-leh d'aber 'ameh nasha shwooq min shim'oon kepa o ya'qoow o yookhanan, o baba o yima dbrata.
ENG: And when he came to the house, he suffered not any man to enter in with him, save Peter, and John, and James, and the father of the maiden and her mother.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܒܵܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܝܼܬܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: O klayhy bibkhaya ywaw o bi'wada ta'zee 'aloeha. Eena eeshoo' meereh, ”la bakeytoon, sabab le-ylaha meetta ila dmeekhta-ylaha.“
ENG: And all were weeping, and bewailing her: but he said, Weep not; for she is not dead, but sleepeth.

ASY: ܘܓܚܝܼܟ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܡܝܼܬܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O gkheek-lhoon bee-eh sabab yad'ee waw dmeetta ywa.
ENG: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.

ASY: ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ، ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܘܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܪܵܬܵܐ، ܩܘܼܡܝ.“
TRL: Poeliṭ-leh eeshoo' lklayhy lbadar, o dweeq-leh beeda dbrata o qirya-leh o meereh, ”brata, qoemy.“
ENG: But he, taking her by the hand, called, saying, Maiden, arise.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܘܼܗ̇، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇. ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: O deeraha roekhoeha, o har bhay 'dana qeem-laha. O pqeed-leh dyawee-laha mekhoelta lekhala.
ENG: And her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately: and he commanded that something be given her to eat.

ASY: ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗ̇. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O 'oejib-lhoon awahoeha. Eena haw pqeeday-leh dlnasha la amree mindee dhwe-leh.
ENG: And her parents were amazed: but he charged them to tell no man what had been done.

ASY: ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ.
TRL: Qre-leh eeshoo' ltri'sar talmeedoehy o yoebil-leh ilayhy khayla o shoelṭana 'al klayhy shede o lbasoeme mar'e.
ENG: And he called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܠܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ.
TRL: Shoedray-leh lmakroeze malkoeta dalaha o lbasoeme mree'e.
ENG: And he sent them forth to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܛܪܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܡܵܠܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܨܘܼܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”mindee la shaqleetoon boerkha, la khoeṭra, o la tarmala, o la lakhma o la zoeze, o la hawe lawkhoon tartey ṣoedrate.
ENG: And he said unto them, Take nothing for your journey, neither staff, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats.

ASY: ”ܘܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܹܗ، ܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O lbayta d'awreetoon gaweh, poeshoen tama, hal dpalṭeetoon min tama.
ENG: And into whatsoever house ye enter, there abide, and thence depart.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܬܵܘܙ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܵܦܨܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”O in nashe la qablee lawkhoon, eeman dpalṭeetoon min hay mdeeta, oep tawz min aqlatawkhoon napṣeetoon-laha lsahdoeta 'alayhy.“
ENG: And as many as receive you not, when ye depart from that city, shake off the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܠܡܵܬܵܐ، ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܘܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon shleekhe, bikhdara min mata lmata, makroeze o basoeme bkl doeka.
ENG: And they departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the gospel, and healing everywhere.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܘܼܫܵܒ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh heroodis ṭiṭrarka klayhy ane, shgheesh-lhoon khoeshawoehy sabab nashe amree waw, ”aha yookhanan eeleh, qeema-yleh min gaw meete.“
ENG: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done: and he was much perplexed, because that it was said by some, that John was risen from the dead;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O khene amree waw deleea peesh-leh khizya, o khene amree waw, aha-yleh nweea min nwee-e qamaye dqeema-yleh min gaw meete.
ENG: and by some, that Elijah had appeared; and by others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ”ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܡ ܠܝܼ، ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ؟“ ܘܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: meereh heroodis, ”resha dyookhanan ana preem-lee, o manee-yleh aha dbishma'ay ywin ane boet dee-eh?“ o ba'e wa dkhaze wa-leh.
ENG: And Herod said, John I beheaded: but who is this, about whom I hear such things? And he sought to see him.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܠܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܨܲܝܵܕܵܐ.
TRL: O deerhoon shleekhe o hoeqe-lhoon leeshoo' kl mindee d'weed-lhoon. O loeblay-leh eeshoo' bnawshayhy lkhda mdeeta dke paysha qreeta beyt ṣayada.
ENG: And the apostles, when they were returned, declared unto him what things they had done. And he took them, and withdrew apart to a city called Bethsaida.

ASY: ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ. ܘܩܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܒܵܣܲܡܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܣܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: dee' lhoon kinshe o zeel-lhoon bareh. O qoeblay-leh, o hamzim wa 'amayhy boet malkoeta dalaha. O anee deewaw sneeqe lbasamta boesmay-leh.
ENG: But the multitudes perceiving it followed him: and he welcomed them, and spake to them of the kingdom of God, and them that had need of healing he healed.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܠܸܓܢܵܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܫܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܟܲܦܪ̈ܘܿܢܹܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܢ، ܕܫܵܪܝܼ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ.“
TRL: O kad qoerbineh yawma lignaya, te-lhoon tri'sar talmeedoehy o meerhoon leeshoo', ”shree lkinshe dazee lmatwate o lkaproone dkhadirwanan, dsharee gawayhy, o machkhee-lhoon mekhoelta, sabab bdoeka bareea ywakh.“
ENG: And the day began to wear away; and the twelve came, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ.“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܘܙܵܒ݂ܢܲܚ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”haloen-lhoon akhtoon mekhoelta.“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”layt lan zawda min khamsha lakhme o tartey noene, ila dazakh o zawnakh mekhoelta qa kleh aha ṭayipa.“
ENG: But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more than five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy food for all this people.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܲܬܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܥܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܒܟܠ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eet wa tama maykh khamsha alpe nashe, o meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”matwoen-lhoon bsee'ate, khamshee bkl see'ta.“
ENG: For they were about five thousand men. And he said unto his disciples, Make them sit down in companies, about fifty each.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O 'weed-lhoon hadkha talmeede, o moetiw-lhoon lklayhy.
ENG: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh eeshoo' anee khamsha lakhme o tartey noene, kheereh lshmaya o boerikh-leh o qṣe-leh o yoebil-leh ltalmeedoehy, o anee moetiw-lhoon qam kinshe.
ENG: And he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake; and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O kheel-lhoon klayhy o swee' lhoon, o shqeel-lhoon qiṭ'aṭe dzeed-lhoon, tri'sar qoepe.
ENG: And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up that which remained over to them of broken pieces, twelve baskets.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ. ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܘܸܢ؟“
TRL: Hwe-laha kad ṣaloeye ywa eeshoo' bnawsheh, te-lhoon lkis-leh talmeedoehy. Boeqireh minayhy, ”manee ke amree kinshe dana eewin?“
ENG: And it came to pass, as he was praying alone, the disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Who do the multitudes say that I am?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon o meerhoon, ”ke amree dat eewit yookhanan ma'mdana, o khene ke amree eleea ywit, o khene ke amree khad min nwee-e qamaye qeema-yleh.“
ENG: And they answering said, John the Baptist; but others say, Elijah; and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܘܸܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena haw boeqireh minayhy, ”o akhtoon, manee bemara ytoon dana eewin?“ joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh, ”at eewit msheekha dalaha.“
ENG: And he said unto them, But who say ye that I am? And Peter answering said, The Christ of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' pqeeday-leh dlnasha la amree.
ENG: But he charged them, and commanded them to tell this to no man;

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ. ܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.“
TRL: meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”ananqayta-ylaha dbroona dnasha qabil raba khasha o paesh moesleea min khwardiqne o goerane dkahne o sapre. Bit qaṭlee-leh o byawma dtlata bit qaem.“
ENG: saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܣܵܪܹܒ݂ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܫܵܩܹܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐܝܼܬ ܘܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.
TRL: O meereh lklayhy, ”man dba'e ate baree, sarew ganeh, o shaqel zqeepeh yawmaeet o ate baree.
ENG: And he said unto all, If any man would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܲܠܸܩ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Sabab man dba'e pariq ganeh bit ṭaliq-laha, eena man dṭaliq ganeh boet deeee, haw bit pariq-laha.
ENG: For whosoever would save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܩܵܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܲܢ ܚܵܣܹܪܵܗ̇؟
TRL: ”Sabab moodee yoetrana eet lbarnasha in qane-leh klaha doenye eena ganeh ṭaliq-laha yan khaseraha?
ENG: For what is a man profited, if he gain the whole world, and lose or forfeit his own self?

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܟܹܦ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈، ܒܸܬ ܢܵܟܹܦ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܥܲܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Man dnakep beeee o bhemizmanee, bit nakep bee-eh broona dnasha eeman date bshoewkha dbaboehy, 'am malakhoehy qadeeshe.
ENG: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in his own glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

ASY: ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܝܼܬ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Shareeraeet bemara ywin ilawkhoon, deet nashe kilye lakha dle khazee mawta hal dkhazee malkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: But I tell you of a truth, There be some of them that stand here, which shall in no wise taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh tmanya yawmane min bar ane hemizmane, loebil-leh eeshoo' lshim'oon kepa o lya'qoow o lyookhanan, o seeq-leh lṭoera lṣaloeye ṣloota.
ENG: And it came to pass about eight days after these sayings, he took with him Peter and John and James, and went up into the mountain to pray.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܵܐ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܹܗ، ܘܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܚܘܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܘܡܘܼܒܪܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: O kad ṣaloeye ywa, peesh-leh shoekhlipa khizwa dpateh, o lweeshteh khweeraha o moebriq-laha.
ENG: And as he was praying, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment became white and dazzling.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ، ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: O ha trey nashe, moeshe o eleea, hamzoeme 'ameh.
ENG: And behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elijah;

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܲܢܵܝܬܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܬܲܡܘܼܡܘܼܗ̇ ܒܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Peesh-lhoon khizye bshoewkha, o hamzoeme ywaw boet shanayteh hay dhdeera ywa ltamoemoeha boorishlim.
ENG: who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.

ASY: ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܘܼܩܪܸܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܫܸܢܬܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܩܪܹܗ، ܘܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Shim'oon kepa o anee d'ameh yoeqrine ywaw bshinta. O eeman dr'eesh-lhoon khze-lhoon khiqreh, o lanee trey nashe kilye lkis-leh.
ENG: Now Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ. ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܬܠܵܬ ܡܛܲܠܠܹ̈ܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ.“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O kad bezala ywaw min lkis-leh moeshe o eleea, meereh shim'oon kepa leeshoo', ”rabee, ṣpayee-ylaha dpayshakh lakha. 'Awdakh tlat mṭalle, khda qatoekh, o khda qa moeshe, o khda qa eleea.“ eena le ywa beeda'a moodee bemara ywa.
ENG: And it came to pass, as they were parting from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah: not knowing what he said.
